title: Perfect Location! Would definitely stay there again!
text: I liked the room, a lot. The staff was all very friendly from the front door to room service and housekeeping! The food was good at all three restaurants on the premises. The only thing I would complain about is that Elevator Stall No. 3 broke down twice and the fire department had to come out. Which isn't a big deal, but no one could get up to their room for a while both times. But I would definitely stay there again. My firm's NY office is just across the street from the hotel! Very convenient!

title: I will not stay anywhere else
text: This is by far my favorite hotel in NYC. It's a great location and the rooms are fantastic. On top of the convenience to everything, the entire staff of the hotel always goes above and beyond to make sure we have a great stay. On our most recent stay, we were assisted by Victor, who helped us during check in, check out and the duration of our stay. We're definitely coming back!

title: Iconic hotel in a great location
text:
We really enjoyed aspect of our stay at the knickerbocker hotel. The staff were all extremely friendly and striving to offer excellent customer service. My daughter was delighted at being given a Knickerbocker teddy, which was very kind of the concierge. 

Prior to booking we were a little concerned about being so close to Times Square and were considering booking near Central Park instead. Travelling with Granny and a young child the location this was actually one of the top aspects of the stay. Everything you would want to is all within walking distance and Times Square is great when travelling with a 6 year old.

Also the hotel is impeccably clean and I liked the minimalist design of the interior. 

The roof terrace bar is also excellent and worth a visit to sink a vodka martini at the place it was invented.

title: Thank you
text: Spotless room, great service from the staff, especially Stephanie and Diana your concierges and the lovely cleaner. When I was asked what could make it better I said a coffee machine. When I got bs into the hotel there was one in the room. Great hotel and great position .

title: “Dog Friendly”
text:
We are from MD and we often go to New York to watch broadway and have night out. We have been to several “Dog Friendly” hotels in NY. Last April 3, we drove to Boston and check in to Revere Hotel with our English and French bulldogs for 2 nights. Never had a problem. April 5 we checked in to Knickerbocker at NY together with our dogs. We arrived there at around
4pm. We were told by the front desk person that we could not leave our dogs and should have the owner be present at all times… that we will be charge $350 when our dogs barks on top of Pet fee, but they will let us know when will be charge beforehand. We told her that this was the first time that we heard of this policy. And we find it rediculous that there is a fee charge when dog barks! And of course they gonna bark! So we asked for the manager because we were stressed by this and knowing the NY city does not have a lot of indoor establishments that allowed Pet to bring. Mercedez, the manager that time had explained to us that this was worded wrong. We also have tried to find the Hotel policy about unaccompanied pets and there is no where we can find it in the site! She also explained that they only charge for Noise disturbance fee when dogs are excessively barking which made a relief on us cause knowing the dog breed we have and they are very lazy. Plus we have Trazodone that we usually give to our pet only when we go out and a baby monitor connected to our own mobile WiFi. Plus our dogs does not have anxiey separation issues. Not even 2hours when we left our room, we have received phone calls from the hotel that they were receiving complains from other guest that our dogs was making noise. In the middle of our broadway show, 19:46 to be exact, another phone call, and after another. So right after the show, instead of getting few drinks we rushed back to our hotel and check our pet. With my friends, we stood in front of our room for like 5 minutes, no bark or noise made by our dogs. 
So I went down at the concierge and spoke to
Mercedes, she has explained that they have been receiving complain from multiple guess. I had explained to her that my dogs does not continously barks,. I also heard from the other staff that there were other dogs on that floor. Our room was situated besides an elevator and only 1 room in front of us. She explained that because it was a common area, my dogs might be barking when guest alights from the elevator which I said they have to move us to another room. I also said that the phone calls we have been receiving is ridiculous and we have never had encountered this problem before. We are trying to enjoy the city for a little time that we have in NY but this hotel has stressed as out. At one point, I thought of being scammed, and I told Mercedez that I felt like we were being single out because we complained on our checked in. She also has explained that some other guest might be sensitive to noise. I have explained to her that as a “dog Friendly Hotel” I find it ridiculous, that we are getting a phone calls everytime a guest complain about barking! On our check out, of course we were charged $350 without informing us, without intervening on what can be done to pacify other guess while we also enjoy our stay in the hotel with a peace of mind that out pets are safe for a little time that we were out, and that no evidence to prove that they are excessively barking other than complains from other guess. That person who was checking out on Sunday morning at around 6am was also very rude. We asked the manager,  Ji won seo and he waived our fee. We also demanded to give the name of that front desk person but he refused to give it out. From cheked in to checked out, this hotel has done nothing but stress to us! We didn’t even get the Plush bed, set of bowls, custom dog treats that they advertise in their web site!

title: A few days break in NYC
text: Not quite a 5 *, more of a 4* but nice enough . Central location . Cocktail bar accessible to non residents. Lifts take an absolute age because open to the public ,  you have to request tea and coffee tray and then remember to ask for clean crockery everyday

title: Fake 5*
text: The Knickerbocker is not a real 5*. It’s a low-end 4* at best. Some staff were friendly and knowledgeable and others unhelpful and disorganised. The breakfast is chaotic with average food. The rooms are outdated with significant wear and tear. The lifts are unreliable and so is the key card system. The location is good if you want the flexibility to move around town. I would consider alternatives before booking the Knickerbocker

title: Family trip to New York
text:
Very well located hotel right next to Times Square, which does it mean it is very busy in the entire area.
The room we had was spacious, but could really have done with some coat hooks in the room - there was absolutely nowhere to hang coats up at all.  We also made use of the sofa bed which was really not great - pretty uncomfortable to the centre of it just due to it being old.  It was fine for our daughter to sleep on, but 1 or 2 adults would not have been comfortable at all.
The roof bar is great for looking out over the city.

title: Sisters NYC get together
text: We love the luxury stay we get at The Knickerbocker, everyone from doorman to housekeeping staff & especially front desk work their magic to make you feel like a VIP. Happy we were able to check in a bit early as it was a “sisters couple of days” and her first visit & with awful rain & she having a cold , it gave us a chance to relax before starting our 2 day plans for places we were going. Also  the bartender & breakfast staff do a great job! My husband & I had  a 3 night stay last month & this was a 2 night one and other than horrible weather it was a pleasure to be at the Knickerbocker. See you again soon!

title: Excellent Weekend Hotel
text: Wonderful weekend in NYC, great location and friendly professional staff. Loved the room which was very clean and tidy. Turn down left cookies which were a luxurious touch. We had dinner at the new restaurant and it was divine. Food was exceptional. Looking forward to returning.

title: Great experience
text: Great hotel!  Perfect location bc it was real close to Time square but not right on it, so a little quieter.  Subway access within just a few steps!  So incredibly helpful staff!  I would def stay here again! Charlie Palmer was excellent! I highly suggest the cheesecake with ice cream. And the espresso martini!

title: Our favorite place to stay in NY
text: Nice large rooms- especially for NY, good service. We have always had great recommendations from Concierge, and different ones each time, which is amazing considering it’s our 4th/5th stay here. The elevators are a little slow though, not sure why.

title: Great staff, below average rooms
text: Staff was great! Door keys didn't work for 3 out of the 4 days we were there. Our three families were spread on 3 different floors and with room keeys not working it made movement nearly impossible. Our AC was terrible in our room it never cooled or removed the humidity from the room. The beds were OK not the best especially for the cost. Overall the people were incredible but the room was not good. Also lots of mold on the ceiling of our bathroom

title: Excellent location, but not a 5* hotel!
text:
We stayed at the Knickerbocker hotel mid March. The location is just outstanding! Regarding the criteria classifying it a 5* hotel, I question them very much!

Considering this category of hotel, the major issues we faced are:

-  Lack of consistent and accurate information shared among different units within the hotel, e.g. reception, restaurant, ... generating negative consequences for the clients

-  Total lack of professionalism, client service mindset in all the dining infrastructure (restaurant, roof top). Before leaving, I shared my candid feedback with the Client Experience manager. He listened to me, apologised and offered us the unique dinner we had in the restaurant

-  Outdated infrastructure (the elevators are quite old, you do not see at what level you are and quite often the badge does not work  [ observed a couple of people struggling to get to their room ] )

-  Level of cleanliness : hardly acceptable for a 5* hotel

- We had asked for a room with view on Time Square. We got a room with a view on the wall of the building next to the hotel! The only advantage was that it was very quiet.

On the other side, we found the two concierges - Stephanie and Diana, that were just great and Victor - one of the baggage porter - that demonstrated an impressive client service mindset and went clearly beyond his primary responsibilities, helping us to solve the issue that the restaurant employees should have solved!

title: Mixed Feelings at the Knickerbocker
text:
The hotel’s commendable aspects included its exceptionally helpful staff, a prime location that promises convenience, and beautifully appointed rooms with excellent amenities. These positive attributes showcased the hotel's potential for a luxurious and comfortable stay, underpinned by a team dedicated to guest satisfaction.

However, the experience was dampened by a few significant shortcomings. Our request for a quiet room was initially met with a placement next to the elevators, and upon requesting a change, we were moved to a room directly beneath the gym, leading to disturbances from the sound of dropping dumbbells throughout the day and evening. The service, particularly room service, was slow and often required multiple requests to achieve a resolution. 

Despite the shining light provided by the hotel staff’s friendliness and assistance, these drawbacks significantly affected our overall experience, highlighting areas in need of improvement for The Knickerbocker to truly deliver on its promise of a luxurious and hassle-free stay.

title: Perfect location for NYC visit
text:
Plus:
Perfect location. Rooms spacious for NYC. Good restaurant (Charlie Palmer). 
No noise despite proximity to Times Square (we were in a junior suite on floor 16). Rooftop. 
Minus: Breakfast overpriced. Elevators should be more efficient.

title: Resort fees!!!
text:
We booked our trip via lastminute.com who stated that the upfront holding fee would be 300USD but upon checking in they tried to charge us 3000USD for the 2 rooms we had booked for a 10 day stay. They ended up charging us 516.40USD because one of our cards wasn’t going through. The person at check in explicitly said that this money would be returned to me at check out. When we went to check out at the end of our trip, they surprised us with “resort fees” that totalled 1032.80USD. When we asked them why it was not stated in the beginning, the front desk told us they were under no obligation to do so, saying that this charge was for the amenities that were said to be “free” online. We then asked to speak to the manager Kevin to file a complaint, he was quite rude and aggressive in his delivery of the information that “we will not be waiving your resort fee”, which he also felt the need to reiterate a fair few times even though we never asked for a refund, only to file a complaint. His tone was extremely court and unhelpful whilst we were just trying to raise concerns. 
The actual rooms were ok bar the fact that I came back to my made up room a few times and found bedsheets that had holes in them. I didn’t feel the need to say anything at the time because the people i interacted with in the hotel were lovely, namely the concierge and bellboys. The check in/out desk workers on the other hand perhaps need to check their attitudes. 
Overall, this is an ok hotel with nice rooms but please note the excessive charges as I don’t want anyone else to be subject to this.

title: Kein Leading Hotel of the World
text:
This is absolutely not a Leading Hotel of the World, we are more than surprised how the hotel manages to meet the LQA standards and not fall out of the collection.

No emotional check-in process, no addressing by name, no escort to the room. Minimal facilities in the room and only turn-down service from day to day. On departure we were asked if we could store our luggage, this would not be a problem as long as we brought it downstairs. The check-out itself, apart from asking for the room number, was irrelevant and unfriendly. Whichever LHW hotel tester checks the standards here, this hotel certainly does not. More than just unemotional service for guests without passion.

Housekeeping on the other hand was extremely good, room service was excellent.

title: Outstanding Hotel and Stay
text:
Stayed for 4 days from 23rd March.
Cannot fault anything
Staff all very professional with a can do attitude
Everywhere spotlessly clean 
Special mention to the concierge and porter team who were friendly

title: Don’t stay here
text: Terrible service, can’t even get their systems to work, we were there for almost a week and no key to our room, every time we got back to the hotel someone had to come up and open our room. Also, don’t bother having anything delivered there because they are too lazy to look through the mail room for you packages. I had two packages delivered and had to leave without them.

title: historic hotel, luxurious and convenient.
text:
The hotel itself is beautiful, inside and out. The whole hotel staff was very helpful and attentive. 
Our room didn't have a view to the street, but that wasn't so bad considering ther's a lot of light and noise at Times Square. The blackout courtains works great thou. 

The only thing I didn't like about the room was the bed pillows. Not very comfortable. Very thick.

title: Wow!  Superb stay!
text: Wow!  The Knickerbocker is far & away my favorite hotel in Manhattan!  The location is ideal.  The rooms are spacious.  The beds are like sleeping on clouds (or at least the way I imagine it would be)!  The staff members are professional, courteous, and helpful.  They were able to accommodate our needs beautifully!  I am pleased to give the highest praise and an extremely favorable review of this superb hotel in New York City!  I truly feel like it is our "home away from home!"

title: Customer service lacking
text: I reserved a weekend through hotels.com but cancelled as plans changed.  Fully refundable reservation.  Knickerbocker charged $700 in error.   Many MANY emails later and although the error has been acknowledged no money received. Just wanted to pass along a heads up for others.

title: Great hotel a step away from Times Sq & Bryant park
text: Great location, nice hotel, friendly staff, roomy accommodation especially for NY standards...I would go again given that prices are normal. Concierge was also very helpful and kind and took the time to find the best options for us. The rooftop has also a great vibe and view

title: We will be back!! 😀
text:
Gorgeous hotel and the staff were all wonderful... We enjoyed room service a few times and the location of the hotel was perfect for us!! 
We saw two Broadway shows, had amazing meals and truly enjoyed Manhattan. 
When we come back, we will definitely stay at The Knickerbocker.

title: Advised
text: Very clean hotel, convenient especially for the nearby metro station with all the most convenient lines available. Contrary to what I thought it turned out to be silent. I stayed with my wife and two little girls and we had a really good time. I advise

title: Travel with family
text: I’ve been to NYC several times but this was my first stay at this hotel and first time traveling with my family to this location.  Given the usual size of hotels rooms in NY, this was generous and location was spectacular. I would definitely come back.

title: Perfect Place for Broadway Vacation
text: The perfect hotel for our Broadway weeks.  The hotel is elegant, the staff attentive, and the location can’t be beat! It is an easy walk to any of the theatres.  Plus, the hotel has a great history that makes our even more special.  This is our second stay at the Knickerbocker. We will stay there again for sure.

title: Booked for a four-day mother-daughter show-filled trip.
text: Everything about my stay with my daughter exceeded our expectations. Perfectly located. Excellent attention to detail. Friendly and courteous and so welcoming. Their rooftop bar is gorgeous. I would stay here again if I come back to NYC.

title: Lovely Stay
text:
We had a lovely stay at the Knickerbocker. It is so convenient for Times Square but also access to the subway. 
It is ultra clean and the staff are friendly and extremely helpful.
The room was clean and we loved the shower. Very nice to get 2 bottles of complementary water per day.

title: Great hotel in NYC
text: Great service. Only complaint was that we tried to order room service twice and both times we couldn’t get an answer to our call. But, the front desk was always helpful and friendly. Our fave hotel in NYC - great location, great service, fabulous room. Really great housekeeping.

title: Wonderful Location and Service
text: The staff are super friendly and helpful.  The only thing to watch out for is the noise from the location... but most of the hotels in Time Square are noisy.  Ask for the rooms in the back away from the main streets.  The bed is comfortable and they are really beautiful and clean rooms and bathroom.  Right next to the Subway and great location.

title: Great Stay beside the payment issue
text:
We stayed 11 nights as returning guests 
Erica Guity who dealt with our reservation was fantastic helpful and supportive
Hotel services were great, people very nice and willing to help at all times
Room was clean and well organized every night we came back to the room
There was one low light to mention. 
We asked the reception to use another credit card to pay our stay instead of the one we put as guarantee to our stay. we asked for it 3 times, at check in, a few days after and at check out , we got various explanations why it should take 3-5 working days until it can take place . It never happen to us and we are travelling all across the globe. The most disappointed situation was upon checking out where the lady at the reception simply push the payment bottom even though we have asked her to change the credit card for payment and we could go back

title: Best NYC experience ever!!! Our anniversary trip was perfect
text: Booking was easy, check in was fast, cleaning staff was thoughtful and efficient. They would decorate our bed each night. The concierge texted me daily asking for feedback and if we needed anything. The staff went out of their way to be kind to us. I could not have expected a better place to lay my head after a long day of exploring the city. The fact what our broadway show was across the street at Lyric Theatre was just a cherry ontop. I forgot my jewelry and they called me and had it shipped to Texas immediately. The honesty is admirable because it had diamonds in it. It warms my heart to have that humanity shown so clearly.  10/10 would come back!! Love yall

title: Great hotel!
text:
We have already stayed at the Knickerbocker twice. Great hotel, great location and very friendly service. We would love to come back again! 
We had a lot of space, the bathroom was big, very clean and the beds were comfortable. Everything is close by, the subway station is just a few steps away. Above all, Bryant Park is just a stone's throw away.

title: Nice time at the Knickerbocker
text: Wonderful hotel. The corner suite was really beautiful.  The staff is always friendly and courteous. The rooftop bar is always a must. Nice touch bring a piece of delicious cake for my wife's birthday. Check-in was smooth as well and the upgrade was very nice to celebrate my wife's birthday. Thank you.

title: Great hotel. Great location.
text: Great hotel! Everyone was so nice and helpful.  Rooms are spacious and clean. Beds are comfortable. Great location. Close to 5th, Times Square, theaters and Macy's.  All were within walking distance, but the subway is close too if you want to explore other parts of the city.

title: Great Hotel
text: This is a great hotel to stay in. I've been to Manhattan a couple of times but this has been the best hotel by far. From all the little touches like bathrobes, slippers, diptyque toiletries, to the wonderful and helpful staff. We felt really appreciated and welcomed to the Knick. The location is also great with the Subway close by. Will definitely be back to stay at this gem.

title: Beautiful hotel with top tier amenities and prime location.
text: Beautiful rooms with luxurious amenities, and a friendly and helpful staff to great you. Beds, pillows, couches and everything else was very comfortable. In fact it was so comfortable that it almost made it difficult to go out. However, the prime location does make it worthwhile to venture out the front door and land right in the heart of Times Square. Once you have had your fill and ready to head back to your room for the night, the buildings unique and stunning architecture makes it easy to spot from a distance even if you don’t have the address handy. Overall it was a great stay and would happily book with them again.

title: Great Experience
text: Excellent service from check in to check out. We had a Junior Suite and really enjoyed the extra space. The rooms were very quiet and welcoming! A great location for many of the places and things we wanted to do in NYC. We would stay at the Knickerbocker again when visiting NYC.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: Friendly staff, from check-in to housekeeping, to bartenders.    Clean nice updated room.    Great rooftop bar.  We actually went before dinner to the rooftop then again after our show.  Location is perfect especially if you’re seeing a Broadway show.

title: Great place to stay
text: great location. comfy bed.  clean rooms. super friendly helpful staff.  would stay here again. very good food nearby.  I don't like that trip advisor makes me do a minimum of 200 characters.  I'm not a big writer and I feel like I could hit the hi-lites without 200 characters.  But that is nothing to do with how great the hotel was :0)

title: The Best Front Desk in NY
text:
Before choosing the hotel I read some reviews that were not too good, however I decided to take the risk and I don't regret it at all.
The hotel is a 10, it has modern, comfortable, clean rooms and has an impeccable breakfast. Our stay was excellent and I cannot stop congratulating Ms. Paola from Front Desk for her cordiality, excellence and professionalism. People generally believe that hotel staff in NY are excellent but that is not always the case, it is very difficult to find a person as dedicated and impeccable as her.
We will definitely return to this hotel.

title: Lovely Hotel, shame about the daily fee.
text: Lovely hotel, great location, very attentive staff. Rooms are great and peaceful and there aren’t really any negatives to staying here. Only downside was that we weren’t really sure of why there is a daily fee for staying there but I guess it’s a NYC thing, maybe combine it into the room price or make it optional.

title: Excellent location and perfect
text:
Excellent location. Check in was very easy and the staff in the hotel are all very friendly.
Lovely bedrooms and the bed is very comfortable.
Only used the hotel cafe and all priced fairly reasonable.
Would recommend the hotel and only place I would stay

title: OWNDERFUL
text: Fantastic service and attention. Perfect location. Cleanliness and quality-price ratio exceeded our expectations. The best hotel for the New Year's Eve event that you can find if you have availability and can afford it.

title: Hope to visit you again
text:
Knickerbocker hotel is a Wonderful hotel, located in a great location. Center but quiet , very good staff . 
The rooms are quiet big , certainly for New York City, subway is second away
This is my third time visiting this hotel.
one side was renovated and I asked to change the room and Lucy was helping me and changed my room immediately .

title: Consistently great
text: Always appreciate the clean rooms, friendly staff, and great location. Front desk, housekeeping, and restaurant staff are all very well trained and efficient. Love the awesome gym too (but they need to fix that speed bag which is always broken).

title: Beautiful and Luxurious!
text: This was our first time in NYC and my sister recommended The Knickerbocker Hotel to us and I am happy she did! Location is perfect, walking distance to everything! The room itself was beautiful and clean. We will come back again for sure. One of the highlights of the hotel was Diana from concierge. She was so helpful with her knowledge of the city. Recommended restaurants, tours, etc. She was super sweet to our 13 year old daughter and would engage us about our day when we returned for the night. I have stayed at many hotels around the world and I have not seen this service without having to initiate myself .Thank you!

title: Johir and Sam provided excellent customer service!   The hotel and staff are top notch.  Would highly recommend!  The hotel is g
text: Awesome experience!  Can't wait to visit again! Thank you for your exceptional service bringing us water as the outdoor deck was closing! So kind of you! We look forward to having you serve us tomorrow. You are a shining example of excellent customer service!

title: Great staff and spacious rooms
text: The building is very austere but trendy and modern. You are very close to everything and the staff was very kind and accommodating. They were responsive to my needs and the housekeeping staff was very attentive. The walkability but privacy to the room in the middle of Times Square is unbeatable

title: Perfect
text:
No downside! 
This was my second visit to the knickerbocker and wouldn’t hesitate it visiting again. Some highlights:
Excellent location
Friendly staff
Beautiful rooms
Tasty breakfast options
Lively bar with beautiful views of the city
Nice restaurant

title: Half Term family trip
text:
Staff fantastic very accomplished hotel with years of experience behind them in hospitality I would highly recommended this hotel to anyone wishing to travel to New York in the heart of Time Square. We only had 4 days stay with 3 teenagers and loved every minute of it. 
Rooms were spotless every time we came back at the end of the day. 
The cafe downstairs was excellent for anything we needed. 
We as a family stayed room only but still can’t fault the place!!

title: Wonderful place to stay with young kids
text:
What a great hotel! Not only was the location superb and convenient but I can not praise the staff enough. Travelling with two young children in the busy city can be daunting. But the knickerbocker made the experience so much better. Clean and spacious rooms and always a friendly face to talk to for advice around the city. A big shout out to Louise who provided such a personal experience, by leaving fruits and cookies in the room for my children. My husband was surprised with a birthday treat on his birthday which was a lovely touch. And finally for arranging personalised NY baseball caps for my two little boys! I can’t thank you enough for our time here. It made our little family getaway much more special. 
100% would recommend and will definitely come back again.

title: COBRANÇA INDEVIDA
text:
Fiz a reserva e pagamento antecipado do total,porém durante o check in o atendente fez a cobrança total novamente em meu cartão de crédito.Questionado no dia seguinte,disse que "houve um erro"no sistema e que seria resolvido.Após estadia de 04 dias e check-out nada de resolverem.
Estou no Brasil há 3 dias e nada até agora de resolverem este problema.

title: Very very good hotel in New York
text:
Love this hotel employee were wonderful
Hotel nice & clean in the middle if town
Jim was very helpful jay & diana are the best you coming to New York I recommend this hotel wi fi very good lounge excellent tv needs a better reception so thanks  for a good time

title: Fantastic!
text: Stayed here over the President’s Day long weekend, and selected it based on the comments and ratings here. It could not have been better. What a fantastic hotel. From the check-in which was swift and elegant, to Jay and the concierge service which was impeccable, from our beautiful, clean and quiet 8th floor room overlooking 42nd Street to the great restaurant and rooftop patio literally 150 feet from the Times Square NYE ball, everything was perfect. The room rate was great, offering excellent value. The location is ideal, across the street from the south end of Times Square and literally above the subway station. We walked just about everywhere, except when we needed to get to 72nd street on the Upper Westside which, thanks to Jay’s advice, took us a mere 10 minutes on the number 2 express subway downstairs. We loved our stay here. Even a few hours without hot water due to a hotel boiler problem didn’t create issues, as it was quickly fixed by the hotel. We’d highly recommend The Knickerbocker and will definitely stay here again.

title: Great location and staff!
text: Wonderful hotel with well appointed staff. Every person we encountered was kind, professional and helpful. Hotel had a hot water issue in the morning and staff handled the sticky situation with class!! We will visit the Knickerbocker again!

title: Convenient hotel for an elegant city break
text: Classy, elegant hotel right in the middle of the action in Times Square. Staff is markedly above average for New York City in terms of warmth and attentiveness, the restaurant wait staff being the exception. Although the renovation is still pretty recent, maintenance issues have begun to appear. My A/C thermostat didn’t work and the sink drain was stuck when I checked in. That was taken care of. More problematic was the hotel-wide lack of hot water on my last day. That was very appropriately compensated on my folio but I still had to fly back home unshowered.

title: This was my second experience in the knickerbocker hotel. And again it was very nice. Whole team is very friendly, kind
text:
The location was perfect. Very convenient to reach to metro, bus. And also very easy to walking around. Very closed to public library, central station, Bryant Park, exactly in the Times Square. 
The breakfast was very nice.
This was my second staying. Sure, the third will be the same address.

title: The place to stay in NYC!
text: The Knickerbocker has the friendliest, most efficient wait staff ever.  Our room was immaculate with turn-down service.  We had a direct view of Times Square.  Personal car service to the airport was terrific.  Thank you for a wonderful stay for our Valentine’s Day trip!

title: Wonderful, the best hotel I've be to in NYC
text: We had a great time, the stay at the hotel was unbeatable. All the hotel staff are very friendly, the breakfasts and meals are fantastic, the rooms are wonderful. We will repeat without a doubt. Most of the hotel staff also speaks Spanish.

title: Great location for tourists!
text: Good hotel, the location is absolutely spot on! Literally 2 minutes walk from Times Square, easy to get everywhere.  Place was clean, fair priced and had great food options at the restaurant.  Staff efficient and helpful, would definitely recommend.

title: Lovely place, very well located, quiet
text: We stayed in a 4 person room as a family (inc two teenagers). Very nice, quiet (despite being in the heart of things). Staff were very friendly. Didn't dine in the restaurant for dinner but breakfast was very good. Andre on the door was very helpful in arranging a nice car to the airport.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: From the moment we entered, you could tell this hotel was special. The staff was attentive and the hotel was beautiful.  The towels were so thick, the bed was comfortable and the room was spacious.  We went to the Rooftop bar and it was great.  We will be back....often

title: Perfect hotel for a Times Square based trip
text: Excellent hotel in the heart of NYC. The location can't be beat if your trip centres around theatre shows, Times Square, etc. Very clean and modern, but steeped in New York history. The staff and concierge were friendly and helpful.

title: Love The Knick!!!
text: First time there, great location, clean renovated room and very pleasant staff.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.  Andrew (the very tall doorman) was the best!! Loved the Rooftop Patio (not the alcohol bill though) lol.

title: How you are treated where you stay sets the tone for the enjoyment level of your trip.
text:
Tye staff is the best. We travel a lot and come to the Knick often because of them.
Andre Sweet is an example of the excellent Customer Service one would expect at a high-end hotel.
It's always fun to arrive and everyone remember who you are. 
Hummm.....I hope we're being remembered for the good things !!

title: Divina experiencia una vez más
text: Esta es la octava vez en el hotel. Guíe en pareja, en familia, y cada vez entienden más mis necesidades y se esmeran en atenderme mejor. Ser fiel a este hotel, tiene su recompensa en el cuidado y atención. La ubicación maravillosa a metros de los teatros y resto y a la vuelta de Bryant park y negocios. El servicio a la habitación bueno y el conforta de camas y almohadas . Gracias!

title: Thank you :)
text: Thank you very much for your kind and very precious advice in particular regarding Broadway shows and museums and also thank you for taking care of us so nicely and the quality of your service very much appreciated. We loved every second of our stay with you in New York City

title: Great hotel
text:
Great choice very well located and nice service as well 
I been with my family and we enjoy very much staying there and we will come back soon to this hotel because it’s perfect to come with kids specially during winter because is next to all subway lines

title: Not what I expected.
text: The Hotel is in a good location and the staff were pleasant. I feel the hotel is a little tired and in need of some TLC, a big disappointment, considering this is a 5 star hotel, is that there is no bottled water supplied and no tea or coffee making facilities, I have stayed in less star hotels that supply both. The elevators are very dark and dingy, some of the screens don’t work, so you have no idea which floor you have stopped at. Also be aware this hotel charges a whopping $51.64 inc. taxes ‘residence fee’ per night, This is on top of what you have already paid per night. Perhaps someone from the hotel who is reading this, can explain exactly what this charge is for,what it covers and the benefits to  the guest?

title: Great experience at the Knickerbocker
text: The Knickerbocker was one of the better hotels in NY that I have stayed at.  The rooms were very spacious and modern and quiet.  The restaurant, rooftop and gym are also very nice.  I highly recommend this hotel!  The staff and service were also very friendly and helpful.

title: Incredible
text:
I'm a pillow snob. Their huge, fluffy pillows were amazing. Pleasant staff who are incredibly friendly and welcoming. I just found it odd they cleaned my room the afternoon I checked in and i hadn't even spent the night, then no housekeeping the next day. 

Great showers, got warm fast, and very nice toiletries. 

Oh! And the friendly bartender in the rooftop bar was so sweet when he gave me a cookie after finding out I was a little peckish.

title: Great location and stylish hotel
text:
Brilliant central location just at Times Square with easy subway and walking access to all the sights in Manhattan you’d typically want to visit. 

Surprisingly there wasn’t much noise at night despite proximity to Times Square, though our room was on the 14th floor. 

Stylish decor in the lobby and our double room, great comfy bed and fab views. Didn’t visit the bar but it looked very cool and I was sorry to miss it. 

Only thing that would have been nice was tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but we certainly weren’t stuck for somewhere to grab a drink with all the activity on our doorstep.

title: Love this place
text: Thank you J and Diana for making this experience so much better! Y’all are awesome at what you do! The rooftop bar is a must-see, right by where the ball drops at the New Year! The rooms are very nice and spacious. We will definitely be back!

title: Christmas Time and Hotel Review
text:
Dates: 23rd Dec 2023 - 28th Dec 2023 (Inclusive)
Room: We had a suite which was lovely (once we complained). It was a lovely room. spacious and just what we wanted for Christmas. The only thing that bugs me is the lack of hangers in the wardrobes. I shouldn't need to phone and ask for additional hangers. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The shower does need updating. For a suite, I would have thought a built in rainforest shower should be expected as a minimum. It was a basic shower head and the pressure wasn't as powerful as I'd like, however, I know this can differ. 
Service: Service was good. I can't complain on this. Everything we needed and wanted was dealt with professionally and with speed. 
Food/Drink: We used the bar once, it was lovely and clean and spacious. Cannot comment on the food in the bar due to not eating in there. We did have room service (breakfast) which was lovely. Granted, American food isn't UK standard but I was happy with no complaints. 
General: The only issue we had was when we checked in, the original room was no as advertised on the hotel and British Airways website. No flowers, small room, view was rubbish. It looked like it has recently been flipped with nothing in the room. No mini bar nor was there a kettle or coffee machine. 
Overall: I enjoyed my stay in this hotel and I would stay here again.

title: Modern, fantastic location, lovely rooms, excellent staff and location.
text:
A fantastic hotel in the heart of Times Square. A modern and swish setting with great staff from the doormen, front of house & bar / restaurant team. The rooms are modern with all the usual amenities with the highlight having Diptyque creams and bathroom gels, a lovely touch.

The room service team deserve special mention keeping the rooms impeccably clean with nightly turndown and fresh towels.

Another huge charm is the Roof top terrace that gives you amazing views over Times Square.

This hotel is steeped in so much history and the location is easy reach of all the midtown setting in the heart of Manhattan.

You won’t be disappointed and management deserve the praise for ensuring all guests are welcomed with a smile from all team members. 

I’ll be back.

title: Beautiful hotel, very friendly staff!
text: J and Diana are the best concierge team we’ve ever met! They are so great to each guest! Room is comfortable and the rooftop bar is very cool! You can see where the ball drops every New Year on the rooftop! This hotel delivers the experience for sure! We will return here very soon!

title: The Knick - @ the hub of Time Square, the Theater District, & good Cuisine
text:
Unknowingly I booked the Knick through a third party and receiving no email or text confirmation prior to our departure, I called the Knick and was gratefully reassured my reservation was in place.

Upon arrival (about 1pm), the front desk could not have been more welcoming and professional. I asked if I could upgrade my room to one with a view and the front desk folks cheerfully accommodated my wishes. Our room was on the 14th floor and looked out towards Time Square, where we could see the famous “Time Square Ball” – this view was outstanding (btw, the blackout shade is effective in giving one a longer night). Our room was spacious, the bed was comfortable (and my wife and are very picky about beds and pillows), the bathroom was well laid out with two ways of accessing it (great in the middle of the night). There was a privacy toilet and terrific shower, and the lighting nicely variable. The personal lights next to each bedside are most considerate of your bed mate. Turn down service is nice. Every room request (even the informal ones) was addressed immediately.

Although we didn’t use the concierge for any personal requests (we arrived with restaurant reservation and theater tickets), after speaking with the concierge we know that we will ask for his expertise when we book our next Knickerbocker reservation (directly). He was knowledgeable and a pleasure to talk to and will trust his recommendations in the future. The staff, to a person (doorman included), understand their roles and are professional of the highest caliber.

title: Great hotel stay NYC
text: Excellent hotel. Staff goes above and beyond. Location is excellent right in the middle of time Square! Food and drinks were excellent. I only had breakfast but there was a great variety! I will definitely be staying again!!!!!! Definitely 10/10!!!!!

title: perfect hotel
text: There is nothing better than this.^^     I was satisfied in every way.     Everything was great including location, service, and room condition.  If I get the chance, I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: An elegant property in the heart of Times Square
text: The location is great––right in the heart of Times Square with great access to shopping, restaurants, bakeries, etc. nearby. Inside the hotel, the din and chaos of Times Square feel far away. I found the rooms to be very quiet. I loved the room blinds and the quality linens and mattress of the bed. It was very spacious, unlike so many other NYC hotels. It is reasonably priced. Two elegant spots to enjoy cocktails, drinks and nibbles with friends right on-site. Friendly, professional staff. Recommended!

title: Birthday trip
text: Stayed 3 nights at the Knickerbocker . Great location . Great room . Only ate there once , that was breakfast Saturday . Not very good tbh . Fruits , yoghurts, cold meats , cheese’s etc all very good as you would expect , but the hot stuff bacon , beans , egg etc. Was only warm verging on cold . Not good . It was a self service buffet style and yet there was a 16 plus dollar service charge , which I asked to be removed from my bill and it was removed . A big let down , May have had dinner if the breakfast hadn’t been so disappointing . Would probably stay again would not eat there

title: Can’t wait to come back!
text: What a place! 10/10 experience at The Knickerbocker! Attentive employees, large and clean space! Would recommend a stay here any day! Wonderful location, easy access to subway stations. The Knickerbocker was the best hotel stay my family has ever had!

title: Will stay here again
text: Everything about our trip was excellent. Check-in was easy. The restaurant and bar staffs were friendly. The location was perfect. The hotel staff texted to make sure everything was ok, and responded to a few special requests. Finally, the room was nice, larger than many Manhattan hotel rooms. All in all, it was a great stay.

title: Great location, comfortable room and outstanding service from doormen, housekeeping, concierge and guest services
text: Great location. Room was  extremely clean and well appointed. The room was more quiet than expected being a city view. Every department was extremely courteous and prompt with requests. Turn down service and fresh towels at night was fantastic. Can't say enough about the service we experienced from concierge to housekeeping and everyone in between

title: Wonderful stay
text: Only a one night stay, I wish it was longer. Centrally located to the theater district and all that comes with it. Good price, large room, all the best of of a high end hotel room. Staff were friendly and efficient. We also went to the hotel restaurant for dinner and breakfast. Food was excellent, staff were pleasant, and knowledgeable.

title: PLEASANT STAY IN NYC
text: Everything during my stay is simply perfect. Clean room, excellent location, easy access to Metro station, quick check in and out, handful staff to help me with my huge luggages. All wonderful memory filled up my stay in this winter.

title: Jan 2024
text: We often visit NYC, and this is our go to hotel. Each time we have stayed, even during the pandemic, has been the same experience. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and kept up with and it is in a central spot to all of our other go to places. Time Square is literally right around the corner and Central Park is in walkable distance.

title: Excellent stylist hotel
text: Lovely hotel, great vibe, totally removed from the crazy streets outside.  Really excellent staff. Room was modern, fantastic view ( which we did pay for ) beds sooo comfy . Nice bar and restaurant. Only one gripe we asked for a coffee machine then only got 2 x coffee pods per day sort of thrown on the table... coffee cups were not changed we had to ring several times to ask for clean cups.. we could have washed them but at almost $600 per night they should have had a clean tray set up with several coffees and clean cups everyday . When we mentioned this at checkout they did know $100 off the bill

title: Out of this world!
text: Perfect sleep: the bed and choice of pillows allows for amazing staff, breakfast out of this world. But it’s also the small details, the gym is open 24/7 with fruit and ice water, the staff pick on. The smallest big details to ensure you are looked after.

title: The Knickerbocker - an elegant gem hidden amidst Time Square
text: The Knickerbocker is an extraordinary hotel.  An elegant gem hidden amidst the hustle & bustle of Times Square.  Wonderful staff.  Large, well-appointed rooms. Excellent restaurant whether the great buffet or amazing dinner menu.  Luxurious value

title: My first stay
text:
This was my first time staying at The Knickerbocker (Times Square) and I'm so glad I did! The staff was amazing. Victor, in particular, made sure I was taken care of. 
He was kind, attentive and honestly, felt like family. After traveling all day, it was nice to be welcomed by such a genuine soul. Thank you, Victor!

Also, the room was beautiful and the views from the rooftop were stunning!

-T

title: Always a great experience
text: We stay at The Knickerbocker each time we visit NYC. The staff is always friendly and welcoming and the rooms are inviting.  I only with the rooftop bar would remain open later on weekends so we could stop in for a cocktail after our theater or musical event.

title: Will return!
text: This was my second stay at the Knickerbocker in New York City and I’m sure I will be back in the future. The rooms are big, beds are comfortable, and the location is ideal. I would have liked breakfast to be included.

title: Definitely would stay again
text: The bed and the pillows were very comfortable.  The toiletries smelled lovely. The cleaning service did a wonderful job.  The welcoming staff were very friendly and helpful.  The restaurant was beautiful and the food was excellent.

title: Nice and clean, close to offices
text: The room size is good. It is clean. Front desk is happy and nice. It is at times square near to my office. I enjoyed $50 credit for a nice breakfast at their cafe. I will go there again if I traveled to New York for work

title: Another lovely stay at the Knickerbocker
text:
We had a wonderful  second stay at the Knickerbocker Hotel this weekend!  The beautiful, clean accommodations set in an ideal location in Manhattan make it our go to hotel in NYC. The staff is welcoming, extremely courteous, professional, and accommodating.
We look forward to our next visit back to the Knickerbocker.

title: Fantastic Stay
text: Great service and the place was beautiful! It was very clean and the room was spacious and a great view too. I would definitely come back when I’m in New York. It definitely gives luxury status!! I didn’t try the restaurant fully but the breakfast was delicious.

title: New Years Eve
text: Beautiful hotel in a great location. Wonderful staff.  This was our second NYE at this location, but have also stayed there numerous times throughout the year. Can be a little but worth it. Room service is very limited,  but Charlie Palmers is very good. The rooftop is amazing. Location is convenient to most attractions.

title: Great stay at the Knickerbocker
text:
The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel and rooms are modern and new it also smells delightful.
Interesting that there was no tea &coffee facilities or glasses however the staff were great when this was requested.
Great location and would recommend to others

title: The Best Hotel in NYC
text: I stayed here for a couple of days and it was fantastic. They offered a complimentary gift basket and were really quick when we needed something. I really recommend this hotel, it is the best I have ever been to and I am a frequent traveler.

title: Amazing Team in the best Hotel in NY
text:
Amazing stay in Room 1601 ❤️

Wir durften vom 1.1. bis 6.1.2024 in unserem Lieblingshotel in NY verbringen. Vom herzlichen Ankunft, zum wunderbaren Zimmer 1601, dem herrlichen Frühstück und den sehr herzlichen, zuvorkommenden und stets hilfsbereiten Angestellten, passte einfach alles. Wir haben uns sooooooooo wohl gefühlt, konnten die Zeit herrlich geniessen und freuen uns mega bald wieder zu kommen. 

Ein riesiges Thank you! für das gesamte Team. Alle waren wunderbar! Amazing people in the best Hotel in NY!

We come back soon❤️

title: Short break in NYC
text: The rooms were lovely, clean, comfortable and well furnished. The hotel is perfectly located in Times Square and close to everything with the subway almost next door. Staff were very helpful. The rooftop terrace is lovely for a drink at night. You would never know you were in the middle of NYC up there! The only thing I would change is providing coffee and tea facilities in the room as that would make a big difference in the mornings. Other than that I can’t fault it and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Great comfortable stay
text: We are just regular people, this was a very expensive place for us! But when on vacation we like to splurge! That being said at first I felt outta place but they treated us just the same when we showed up in sweat pants and hoodies! lol great place great location!

title: Friendly staff, great location
text:
Absolutely loved everything about our stay and how friendly the staff were. We especially loved the local directions from the concierge, Denise. She was very informative and nice to our kiddos. 
We loved the location, not a fan of the car horns as wake-up calls, but we loved the ease of getting to other attractions from there.

title: True Gem in Time Square
text: We stayed here for Christmas for 2 nights. The customer service and all the staff were so polite and helpful. The rooms were beautiful, the valet parking was perfect, the rooftop bar was awesome. Drinks were absolutely delicious. My family will return to this hotel next time we stay in the Times Square area and recommend it to anyone else who is considering it.

title: Definitely Go!
text:
Amazing NYE party and staff! 
I would highly recommend a stay there! Everyone was so accommodating and the location was superb! I hope to return again! Thank you to everyone there for their kindness, smiles and putting me in a NY state of mind!

title: Very Memorable, Really enjoyed the hospitality!
text: The Staff could not have been more helpful, accommodating, friendly and hospitable!  The hotel is beautiful and conveniently located ~ the staff really made it special!  We were there for NYE with children and they made sure we were well taken care of, knew what to do and where to go and how to have a great experience!

title: Post Holiday Family Trip
text: This was one of the best hotel experiences we have had. First hotel is awesome. Historic hotel with updated rooms and amenities. Restaurant was fantastic and great with the kids. Rooftop bar was also great with top notch bartenders and great outside patio. Rooms were updated and modern meeting. Blackout shades and very comfy bed and pillows. We upgraded to jr suite and was more than enough room for family of five. Concierge team was great before we arrive and made dinner and limo reservations for us. Made our kids feel as stars upon arrival. Jimmy was an already a great representative for the lobby. Helped us with our bags and welcomed us each time when we come back to the hotel. He was one of the greatest parts of our visit and made us feel very welcome as guests. This was a great family trip and recommended if you have a family to stay here for your trip as it was worth every penny for the comforts that were afforded to us.

title: Good stay
text: Excellent stay and location. If you get this hotel for a reasonable price then please do book them if visiting Times Square. Worth the penny. Just 200 mts to the Times. Would recommend for all type of people.

title: Passagem de ano
text:
Excelente hotel. Passamos aqui a passagem de ano de 2023 para 2024 e foi excelente. A localização é top em pleno times square. O staff é muito simpático e atencioso e os quartos são muito bons.
Se desejam algo central é bom, este é o hotel certo.

title: Great staff, clean room and location that doesn’t compare.
text: We enjoyed our stay but we didn’t expect the extra cost per day. Being Australian we weren’t aware of this until paying when checking out. Location, staff and cleanliness of the room were great. The food from the restaurant was yummy and catered for a celiac.

title: Love the stay-in at The Knickerbocker
text: I stayed at The Knickerbocker on Christmas, and it was the perfect Christmas ever, I am glad I chose The Knickerbocker to stay for our Christmas. The room condition is really good, and the staff was VERY kind and excellent. Highly Recommended!

title: A classy gem in a perfect location
text: We had a wonderful festive stay at The Knick. Staff could not have been more welcoming and helpful and they made Christmas extra special for our children. This hotel is a classy gem in a perfect location with first class food and cocktails.

title: Great spot in heart of NYC!
text: Beautiful property i. The heart of NYC/Times Square, great location to get around to all the sites, super comfortable beds, great food, excellent service all around, we had zero issues during our stay…I will definitely return!

title: Amazing
text: Amazing staff and amazing rooms and amenities. I had a nice experience from the moment I walked into the door to the moment I exited the door to go back home. I would consider going back again if I ever return to NYC

title: Greatest NYE celebration!
text: This place was nothing short of amazing! The venue is completely beautiful and the service is so awesome!! I would absolutely recommend checking this hotel and rooftop out any time visiting New York or exploring the city!

title: Johir is the best
text:
Johir is the main man. This guy gave TOP SERVICE!!! This was my first experience here for NYE and he was the best! He helped everyone with our dietary restrictions. 5/5
Also, this time is the best I def recommend it

title: Jahir for the win
text: Johir is amazing!!! Made our night amazing!!! Everything was absolutely spectacular!!!!!!!!!!!!!! So kind so attentive and helpful could not have asked for a better server. Thank you so much for the Knickerbocker for this is experience  and please give him a raise.

title: Marvelous Oasis in Times Square
text: We had a fantastic stay at the Knickerbocker Christmas week…the hotel is fabulous, the staff fantastic!  Shout out especially to Jimmy and Diane who were so helpful as I showed my 4 grandchildren NYC at Christmas for the 1st time!

title: Holiday stay
text:
Great location and the staff are very polite and attentive. We had no issues and would definitely stay again. 

Close to Bryant park, Times Square and subway. Easy walk to Radio City Music Hall and Broadway.

title: Excellent
text: Great staff, great room, good food. Stay here every year or two and never  disappointed. Part of Leading Hotels of the World, so we get points and free breakfasts. Location is only drawback. Times Square sucks.

title: New York was awesome
text: The hotel was awesome!! Big room, exceptionally clean.. they cleaned every day brought clean towels and water bottles daily.. the breakfast was good but ridiculous we had the buffet one plate it was 114.00 for 2

title: Christmas getaway
text: Very clean, comfortable and customer service friendly.   The hotel has a very relaxed atmosphere amid all the hustle and bustle of the city which was wonderful.   The location was perfect and the rooms were modern and clean.  We enjoyed the rooftop lounge, it was perfect to relax with a drink and take in the city lights.  Will stay again.

title: Knickerbocker
text:
We made our room reservations well in advance and confirmed them twice. When we arrived they had trouble finding our reservation and when they did, they realized they had given away the room we booked so they put us in a smaller, inferior room. The room had one small window that faced a building that was only a few feet away, this blocked the sunlight and caused a dark gloomy, depressing room. We called it the dungeon.  At check in, I asked to speak to one of the managers and the clerk assured me they would reach out to me and make things right, but they never did. 
After 2 nights, I received one of those automated texts asking how our stay was going.  When I responded, we had some issues they texted back concerned, but at that point it was too little, too late. 
When looking for a hotel in the city there are a lot of choices and I know in the future, we will be staying somewhere else other than the knickerbocker.

title: Knickerbocker hotel
text: We had a great stay at the knickerbocker, fantastic location, central to everything. Rooms were nice, clean, great amenities. We found all of the staff super friendly except the staff at the rooftop bar, unenthusiastic, rude, overcharged us a couple of times

title: Great staff
text: The staff is amazing, very attentive and efficient. They made you feel welcome and went above and beyond to make sure everything went as smoothly as possible. Clean hotel, comfy beds and pillows. Rooftop bar was nice and drinks were great! I will definitely be back

title: Nice but not 5*
text:
Overall this is a decent hotel in NYC and the location is great for sightseeing. The hotel is in the ‘Leading Hotels of the World’ group and markets itself as the only 5* hotel in Times Square - This is NOT a 5* standard hotel. 

Pros -
* Location, perfect for sightseeing 
* Housekeeping, the room was always immaculate on our return.
* Room sizes, larger than the average NYC hotel.
* Noise levels were so low considering the chaos outside.

Cons -
* Tired decor in room, carpet frayed at the edges and stained with what looked like make-up. The dressing gowns provided had seen better days and were not wearable.
* the rooftop bar, you’ll be lucky to get in as it’s always used for ‘private events’ seemingly at peak times, this was annoying.
* No personal touch - because of the way the lobby is laid out staff literally have no idea if you’re a resident or just a customer using the bar. We stayed at the hotel a week and couldn’t tell you any staff members that stood out to us or made it special or even recognised us as guests.
* No in room tea/coffee facilities. There were free hot drinks in the lobby in the morning but this would have meant getting dressed to go down to get a drink.
* No ‘do not disturb’ sign for the door - this is something I’ve never encountered before as a problem, but due to this the housekeeping would come in the morning/evening and wake you up by knocking. This is an easy thing that could be rectified.

I would recommend this hotel but that’s purely based on the room size and location but I think you could probably get nicer for less money not too far away.

title: New York the best city
text:
What an amazing experience we had. The location of the building is perfect with subway access right next to the hotel and with a great view to the Times Square from the rooftop.The bedrooms were conmfortable although the cleaning that wasn’t that perfect. Beside this, the breakfast was good with great food but it was’nt much diverse. 
In summary it was a perfect New York City experience to have with your family. Totally recomend.

title: Disappointed
text: Our experience was disappointing, and that the air-conditioning didn’t work in both rooms that we had.  Along with that the TV didn’t work and we had four or five different folks come up and try to fix it. The door on the refrigerator was broken off. Unfortunately, it did not appear that the hotel has kept up with other top-tier hotels. This was a Christmas vacation That we were excited about that did not live up to expectations. By the way, when we called to have the TV fixed, it went to voicemail and we needed to leave a message.

title: Top Hotel
text:
The hotel is in a top location, it is very clean and comfortable. Only the breakfast staff is a bit careless and not always very friendly.
We would book this hotel again at any time and would be happy to recommend it to others. 

Das Hotel ist in einer Top Lage, es ist sehr sauber und comfortabel. Einzig das Frühstücksperonal ist ein bisschen lieblos und nicht immer ganz freundlich. 
wir würden dieses Hotel jederzeit wieder buch und werden es auch gerne weiterempfehlen

title: Wonderful time at The Knickerbocker
text: We had such a wonderful time.  The Knickerbocker was  amazing.  It was the perfect location to everything!  Walking distance to Bryant Park, Grand Central station, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center,  Empire State building and Joe's Pizza and of course everting you can find in the Times Square.  The Hôtel was clean and the staff was super friendly.  The views from the roof top bar were spectacular.  I highly recommend The Knickerbocker.

title: Great hotel and best stuff ever
text:
Great hotel and best stuff ever ,  the location is amazing, everywhere is just steps away . This was my second visit to NEW YORK, I didn’t think twice to go and book at this hotel again.
Hotel is very comfy and quiet, rooms are amazing , I travelled with my kids , and we got both rooms connected with corridor entrance. 
Kids like the rooms facilities . 
Thank you

title: Elegant hotel in excellent location
text: Lovely big suite with huge bathroom and fab toiletries. Very friendly and helpful staff. Large rooftop bar with wraparound balcony. Walking distance to Empire State  and Times Square. Quiet despite position.

title: Perfecte service en locatie
text: Prachtig hotel op goede locatie. Vriendelijk personeel en lekker grote kamer met super fijne bedden en douche. ‘s avonds ook nog een service om de kamer nachtklaar te maken als je dat wenst. Koffiezetter en waterkoker niet aanwezig maar op verzoek kunnen ze dat in de kamer zetten. Net als een magnetron. Het ontbijt is ook zeer uitgebreid en luxe. Klein minpuntje maar dat is een detail: voor een 5 sterrenhotel zou de föhn wat indrukwekkender mogen zijn. Met dit exemplaar kreeg je nog geen cavia droog geföhnd 😀

title: Amazing view
text: Amazing room with perfect view of balldrop, comfortable bed but the pillows were super uncomfortable to sleep. Great location, walking distance to everything make sure to check out the rooftop bar every nice and layback

title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel
text: A lovely boutique hotel - spacious room and bathroom and very quiet.  Really well located too for sightseeing and shopping. There is a great rooftop bar with seating both inside and out. If staying for New Years Eve, this is the closest vantage point to watch the famous ball drop. If not, be sure to stop and sample an espresso martini, for which they are famous.

title: Great stay and great location
text: Great stay. Great location. Big room. Friendly staff. We have stayed in a lot of Times Square hotels. We would stay here again. One of the biggest rooms we have stayed in. Plenty of space to share vanity / bathroom area. Location is excellent, beginning of Times Square and one block from Bryant park. Subway right outside. Coffee quick serve was excellent.

title: Unfriendly and unmotivated staff otherwise very good hotel
text:
Front office is a disaster and the concierge only gives out lists of restaurants or bar tips, the concierge does not make reservations.
The chambermaids, on the other hand, are super friendly. The hotel (room, restaurant) is well equipped and in a great location, even if the wardrobes and furniture in the room are already very worn. However, the mattresses are very comfortable. I can't quite understand why it is an LHW hotel.

title: If you want to be the best you have to deliver, otherwise you are just average
text: The positives - the hotel is in a great location and the staff are great, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfy.  We were on the 7th floor, couldn't hear the street noise at all even though our window fronted onto it.  The disappointment was a lack of coffee machines in the room, and that if you did want free coffee you could only have it between 5 and 7am.  As it happens we wanted to stay nearer to UK time to avoid the jet lag, but getting dressed to go downstairs for your first coffee of the morning at 5am is just annoying.  Even Premier Inns in the UK have a Nespresso!  Also the bars in the hotel shut  early, so by the time you have had dinner and return they are shut - not great.  Worse one night of our stay the bar was shut for a corporate do, which given there's no alternative (it was too cold for the rooftop) other than going back out, is frustrating.

title: Great value money.
text:
Maybe not the top notch 5 stars hotel but, in Manhattan, is great value money hotel.
Everything slick and neat from check in to check out, perfectly located,.
The only downside is the rooftop often booked for private parties, hence not accessible to the hotel guests. 
Will return for sure.

title: Front office stafff great
text:
Currently staying at the hotel for the first time even though I have been to New York many times 
My new home away from home 
Excellent location 
Great room wise compared to other hotels in the area 
Breakfast staff extremely friendly 
Reception staff member Lucy has be fantastic and great service especially with my Child

title: Great hotel and service
text: Great hotel and the doorman was exceptionally professional, friendly and proactively helpful ordering a limo and suggesting a coffee while I wait 10 mins.   I've forgotten the doorman's name, but I checked out Dec15 around 7:30am and he had worked the morning before.

title: Service like no other
text: Beautiful location. We will come back because of Victor the Bellboy. Wow what service he provided. Bar none, one of the best customer service experiences and we travel extensively. So attentive, helpful and very in tune!

title: Ok for a city break
text:
Although the Hotel was centre of where we needed to be and aesthetically looked pleasing, the walls are like paper. 
Positives:

Genuinely friendly staff.
Ideal location
Holding room for luggage
Daily room maids.
Fridge in a good size room.

Negatives:
Slamming of doors and banging in rooms above.
Noisy bathtub 
Can also hear the adjacent rooms using bathrooms. 
The carpet in our room needed updating.
And what is going on with the location of toilet paper? Should be placed at hip height not feet. 

Overall our experience at this Hotel was ok. 
We only ventured up to the roof top bar once which was nice. You get a complimentary drink with a token you get once signed in.

The only other issue is charging my credit card a wrong amount on checking out.

title: Calm comfortable room in the middle of everything. Rooms are quite large. Bed and bedding are very luxurious feeling.
text: We enjoyed the friendly and helpful staff. The roof top bar and restaurant were nice to come back to after being out all day walking and shopping. Location is really great as we were near subway stations as well as Bryant Park and 5th Avenue. Highly recommend

title: Holiday experience in the city
text: We booked through Priceline and had  a nightmare of an experience. We arrived to the Knickerbocker hotel and somehow our reservation was cancelled although I had paid a month prior through a third party priceline. One of the night managers Ariellee saw how exhausted we were trying to deal with Priceline all day and into that night. He gave us a room even though our issue wasn’t resolved. He honored what my Pricelines price and was so accommodating to us during our whole stay. I would highly recommend staying at the Knickerbocker hotel between the roof top club, restaurant, and location this Hotel is the real deal. I will always consider it our first choice when we travel to NYC because of how Ariellee handled our unfortunate situation.

title: Terrible experience
text: The hotel front desk clerks only care about you if you boast about the millions of dollars you make. A gentleman in front of me was treated like royalty as he was very loudly shouting how much money he makes. When I approached and stated I wanted to check in their demeanor changed drastically. My company booked and prepaid for the room but they decided to charge my personal card over $800. I explained that my company had already prepaid for the room and they told me “That doesn’t matter you need to pay” At no point did they try to help or find a solution. I also was never informed of the rooftop no lounges and bar on the 4th floor like the previously gentleman was. My company booked and paid for a Superior Queen room and paid extra for a view. I was given a room with 2 beds and no view! Of course it upset me because I did not get what I booked and paid for. I called front desk and was told they did not have the room I booked available. So why would they offer a room let me pay for it and turn around and say sorry we don’t have that but not even offer a refund for placing me in a basic room. The room I was placed in was dirty. There was trash left in the room. Dirty towels in the bathroom and half drank water bottles. This is definitely not a 5 star hotel at all! Staying at a motel 6 would be better than staying here! After I checked out I was then charged an extra $30 and I have no idea what for. I did not eat at the hotel. I did not ask for anything extra. I did not order room service. I will be calling my bank to dispute that extra $30 since it was not printed on my invoice and I know the hotel will not offer me any solutions.

title: Keine 5 Sterne
text:
Keine echten 5 Sterne hat dieses Hotel. Der Service ist durchschnittlich, weder Minibar noch Wasserkocher am Zimmer, dafür ist der Roomservice teuer.
Die Zimmer sind eher dunkel… 
Für 4 Sterne Hotel wäre es ok.
Concierge ist nicht wirklich vorhanden.
Für den Preis kann man besser Übernachten in NYC.

title: NY where dreams come true
text:
What is not to love about the Knickerbocker a perfect hotel in a perfect location. We stayed on the 6th floor and the room was huge, elegantly stylish, immaculately clean with the comfiest bed I’ve ever slept on and a nice choice of toiletries.  The noise from the chaos  below of Times Square did not really have any impact, I wished I had now paid a little extra to have gone to a higher floor and a bigger window but that’s not anything against the hotel.   

We arrived at 8pm and the last thing I wanted to do was go out and explore so we showered and headed up to the rooftop bar for food and cocktails, both were outstanding and the views spectacular, a great introduction to NY on our first night.  I was a little surprised how early the rooftop bar closes, I guess that’s just me being British but in one way it meant we were in bed early enough to be up exploring the next day. 

I do think that for the cost of the room it should have something like a Nespresso machine, but other than that I can say, check in staff, bell boy, housekeeping were all exceptional and I would highly recommend to everyone, I already have :)

title: Nice journey in New York
text: The hotel is so nice and staffs was so good. Air conditioning is so good . Breakfast is so delicious and room was so clean . It is central and very close to Times Square. If I come again to New York I choose it

title: ok aber nicht mehr
text: gutes hotel aber kein LHW Hotel, gute Lage, frühstück durchschnittlich, teuer, freundliches personal, Lift unübersichtlich, zimmer ebenfalls durchschnttlich, kein wasserkocher, minibar leer, ein tee 27$ roomservice, türöffnen gab es nicht

title: Very nice, great location, needs a tiny bit of love
text: Renovated rooms and 4th floor restaurant are great.  Rooftop bar space (inside) and some of the furniture (couches in suite, some chairs) all feel very worn/needing replacing.  Minor and easily fixable.

title: Simply the best in every way!
text: Simply the best in every way! From the amazing staff to the comfiest bed and fluffy pillows you could ever dream of. Our stay was perfect in every way, it felt like staying at a home in the centre of a large busy city. Saying that, the location was perfect for our trip, super easy to get from place to place and never too noisy to keep us awake. Just simply perfect!

title: Knickerbocker ist leider eine große Enttäuschung
text:
Positiv:  Rooftop Bar ist schön, schließt aber um 23 Uhr und ab 22:30 Uhr gibt es keinen Service mehr.
Lage ist gut, direkt am Times Square, aber auch nicht einzigartig. Es gibt viele Hotels dort.
Die Fassade des Hauses von außen ist sehr schön, leider wird im inneren dem in keiner Weise entsprochen.

Negativ: · Das Hotel ist leider eine Enttäuschung. Eigentlich ist das mehr ein Apartmenthaus. Keine Lobby, keine Atmosphäre. Wie in einem Studentenwohnheim geht man zu den Fahrstühlen und findet sind in einer Etage mit Türen. Nichts gemütliches, alles total steril und einfach. Im Zimmer sind Schlafbereich und Naßbereich nicht getrennt, lediglich eine Milchglasschiebetür. D.h. wenn einer auf der Toilette ist, ist der andere mit dabei. Stil eines einfachen Budget-Hotels, nur zum Preis von über 1000 $ pro Nacht. In der 4. Etage ist ein Frühstücksrestaurant, davor ein paar Tische, die sie Lobby nennen. Da will man nicht sein.

title: Overrated, Dated and Poor Sevice
text:
Our first impression proved to be the reality of this hotel. Long ago, the hotel decided that renting out the lobby to a sneaker. Store was more important than a grand entrance for your guests. The lobby is tiny and has very little seating for guests waiting to check in. We joined the queue leaning against the wall and waited 20 minutes to check in. We spent this time listening complaints from guests going to the front desk. We had hoped we would have a better experience, but that was not the case. 

Our first room was an awkward interior room with a view of the hotel HVAC system. It went downhill from there. When we came back from a show we noticed that the room was quite warm. Turned thermostat all the way down but it kept warmer. Opened the window as much as we could. Kept waking all night from the heat. It was 80 degrees in the room and impossible to get a good sleep. 

In the morning I went down to request a room change. They asked if they could look at the problem first. I described how horrible the experience was and said not only should I get a room change that the hotel should make a concession for putting us in a room that should not be in service. agreed to provide a new room but would only offer a $50 food and beverage for a horrible night. She said if I was unhappy with that she could have a manager call me I said that would be helpful. She also said that someone would call me when our new room was ready they would call. We never received a call the room was ready. 

When we returned around 5 PM, they did indeed have a new room for us. At this time, I mentioned that no manager had ever called me and I was still waiting for that call. We went up to our new room, which had better temperature control and an improved view, which was less important. The problem was that like the other room it was beat up and outdated. The carpet was stained, bedding had stains, curtains were ripped, and the furnishings showed significant wear and tear. 

I should also mention the elevators are horrible. You’ll spend a great deal of your time in this hotel, waiting for an elevator. Not only really slow, they don’t even have an indicator to show which one is coming and which ones are near. Some things old are nostalgic and charming. Some just need to be replaced.

Definitely not a five star property. Not even close. to request for a manager to call me any three night stay, never happened. 

This hotel has a wonderful location. The benefits and there.

title: Great, beautiful hotel!
text: The rooms are wonderful,  great bedding and the nicest pillows!! Was pleasantly surprised at how spacious the rooms with a great shower!! Great location too. Friendly staff, very CLEAN, nice restaurant and a  rooftop!! I will certainly stay here again!

title: Exquisite Elegance at The Knickerbocker, NYC
text:
My stay at The Knickerbocker Hotel in NYC was nothing short of magnificent. Located right in the heart of the city, the hotel expertly blends historical charm with modern luxury.
