The room provided a serene, stylish retreat with stunning views of Times Square. Fine dining at the hotel’s restaurant was a highlight, offering delicious cuisine and exceptional service. The rooftop bar was a real treat, boasting spectacular city views and a great selection of drinks.

Its prime location made exploring New York’s famous attractions incredibly easy. Every staff member demonstrated outstanding service, adding to the overall excellence of the stay.

The Knickerbocker isn’t just a hotel, it’s an experience, perfectly capturing the essence of New York luxury. I highly recommend it for an unforgettable city getaway.

title: Cuidado con la tarjeta de crédito
text:
El hotel está muy bien situado. 
Pero a todos aquellos que quieran venir, vayan con cuidado, porque en el checkin lógicamente te piden una tarjeta de crédito y te bloquean un dinero, hasta aquí bien. Pero luego juegan con tu tarjeta como les da la gana, te van haciendo cargos, alguno lo anulan…. Cuando nadie les ha autorizado a utilizarla. Lo normal es utilizarla en el checkout, pero durante la estancia, NO PUEDEN USARLA. 
VIGILEN SI VIENEN

title: Excellent
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Knickerbocker. The hotel staff is  excellent. Went out of their way for us the whole stay. Everyone from front desk, housekeeping and doorman were all so helpful and kind. Great location in Time Square in the heart of everything easy access to the subway and train. Even with the hotel in Time Square the rooms are very quiet. Family friendly safe and comfortable. Amazing views from the roof top bar. Excellent drinks and food.

title: Attention to details!!!
text: Attention to details in all areas!!! Took a trip with one of my daughters and had the most fabulous experience!!! Luxurious linens and towels, beautiful and ample closet space, incredible toiletries, bottled water and chocolates before bed were just some of the treats provided!! Each and every staff member did what they could to make our time perfect!!! We will be back (HOPEFULLY SOON!!)!!

title: Great hotel in great location.
text:
Fabulous location. Walking distance to all the major sites as well as Broadway plays.  Rooms large and comfortable. Staff very helpful. Will be our go to place in NYC.
Special kudos to Houcine and Gania, who took such good care of us at breakfast every day in the 4th floor restaurant.

title: A WOW! Hotel
text:
I was frustrated to not get the room I reserved at the Knickerbocker Hotel. Because of my medical condition, a room with two beds was reserved. When my daughter and my self-arrived at this hotel, our reserved room was not honored. The attentive and courteous of the hotel manager at the time, Asian tall guy, we did not get his name; made our stay as comfortable as possible. The Knickerbocker hotel with its convenient location and luxurious accommodations made our stay truly memorable. The Knickerbocker Hotel with its location and exceptional staff service, especially the Asian tall manager, is highly recommended!
Luz D Estrada/CEO/Ameritrans Express Inc

title: Amazing experience
text: Truly an amazing experience every time we visit!!! We will never go anywhere else when we are in NYC!!!  The staff is the best of the best a care about the details greatly!! Can’t wait to come back for another visit!

title: Great place to stay for a weekend in NYC
text: Great service very friendly and accommodating staff!!  Room was extremely large and very nice. Hector greeted us and took care of our bags and let us know that if we needed anything at all not to hesitate to ask. Overall great experience at the Knickerbocker!!

title: A pleasant surprise
text: The staff is great, the rooms are spacious and the hotel is in a great location. It was a pleasant surprise considering most hotels in New York are small and expensive for no reason. I will definitely visit again.

title: A wonderful time in a very smart hotel.
text:
Knickerbocker Hotel is a superb hotel. Ideally situated at Times Square, the best starting point to visit all the ‘must see’ NY attractions.
The hotel has a very grand marble reception area, further enhanced by a wonderful Christmas tree that appeared during our stay. Our room was large, clean, and very comfortable.
The staff are all friendly, attentive, and efficient, nothing was too much trouble. The room servicing, and turn down service was super efficient, the front of house staff were happy to risk life and limb hailing taxis for us! 
The only niggle, for those of us who like an early morning coffee, or cup of tea after a busy day, in their  room -  tea making facilities have been removed from all rooms. 
We asked on three occasions for a kettle and two mugs  to be loaned.  Promises were made each time, none appeared … 
Would we stay here again? Definitely -  (we’d simply remember to  pack a small kettle!)

title: Nice, clean and central
text: Hotel very central and has everything you need.  Found the elevators very odd.  Never tell you what floor you are on until the doors opened.  Found several people who had also gone to several floors they didn't need to so not just me.  Beds very comfortable and shower was amazing.  Toilet door didn't quite close so luckily was with good friends and no idea why the toilet roll holder was about 12 inches off the floor.  Would stay there again though if I wanted to be central in manhattan.  One wee tip is they did offer to get us a car to go to a show downtome.  Would have been $75 dollars.  We said no and managed to get a yellow cab for a lot less.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Great location with large clean modern rooms and nice people...near everything we went broadway, west village, nolita, met etc in two days, Great room service as well! Gym is great, no pressure anywhere... 5 stars

title: The Knick is the Best
text: The Knickerbocker is perfectly located in Times Square. The staff are all pleasant and gracious. For us, the Knickerbocker is the only place to stay when in New York City. I highly recommend the Knick to help make your NYC experience the best.

title: THIS HOTEL IS A SCAM! STAY AWAY!
text:
I rarely write reviews online but my experience has been so bad with this hotel that I find it necessary to share it with everyone  looking at this place.

I made a reservation at the Knickerbocker's through one of the online travel services for one night and I got a great rate of $70 per night with breakfast included. Just an hour before checking in and as I was on my way someone from the hotel called and informed that they cannot honor the $70 price as it was mistakenly put online and is too low. He offered a price of nearly $200 per night or my reservation would be canceled, to which I agreed given I did not have anywhere else to go on the last minute. I was checked in with an African-American reception lady and I asked her if the higher price also included breakfast, to which she said yes and confirmed my rate includes breakfast.

An hour later the hotel charged me $443 for "security deposit and resort fee." When I complained over the phone to the reception, they reported that my hotel rate did not include taxes, resort fee and security deposit.

The next morning when we went for breakfast, I requested the server for an espresso and he coldly responded that they do not serve espresso based coffee and that I had to go to the cafe in the lobby on ground floor to get an espresso if I need one. Forgetting about espresso, I went to check what kind of breakfast they were offering and given I was told my breakfast is included, I and my girlfriend grabbed a glass of orange juice, a croissant and glass of milk since there wasn't much options anyway. (The breakfast included only croissants, scrambled eggs, two types of bread, milk, orange juice, yogurt, some fruit and veggies and potatoes and that's it. The funniest breakfast I have seen in any 5 star or so called 5 star hotels!) The breakfast service was so bad that my girlfriend joked about a chic-fil-a's service being better than this so called 5 star hotel. We were still joking about the breakfast when the waiter brought an even funnier $120 bill in which we were charged $45 per person for a glass of milk and orange juice. On top of that, the waiter had included an 18% gratuity twice, yes, you read it correct TWICE and a total of 36% gratuity to the bill. When we mentioned the breakfast was included the waiter very rudely responded that if it was included we would get a refund but WE HAVE TO PAY and sign the bill. Having left with no option I paid the bill and as I was exiting the restaurant, another waiter directly ran after me and asked me to pay for breakfast to which the waiter I had paid the bill to shouted from the other corner of restaurant that I am clear to go. Very funny scene!

I reported all this to the front desk and they promised that one of the managers would contact me. An hour later one of the managers called and asked me about the situations I have had with the hotel since the previous day. After I explained everything, the manager very cold and unapologetically said that everything has been conducted from their side as per the hotel's policy and that she can't help me. When I insisted on being overcharged she without saying anything further hang up the phone and did not answer my call after.

Upon checking out I was furious and tried to talk to someone who would probably care but the front desk couldn't find a manager after calling here and there for a long while. On top of that, when I complained to the African-American reception lady who checked me in the previous day that she gave me wrong information about breakfast being included, she straightforwardly lied to my face that she did not check me in! After the failed attempts of finding a manager, one of the front desk gentleman promised me that one of the hotel managers would call me eventually after my check out. Now it has been three days since my check out & I haven't been contacted by anyone from the hotel!

The amount of unprofessionalism and carelessness towards guests I saw in this so called 5 star hotel is unparalleled to any hotel I have ever stayed in!!

title: Peaceful, upscale retreat in the heart of NYC
text: Excellent accommodations, friendly and professional staff, and all the amenities you need in a Manhattan hotel. Rooftop and 4th  floor bars/dining are a great escape from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Easy subway access uptown or downtown.

title: Wonderful!!
text: I can’t say enough good things about this hotel. The service is superb. The rooms are spacious, quiet, updated, and very well-appointed. The location is perfect.  The rooms are reasonably priced. We had an excellent experience!

title: Perfect stay with Family
text: Location right in Times Square, but feels away from it all. Easy walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Summit, Broadway shows, and Bryant Park is next door. The staff made us feel like royalty and attended to our every need. Room was gorgeous and beautiful - we stayed in a double queen ADA suite. Breakfast buffet delicious, complimentary coffee and tea in lobby each morning. Subway steps outside the door. Beautiful views. Our expectations were exceeded in every way!

title: Amazing hotel!
text: Me and my friend decided to take a last minute trip to New York and found this amazing hotel and booked it. As soon as we arrived we were greeted at the door and was helped with our bags. Every member of staff was so polite and friendly and made us feel very comfortable. The room was very lovely and was cleaned daily by staff. I can’t fault anything about this hotel nor the staff everything was perfect. And the view we had from our room was unreal too! Every time we came back to the hotel we were greeted by the doorman which was a very nice touch. I will 1000% be returning here when I come back to New York! Thankyou very much!

title: I love the Knickerbocker! It is the best!!
text:
I am writing this on Thanksgiving, and that is appropriate as I am so thankful that I choose to stay at the Knickerbocker for my two week business trip to NY in early November. I have stayed in many hotels, including luxury hotels in NY that are famous, and so I know what I am talking about when I say that this visit was exceptionally pleasant. 
The desk clerks were welcoming. Housekeeping was excellent. The room was sooo comfy. I love the pillows and the bed, especially. The design and size of the room and bath were just right. 
But best of all were the people who work at this gem of a hotel. The wait staff in the restaurant were great. I can't name them all, as I was there for two weeks of dinners and breakfasts, all of which were excellent and the service was so friendly and welcoming.  But, just to name two:  Gania and Houcine were very kind and attentive, 
The doormen and bellmen were surprisingly personable, pleasantly greeting me each day as I left and returned, and graciously offering any help I needed. 
And, to end with two of my favorites, the concierge's, Stephanie and Diana, were just lovely; they worked together to make my visit incredibly enjoyable. They are stars! 
Thank you to the staff of the Knickerbocker. I will see you all again, soon.

title: Perfect in every way
text: The staff was great as we visited for the loss of our grandfather. Samia Dumani in sales was the most understanding and considerate. This wouldn’t have been possible without her.  I will definitely be back.

title: Great Hotel
text:
We had a great family trip. All staff was very friendly, they even accommodated an early check in!
At check-out my boys received a little backpack, coloring book, and teddy bear from the staff 🥹. The hotel was very clean, the beds were comfortable, and the walk in shower was amazing. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Birthday
text: I love ❤️ the Knickerbocker! I stay there every time I visit NYC! 1-2 times a year! Right in the heart of Time Square! The staff is amazing! The rooms are always clean! Small but very nice. I love staying there.

title: Spam calls post checkout is absurd
text: We’ve stayed there many times, go into NYC 3-4 times a year. Always a nice time at the Knick, but after we check out it’s non-stop spam calls. I am convinced after check out today that they sell/share our contact information with 3rd parties. (Same thing happened after I checked out in March this year and last fall). Doesn’t happen when we stay at other NYC hotels. It’s really a shame because the hotel is great, but the post checkout spam calls makes me never want to stay there again.

title: I wouldn't normally leave a review
text: I wouldn't normally leave a review, however not only was the hotel fantastic, the staff went over and above to ensure our experience was perfect, we had an issue when checking out (no fault of the hotel) and the team went out of there way to take care of this for us. Would 100% recommend the hotel and the fantastic team.

title: Great service!
text: I recently enjoyed some delicious cocktails on the 4th floor at the Knick again, and let me tell you, the service is always amazing! From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I was greeted by the most attentive staff. It was also such a pleasant surprise to see the general manager there in the lobby, showing support for his team which is not common in a lot of other hotels. It really added to the overall experience. Highly recommend!

title: great stay
text: Great location, wonderful service - front desk, concierge, bell man. would definitely return. Took care of our large vehicle without any hassle.  Room was lovely and rooftop bar was a great spot to view the city

title: Great place
text: Great service, clean rooms. Bigger than expected for an NYC hotel room in times square for that price. All other places were almost double the price. Location is great. Of course parking could be better

title: Beautiful oasis in the middle of Times Square
text: Perfect details in every aspect for a luxury hotel: the electric lighting, ample storage, electric blackout shades, housekeeping. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were fluffy and supportive. Would absolutely stay here again.

title: Lacking attention to detail
text: Lackingattention to detail, however when I asked for couch bed to be made up all they did was throw a blanket in the old mattress. For a 5 star hotel that, I would expect the bed actually made. Front deck staff very nice as well as the bell men. Bed was comfortable

title: Polished professionalism from start to finish
text:
The staff, and presentation of rooms was fantastic, no complaints and would happily recommend to others looking to spend some time in New York.

In particular the team at the Charlie Palmer bar were great, and the Knickerbocker Martini was well worth the trip.

title: Good Hotel in a great location. Good bar. Nothing remarkable in the inside
text:
The overall experience was good, the location at the corner of Times square is absolutely top with a subway entrance just out of the door. Rooms are comfortable and correctly sized. What disappointed us a bit is the lack of "personality" of the inside of the hotel, which is in contrast with the monumental exterior facade and the long history. There is nothing unique or remarkable inside the Hotel, the all place is functional but "aseptic", when you are inside you could as well be in any other standard hotel. This is also in contrast with our usual experience in the hotels member of the LHW. 

Breakfast had a somewhat limited choice but the quality of everything was very good, so nothing to complain about. Not so for the breakfast room, where every seat was exposed to a stream of cold air from the ceiling and there was music too loud (we had to ask twice to turn it down).

One of the best things in the hotel is the bar on the top floor. First of all you do not need a reservation to find a place, you just walk in. There is what seemed a nice and spacious terrace, but it was too cold to sit outside so we sat at the bar. We had two different barmen in the two evenings we were there and they were both good. A Manhattan seemed appropriate, given the location, and it was great. Only minus: they do not offer any nuts or similar with the drinks. A questionable choice, had we had something to crunch we would have ordered a second drink, since we enjoyed the first one, but that was not the case. 

In the room initially there was no kettle or cups or anything and the shower gel dispenser was broken. After we informed the reception both things were rapidly corrected (but why didn't they check before ?) We found later that two drawers and one light were broken, but honestly we did not bother asking for repair (in theory also that should have been checked by maintenance, without us asking for it)
Elevators are too slow for the numbers of stores of the building and there is no indication inside of the floor Nr. at which you are. (at least, it was not working)

Personnel was like the interiors: functional but impersonal. Only one lady at checkout was nicer than the average and managed to give us a copy of the nice book about the hotel history which we had seen inside the room. Appreciated.

It was possible to get only two hours of late checkout, unfortunately. (late checkout is one of the (not guaranteed) benefits for LHW members, like us.)
So we left the luggage in deposit for a couple of hours. I was a bit surprised and irritated that when collecting the bags the employee explicitly asked for a tip. I ignored the request but I found it unpolite and inappropriated in such a hotel.

Price is on the high side for what you get, but I guess the location is the main cause for that.
In summary, if it fits your budget, this hotel is a good choice.

title: Clean, modern, perfect location
text:
very clean. Modern perfect location. There’s no minibar but there’s a fridge 
very comfortable bed. Great shower with hot water. A little pricey . Rooms are spacious. Tv has movie channels . Good!🙂🙂🙂

title: Top Notch!
text:
There really aren’t enough good things to say about this hotel. Top to bottom, it was a wonderful experience. 

We were leaving Manhattan on an extended cruise and the staff was happy to store some luggage for us while we were gone, including letting me back in to grab a forgotten item. 

The attention to detail was impressive - from the doormen to the housekeeping staff, we were so pleased. Full concierge treatment. As an aside, the in-house coffee shop has EXCELLENT pastries and the restaurant was fantastic. 

We look forward to our next stay!

title: Getaway in the middle of Times Square
text: The hotel staff was so friendly & helpful. The hotel was extremely clean & the lounge & bar areas were fabulous. Can’t beat the location with easy access to everything. The shower and products in the room were excellent. I slept really well, the beds are very comfortable. Highly recommend. It’s a relaxing getaway in the middle of the busy city.

title: Great weekend!
text: I just had a wonderful weekend stay at the Knickerbocker with my girlfriends from high school. The rooftop bar was amazing! Delicious snack and drinks, and the staff and the service were great. They provide warm furry blankets which made us feel so cozy and comfortable. You have to try the spicy margarita! We really had such a fun time and can't wait to go back!

title: Wonderful
text: The room and bed were very comfortable.  The gal who cleaned our room set out our slippers at night and cleaned exceptionally well. We gave her a bonus.  The staff was very helpful, as well.  You feel very welcomed the moment you walk in the door.

title: Birthday treat.
text:
The room was clean and comfortable although the pillows were a combination of hard or like a marshmallow. The buffet breakfast when we had it was nice with lots of variety, nicely cooked although I think the pancakes were a little dry as they had been out for a while. Times Square is incredibly loud and bright as one would expect and although we could hear noise in the room it didn't stop us from sleeping. Housekeeping staff were very good and we had the room cleaned with fresh towels daily. Checkout wasn't very efficient and I am currently in contact with the hotel in dispute of our bill (we were nearly charged twice for residence tax on checking out and believe we were also charged on checking in, so just be aware of hhis as the checkout staff commented that there was a "glitch in the system".)
Spoiled a nice stay. I'm not sure that it's worth the money, there are probably places that are cheaper but just as good.

title: All in all, a good stay
text: The room service was great. The bacon was a tad over cooked and burnt but all in all, great. The bed and sheets were nice. Loved the slippers. The robes definitely need updating as there was rips in one of them and they weren't the softest of materials. The soft towels made up for it though. The restaurant is lovely. The food was amazing. They catered to my gluten free needs well.

title: very nice hotel
text: the best bed pillows and room confort i can’t complain about the stay very good price the staff very friendly very nice the food also well cooked the room very clean i don’t have anything bad to say .

title: Excelente localização
text: Hotel com localização fantástica, staff atencioso, design agradável… porém, vários itens da acomodação necessitam manutenção. Destaque negativo para a ausência de qualquer item de minibar, inclusive água (apesar de existir estrutura no quarto para isso), em função da pandemia (de acordo com informações do front desk). No geral, uma excelente opção para visita a Nova York.

title: Another Great Stay!
text: Another great stay at The Knickerbocker!  I highly recommend the hotel.  The location is awesome.  The rooms are spacious and well appointed.  The staff is very accommodating!  I will stay here again!

title: Cozy clean hotel that felt safe and enough staff to tend to our requests.
text: Clean neat and professional staff that helped accommodating our request. The breakfast was great and the cafe was a convenient way to grab a quick coffee or tea before heading out the door for the day. Slippers were convenient because we forgot to bring ours.

title: The Knickerbocker
text: Attentive caring staff. Excellent hotel modern functional rooms in an elegant New York City landmark. Very nice buffet breakfast. The hotel is in an ideal location, right on Times Square. Very good security.

title: Classic NYC Hotel
text: Service & staff were very attentive, friendly, and professional. From the reception desk to housekeeping and bell staff, all were excellent. Looking forward to my next visit, hopefully sooner than later.

title: Great hotel centrally located for shows
text: The room was spacious and well-furnished, with a very comfortable bed. Unfortunately, some people in our group were placed in rooms that had the super-bright LED H&M sign shining right into their window. I realize the hotel has no control over this, but they found it quite annoying. Loved the staff, they were friendly and attentive. Gym was only so-so -- they had Peloton bikes (yay!) but one had a seat that wouldn't adjust and the other one badly needed service; it didn't work like a regular Peloton bike. The rooftop bar is fabulous, and the location is superb.

title: Best stay by far !
text: Amazing from start to finish . Room was clean and had breath taking views of time square. We received 2 comp drinks for the roof top bar and an upgrade to a corner suite. All staff were amazing and go above and beyond . Our new permanent hotel to visit when coming to Manhattan !

title: Un hôtel de qualité à découvrir
text:
Un hôtel de qualité très bien situé pour découvrir New York ( proximité stations de métro , bus et taxi )
Hôtel calme et bien insonorisé 
Belle taille des chambres et salle de bain 
Belle salle de sport 
Personnel à l’écoute

title: DO NOT SAY HERE, RUN! Sterile, cold, not charming, unfriendly staff, understaffed shell of a hotel. Not for families.
text:
DO NOT STAY HERE, ABSOLUTELY A JOKE OF A FIVE STAR HOTEL!!!

The fact this hotel is rated asa five star hotel is laughable. Someone must know someone because I have stayed at four star hotels that shoot this sterile joke out of the water. 

I complained and politely asked to change rooms upon arrival and was told they had nothing. I called two more times the same evening to no avail. Then at 6am upon waking called to talk with a smart man who said if i cared so much I should have come down last night and complained. I was shocked at his audacity and explained we have three little ones upstairs why would we do that when obviously we have still
accomplished nothing over the phone as we would in person. 

First off the customer service here is non existent. Upon arrival we were not acknowledged in any warm way. The room we booked was to have a view of times square rather we have a view of an office building rather than the city. The window is shoved in the corner and you quite literally have to stand in the actual window to see out it. 
One generally prefers to wake up and look out a window in this care that is not possible. 
see here you must choose—large bathtub or view. I chose view for my children despite how they prefer a bathtub so they could still see the city the outside when up in the hotel resting. There is nothing to see. 
You should not book a room with a “view” because there is not a desirable one…..this may work to trick someone into thinking they are viewing something if you have never been to NYC. Our room look’s NOTHING like the pictures online. 

We specifically chose this hotel because it was supposed to have that new york charm however you cannot get past the cold unwelcoming feeling this shell of a building gives you.

Avoid this place at all costs for the sake of your pockets and your NYC experience. This has zero charm, snarky rude staff and they on top of it are noticeably understaffed.

$200 at the restaurant in the hotel for some cheeseburgers old pasta, no server just a hostesses shuffling about. The whole restaurant made us so uncomfortable. Super strange there were two ladies just sleeping on the sofas when you enter the restaurant….
Absolutely atrocious. 

This has been a really disappointing start to our birthday getaway for our son, We even we’re told to call the day of arrival for a special birthday welcome and then we’re informed once calling it was the day before. Someone isn’t communicating with their staff to the guests correct so they stuck a measly chocolate up here for him. No card like happy birthday nothing. I’ve stared again at four stars in the city that greet you with strawberries and champagne, have incredible views and bathtubs not compromising square footage. That warmly welcome you and make you feel at home. 
Shame on us for even thinking hey let’s try something different and stay in the “touristy” area. This hotel will never ever ever come close to ever having a sliver of charm. They absolutely need a full makeover on the meaning of hospitality.

title: Stay here!
text: Quiet room. Tons of space. Absolutely exceptional customer service. Noise machine and extra pillows delivered to the room made our stay even more comfortable. The shower was lovely. The lotion and toiletries smelled heavenly. Seriously, just stay here

title: Never a LHW-Hotel
text:
The most ugly experience in a 5* Hotel. Dirty room, no low carb breakfast. Unfriendly service.
Should be deleted from the leading hotels of the world.
Location is good, the quality of property is never the "leading" one.

title: New York Visit and Great Hotel
text:
This hotel is ideally located and the staff (all of them) were very polite, helpful and courteous.
We did have a noise issue and upon checkout the staff noted our feedback and took steps to focus on customer satisfaction.  We had used some of the amenities and bar area and everything was really good.

title: Best location in Manhattan
text: Excelente staff welcome arrival, they make me feel like family every time I return! The rooms are fantastic and the location is amongst the best. I am already looking forward to returning for a future stay, hopefully for Christmas! The value hit the spot.

title: Excellent hotel and excellent location!
text:
We just left after 4 nights here. It was my husband’s first time to NYC and my first time to really visit, with a work trip 16 years ago that mostly just offered walking to see the city. This location was fantastic for getting a taste of the craziness of Times Square, without having to take time to “go see it.” We had super easy access to subway to get all over the city. 

The hotel is beautiful, all staff was very friendly and helpful, and our room was far bigger than I expected for in the city. It was beautiful, comfortable, and pretty dang quiet for where it is! We loved it and would highly recommend to anyone.

title: Comfortable and accommodating stay for weekend away!
text: Room is comfortable and thoughtfully designed.  Staff is friendly and accommodating. Lounges, both the rooftop and 4th floor, are always desirable.  Bar and mealtime food is very good. Location is exceptionally convenient for access to whatever Manhattan destination.

title: Good experience with a business stay!
text:
Overall, great experience with The Knickerbocker. I booked a room block for a business meeting nearby, and received generally positive reviews from my guests. Yes, it's loud. It's in Times Square so there may not be much that can be done about that (maybe better windows?). I did wish there was a coffee maker in my room! And the elevators were bizarre - no indication of which floor you were on while inside the carriage! Very strange. 

The rooms were very spacious, beautiful bathroom, comfortable beds.

I received excellent support from the Sales Team regarding my room block. I think I reached out to my contact multiple times a day with updates / changes / additions / general requests - she always responded quickly and was always able to meet our needs!

Finally, I also want to give some very positive feedback about the representatives at the front desk. They were so lovely, each time I approached that desk I was met with a warm smile and a wonderful customer service approach. So very helpful!!! Actually, everyone in the lobby was terrific (porters / doormen, etc).

title: Very noisy - avoid
text: This hotel is rated five star. It is nice enough upon check in. You have to share the elevators with a huge line of non guests trying to get to the rooftop bar. Fine. Rooms themselves have been recently redone in a fairly modern tone. The real problem with this hotel is that you can hear everything - and I mean everything - going on inside the rooms on either side of you. It seems to mainly come from the doors connecting adjoining rooms. Probably the thinnest walls and worst noise pollution I've ever experienced in a hotel, and I've traveled a lot. I would not stay here again.

title: Thanks to the Knickerbocker for a great business hotel
text:
The Knickerbocker has become our New York Hotel of choice, given its central location in mid-town. 

The key strengths are the good-sized rooms and comfortable beds - with amenities like a tub if you upgrade and a good amount of space for hanging clothes. 

The key thing for me is the quality of the team. From Lucy at the front desk who was able to get one of the rooms that I particularly like, to Stephanie and Diana the concierges and the super helpful Gania in the restaurant. 

The whole team are always helpful, whether getting extra hangers for suits or arranging for a tea kettle. 

It is also good having Jakes so that you can get a coffee heading out for the day. 

Thanks, as ever, I am sure that I will be back.

title: A Lux Bargain
text: The Knick is an incredible New York hack.  Near Four Seasons Level amenities and quiet at a comparatively bargain price.  Been staying here for five years and have never had a bad experience.  Yes, it’s on Times Square.  That is either a feature or a bug, depending on your tastes, but as a business traveler I find it irrelevant.  Excellent sound insulation.

title: Hidden GEM amongst all the Hotels near Times Square. Great for solo as well as with Family !!
text:
Nice & comfy rooms. I was upgraded to 37 m2 room as they are extremely rare in NYC. 

Location is very central & closer to all main attractions. I highly recommend the hotel. 

I have stayed here in 2017 with family as well as 2023 as a solo. Both times I enjoyed the place.

title: Sadly, I've had better treatment in a 2* hotel
text:
Pros: the door/security staff were REALLY lovely and genuinely couldn't do enough for you. The rooms were a decent size and very hi-tech (you could tell absolutely everything had been considered right down to the little light in the toilet that gave off just enough light so you could go in the middle of the night without needing to wake up too much or wake anyone else). The location was also fabulous as you could walk to most places. Pre-arrival communication for things like arranging transfers etc was excellent and timely.

Cons: despite being made aware on numerous occasions by both myself and my travel agent that we were there to celebrate my 40th birthday, not once was I offered so much as a word of celebration which is practically unheard of in the travel and tourism industry. When we requested a restaurant recommendation, we were automatically given a top end one (dinner that evening cost me $200+ and I've had MUCH better for under $100 (I later learned the hotel is affiliated with a number of restaurants so they will only ever recommend them). The location, whilst great, is also a lot more dangerous than other areas which is obvious when you smell the amount of marijuana being consumed in public and witness the amount of emergency vehicles being required in that area (we were unable to vacate the theatre after the show we'd been to watch until it was deemed safe to do so. Housekeeping was hit and miss and the maid seemed shocked when I gave her a tip. Aside from door/security staff, the rest just seemed like elitist idiots that had been mixing with over-privileged guests too long. I'm a frequent traveller and have had better treatment at a 2* - don't waste your money, there are MUCH nicer places!

title: Top Lage direkt am Times Square mit super Rooftop Bat
text:
Schönes Hotel mit Top Lage direkt am Times Square. Die Rooftop Bar hat uns sehr gut gefallen - schade nur dass einige Schaumweine auf der Karte nicht erhältlich waren.
Dafür war die Bedienung in der Bar sehr freundlich und aufmerksam.
Eine Kleine Anmerkung zum Gym: klein, aber grundsätzlich alles da was mein braucht. Leider waren beide Spinningräder defekt (Satel nicht verstellbar)

title: Best hotel in Middletown Manhattan
text: I absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms had large 5ft long towels, well lit, large TV, remote controlled shades, multiple ceiling to floor mirrors, rain head showers, bath robes, sleepers and complimentary Sarasota Spring water.  I didn’t want to checkout.

title: Not quiet a Knickerbocker Glory
text: This is my fourth visit to NYC and Knickerbocker came as a recommendation. There was a lot to like - very comfortable bed, quiet room, fabulous bathroom and excellent staff. However, the lack of tea/coffee making  and (empty) mini bar facilities made the stay feel more 4 star with a 5 star price tag. A special mention to the housekeeping staff who were exceptional.

title: 20 year anniversary trip
text: Beautiful clean rooms and great pillows. Staff is very friendly. It was perfect for our celebrating 20 years of being married will definitely stay again! There is a small refrigerator and the automated blinds were a plus!

title: Ottimo soggiorno
text: Hotel con struttura esterna tipica della vecchia New York ma con interni moderni e all’altezza di un cinque stelle. Posizione strategica a fianco di Times Square (dall’ottimo roof bar si può vederne una parte) e nonostante questo all’interno stanze silenziosissime

title: Awesome!
text: Awesome! We enjoyed our stay during my Sisters birthday. Everyone was so pleasant in greetings you chose a off chain excellent staffing. Housekeeping did outstanding job in keeping things in order. I appreciate the rooftop and restaurant.

title: Wedding planning
text: The property is just amazing, and it is the perfect hotel with a great staff!  All of the amenities that are provided are top notch.  We had three rooms on this trip and were there to finalize our daughter's wedding stay that is coming up at the end of November start of December.

title: Amazing
text: Absolutely loved our stay here. Amazing hotel, staff were very friendly helpful and welcoming. The room was amazing very clean and beds very comfortable. Would definitely recommend and would definitely stay here again.

title: Would definitely stay again!
text: My daughter and I stayed for two nights. The room was very comfortable and clean - the quietest I’ve stayed in NYC. The staff are outstanding! Excellent location. We enjoyed the cafe in the morning for coffee and pastries.

title: family trip
text:
family friendly. elevators are a bit busy on the morning and sometimes n the evening due to the crowd on the roof-top, which I recommend.
People are nice and helpfull if something is missing or needed.

title: The Best All-Around Hotel Experience
text: I can speak to the amenities, which were very good,  the room and bed were comfortable, and the location was perfect. The most excellent part of our stay, however, was the staff. Every person in every aspect of the hotel that we had contact with was so friendly and helpful!  We will be back!!!’n

title: 1st time in New York
text: The hotel, rooms staff and location were all amazing, staff so friendly, rooms lovely and so clean. The house keeping were amazing, they even got your slippers out for the evening. Staff also very helpful especially jimmy he helped organise our taxi for home nothing was to much trouble. Loved our time at the knickerbocker and will be most definitely returning hopefully next Christmas time.

title: Short City break.
text:
Great stay, staff were amazing. Stephanie the concierge and Jimmy were great hosts. 
Katy and Juan in the CP lounge we’re great hosts.  Will definitely visit again.
The roof top bar was also great.  The staff are very accommodating and always willing to help.

title: Outstanding in all aspects!
text: I travel a lot and have never had this level of service or quality of sleep in NYC! I cannot say enough about every member of the staff here. HIGHLY recommend and now cannot imagine staying anywhere else in NYC!

title: Theatre Tour Stay
text: Our group had a wonderful trip and stay at the historic Knickerbocker . The hotel has been refurbished to be A 1 . The rooms are large by NYC standards and the staff is extremely warm and welcoming . The room had a mini frig I could keep breakfast items in and a luxurious bathroom . There was a decent gym for a hotel on the 4 th floor and I could head to Central Park 1 mile away for a run or walk . The conceire staff was extremely friendly and helpful .

title: Best location, great Hotel.
text: I always stay there when I travel to NYC. This is a great hotel at a historic building, good rates for NY, with the best location at times Square, including subway hub at their door step. Easy to get any place in the city and airport.

title: Wow 👍
text: Fabulous ROOMY room. Comfy bed and daily housekeeping. Hallelujah! Great location, exemplary service. The staff deftly handled a demonstration immediately outside the hotel, keeping both guests and demonstrators safe.

title: A great extra-long weekend stay at the Knickerbocker!
text: Very nice hotel and conveniently located in the centre of Manhattan just off Time Square.  Clean throughout and great service.  All of the staff were friendly and helpful.  We will definitely say again.

title: Wonderful !
text: Everything clean, organized, the attention was excellent, they have all that we need to feel good, the location is the best, I have everything close. The decoration is nice. I would like to comeback

title: Wonderful time
text: Fabulous room comfy bed bathroom big with a  great shower, right in middle of Times Square Friendly and helpful staff. Left us a free bottle of wine and big piece of heavenly chocolate cake as was my birthday would stay again

title: Want the wow on a budget, come here.
text:
Beautiful hotel that is a cut above the rest. High quality rooms and beautiful, timeless decor. 

Isn’t one to offer views from the rooms but the roof top bar and location of the hotel more than make up for this. 

Everything was extremely clean and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel 100000000%.

title: Wedding
text: The staff was extremely helpful.  The only problem I had was my body lotion was used and I thought that was unsanitary.  The cafe had delicious breakfast and coffee.  The bed was very comfortable and I loved the shower.

title: Poorly trained staff. Noisy rooms, even for NYC.
text: Have stayed previously at the Knick.  Sadly, customer service has fallen dramatically.  Hotel staff are poorly trained and borderline rude.  Also, do NOT stay here unless you want to hear a drum set well past midnight in your 5 star hotel room.

title: Celebrate Birthday and Anniversary
text: This was Fantastic , location, staff and room! Easy access from subway. The added touches of bathrobes and large shower made the room even more enjoyable. The concierge.was very helpful as well. Great view from room.

title: 4 star no more...
text: Ok, let's get something really clear:  this is nowhere near a 4 star hotel anymore.  It was the last time I stayed there in June 2018, but that was over 5 years ago.   Today, the hotel is nothing more than a hotel tonight 3 star special for the type of people that love Times Square.  That's fine, if not for the fact that it was $500 the night when I stayed there.  The room was small and bare bones  (weird things I suspect happened during the Covid / homeless era.). The bar, which used to be cool is overrun by cruise line types.  But worst of all...only two elevators were in order.   It took me 30 minutes to check into my room and I had to plan a strategy for exiting the hotel, packing my bags and figuring out how I would get to Penn Station.  I will say at least  the staff was attentive, that was a redeeming aspect.   They were doing their best.  But this once splashy, cool hotel is now just another Times Square special that could find a place on the seedier side of the Vegas strip,  I'm sure it's not easy running a hotel in NY these days, but it's a three star hotel that should never be higher than $300 per night.  Avoid unless you're the type that enjoys carnivals, and Disney World in August.

title: Regret Visit
text: I have stayed in the hotel before at a rate of $400. Now the rate is more than double for a decrepit and worn down hotel with poor service. No even a bottle of water in the room, very understaffed and no customer assistance. You are better off paying a few dollars more and getting a 5 star experience somewhere else.

title: Love the Knick
text: Comfy, chic, great service, great location. Better prices than neighboring hotels with higher prices! Loved the beds, and room service.Also held a business event here once on the roof and it was spectacular

title: Great hotel for Times Square
text: We loved our stay! The staff was great- so friendly and helpful. Rooms were large and clean and both restaurants were nice. Location in Times Square is convenient plus there’s a subway station on the corner.

title: Would do it all again
text: Room was wonderful. Very up to date and modern in such a traditional famous hotel. The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable, and help full. Special thanks to Jay and Diana. They were my best friends. The only criticism I would have is I ordered breakfast through room service one morning and my eggs Benny were not hot. Still tasty. The roof top is amazing. Was a very special look at a great city. Thanks to everyone.

title: Perfect place to stay for a Broadway weekend.
text:
Very helpful staff in the lobby and check in areas. 
Appreciated the
Robes and slippers because we packed BERY light. 
Remarkably comfortable bed. Remarkably uncomfortable sofa. 
Great location and very quiet.

title: NYC and Times Square Experience
text: This hotel is a peaceful haven amid the hustle, bustle, and craziness of Times Square.  Our room was very well-maintained and quiet.  The beds are comfy and the bathrooms luxurious.  My 10-year-old grandson especially liked the rain shower.  We all really enjoyed the view and ambiance at the rooftop lounge.

title: Exceptional views from rooftop restaurant.  Hotel staff well trained.
text: Clean comfortable room.   Short on amenities.  Spotty contact with guest services.  Bell men and concierge exceptional in their service. The outdoor restaurant offers a great menu of small bites.  Friendly efficient service.  Great view of Times Square

title: Stellar location
text: Simply can't beat the location! Rooms were modern and spacious, and the breakfast buffet was excellent. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Just a few steps from main attractions like times square, broadway, the wax museum and New York library. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Business meeting in NYC
text: Good location, large meeting room, food service for meeting was very good.  Easy to get to on 42 Street. Room was modern, clean and very quiet. I would use this hotel for midtown meetings in NYC.  Well priced meeting space.

title: Amazing stay !!!! Perfect location ! Delicious breakfast !!!!
text:
Amazing experience !!! 
Thank you ! 
Hector the  doorman made our experience perfect thank you!!!!
Clean room , very modern bathroom and best shower experience !
Lots of pressure and spacious shower.
We had the city view king size bed with sofa room.

title: Amazing staff and location!
text: My daughter and I just got back from a girls trip to NYC and we had the best time! We stayed at The Knickerbocker in Times Square and we loved it. It was a beautiful hotel, the staff was very friendly, and it was in a great location. Diana Ferreyra works at the concierge desk and she was the best! I told her all the places we wanted to visit and she helped us map out how to get there and what type of transportation to take. Diana even made a back up dinner reservation for us in case we were not able to get into the restaurant we planned to have dinner at before Wicked. She was so sweet! If you are planning a trip to NYC, I highly recommend The Knickerbocker!

title: Clean and inviting
text: Cordial and professional staff. The room and the common areas were clean and inviting. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is strategically placed close to many tourist attractions and main transportation hubs.

title: Tolle Tradition mit kleinen Fehlern
text:
Schönes Hotel mit Tradition, es fehlte hier und da die übliche Höflichkeit, die ich aus den USA und insbesondere von Hotels dieser Kategorie kenne. Zimmer war geräumig und auch sauber. Turndown Service gab es auch, es fehlt lediglich diese grundsätzliche Zufriedenheit der Mitarbeiter. Absolut sympathischer Doorman aber total uninteressierte Kellnerin in der Roof top Bar. Wir hätten wesentlich mehr gegessen und getrunken gestern Abend. 
Wir versuchen es vielleicht über Ostern nochmal!😀

title: Keep looking. Save your money
text:
If you want 5 star, clean and friendly DO NOT stay here. I do not know how they got 5 stars but they do not deserve 1 star. Everything smells like weed. Staff is rude and not accommodating. Suite advertised as sleeps 4 but when myself and two sons arrived they put us in a room that slept only two. Ashoal the manager spent more time going on their website trying to prove me wrong then helping myself and my kids who were exhausted to find a place to sleep. Ashoal please see my screenshot of the advertisement. When they finally moved our room it was disgusting.
Showers dirty, everything dusty and stains everywhere. Rooms are large but impractical. A lot of wasted space. No coffee machine in room.
Menus in restaurants are not kid friendly. Food was dry, tough and have both my son and I food poisoning. The younger one luckily didn't eat enough to be effected. Manager promised to take care of my son for all the room issues but disappointed him by doing nothing. Only after I reminded the manager 15 min later he showed up with a small inedible dessert and threw it in front of him.

title: Exceptional customer experience!
text: Every person we interacted with was very helpful and pleasant.  I didn’t get the name of the woman who checked us in but if you can find her please tell her we appreciate her and recognize her for making our stay the best ever in NYC.  This experience made my friends birthday celebration excellent.

title: Great!
text: Excellent service. Great room! Rooftop bar and food were great!! Only thing is the parking. It was $160 night on top of a resort daily fee. To self park would’ve been $75 but we had a special needs child who wouldn’t walk from there. Even the plaza hotels parking was $90

title: Calm after a busy day.
text: Perfect location, directly on Times Square. Within walking distance of Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Fifth Avenue and others. After a hectic day's sightseeing the Knickerbocker provides a haven of calm for relaxation and 'recovery'. The roof bar is super. All staff have been friendly, extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Our room is a good size and comfortable. Would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

title: Extremely comfortable rooms
text:
location was perfect; comfort of the room was excellent; very good hvac system made me always comfortable when in the hotel.  Also very quiet and private.   Housekeeping staff was very accomodating.

Make sure to check out the hotel bar in the evening; very enjoyable.

title: The Knick got it.
text:
I have yet to encounter someone who isn't kind at the Knick. It was my first time and I popped by for my 30th birthday and I was NOT disappointed. Hotel is clean. The location is fantastic to reach anywhere in the city. You gotta try the St. Cloud for the view and the kind staff.
 Can't wait to go back for NYE 2023!

title: A great vacation, a high-class hotel with excellent service
text: We had a perfect time in the best hotel in New York. Close to Times Square and other places. Easy access even for people with limited mobility. Two great bars on the fourth floor and on the roof of the building with plenty of drinks and cocktails.

title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!!
text: Very nice hotel with a great staff. Location is perfect, as well. You are literally a block or 2 away from Times Square. Great food option in the hotel as well as near by. We really enjoyed our stay here.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: First trip advisor review I've ever written.  Hotel was perfect; modern, clean, big room, impeccably quiet for such a busy (well situated) location.  Rooftop restaurant is lovely with a cool ambiance and kind and knowledgeable staff/mixologists.  Will definitely stay again.

title: This is a true jewel of a hotel!
text: The Knickerbocker Hotel is a jewel in the crown of wonderful hotels in the Leading Hotels of the World portfolio! the hotel is lovely. The gym is amazing! Food delicious. My room was so spacious and comfortable. All impressive however, it is the staff that make this property amazing! A definite repeat for this traveler! I look forward to my next stay. TJV

title: Excellent !
text: I have travelled all over the world and I think that a very pleasant experience at a wonderful  hotel makes all the difference between a good vacation and a great one ! My experience at The Knickerbocker Hotel was just a wonderful  experience and made my trip to New York City memorable !  The location of the hotel in Times Square is great ! The room was clean and very nice . The service was good and the staff  friendly ! I went to the rooftop bar / restaurant and the atmosphere was relaxing ! I would definitely stay at The Knickerbocker , 6 Times Square , again and would highly recommend it !

title: Modern yet cozy
text: Check in was a little crazy.  The concierge desk, front and center when you walk in the main doors.  Concierge, busy helping a couple.  Stood there waiting 10 minutes before we were told that the check in desk was behind the wall behind the concierge.  The room itself was great.  There was no ability to connect to apps on the TV, Netflix and such.  The outside part of the rooftop bar was the most impressive, views were one of a kind.  Clear view of the Time Square New Years Eve ball.  Thank goodness for the complimentary umbrellas.

title: Great Wedding Celebration
text: I was blown away by this properties customer service! When my wife and myself checked in we were greeted with a celebration cake. Everyone was helpful and kind and I would recommend this property to anyone who inquires.

title: Amazing staff and great location
text: The staff were so wonderful, friendly, funny and super helpful. The location is great, the subway is not even one minutes walk away and the views from the room of times square are pretty. The room was really nice and cozy, and the bed was so soft and warm!

title: Ottima soluzione
text:
Prendiamo una Junior suite per 3 ospiti e rimaniamo piacevolmente colpiti dal trovare due queen size ma
Anche un divano letto molto comodo : in questo modo tutto avevamo il proprio letto. 
Camera molto spaziosa, pulita e con un bagno veramente grande. 
Unici nei nell’illuminazione veramente debole e l’affaccio
Nel cortile interno vista uffici .. in pratica non era mai possibile rimanere con la tenda alzata. 
Il personale abbastanza scortese.  
Per quanto riguarda la posizione , ci troviamo in una zona ad altissimo traffico ed a due passi da Times Square , con i pro e contro del caso. 
In generale un’ottima struttura, nella quale dovrebbero migliorare un po’ nell’assistenza al cliente ma per il resto garantisce un soggiorno più che confortevole

title: Centralissimo
text:
Ottima posizione, a due passi da Times Square (e dalla metropolitana).
Hotel elegante e moderno. 
La camera molto ampia e confortevole, con due grandi letti e un divano letto; fa sorridere che pur avendo pagato per tre persone, ci sia stato detto di aprirci il divano letto da soli (poi sarebbero passati a farlo) altrimenti ci sarebbe stata da pagare un extra charge. Anche il bagno molto ampio e confortevole. La nostra stanza si affacciava verso l'interno e quindi era molto silenziosa. 
A disposizione degli ospiti anche una piccola palestra.

title: excellent
text: Splendid location, friendly staff, unique rooftop. Not too big, the hotel gives the impression of relaxed quite place in the mid of the madding crowd. Will certainly come back with the family, too. Iconic.

title: Always a great experience!
text: Hotel staff are top notch, service is great, and the hotel is always clean and quiet. It was a busy week in New York so the hotel was a bit more crowded than I had experienced in the past. The only drawback to that was that the elevators were a bit slower than normal but not at all a huge problem.

title: Amazing experience and Johir was great!
text: Great spot in Times Square - staff were amazing, especially Johir! Great selection of drinks, and fantastic view. We ordered the Albariño, and enjoyed it with the olives and chips and dip. Smoking area also for those that smoke!

title: Prime location in Times Square
text: Very comfortable bed, bathroom, temperature control, super quiet. Great in room dining options especially for breakfast if you have a busy day planned. I wish the rooftop were open at other hours and not just after 4:00 pm.

title: Right in the middle...
text:
Excellent location, a lot to discover in walking distance.
Amazing rooftop bar, really a place to be.
Junior corner suite is my favorite.
Fast check-in and check-out service.
Very helpful concierge people.

title: Style and location comes up trumps
text: Everything about the Knickerbockers is ideal for the business and tourist traveller location is ideal and the service from a friendly and customer focussed staff is outstanding . The only `down side is that the designers was allowed to achieve look over function where seating was concerned. Sofas in the bar areas are too low and uncomfortable to use indeed in the rooftop bar rolling off the sofa and couches is the only was to get off. In the breakfast rook the chairs are low compared with the table height making dining uncomfortable . If you are over teenage the seating is not for you. Raised with the staff they simply share that the comments are legion  but ignored by management a sad destruction from a great customer offering. So if you are young hip and ultra mobile the knickerbocker is for you if over twenty and slightly arthritic may be less so.

title: Comfortable hotel, great location
text: Really beautiful hotel and excellent service. Room was spacious and luxurious. Diptyque products in the bathroom were icing on the cake! We slept very comfortably for a reasonable price in NYC. Will definitely return!

title: Perfect 2 days
text:
absolutely loved the hotel... great location, very helpful and friendly staff.  The roof deck was beautiful 

didn't love all the ceiling to floor mirrors in the bathroom space - but set up was nice

title: A few Days in New York
text: A great hotel in a very central location close to Times Square. Our room was well appointed and spacious especially for a Manhattan hotel. An added bonus was the buffet breakfast and  the service was always efficient and friendly.Definitely a hotel to recommend

title: Business trip
text:
Perfect location in Times Square close Broadway, 5th Avenue, Bryant Park and all the shopping and restaurants the area has to offer. 
Spacious rooms with all required amenities. Helpful staff. Great bar on the roof. 
I visited for a business trip and would definitely stay again.

title: Love the Knick. 🍎
text: Central location, spacious, quiet and modern rooms, excellent water pressure, 2 daily breakfast options, fast and seamless wifi throughout the hotel, superb rooftop bar serving light snacks. Thank you for looking after me during my four night stay.

title: Great First Impressions
text:
From the doormen, to the concierge, the rooftop restaurant (the chips and dip were the best!!!), Mary at the front desk, to the well appointed room, staff  service/professionalism/friendliness and the sense of feeling important, Knickerbocker receives 5 stars.

My only comment was the parking was odd and a bit expensive at 360 for 2 nights. Instead I self parked for 180.00. The hotel cost was fine.  I just could not wrap my head around the parking cost but that is market.

Great Trip and great overall experience.!! We will visit again.

title: Our recent visit to NYC
text: The concierge staff was incredible. J, Stephanie, and Diana made our trip so special. There is a reason they are your guest's first impression when you enter the front door. Their expertise and recommendations were incredible and saved us so much time and money if we had simply ventured out on our own. Our rooms were so comfortable. Coffee and breakfast at Jake's were a great way to start the day. The location was perfect.  Loved everything about our stay.

title: Great
text: Our experience was wonderful from start to finish! Everyone was so kind and helpful, the rooms were amazing and the amenities were awesome! It’s so clean and nice and in the middle of it all. We will be back!

title: Great location
text:
We stay here when we have midtown plans. It’s safe, clean and convenient. 
Our housekeeper brought nice warm towels during our stay which was great. Room service is excellent. Wish we could have had the 2pm checkout promo that’s plastered all over their website but I guess the hotel was filled to capacity? Also paying the extra for a “premier city view” shouldn’t mean a view into an office building.

title: Fabulous from the moment we arrived
text:
Great hotel from the moment we arrived. Greeted by Paula and introduced to her Director Tobias. Checked in early and asked if it was a special occasion. A belated birthday gift was delivered to the room the following day. 
Great room, great size, best shower ever, great location and quiet considering how close to Times Square. 
Lovely rooftop bar with great cocktails. 
Would definitely recommend. 
Thank you Knickerbocker.

title: Worth the price!
text: Nice sized room, helpful staff, a La carte breakfast was great. Room was dark, quiet and comfortable.  Small gaffes, such as no water and water glasses in the room were quickly corrected.  The buffet breakfast seemed overpriced even for nyc, but the individual orders were New York reasonable.

title: Great for business, centrally located
text: We actually changed hotels into the Knickerbocker on recommendation of a friend. The hotel has terrific service, and a great place both on the roof and the 4th floors to get away from the hustle and relax. Clean rooms, friendly people, good music, it’s a ten.

title: Special night
text: We were made to feel very special from the moment we arrived. What an oasis of tranquility just steps from the clamor and buzz of Times Square. Thank you to the whole hotel team for a lovely stay. Will come again.

title: Luxury at its finest
text: Above the craziness of Times Square there is a haven of serenity. Everyone we encountered from check in to check out, 4th floor lounge to rooftop bar and everyone in between exuded hospitality. We cannot wait to return. The Knick burger was to die for and worth a return visit on its own. A truly wonderful stay at the knickerbocker hotel.

title: New York holiday
text: The room was good! Very comfortable. No glasses for wine or beer. No coffee machine or kettle these would have added to the pleasure of our stay. It was also quite expensive when you add tips, the city taxes and the additional $45 per night charged by the hotel.

title: Premier City View/5 star hotel?
text:
This was our second time staying here. First time was prior to our son’s wedding and we had booked a few suites. Well money talks and bs walks. This time my husband and I booked the highest tier room with the promise online of “upgrade” and “2pm checkout” via the promotion we use and always direct our clients to use. 
Neither was available at check in or check out.
The “premier city view” was an office building. For over $500 per night. If it wasn’t 95 degrees outside I probably would have left and called my cc company. Ridiculous. 
The egg sandwiches at Jake’s were inedible. I don’t even know what the egg square like patty was! 
On the plus side, room svc was good, staff is nice, it’s safe. Noiseless and great blackout curtains. 
Think we’ll go back to The Plaza or The Ritz Carlton. Those are five star hotels.

title: This hotel was amazing !!!
text: This hotel was amazing and right in the heart of Time Square ! The scent in the room is so refreshing and satisfying !!! The room was very luxurious and I loved the lighting controls very user friendly !

title: Knickerbocker is A BRILLIANT HOTEL
text: Absolutely Brilliant stay at the Knickerbocker. We were here for a week and I cannot speak more highly of the fabulous experience that my family and I had at this landmark place. The staff is extremely professional, hard working and always ready to help. The cleanliness of the rooms and the fragrance that greets you when you enter the Hotel Lobby is just beyond mesmerizing. I hope I can come back to this place very soon.

title: Another Great Stay at The Knickerbocker
text:
This is our third time staying at the Knickerbocker, my husband and I would not stay anywhere else when visiting NYC. The rooms are large and exceptionally clean. The bed was comfortable. The automatic blackout shade helped us sleep in. The robes and slippers provided with the room were a nice touch. The bathroom sink has a large vanity area. The toilet and shower have separate spaces. Checking in and out only took a matter of minutes. We arrived at 10:00 AM and we were just going to have them hold our bags until check-in time. They informed us our room was ready, which was perfect since our day had started with an early flight. The security is excellent, there was always someone standing at the entrance door and at the elevators. No long lines or waiting for elevators. The concierges were extremely helpful and knowledgeable, especially Stephanie. The rooftop bar is great! We received complimentary drink coupons, which was nice. 
The location is great, right by Times Square and close to the subway. We used the subway to and from the airport (LGA). A round trip for a couple is under $12.00. We just tapped our credit card for the subway rides. We each had a carry-on, and it was quite easy to get around. There are some stairs and escalators, but it was not a problem. The subway was the only transportation we used to get around.
It was an easy walk to the Broadway Show Sweeny Todd, which was outstanding! The concierges told us if we arrive 20 minutes before the show there would be plenty of time. That was absolutely correct. There is no need to get there real early.  
My husband and I had a wonderful stay at The Knickerbocker!!

title: Great Stay at the Knickerbocker NYC
text:
The Knickerbocker hotel was lovely.  The location is great, especially if you are there to see the main sights of NYC.
Stephanie, the concierge, as well as Paola in reservations are gems, and a big asset to The Knickerbocker.
I was with my two nephews celebrating their school graduations, and Paola went above and beyond in recognizing their achievements.  Stephanie answered emails and any questions we had about our agenda without delay.  Her recommendations were excellent to help guide us in NYC.
The rooms were nice and very clean, Housekeeping was perfect!!  
We dined every morning at the buffet as well as the a La carte breakfast menu.  The wait staff were very attentive and efficient.  The food was good,
I highly recommend The Knickerbocker Hotel.

title: recurrent guest
text: Had an amazing time as always. Service at checking was great, attentive and caring. Would have love to have better quality pillows. Also the bartender at the rooftop was a little rude when we tried to use our free cocktails, as if we were not good enough because we were using our free cocktails Bouchers instead of paying. Other than that amazing hotel.

title: Eigentlich gutes Hotel mit Mängeln
text:
Definitiv nicht 5 Stern und auch nicht „Leading Hotel of the world“ (wie Sacher/Wien oder Bayrischer Hof/ München)
Vorteile des Hotels: Lage zu Sightseeingtouren und Bahnhof, U-Bahn und Bigbus vor der Haustür, saubere Zimmer, 2x täglich room service 

Mängel:  
Im Zimmer: knarrende und quietschende Eingangstüren (627/629), klemmende Schiebetüre (627),  
Die Zimmertüren fallen mit Lärm ins Schloß, was auch 3 Zimmer weiter noch zu hören ist 
Dusche oder WC der Nachbarzimmer sorgt für unangenehme Geräuschkulisse 
Blick in einen dreckigen Hinterhof mit lauten Klimaanlagen 
Keine Lärmschutzfenster - Hier kann es durchaus sein, dass man um 5.30 von plötzlich einsetzender lauter Straßenmusik aus dem Schlaf geholt wird. Um 6.30 darf man dann weiter schlafen (1.September) 
Leere Minibar am Zimmer, die man sich erst befüllen lassen muss, ist auch mühsam

Rund um das Hotel ist essen und trinken sehr teuer.

title: Great location, clean room
text: Water Pressure was awesome! Room was clean. Location worked great for us as we walked to both a plan in the theater district as well as Penn Station for a train to Metlife stadium. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Trip to New York
text:
Had an amazing time. All the staff were very polite and professional from day one. 

Facilities were amazing. The H&M sign across the road was very bright through the net curtain which did disturb my sleep a little.

title: Huge Room in Time Square
text: Room size excellent to Manhattan’s standards. Good beds, good curtains and blackouts important for LEDs in Time Square, shower pressure perfect. We did not like the pillows - although they have options - one was very thin and the other thick for our preferences. Staff friendly.

title: Recent short vacation to watch the US Open
text:
Nice clean and large room, very comfortable bed. Excellent hygiene and daily cleaning.
Excellently situated or access to Times Square with the subway very nearby.
Do not take a taxi from JFK to this hotel as you could take the subway quite easily and the hotel is two minutes from the subway. This will save you at least $80.Nice clean and large room, very comfortable bed. Excellent hygiene and daily cleaning.
Excellently situated or access to Times Square with the subway very nearby.
Do not take a taxi from JFK to this hotel as you could take the subway quite easily and the hotel is two minutes from the subway. This will save you at least $80.
It takes only 45 minutes via the subway to get to the US Open tennis.

title: Nice, understated place near Times Square.  Wish there were more nods to the history of the building.
text: The door, concierge and bell staff were very personable and helpful.  We loved the space in the room and the bathrooms were outstanding.  It was easy to access and get to whatever we needed.  The restaurant and rooftop bar were nice, but pricey.  Decor was understated and tasteful.  However, while nice, I would love to see more nods to the history of the building than just the book that was in the room and the exterior facade.  I know it is landmarked, but it doesn't take much to add displays in the lobby, inside the elevators and on each floor by the elevators which could be informative.  Reading the book it was fascinating to skim through all the beginnings of the hotel and it's evolution, but does everyone really take the time to do so when there is so much in the city to see and do?

title: Amazing location and a timeless landmark.
text: My stay was fairly pleasant at the Knickerbocker. It was my first time at the property. My room however was felt a bit claustrophobic. It only had one window overlooking 42nd street and there was a huge wall covered by blinds to the left of it that I feel like could’ve had another window to it. I did notice a few minor blemishes on the bedroom wall and restroom that made it feel bit antiquated. Nonetheless, staff were pleasant and greeted me every time. There was a doorman who would always open up the door upon my arrival. The property was within proximity to a lot the destinations I visited. I will more than likely stay here again hopefully in the near future.

title: Best experience
text:
We stayed at the Knickerbocker from August 30-September 03, 2023. The concierge Stephanie Donete was very knowledgeable.  All the places we went we asked her for directions  and the directions she gave was accurate. She was very friendly and dedicated to giving 100% customer service.  Her customer service was superb (100).  The hotel was very immaculate and the guess services was on point.  Each time we called for something they were there within 5 minutes.  The Knickerbocker will be our choice of stay when visiting New York in the future.
Doris Lacy-San Antonio, TX

title: Excelente opción para hospedarse en midtown
text:
Excelente Hotel, cuartos amplios y limpios. 
Excelente ubicacion (aunque tal vez un poco demasiado "turistuca" y concurrida pero muy centrica.
Me encantaría seguir dando mi opinión y lo haría más seguido si no tuviera el compromiso de cumplir con las 200 palabras que exige este ensayo

title: Knickerbocker Doesn't Disappoint and Our Pick for Times Square New York
text: We stayed as a family of 3 people in 2 rooms at the Knickerbocker Hotel for 8 nights and cannot rave about this hotel enough in Timesquare. Timesquare can be quite manic and overwelming, but the staff and service de-compressed our stress levels to a welcome smile each and every time we entered or left the Hotel. Abdul checked us in after being stuck in customs for over 2.5 hours and we were glas to arrive. Jimmy was so lovely each and every time we saw him and took care of us a well as the lovely Concierges. The rooftop bar at St Clouds was amazing and so beautiful to chill out and have a cocktail or 3 and the American Breakfasts were delicious and kicked off the day. We were so impressed by everyone, so thank you Knickerbocker can't recommend you highly enough!

title: Great Hotel!
text: Great hotel to stay in Times Square.  Fabulous rooftop bar that overlooks the ball that drops on New Year's Eve.  The staff is very engaging and helpful.  Bryant Park is a block away with lots of action including restaurants, concerts, ping pong, waffle kiosk, etc.  The #7 subway to the US Open is a block away

title: Beautiful, mismanaged hotel.
text:
Beautiful room with luxurious bathrooms. Turn-down service occurred 2 nights out of 3. The 4th floor restaurant had problems one might expect at a place that was just opening, including a waiter who was very far from sufficiently fluent in English.  

As a departing gift, we discovered a surprise $45/day "Hotel fee".  There weren't resort amenities to justify it.  Nothing, really, beyond the room.  Unexplained and unconscionable.

title: Great hotel
text: First off Hotel smelled divine, everyone was polite. The rooftop was a vibe, the robes and slippers were a plus, and the AC never went off (that is big if you sweat in your sleep). Would stay again, would recommend. Oh! and we had 24hr room service, the rigatoni was bussin at 3:52 am

title: Best option in hotel
text: Excellent hotel. Rooms perfects . Very nice attention and good ubication in times squares . Absolutely recommended . Every day clean the room and staff is very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is amazing .

title: Nice Stay At The Knickerbocker
text: After reading many reviews and careful research, I decided to stay at the Knickerbocker - I'm extremely picky about hotels and willing to pay for something nicer.  I ususally stay at another hotel in Time Square but that hotel was closed so was forced to try something new.  We arrived and they assigned a lower category room than what we paid for.  We complained to the front desk and at first they told us that the hotel was fully booked and nothing could be done but that changed when we asked to speak with the Manager.  At $700 a night I wasn't going to settle for anything less than what I paid for.  After showing us several rooms we finally agreed to take an accessible room which wasn't ideal but it was the best of the lot since we weren't going to be disturbed by the constant pinging of the elevator.  We ate breakfast at the restaurant and it was good but pricey.  The staff and door people don't pay any attention to you, we weren't even offerred assistance to get a cab.  The location is ideal and the hotel is clean and modern but my husband (who is less picky than I am) says we won't stay there again, the check in experience was off-putting and the hotel isn't really anything special considering it's branded as a luxury hotel.  I've stayed in luxury hotels and the Knickerbocker isn't it.  Having said that, if you're not that picky and want a great location in Times Square then I would recommend it.  Rooms are small but it's clean and serves its purpose.

title: Great experience
text: The Room was beautiful and spacious, loved the lighting options. All of the staff were friendly and accommodating. The location in Times Square is incredible -everything is accessible and easy to walk to your destination.

title: Luxe quiet stay at Times Sq1
text: Loved staying at the Knickerbocker, travelling for business. The team was super helpful at getting me a quiet room at the back of the building, and although originally in a special needs room, I was able to move to another 'normal' room which had a larger desk to work on. Loved the rooftop terrace, though did not use the restaurant or gym. Loved the cafe on the ground floor, super practical, wish every hotel had that.

title: Stephanie - Best Concierge Ever!
text:
Great location, right next to the Subway and Times Square, and a short stroll to Bryant Park. Beds very comfy and the room wasn't too noisy given the busy street the hotel is located on. Sadly on our last night the people in the room next door were having VERY loud sex at 2am which kept us awake then in the morning they just had a screaming argument. Very selfish and inconsiderate behavior. 

There is a very good coffee shop on the ground floor called Jakes which we frequented every morning with lovely helpful staff. Biggest let down really was the St Cloud rooftop bar. Service was either slow, non existent or completely inconsistent. My husband asked for a smoking table so he could vape and we were put into a small atmosphere-less 'box' area then when we looked behind us in the middle of the main bar a guy was sat smoking a massive stinking cigar. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food.

Best thing about this hotel is the concierge Stephanie, the most helpful, knowledgeable and enthusiastic concierge we have ever met and a real credit to the hotel. Would definitely recommend, just drink at a different rooftop bar.

title: Perfect night in NYC
text:
Loved this hotel.  It has a great location at the southern end of Time Square.  I chose the hotel because of this location and its proximity to the theater district.
