My room was on the 12th floor facing 42nd Street.  It was quiet considering the hotel location.  There were plenty of amenities in the room - iron, hair dryer, mini frig, umbrellas, laundry service, toiletries, etc.  The room was clean and modern.  There were dimmer switches for all the lighting which was unique and oddly useful.  Plenty of electrical outlets so tech devices could be changed.  The bed was comfy.  The room thermostat worked properly and was quiet.

The staff were all courteous and helpful.  My only complaint would be that they didn’t have my phone number and email correctly added to my reservation.  This caused a bit of confusion on my part when I didn’t receive hotel communications.  The error was prompted addressed by the staff when I brought it to their attention.  No real harm came from the error.

Overall I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for an upscale hotel with a good location.

title: Give it a Try!!
text: Close to everything! Spacious rooms, clean, and great service.  All staff were friendly.   You have to check out the rooftop bar.   A bit on the pricey side but you have to experience this.  Best view of the New Years Eve Ball.   Stayed on the front of the hotel overlooking the busy street but was still quiet. This is the second time I have stayed here and will do so again when I visit New York.

title: Perfect in every way!
text: The hotel is great, but the staff is even better.  Ever member of the staff was professional and more than willing to help.  The quality of the rooms and restaurants made us wish the trip would have lasted another week.  We will be back.

title: Un'oasi di pace nel centro di New York
text:
Stanza molto confortevole, pulita, due comodi letti.
Reception curata.
Posizione centrale. 
Il personale ha soddisfatto le nostre richieste con precisione e gentilezza.
Non abbiamo usufruito della colazione, quindi non posso esprimere alcuna valutazione, ma il roof è sicuramente da provare!
Siamo stati molto bene!

title: EXCELLENT!
text:
Personnel bienveillant et réactif. 
On a été surclassé à notre arrivé.
Chambre très bien agencée. Pas de vue sur Times Square donc très calme…(vue sur un autre immeuble).
Ménage effectué 2 fois par jour.
4 ascenseurs donc pas d’attente pour rejoindre la chambre.
L’hôtel est idéalement situé (proche du métro, des Red stairs, d’un super marché, de Bryant Park, à 5min du Rockefeller Center et à 10 min de ETB..)

title: Another Great Stay in Midtown
text: We have stayed at the Knickerbocker several times and always have a great experience.  Comfortable rooms and plenty of space for the price in an excellent location Midtown.  We made more use of the rooftop bar this time, with an upside and a downside comment.  Like the atmosphere, not loud even with the location next to Times Square.  However, as soon as it hit 11 PM felt like staff was trying to run us out the door.  They had no problem serving us a drink as last call at 11, but immediately had people trying to rush us out.

title: The Knick is a must stay
text: I’ve been staying at the Knick for years and it’s always a consistently great experience. Wonderful for theatre trips because you’re within walking distance of all the Broadway houses. Beds are super comfy. Room service is awesome.

title: The go to location in a city full of great locations
text: Great central Manhattan location. The Knickerbocker is a lovely  historic building but the interiors are gorgeously modern. Super helpful staff at every turn. The St Cloud rooftop lounge is not to be missed.  Sip your delicious cocktail while viewing Times Square from the clouds.

title: Not what I expected from a 5 star luxury hotel
text: I booked for 2 nights and wanted to give my kids the luxury hotel experience since this was their first time at a 5 star hotel. The person who took my reservation told me they had EV chargers at their parking space and the room i booked had a view…when I checked in, they had no chargers and the view I had was another building with office spaces. The suite we had had a broken lamp and some of the wallpaper in the bathroom were peeling off. Odd for a 5 star hotel I thought. The manager apologized and they did comp me 1 day of valet parking…I wanted to make the most of it. the bell staff and housekeeping were amazing though. When we checked out, one of my kids left their phone in the room by accident. They were nice to offer to have the phone shipped to our house since we had already left. I emailed my info to them but what made me go over the edge was that they also shared my personal info with another guest when they emailed me back. I was ok with everything else but that was not cool. The manager on the phone said she would have the concierge look into it. The person who accidentally shared my info sincerely apologized. That was fine but management did nothing to respond. I, personally, would have paid an extra 300-400 per night at another hotel if it meant I would get better overall service and what I asked for. But that was a let down to me. Just disappointed in the whole thing overall.

title: Highly recommended
text: We really loved the character of the hotel, it was the perfect location for our first visit to New York.  The entire staff was friendly, accommodating and professional.  Our beds were very comfortable. We really enjoyed starting our day at the breakfast buffet  and ending it with a drink at the roof top bar.

title: Bien pour une première 😘
text: Très bel hôtel avec un personnel aux petits soins! Toujours souriant! Petite déception par rapport aux armoires pour ranger nos vêtements. Étant à 4 pour 9 nuits, c’était un peu limite. Pas de machine à café ou bouilloire dans la chambre, ça manquait. Mais en dehors de ça, l’hôtel est très bien situé.

title: Staying in a NYC wit a Knick
text:
Our staying at Knickerbocker was great: large rooms, excellent location, wonderful building.
We would like to thank Gania of the breakfast reception for her kindness: she made the beginning of our days in NYC much more pleasant.

title: Outstanding Service/Nice Location/Great Price
text: The personal service (concierge/doorman/bellman) were outstanding.  Our room was lovely. The breakfast buffet was great.  The location was terrific.  We felt safe to walk around and explore, but were not in the part of Times Square that was too crowded.  We got a great price too!  The only negative was that the lighting in the bathroom was not bright enough.

title: So So
text:
Noisy room and in general the position of the hotel is in a dirty and chaotic area, of the town,  I wouldn’t recommend .
No lobby !?!
Luckilly personell was nice, polite and efficient .
Room could be cleaned better.

title: Exceeds expectations
text: The team are so professional and intuitive, they helped me with a luggage situation that would have been so easy to dismiss, but their care made my travels so much easier.  The room was outstanding in comfort, the bed was luxurious. The coffee at Jakes is a secret treasure.  I will come back and stay longer next time.

title: Disappointing Knickerbocker
text: Perhaps we expected too much from a hotel identifying itself as one of the best and unique. Turns out it was not very special at all. Standard items in our room were missing and we waited for some time for 5hem to be provided. Staff were either too busy to be helpful or just plain grumpy. Facilities were ok but rooms were fairly ordinary. Location was the best feature nothing much else was in any way out of 5he ordinary.

title: Great service. Nice rooms
text: Very impressed with the people and rooms very nice.  Nice and quiet. Even with being so close to times Square. The maids kept the room very clean and tidy. The staff always asking if we needed anything and quick to come to the room if needed.

title: Week at the Knick
text:
Lovely building right in the heart of Times Square.  Large room, big shower, 
long bathroom vanity, commode behind separate door...nearly perfect room! Staff was wonderful.  Breakfast was good, but exorbitantly expensive.  Not much sound proofing,  so if your light sleeper, this could be challenging.   Had a guest on our floor who took his phone calls in the hallway at 8 a.m. until I finally "shushed" him and he went back in his room.

title: Top place
text:
Our journay was super at the hotel. Everything was fantastic: breakfast, cleanliness, service.
 Hotel that i surely suggest to my friends. I adored the good smell and the silence inside. Many thanks to all the staff

title: Kindness and luxury at the Knick
text: What a grand adventure we had at the Knick! We were shown so much kindness and were treated to luxury. The location is right in the heart of it. We so enjoyed the excitement of Times Square. Our room was spacious, clean, and so comfortable. We will certainly return!

title: Recommendable
text: Great location on Times Square, ample room, very comfortable and spacious, spotless, great staff, excellent roof top. Beds we’re very comfortable, vero noises and bathroom is very roomy. Would definitely recommend it and be back!

title: Solo Time To Nourish My Mind, Body And Soul...🥰
text:
Loved the hotel; room 917; high quality amenities, linen and bath towels. I  enjoyed most of the guest services provided. I was especially impressed by Jay in Consierge!!! Thank you for the recommendations! Jay is certainly an asset to Knickerbocker. Congratulations!
However, I requested a quiet room for peace and meditation, which at first it was...quiet and peaceful. Then there were noisy guests in two rooms close to mine for three days. Why allocate those rooms to anyone at all? The hotel was not super busy during my five (5) night stay, so allocating other rooms would not have been difficult. Although this was very annoying, I would expect Knickerbocker to fulfil guests' simple requests, especially when most of the hotel staff did their job exceptionally! I was and still am so impressed by the high standards provided by Knickerbocker. The only negative comment I have about the staff is that housekeeping staff need to do their duties quietly! My sleep during three mornings was 'shockingly' interrupted by loud noise, loud talking, loud laughing and doors constantly being shut...not acceptable!!! Staff should be considerate, quiet and use commonsense, at all times! Thank you for a mostly enjoyable and satisfying experience. I would love to return with my husband in the near future! Many thanks...💛🙏💛

title: Excellent location near Times Square!
text: The Knickerbocker is located in an excellent location near Times Square. The hotel rooftop bar was exceptional, food was great and we had a view of the Times Square ball that is dropped on New Year's Eve. The staff were very friendly and provided great service.

title: Excellent
text: This hotel is highly reccomended. Excellent location, normal size of room, simply we are very satisfied. We enjoyed the rooftop bar as well. The only thing that I can mention, that the breakfast is very expansive. But you can enjoy the Jack’s caffe for a coffee in the morning.

title: best location is New York City .Period.
text: Location, Location, Location, this hotel is in the heart of New York, steps away from Bryant Park, 6th Ave, Times Square and 10 subway lines. You cant get better in terms of location. Close to everything and the subway is right below for you to go anywhere in NY. Even despite being right by Times Square, its surprisingly quiet and you cant hear a thing in the rooms, i got the corner room overlooking TSQ. Great hotel staff and beautiful flower decoration. The rooftop bar is amazing.

title: Great location
text: Great location. Clean, convenient, and helpful staff. Parking is a little tricky- was given the address of an off-site parking garage, and because I used the QR code at the garage (which was prompted when pulling up to the garage), and because the hotel staff ran out of validation tickets, I ended up having to pay a lot for parking.

title: My Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: This is my 4th visit to the hotel in 8 years and it is always an excellent experience. The proximity to Times Square is perfect and the view from the rooftop bar is spectacular. The rooms are gorgeous and staff is always very welcoming.

title: The Heart of Times Square
text:
The location puts you in the heart of Times Square. The Subway is right in the corner so getting places was very easy. We had a king room on the 7th floor. We really didn't hear any significant outside noise. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The shower had amazing water pressure and the room was very clean.
We did make a visit to the rooftop bar which had a great atmosphere and views. Our only "complaint" was that the cocktails were a tad pricey for our budget.

title: Superb Service, Location and Value
text: Amazing service and value in a prime location.  Room was on the small side (no room for a nightstand on one side of our king bed) but it was very quiet and very comfortable.  We enjoyed the roof top bar, too.

title: A surprisingly quiet oasis in the middle of one of the busiest tourist spots in America!
text: A surprisingly quiet oasis in the middle of one of the busiest tourist spots in America! No need for room service as there are countless options for all food preferences just steps outside. An interior-facing room still allows for a surprising amount of light while providing the benefit of protection from Times Square noise.

title: A must for a NYC a first timer - close to it all
text:
Great location for a NYC first time visitor! Tranquility amongst the hustle and bustle of it all.  Great concierge and immaculate housekeeping.  
The hotel has a lot of history and is one the oldest in NYC - close to everything - Central Park, Broadway, Empire State etc and just a few stops away from downtown 9/11 memorial etc

title: Time Square Gem
text: Best hotel for convenience, service and food - awesome time - Rooms are spacious, rooftop bar is just chic and crazy vibes with best views of NY City - cocktails and wine list is great - from entering to leaving hotel - just great experience

title: Very nice facility
text: Very nice facility, well managed, helpfull and friendly staff. would stay there again, roof top bar is just great, if you go early, you will have a good chnace to sit outside. Sleep quality was just great, no noise in the middle of town.

title: Average…
text: Overall a good experience. $1800 for 4 nights 3 days… the rooms did not meet my expectations for the price paid. Furniture had obvious wear and tear, chipped/cracked flooring, no bath mat next to shower so unless you wanted the bathroom to flood you had to stack towels up next to the shower. There wasn’t a fan in the bathroom so taking a shower fogged up the bathroom mirror. Also no fan for going to the bathroom…  We were kicked off our wi-fi the morning of checkout but didn’t check out until 12pm… Bed was comfortable. We weren’t in our rooms but long enough to sleep so it was sufficient. Would look into other hotels for our next stay.

title: Excellent
text: Beautiful hotel, smells amazing as soon as you walk in, very good location if you want to be in times square. Rooms were Spacious, clean, comfortable bed, staff was nice. I would stay here again for sure.

title: Well worth it!
text: I had a perfectly lovely stay at the Knickerbocker! The location is convenient. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable. We dined at the restaurant, and it was very good.  The Heirloom Tomato Salad was wonderful.  Please use Diane, the Concierge for any questions you have. She is fantastic! All the doormen were also very friendly and helpful. I might have developed a tiny crush on Andre. My stay here was worth every penny!

title: You can't go wrong at the Knickerbocker
text: The Knickerbocker is always a reliable and consistent hotel. The staff is professional and friendly and the housekeeping staff is superior. There are multiple options for drinks and the rooftop is pretty. I appreciate the concierge always being available and helpful

title: Our favorite hotel in New York!
text:
We come to Manhattan every year to see Broadway shows and have stayed at a dozen hotels and the Knick is our favorite. 

This year Gania made every morning at the restaurant a delight and when we left Andre got us a taxi and walked with us to meet it at 7th. He made our trip to JFK easy. 

We will see you next year in the spring. 

Thanks!

title: Best Hotel In NYC
text: We have just checked out of the glorious Knickerbocker Hotel after our weeklong stay there.  There are many reasons why we have stayed at the Knickerbocker every year for years.  This is a fabulous hotel.  Terrific location, friendly service, amazing rooms.  The food at the Charlie Palmer is EXTRAORDINARY.  A big shout out to Gania in the restaurant for being so KIND AND WONDERFUL!!  Another big shout out to André the doorman, who GETS THINGS DONE!!  Thank you, Knickerbocker!  We can’t wait to return next year!

title: Excellent location and rooftop.
text: Excellent location, comfortable bed,  friendly and helpful concierge, excellent rooftop. It is located in Times Square and  on the spot. There is a story that Martini was created here in the Knickerbocker club.

title: Kd
text: Pillows and sheets were amazing and the staff were also very helpful.  We had a few issues with the television and the motorized blinds but they fixed it in a timely manner.  We would definitely stay again

title: 5 Star
text: Very clean rooms I had a suite and a premier city view king only noticeable difference was the suite had a unneeded hallway in it. No business center if you need to print boarding pass. or work docs. No true doorman or bell hop to help get luggage in and out of the hotel these are all thing you'd expect from a 5 star hotel. Roof top bar was great. Hotel is located at time square, which is great for tourist

title: Great/Checking out sucked
text: I had an amazing experience at the hotel. And we had the staff & manager check on my husband who wasn't feeling well. However, my checkout experience was absolutely horrible. The agent who handled my final bill was very rude. And she did not want to answer questions I had.

title: Not really a LHW
text: Not really a LHW. Though "the most" central in Manhattan, the hotel is not sufficiently noise protected.  Service not LHW like at all, e.g. improper check in, no LHW gift. Mass, no class, no style. One of my saddest LHW experiences.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Rooms were nice and location is good. Expensive but it is central.

We had an issue with our room and were moved to a room with a better view quickly. 

The guys at the front door and the gentlemen who helped with our bag were super nice. As was J at the concierge desk.

title: Top Knick
text:
First time visiting this hotel and I can say it was an amazing experience from start to finish. Usually when visiting the city we like to stay away from the hustle of tourists on Times Square however as soon as you walk through the doors of the Knick you are transported away and instantly put to ease. 
The reception staff and concierge service are great and flow with a quick process, no queues or waiting, instead a lovely calming reception area. 
The rooms are immaculate, we had a room with a good view of the city and could’ve sat there all day. All the appliances were modern and the room was a generous size for the city, there was no cramped feeling when bringing in the suitcases, instead these could be hidden in the large wardrobe space. The bathrooms were also a great size. 

On arrival we were gifted with two drinks to visit the rooftop bar and wow what an experience, a modern stylistic bar with great ambiance and a laugher and chat to be heard from all over the rooftop. There is a mix of outdoor seating and indoor bar space which was great and had the same calming feel even though time square was within sight. 

Great experience, highly recommended.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: Loved our 4 night stay at The Knickerbocker Hotel.  The staff were very friendly and helpful the hotel room was very comfortable and we loved the Diptyque toiletries in the bathroom.  The blackout blind worked so well, we slept in most mornings not realising what time it was.  It was also very quiet.  Would definitely stay here again but not during peak season as it was very busy.

title: Loved the knickerbocker
text: The room was very clean. The room service was amazing. The bathroom was spacious. Great location!!! Subway right at the corner.  Hotel staff was very courteous. They even text you to see how your stay is going. Highly recommend!

title: Ideal choice for a remarkable experience in NYC
text:
The Knickerbocker Hotel in NYC is a perfect blend of timeless elegance and modern luxury. Its prime location in Times Square puts you at the center of the city's energy. It took me a couple of minutes to go to Broadway’s Minskoff Theatre to see The Lion King. Walking distance to iconic places like Saint Patrick’s Cathedral, 5th Avenue shopping, Rockefeller Center, The Empire State Building, and many world-class restaurants.  

The hotel has a contemporary design, state-of-the-art facilities, and plush rooms with cutting-edge technology. The room was very quiet despite the location in such a busy area. 

I experienced the Rooftop terrace and enjoyed breathtaking views of the city skyline. The staff service was exceptional and made my stay memorable. The Knickerbocker Hotel is the ideal choice for a remarkable experience in New York City.

title: Daddy-Daughters Long NYC Weekend
text:
2nd time staying at the Knick. As before, we thoroughly enjoyed our 3-night stay. Like many of us that have stayed at hotels, resorts, etc., we've experienced great service. The Knick does the same; however, they took it one notch higher for showcasing a genuine concern to ensure a fabulous stay. For instance, our first turn down service they presented us with cookies, milk, and a mini box of chocolates. Why? Who knows, but the touch won the hearts of my daughters and me.  

Daily text messages from the concierge asking if there's anything they can do to silent windows blocking out the nonstop noise from Time Square also is a plus.  Location is paramount with subway station  on hotel's corner. I will not hesitate to book at the knickerbocker when I return to NYC.

title: Superb Hotel
text: Fantastic hotel, in a fantastic location. We read so much about New York and Times Square before we arrived and were quite apprehensive. This hotel was perfect for us and our family. Yes, Times Square is busy, but it is Times Square. The hotel rooms are large and extremely comfortable. The only very slight shadow on an otherwise perfect stay was the baggage handlers, who made constant requests for tips, despite me assisting them in retrieving our luggage.

title: nyc at its finest
text: the staff is very professional friendly which made our stay enjoyable  the breakfast buffet choices were diverse and tasty and the wait staff was excellent  we are looking forward to our next stay in new york city

title: Final night
text: Stayed in the Martini suite, what a lovely room. Friendly staff, great roof top bar. Has been the first time at this property despite many trips to New York in the past and unfortunately only for one night at the end of our trip. Now at a top spot of my favorite hotels in NYC. Only one little downside that a Cafe Latte is not included in the breakfast…

title: Comfortable Quiet Respite in Times Square
text: We had high expectations of this pricey room and it delivered. Location just above the subway at SEC of Broadway and 42nd in Times Square makes you a quick walk/ride from the entire city. Doormen were present half the time, brought bags to room quickly, and kept away the non guests from entering. Elevator requires a key card to access your floor as most do in major cities now. The room was ice cold during some of the hottest weather in NY this year, remote controlled drapes kept it plenty dark to sleep in after a late night. Double vanity sinks huge mirror, walk in shower with rain soaking head (was spa like) with opaque glass doors. The bathroom door is a sliding glass opaque glass door with a drape for extra privacy and to block light from the bathroom window. Queen beds instead of the full size at many NY hotels is one of the reasons we chose the Knickerbocker; they were the best beds of our east coast vacation. Large sitting couch was a nice place to crash after walking 5th Ave and Times Square and crush Joe's Pizza in the wee hours of the night. Room was clean, two bottles of water each day, ice delivered by food service as needed, remotes for lights, drapes and to show privacy wanted or service needed. Small closet had slippers/robes, hangers and a few drawers including a safe if you feel the need for one. We hope to be back. Our one regret is that we didn't get to the St. Cloud roof top as it closes  earlier than we returned each night.

title: Great Hotel - Not Great Restaurant
text: The hotel itself and the rooftop were great. I will definitely be booking this hotel again in the future. My one complaint was the restaurant - Charlie Palmer. The service was horrible. The food was not good at all. I feel like for everything else the hotel offers - this is definitely an area they need to focus on upping their game. It is the reason I took 1 star away.

title: Business Happy Hour
text: Johir was a great server awesome place to go for a business happy hour. Definitely get the appetizers they were a huge hit in a group setting especially the sliders. Sweet views of Times Square and nyc in general .

title: Excellent Hotel and Location
text: From the staff to the restaurant to the quiet, beautiful room that was a sanctuary from busy Times Square, it was a perfect location that was also quiet and luxurious. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

title: Fabulous First Visit
text: First trip to NYC. This hotel was Wonderful from start to finish! Big room, nice bathroom, wonderful doormen! Awesome housekeeping and turn down service. Delicious breakfast buffet! Will stay here again next time we come to NY. No complaints!

title: Broadway hustle and bustle
text:
Overall a good experience. 

The positives: very friendly staff, clean, good-sized rooms and beds, chambermaids/housekeeping was excellent, very central location (maybe less than 1 minutes walk to the subway) and fun roof-terrace/bar.

The negatives: location just off Times Square means that in the afternoons/evenings the streets and pavements can be heaving with all and sundry (tourists, performance artists, drug-dealers, hustlers, et cetera) making it unpleasant/hard to get through the crowds to the hotel.  Although when booking we requested a room away from the elevators (we had read reviews that people congregating for the lifts could be noisy), we were given a room by the elevators.  The next day the staff moved us to a room further along the corridor with no fuss.  In the first room the bathroom/lavatory lay-out was rather odd meaning little privacy.  In the second room it was better but not great.  Another negative was that the window blind did not fit well (I think it was worn out) meaning that the flashing lights from the huge neon signs on buildings around Times Square infiltrated the room.  On that note, I'm not sure I have seen so many small lights for this and that in the room all through the night.  If you are very light sensitive, this might not be the place for you.

It was pretty good value although breakfast was not included (something that I usually loathe but not a problem in NYC as it was fun to breakfast out).  Whilst I have given it 4 stars, next time I will look elsewhere for a quieter location.  That said, I wouldn't be upset if I had to stay there again.

title: Amazing stay
text: Beautiful hotel, amazing room, lovely staff. I stayed at The Knickerbocker hotel for just under a week for a work trip and on my arrival they had upgraded my room for free which was lovely. I have had no issues while staying at The Knickerbocker hotel. My only recommendation is that if you come with someone but are in different rooms on different floors their floor number should be put on your card as well so you are able to go see them.

title: Good hotel
text: the hotel is in an excellent location for tourists. great room size, apparently new, and excellent cleanliness. breakfast and service in general are also good. surprised me positively. we will stay again on our next trip.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Stayed here for 4 nigths and the hotel couldnt of been better, the staff, the room and location. A big thank you to the staff on reception and a big big well done and thank you to Jesse Shen in food and Beverage for your help with making my partners 60th super special. The rooftop bar is a wonderful place to relax, and the coffee shop which is linked to hotel has the best pastries. Cant wait to go back.

title: The best!
text: Service was amazing. My husband and I celebrated our 10 year wedding anniversary and the hotel acknowledged it my sending champagne and chocolate to our room. Our room was so great. Definitely made our first time in New York a memorable time.

title: Top notch for comfort and location
text: The hotel location was perfect for our needs for seeing the touristy things (Times Square, theaters, many dinner venues, subway entrance, breakfast cafes...) The beds, pillows, amenities in the room were top notch. Bathroom set up was great for multiple users. Maid service the best - especially the chocolates. We enjoyed the rooftop for pre-dinner drinks. The free coffee at early hours was a bonus. The front desk staff, the door people and concierge were friendly, efficient and helpful. It was nice to be able to control the room temperature and it was quiet. The lobby, elevators and hallways were always very clean and shiny. Two of the guests were first time visitors to New York City and your hotel gave positive lasting impressions.

title: How long does it take to deliver water?
text: Every time the complimentary water - that was actually paid for with the daily residence fee - was requested, the staff failed to deliver it or it was delivered several hours later! Front desk agents seemed so unconcerned about the issue. However the hotel itself is nice but requests seem to be a hassle…

title: A Centrally Located Gem
text: The Knickerbocker Hotel is a gem.  Everything says class there.  The staff throughout is very professional.  They exceeded expectations.  I needed ice every evening because of a recent operation on my knee.  A gentleman that worked at the hotel remembered and brought the ice without having to be asked.  I wish I knew the gentleman’s name, because he should be commended for his fine service.  I was reluctant to call every evening, but he made my embarrassment subside by being understanding and assertive.  Please recognize this gentleman.

title: Summer NYC
text:
It is in a Great location.  the room was clean and very spacious. 

The staff were all very friendly and available to help. I definitely would stay here next time I am visiting. Highly recommend this hotel

title: First Class Hotel that will meet all your needs!
text:
The atmosphere is felt upon arrival. From the Customer Service rep, Front Desk personal and the Bellman officials. The decor is soothing, with blackout shades, living room space, cozy bedding etc.
The location is the best.
The roof top was the highlight as you can relax, chat, eat, drink etc.

title: Fantastic hotel stay!!
text: Fantastic hotel. Employees super nice.  Rooms are very clean and great beds. They provide room service daily unlike so many hotels after Covid which is so nice. They connected via text immediately after checking in and made sure we were good mid trip and also reminded us we could let them know easily via text if we needed anything. I highly recommend. Also in the middle of everything - Broadway, 7th ave, and theater district.

title: A very good trip to new york
text:
ideally located hotel. The staff very attentive. Without forgetting the roof top. Excellent stay.
We had a corner suite. The view was beautiful over times square.
The breakfast was very generous and excellent.

title: Amazing
text:
we are a brazilian couple and we were delighted with the hotel! mainly with the hospitality of the employees, especially with Luz, she was very attentive, helpful, polite and kind!
Comfortable, clean and well located hotel, although it is close to a very noisy area, the rooms are very quiet.

title: Overcharged already with no invoice and still waiting for a call back
text:
Dear Knickerbocker,

I would appreciate if someone can call us back regarding the overcharge for room 719 from June 23-July 1. 

I’ve tried to email Monika and front desk and shocked that no one reply or provide an invoice. Upon check out the issue was highlighted to front desk. I was promised no charge until clarified with Monika.

Three weeks later, we still have no invoice but have been overcharged already.

I would be happy if one can get back to us. You have our contact as I’ve written several times and left multiple voice messages.

Thank you.

title: Mixed review
text: I had just taken a shower and reached for the folder towel and the largest cockroch (2 inches long or more) jumped out and onto the tile of the shower - shocking to say the least!  Threw a towel over it and called the front desk.  Someone came in 10 minutes and collected towel with bug.  Front desk suggested changing rooms but with family next door in 2nd room and activities booked, I said no - just clean entire room carefully and replace ALL linens.  I was credited $200 on a $2,500+ bill for the stay which wasn't much considering the shock.

title: Will come back again
text: We spent 4 nights with my two boys at the Knickerbocker. Location is perfect - walking distance to Times Square, 5 the Ave, Summit One and also subways. Staff were very helpful and also rooms are super nice and clean every day. We will definitely comeback if we visit NYC again.

title: Great service
text: Great location in the heart of Times Square. Subway was located a few steps away for easy travel around the city. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Turn down service each night was a nice touch. Buffet breakfast was top notch.

title: Fab hotel with patchy service
text:
This is a great hotel and we enjoyed our stay. 

Loved: the rooftop bar, the coffee shop, the friendly concierge team, the location, the initial check-in, the beds, the size of the rooms, no noise, and loved the style and feel of the place. 

But the front desk staff were such a let-down. Unhelpful and disinterested. And we dealt with them quite a few times, sadly they were consistent in their poor attitudes. We extended our stay and rather than getting ‘that’s great, how can I help’ we got ‘well you’ll have to go online and book again’ as if we were presenting them with a problem. Our tv didn’t work, the maintenance guy came and tried to be super helpful, sadly with no luck. So the night shift front desk person came up and apologised graciously and we all agreed we would sort it in the morning. Once the morning came and the usual suspects were back at the desk we were met with ‘ well if maintenance can’t fix it, there’s nothing I can do’ and immediately turned away.  We asked to change rooms rather than stay in a room with no tv. She huffed and puffed and said ‘well we can’t upgrade you’ implying we were fishing for a freebie. FFS we were staying a week and just wanted a working tv. So after much muttering and typing and avoiding all eye contact she conceded they could move us to another room. But it wouldn’t be ready until 5pm. So we asked if we could keep our existing room until then, for a seamless handover. More staring into her screen and muttering and finally 10 minutes later we got a reluctant ok. But then we got locked out by our room key, and were met with defensive explanations rather than ‘let me help you with that’ . It felt like dealing with petulant, lazy teenagers. Frustrating and annoying. Other guests felt the same way, we shared eye rolls and sighs as we waited in queues together, so it wasn’t just us. 

I’d love to go back as it was a great hotel. But hopefully all the petulant front desk staff will be gone and will be replaced by welcoming, communicative adults.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We had the pleasure of staying at “The Knickerbocker Hotel” in March 23.  Location,  location, it’s in the heart of it all but also really quiet, peaceful and calm once inside the hotel. The rooms are spacious, very modern, comfortable and clean with lovely bed linens.  We asked for tea and coffee facilities and this was provided no problem. We had a 10th floor room view facing the main drag and were not disturbed by noise at all.  The concierge were so help, Stephanie and Diana provided excellent restaurant recommendations and detailed location instructions.   The roof top bar had an amazing view and lovely vib about it.  Also they  served complimentary coffee in the lobby until 7am for us early risers, which was a nice touch . Would I stay at “The Knick “ again, you bet!

title: Great hotel
text:
Great location 
Diana the concierge is amazing for recommendations 
all the door guys and reception have been lovely 
The hotel is well renovated, rooms are clean and sleek 
We haven’t tried the food but menu looks good

title: Knickerbocker : beautiful , with BEST STAFF EVER!
text:
I really can’t say enough good things about our experience of the Knickerbocker Hotel. Beside the beauty and comfort of the hotel, 
 ( most amazing NEW YORK views from the luxurious sky top bar and lounge, great restaurants , rooms  with cushy pillows and bedding, huge showers with hand- held shower heads, extra large screen TVs , etc), it was really the staff that made our trip so special there. 
From Brandon who initially & warmly welcomed us to the hotel, to Luz who met every one of special requests ( and we had many, as it was our 1st trip to New York! 🤣), to Stephanie, the concierge , who deserves her very own paragraph! 
An exceptional concierge can make, or break your trip, and I have traveled much, and met many concierges, but I have never, and I mean NEVER, experienced a concierge as professional, knowledgable , and helpful as Stephanie. 
Every morning when we woke up, we would travel downstairs to the concierge desk, where Stephanie would be waiting for us with a smile. We told her the long list of things we wanted to accomplish that day, and she patiently guided us through each step, from which subway trains to take, what traps to avoid , secret treasures to delight us, and in general , how to have a fabulous day! She’ll make your trip a “10!” 
Go to the Knickerbocker! You’ll be glad you did!

title: Almost 4+
text:
Beautifully renovated.  Rooms well laid out and equipped, but:
Although we requested a quite room we were first given a room near the elevators.  After a night and morning listening to people congregating near the elevators and listening to the chimes we  switched rooms.

Suggestion:  show guests a floor plan when checking in indicating room location.

We had a breakfast buffet included package, which as great.  Wonderful selection and service.

We were given coupons for a complimentary drink.  We tried to use them at the roof top bar but there as a very limited selection for the coupon value, but the 4th floor bar had a greater selection with no concern with the value.  Curiously inconsistent.

As there is not always a door person, automatic doors would be great when arriving or departing with luggage.

A nice touch would be to have  a cold water dispenser available when checking in.

 Well equipped gym.

Complimentary bottled water supplied in the room.

We loved to return to the Knickerbocker in the future and see if our comments made a difference.

title: Another great stay
text: The Knickerbocker never disappoints.  The location is perfect as it is located in Time Square. Staff is wonderful. Rooms are large and clean with great showers.  We have several times and ways thoroughly enjoy ourselves.

title: Oasis of Calm in Times Square
text:
Recommended.
Accommodation very nice & upgrade to deluxe with drink vouchers appreciated. 
The poor restaurant service & food let the hotel down. Lots of room for improvement. 
Special mention to the lady concierge (didn’t catch her name) who was courteous, knowledgeable & patient. Wonderful asset to the Knickerbocker & her guidance enhanced our experience.

title: Reception
text: Diana at reception is an absolute star, happy to help find great days out, happy to take the time to find the best match for you, very knowledgeable and with an amazing attention to details . Thank you

title: First Class Service
text: The staff is amazing. Anything we needed was immediately taken care of. First class customer service. Paola checked us in and was available at any time to address any requests and make sure our stay was exceptional.

title: Loved the Knickerbocker!!
text: Can’t beat the location. In the heart of Times Square! Beautiful hotel. Staff was amazing. Room was upscale and very clean. Would stay here again! Definitely check out the rooftop bar - had amazing overlook to the city and had a nice embiance.

title: It was convenient
text: Hotel is at a great central location in the middle of Times Square, it was pretty convenient since a bunch of tourist activities were around. Rooms were nice, smart lighting, usb chargers, and housekeeping was outstanding. I also like the brand they use for soap and shampoo. Not so much amenities but it was a pretty decent stay. The roof top was nice too.

title: Rooftop Rendezvous!
text: At first, my wife and I were disappointed to find that the rooftop bar did not open until 4 PM. However, the doorman explained that the fourth floor bar would be more than happy to serve us until the rooftop bar opened in about an hour and a half from that point. This was a brilliant idea, we enjoyed the fourth floor bar, and then had food and more drinks on the rooftop bar to round out a beautiful evening!

title: Fun family trip
text: We enjoyed the kind and attentive staff. The hotel was in a great location in Times Square. The room had great water pressure. It also had high end bath products. Marcelo was great in helping with our luggage. I recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect location for a NYC adventure!
text: Perfect location for us. Loved the easy walks to Broadway shows, Birdland Jazz and many restaurants. Nice walk to Central Park and the Met as well. Would stay again. Great coffee at Jakes and drinks on the rooftop. Would definitely stay again!

title: Fantastic Customer Service!
text: We could not be happier with our stay at the Knickerbocker hotel. Upon arrival we were given a room with a funny smell and mentioned it to the front desk. Immediately they moved us to a new room, no questions asked! The rooms are very clean, quiet and comfortable. The location is great for tourism as you are very central and the subway line right out the door makes getting around very easy. Staff are friendly and helpful - service is great. Coffee at the restaurant on floor 4 was excellent! We definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: This hotel experience was fantastic from start to end. Easy website to book direct and picked up a last minute deal. Friendly staff at check-in and check-out and the concierge were all extremely helpful. Rooms were very modern, immaculately clean, bed was super comfortable and we loved the black out blind. We were right on the main road and hear minimal amount of noise. Excellent location and plenty of garages around to park your car.

title: Wonderful property
text: The Knickerboker in NYC near Times Square is a wonderful business hotel. Wonderful, large and comfortable rooms, amazing breakfast buffet, perfect location close to the theater district and Broadway, incredible roof top bar, I really recommend it!

title: New york trip
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Knickerbocker.  The hotel staff was very nice friendly and accommodating.  Our room was great and we had a good view of times square.  The location is great!!  We were able to walk to most of our destinations.  The hotel staff also helped book our return car to the airport.  I would highly recommend the Knickerbocker.

title: Superb
text: We stayed at this property for a week.   Excellent location, clean, comfortable & quiet rooms, lovely rooftop lounge/bar, good restaurant,  and great customer service.   Highly recommend this property.

title: Will stay again!
text:
Where do I start? 
The doormen were welcoming. The front desk staff were courteous, kind and helpful. Three rooms are well-appointed and provide respite from a bustling exterior. Great shower pressure, comfy beds, wonderful linens. We ordered room service and it was fresh and promptly delivered. A housekeeping member stopped by to ask us if we needed anything, noticed my daughter was with me, and came back with a smaller robe so she could feel pampered and cozy. It was a lovely experience that exceeded my expectations.

title: Nice location, everything is nearby and the hotel staff were extremely friendly and the cleanliness is very good
text: One of the best hotels to stay in during a visit to Manhattan as the location is at the center of city where everything you need is at your disposal, the rooms were very luxurious and the cleanliness is top notch and lastly the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with everything thing we needed and we’re definitely coming back again

title: Great hotel, Great staff...even better location!!
text: Everyone on staff at this hotel was friendly, knowledgeable and treated us so well.  Location was perfect for all the sights, Broadway shows and subway. Room was plenty big and loved the black out shades!!  Beds were comfortable, but pillows could have used a little more support.  Loved the space in the bathroom especially since we were sharing with teens. The only downside was the lighting. we couldn't have the lights off in the bedroom and on in the sitting room...unless it wasn't functioning correctly.  I also wish the lighting was brighter.  It was a bit dim and hard to do makeup etc. But overall...great hotel and I would book it again!

title: Great overnight in NYC
text: The room was very nice and at a reasonable price.  We loved our mini suite with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch, perfect for 3 moms and their daughters.  The girls first time in NYC. They were very attentive to our needs, brining up more blankets, towels and water.  Have already recommended to friends.

title: Great location and staff
text: Excellent location. Great doormen and bellhops. Our clean lady was great as well. Rooftop bar was nice, but all 3 times we went there were minor issues where we weren't allowed to order a drink outside. We could order one inside, although one time they closed early.  The rooftop bar was one of the reasons we chose the restaurant, so after our third time with no luck, it was disappointing. Perhaps if we were to go early in the evening there would not be as much of an issue but we wanted a drink after a long day.  Otherwise the facilities were wonderful - great gym and buffet, and very clean!

title: 50th wedding anniversary trip
text:
Great service comfortable and stylish only yards from Broadway. Excellent.
Staff were all efficient and curtious, enjoyed our stay a lot. Rooftop bar is special . Couldn't fault it especially as it is so close to theatres and attractions.

title: Wonderful stay at the Knick!
text: My 16 year old daughter and I stayed at the Knick when visiting NYC. It is the best location. Our room was spacious with comfy beds and a large bathroom. The hotel is clean and the extra touches like the turn down service with chocolates make it special! Most importantly, the staff are friendly and attentive and went out of their way to make our trip enjoyable! The rooftop bar is epic. Highly recommend this hotel. We will return!

title: Top Notch Service
text:
Everything was TOP NOTCH. Rooms were so so clean. Staff were amazing. Special thanks to Front Desk Manager, Monica Thapa; special thanks also to Ji, who worked his socks off to bring our room & my children next to each other. Thanks to Tony, Paola, Jarred, Marcelo. Thanks to everyone.
They all want you to feel as if you were at home. Everything was amazing.

title: Best hotel there is for a NYC trip
text: Honestly super impressed this was in time square. I thought it would be louder or feel less safe but it was the opposite. I felt super safe, it was quiet, clean, roomie, the elevators were quick, I was able to early check in, the staff was nice. Not one complaint. Also everything we could ever want was in walking distance.

title: Great experience
text: Spacious room and bathroom. Location is awesome. Lots to do around and easy to get to. Rooftop is amazing with great food. Was able to do early check in. Loved the sustainable lighting controls. All in all a wonderful experience.

title: The Knickerbocker in NY
text:
The Knickerbocker is a great hotel. It was a great room. Beautiful decorated and clean. Staff were great. Location was also good. 

Only downfall is they claim they have parking. They do not. What they do is charge you $150 to bring it to a parking garage four blocks away. Or you can bring it yourself for $75!!

title: Highly recommend!
text: Needed a last minute hotel and this hotel had everything that we needed along with the perfect location. Rooms are gorgeous and clean, we loved the rooftop bar, and the employees are all so welcoming. Highly recommend!

title: מלון מדהים עם שירות מעולה בלב טיימס סקוור
text:
ברצוננו להמליץ בחום על המלון הנמצא בלב הטיים סקוור סמוך לרכבות תחתיות
חדרים מרווחיים נקיים שרות ברמה גבוהה
בנוסף ברצוני לציין את פאולה מנהלת הקבלה על הטיפול המקצועי המסור והאישי על המאמץ להעניק

 לנו אירוח מכל הלב חווינו  שבוע נפלא במלון בניו יורק

WE would like to warmly recommend the Knickerbocker Hotel located in the heart of Times Square, near the subways, spacious, clean rooms, high level service. In addition, I would like to mention Paola, the reception manager, for her professional, dedicated and personal care, for her effort to provide us with hospitality from the heart, and everything was done with a smile and with a lot of desire  Well, we had a wonderful week at your hotel in New York Port Benny and Ronit.

title: Fabulous hotel!
text:
5 Stars for a 5star experience!

The Knickerbocker is a fabulous hotel.  Beautiful clean rooms with comfy beds and a great walk-in shower, I can’t recommend this hotel enough. 
We had a tasty breakfast with a lovely selection of fresh food. Great coffee in Jake’s and the perfect nightcap in the rooftop bar.

title: Superior Service
text:
The Knickerbocker is a 5 star hotel with superior service.  Every person that works at the Knick is very professional yet creates a warm and welcoming environment. They go above and beyond to anticipate their guests' needs to make sure they have a positive experience.

Rooms are clean and well maintained.  Another plus is that it’s in the heart of Times Square and very close to various subway lines.

The Knick is a top notch hotel and I would highly recommend staying here.

title: Beautiful Hotel!
text: Beautiful, spacious hotel! Service was outstanding - would definitely stay here again! The only negative is we were unable to get on the rooftop due to private parties and closing at 11. It should stay open until at least midnight.

title: Great Experience
text: The Knickerbocker is a really beautiful hotel. My wife and I loved it. It’s not cheap, but if you are looking for a wonderful place for a special occasion, we would highly recommend this hotel. Just a very classy place, top to bottom. Great location.

title: Semana en NY
text:
Viaje con mi hija del 11 al 18 de junio (habitación 1212) Hotel con excelente ubicación, cerca de principales atracciones turísticas (museos , teatros , edificios famosos , shopping ,central park, ferry turístico ) . Habitación amplia, cómoda, con muy buena insonorización para buen descanso  , excelentes camas y almohadas . Buena  limpieza .Personal amable en general , sobre todos las señoritas camaristas y Marcelo de los bell boys , señor muy carismático , agradable y atento . Nuestro agradecimiento para todos. Solo tuvimos un pequeño detalle de angustia una noche que por accidente se les activó la alarma de incendio como a las 3 de la madrugada , pero bueno , no sería NY si no hay algo de stress!! 
Muy recomendable. Esperamos volver pronto !!

title: amazing
text: Perfect stay. This hotel is in the middle of the city, yet quiet and quaint. Bedrooms are spacious, bathroom with all amenities and pillows just amazing. Air conditioner was not noisy, which is a must for me. Will go back!

title: Ok hotel, terrible pillows
text: Could t use the down pillows. The replacement pillows are the worst. 3 nights of sleeping on a board basically. The lobby is basic, staff seem fine but very little interaction. Good location near Times Square.

title: Amazing Stay
text: From the moment you walk in you know that you are in a 5 star hotel. The smell of the lobby is incredible especially after walking in the sometimes smelly city of NY. Very friendly staff and very professional. The room itself was fabulous! Location is great.

title: Alarms and residence fee
text: 5 star should mean a peaceful nights sleep. However, at the Knickerbocker it could mean alarms waking you at 245am. It was a false alarm but confusing messages from the house night staff on the room loudspeakers made for a restless late night. Heavy glass doors add to the ambiance but aren't very useful in a small hotel room. The $45 residence fee/night gets you the option to pay for water at a reduced rate. Found myself second guessing why we didn't pick the Hilton next door. Oh, and there are no less than 5 taxes and fees charged per day per room.

title: Great staff
text: The rooms are good size for NY and very clean. The staff are very friendly. Great location. Highly recommend. Definitely will go back. The roof top is great. food is good. DJ is great can play anything you wish.

title: Chill comfortable vibes in mid-town
text: Very attentive and well trained staff, rooms were clean and comfortable, understated decor, vibe of a boutique hotel, but a historic property located in mid-town.  Would definitely stay there again if attending a Broadway show.

title: Birthday trip for grandma
text: Friendly and helpful staff!  We came for grandma’s 90th birthday- it was on her bucket list to see a Broadway show.  The Knickerbocker gave us a great location to experience the theater district.  Wonderful!

title: Great place
text: Clean and very comfortable!!! Right on the Times Square and 2 minutes for Broadway!!! Great service room!!! Whhen back to NY will definitely considere to stay here again. Staff friendly and courteous.

title: Quality hotel in Times Square
text: Great location in Times Square, really large rooms (unbelievable for NYC).  Nice breakfast buffet, and overall good hotel.  It was our second stay here, and would definitely stay again.  Concierge has some good restaurant recommendations too.

title: A recommended hotel in New York
text: After several years of not visiting New York, I arrived about two weeks ago and chose a hotel that turned out to be excellent. My family and I had a great stay at the hotel! excellent service! Excellent location! In short, highly recommended!

title: Great hotel with great location
text: Was a little worried when we booked this due to location and noise. Being so close to time square I was worried it would be loud at all times. When you walk in the hotel it is very well isolated from the sounds outside. You often forget you are in New York let alone feet from time square. Our room on the 10th floor was extremely quiet. The service was always waiting to assist with any requests. The hotel was always clean and the room service some of the best I have experienced. We only went to the rooftop bar for drinks so cant really comment on the food anywhere in the hotel. The rooftop bar was nice with great views of the square. Prices were a little higher but as expected for the area. Overall a great stay and highly recommend.

title: Knickerbocker Glory
text:
The location is perfect, right on Times Square, and all the Broadway theatre's only a short walk away. Times square has an accessible Metro 140ft away, that also has a direct shuttle service to Grand Central station, and the hop-on hop-off sightseeing bus stop right outside the hotel door. This makes getting around New York and seeing the sights a breeze, with most of NYC many attractions near a metro or bus stop. If your staying for a while get a Metrocard or Omny pass to keep costs down, these are valid on both the subway and local buses. 
The Hotel itself was exceptional. An iconic building in its own right, frequented by many celebrity guests over the years, its Victorian façade, hides a state of the art interior. If you have time, look for the old hidden door to the knickerbocker hotel still visible in the Times Square metro station, or visit the ultra-modern St Cloud's Lounge on the rooftop and enjoy a drink or snack. 
Our room was very spacious, scrupulously clean, extremely comfortable and surprisingly very quite. We had views over times square, access to the gym, and the rooftop bar. The air-con was great for the hot weather, as we returned to a nice cool room. The walk in shower was perfect, and multichannel TV. kept us up-to-date with world affairs and the weather.  A coffee pod machine can be requested. If you miss your morning cuppa just ask for a kettle. Room came with a built in fridge, plenty of storage space and a safe.  
However, More important to us than the location (which was perfect) and the exceptional hotel, was the attitude of staff. We have never been treated with such respect, and hospitality. The staff went above and beyond being courteous and friendly without being in-your-face or obvious. A big shout out to the housekeeping department who kept our room spotless and topped us up with bottled water, and the concierge and reception staff who assisted with a return car to the airport. We highly recommend this hotel on so many levels, and would love to return here. Thank-you for your part in making wonderful anniversary memories we will never forget.

title: Great stay in the heart of Times Square
text: Was impressed at how quiet it was given proximity to Times Square. Staff were very friendly and helpful when we asked for anything. We enjoyed a light supper one night on the rooftop. Beds were comfortable. We would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect in every way with EXCEPTIONAL service
text: Besides the fact that the location is great, the rooms are lovely and the bar and breakfast were wonderful; what stands out most is the service. The people at this hotel are friendly and accommodating. They make you feel at home and do all they can to make your stay special. We would highly recommend and will definitely be back the next time we are visiting NYC.

title: Can't wait to come back!!!
text: Absolutely a great place to stay! We will definitely be back! Thank you to ALL of the staff you ALL were Absolutely Amazing, but especially our guy Jimmy!!! Thank you for an absolutely amazing NEW YORK EXPERIENCE!!!

title: Fantastic hotel!
text: Beautiful room… wonderful service!  Location is very central. Bed was very comfortable and amenities were above average. Very fine finishes throughout. Rooftop bar was a great relaxing space to have drinks in an area that’s very high energy.

title: Tolles Hotel in absoluter perfekter Lage
text: Das Hotel bietet für New York ein tolles Preis/ Leistungsverhältnis. Wir haben uns von Beginn an sehr wohl gefühlt! Die Eck Junior Suite war für uns perfekt. Der Zimmerservice herausragend und die Kommunikation mit der Rezeption perfekt. Ich hatte meinen Adapter vergessen und bekam innerhalb 10min einen vom Hotel gestellt. Das Essen im Hotel ist ausgezeichnet und die Rooftop Bar einen Besuch wert. Alles ist sehr sauber und die Betten sehr bequem. Es war unser Wunsch sehr zentral zu sein und mit diesem Hotel war es perfekt. Wir freuen uns sehr mal wieder dort Gast sein zu können.

title: Good hotel, can be improved
text:
Overall good hotel with great location. 

Biggest issues was inability to contact the front desk. Typically when calling the front desk for assistance would get no answer and instructions to call back later. Over 2/3 of the time no answer. 

A small annoyance was changing the breakfast we prepaid for hours in the morning without notice. Other areas for improvement would be adding advanced technology seen in other luxury properties such as chromecast for streaming, easy connection to wifi, or mobile key for entrance into the room.

title: Not worth the money, not 5 star
text:
The hotel is located on Times Square, a busy district, quite central.
Our welcome was very unpersonal, we booked through LHW and were granted a guaranteed roomupgrade. But we were told that we had already booked the highest category. Which was not true. They had a junior suite available, which was the next room category. Then they said they were fully booked. Which was not true. So which too much discussion we got that room.
The full amount was deducted from our card before we even saw the room. It was no guarantee prepayment.
Staff at front desk is very inattentive, no welcome, no smile, no luxury feeling. After 20 minutes we asked for water. We got a glass bottle, no glasses.
The room, junior suite, was small, dark. Good bed and bathroom. Fridge was empty.
For breakfast you need to give the host a voucher, wtf?! For American style this was a good breakfast, we think it was very mediocre. In the evening, the bar and restaurant are just a joke.
After talking to a manager we got a bigger room the third night, to compensate.
We paid quite a lot and this hotel is not worth that. Staff is very inexperienced, rude even, they make lots of mistakes, don’t understand ‘other’ cultures, react automatic, etc . So we will not come back.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Very convenient location, fantastic service and comfortable rooms. We arrived earlier than check-in time and room was ready for us. And we were allowed to stay until 2pm at the departure day. Very kind! Will stay here again.

title: Very good hotel for a good price for NY
text: A very good hotel for NY, taking into consideration the size of the room and the bathroom (very good bed as well). Our room was on the 15th floor and was quiet. Efua was super helpful, very nice person who helped us 2/3 times at the beginning of our journey. We missed her afterwards.. so a great thank you for her support and kindness !! If i have to say something : the point of improvement would be the breakfast, and in particular the buffet, which for me is not at the level of a 5 star hotel in terms of quality and diversity. But all in all, would recommend the hotel if you need to be in the TimeSquare zone, as very well located and rooms of very good quality. Would surely come back for next trip.

title: Fun at the Knickerbocker
text: We were booked into the Knickerbocker by way of Cunard.  We were welcomed so warmly and they bent over backwards to make our 2 night stay the best it could be, Starting with a great welcome from the front desk to the professionalism of the porters and bellmen everything just fell into place. Diana, the concierge was an absolute delight and so very helpful in assisting to navigate in NYC. Other individuals that joined us on the Queen Mary 2 who stayed at the Knickerbocker felt the same way. The rooftop lounge was a good experience.

title: Fantastic
text: Great room and great bed/ sleeping/ bedding x .. concierge was amazing. Had a great meal at  a great restaurant before a show .. gatsbys x .. roof top bar was lovely overlooking paramount clock and times sq x

title: Family trip New York
text: Wonderful hotel, very good service, big rooms even for familys, a perfect hotel and central located in mid town of NY. The rooftop bar is perfect to enjoy the evening after the long sightseeing trips and the breakfast is very good and I would recommend the hotel to my family and my friends

title: Modern, luxury
text: Beautiful, modern hotel with lots of amenities. Perfectly located and wonderfully attentive staff. Room was an extremely generous size (no view, but we appreciated being off the bustling street) with the most gorgeous smelling toiletries! Turn down service each evening and great rooftop bar! Without hesitation, I would recommend this hotel to couples travelling to New York.

title: Great Service, Great Stay
text: This is a real nice property and right in the heart of things. Steps from Time Square with a side entrance if looking for slightly less bustle. Nice rooftop bar. From beginning to end, real pleasant service. Wish we could have stayed longer.

title: Perfect NYC hotel
text: This hotel was the best hotel I’ve stayed at in Manhattan! The location was perfect, right on Times Square, the concierge and overall customer service were phenomenal, and the food at the restaurant was delicious. I may never stay anywhere else!

title: Knickerbocker May 2023
text: Wir haben das Hotel wegen der tollen Lage ausgewählt. Man kann sehr viel zu Fuß entdecken. Das Frühstück ist sehr gut aber auch überteuert. Stephanie und Diana gaben tolle Tipps zu Restaurants und Sehenswürdigkeiten abseits der „normalen“ Wege. Die High Line ist ein Muss.

title: Excellent Time
text:
Very Clean and Comfortable.  Staff was very helpful.  I am booking my next stay with family.  Top Notch accommodations and facility.  Food was excellent but a bit pricey... Very conveniently located.

thanks- Joe

title: Knickerbocker NYC
text: We love the Knickerbocker; it is probably our favorite hotel in NYC. It has a great location in Time Square and is a quick walk to all our favorite activities, broadway, shopping on 5th Ave., and great restaurants. The staff is wonderful, and the hotel overall is very nice. The rooms are also very spacious for NYC standards.

title: Comfort, location and beauty
text: I have stayed in NYC before so expected a small , average room. This exceeded my expectations. The room was beautiful and comfortable. The staff were all exceptional. The location could not have been better, right in the middle of everything. Would definitely stay there on my next trip.

title: Really great choice!
text: Stayed for 4 nights over Memorial Day weekend for our first trip to NYC. It was very pricey but worth it overall. It has a great location right in Times Square and so close to the theaters. The rooms were very nice. We had a couple issues with the sliding door to the bathroom and tv reception but they were quickly addressed and fixed. The roof top bar is very cool - you can see the ball that drops on NYE. We were on the 12th floor and only heard sirens once in awhile - overall very quiet. We received cookies and milk the first night. We stayed with our 19 and 20 year olds. Chose this hotel also because they have queen size beds. We had a strange boxed support in the room that we had to keep walking around but the room felt spacious.

title: Commendable service
text: Beautiful hotel, excellent location. Most staff provide superior service. Room was spacious and well appointed. Check out restaurant recommendations ahead of time and read reviews. Know that transportation services add a gratuity to the price otherwise you may likely double tip.

title: New York in May 2023
text:
We received excellent hospitality from the Knickerbocker Hotel from our arrival to departure a week later.
The staff were always helpful, rooms were modern and luxurious, housekeeping was spotless.
Hector and Pedro who were part of the lobby team went out of their way to chat and deliver 100% service, Stephanie the concierge helped us with transport advice and local recommendations A+.
We expected the hotel to be good but you never know, as a lot of reviews can be misleading….our expectations were met and exceeded….we will definitely recommend the hotel to our friends and it would be our first choice on any return trip.
Paul.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: This hotel is incredible.  The location is incredibly convenient for leisure and business activity.  Even though it is really in the middle of times square,  the guest rooms are incredibly quiet.   You actually hear nothing from the outside.  That might be - because the rooms are so luxurious that you are too busy enjoying everything the room has to offer.  Even the smallest rooms are spacious.  And to top it all off - the staff is well trained and very nice and helpful.  Excellent price value and luxurious.

title: Terrible nighttime sleeping experience
text: I am writing this review in the middle of the night (actually early morning - it is 2:37am). I had room number 1502 where the air conditioning is not working. I called the hotel staff at 1:30, they sent a technician who tried to convince me that the temperature in the room was 65. Just to be clear, the fan wasn’t working and the temperature felt like 80 in the room. Nevertheless, the tech, Will, refused to accept that a guest in the hotel would have no desire to wake up in the middle of the night and complain unless it was actually hot. The manager then called and said he could accommodate me in a different room on the third floor. I  am here now and the temperature is fine but the shades are not working. I can’t get the shades below halfway point. I am a business traveller and just trying to get a good nights sleep which s destroyed. Absolutely not the experience expected out of a super expensive property. By the way, the hotel manager also tried to convince me that the temperature in the original room was “cool” but likely the temperature in the new room is cooler because it’s a lower floor!!

title: Amazing family long weekend to NYC
text:
Two things made the knickerbocker stand out. 1. A room that comfortably slept 6 (a rarity). 2. The staff. Very helpful with issues that come up. They were also really personable. The hotel was small enough to get to recognize people throughout the weekend. I’m usually pretty tight with my tips - but I gave them out freely this trip as I felt they deserved it for going the extra mile.

We got a junior sweet with two queens and a pullout. The other nice thing was it faced an interior courtyard-maybe 10 feet across. At first I thought it was a downside because there was no view. But the plus was no street noise at all. We had fantastic sleeps in the middle of Times Square.

title: Family recommended
text:
Excellent hôtel
It is well situated. The breakfast was excellent. We were on the 7th floor and could not hear the noise from outside. It is easy with our 2 kids 6-10 years old.  I would go back. It is confortable.

title: A Wonderful Hotel in Times Square
text: what a pleasant surprise!  I have stayed at a number of different hotels in New York, but the Knickerbocker is now my favorite.  This is an old hotel in Times Square that has been wonderfully renovated.  It has the feel of a small hotel with no lines to check in or out and an extremely courteous staff.  Our room was on the eighth floor, but extremely quiet.  We couldn't hear any street noise or noise from another room.  The room was modern and very well designed.   No room bar, which I never use, a nice closet, plenty of drawer space, a comfortable desk, and a nice and comfortable bed with four large pillows, two firm and two soft.  Convenient power outlets and adequate connections for my devices.  The bathroom only had a single sink, but it was cleverly laid out with a nice shower and a separate toilet area.  Daily maid service was provided automatically unlike the trend in many other hotels.  If you don't go the theatre in New York you probably should not stay in the Times Square area, but if, like us, you do, the combination of a good location for Broadway theatre and a very pleasant hotel makes this a great pick.  We will be returning.

title: Excellent service, and very beautiful hotel.
text: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here, and it was perfect. Spacious, beautiful room. Windows are sound proof. I can’t say enough about this hotel. They thought of everything. Great cocktails!

title: Perfect stay in NY
text:
Very nice hotel
Good location to visit New York
Even being on Times Square, the noice is reduced, so no problem sleeping.
Nice and clean rooms
Friendly staff 
Fast check in
Nice rooftop bar
Breakfast is fantastic and very helpful staff
Food is very good

title: Bad hotel for business traveler
text: Slow elevator, late breakfast, rude front desk, no  business center (must email documents for someone to print). I had shipped boxes to my hotel for work and I had to beg to actually get them to my room. And no one cared.

title: Only good thing about this hotel is the location!
text:
As the title says I can’t think of any other positives other than the location! 

Service was pretty much non-existent, as goes for the concierge service (one lady was lovely apart from that I got blank stares from everyone else when asking for directions or recommendations).

The room was a decent size for NYC, how there was so many things that were damaged (walls, bed frame, blinds, you name it).

Will definitely not be staying here given the price we paid, no value for money, would have been better staying in a budget hotel!

title: Visita turistica in coppia
text: Ho soggiornato una settimana in quest’hotel. Il personale è molto disponibile e accogliente, l’ambiente è pulito e la posizione della struttura centrale per poter visitare la città. Consiglio questa soluzione come punto di appoggio per poter visitare New York senza problemi logistici.

title: Good location, poor customer service
text: The room was clean and the location is good (in Times Sq). The service is not flexible and we had trouble checking in despite sending a note about an extra guest arriving earlier. In the end my business partner was to pay for both rooms, but we discovered afterwards that they had billed and charged two cards separately anyway, despite assuring us at the time. It's an ok hotel but there are other options!

title: Great location & great sized rooms.
text:
Great location. Convenient. Great sized rooms. 

I stayed here on business for 9 nights and the in-room dining was great. The food was good, and it was delivered in a timely manner. The gym & fitness studio is also good for a hotel. 

It is convenient to many sights and it is quite central for Manhattan.

The only cons really, is the lifts are quite slow (but I have found this to be normal in most hotels in Manhattan) and I could not cast my phone to the TV (less of an issue if you are in NY on holiday and out and about all the time.

title: Review
text: I am rating 3/5 stars due to poor service. Having to call the front desk several times to bring water which they may or may not do. They also have quite a few doormen who just stand around and stare at you instead of opening the doors which is not convenient at all when toting a baby and a stroller throughout. The room was okay. The price of our stay was not worth the service that we received. There are plenty of other hotels in NYC that can accommodate for better service, views and rooms.

title: BAD rooftop Manager
text: Rooftop Bar. No service. Rude manager. Never told closing time 11:00 p.m. we were given free drink Coupons. Never used. Asked for Seltzer at 11:10 pm to take to room. manager of rooftop bar asked why I was being difficult.  No area for guests. Music too loud. Could not take a phone call from hospital where I could hear. Even in the bathroom. Husband was in hospital…why we stayed at hotel.

title: An Exceptional Hotel Stay
text: A wonderful hotel close to Times Square's theaters.  The bed was extremely comfortable, the room large and exceptionally clean and with the exception of the extremely loud boom boxes playing on the streets over the weekend, very quiet.  The rain shower felt lovely and the lotion and shampoo offerred divine.  Staff were wonderfully friendly and eager to accomodate my requests.  The restaurants within the hotel were exceptional, just like the hotel itself.  I would not hesitate for a second to return and plan to do so!

title: The Knickerbocker Hotel NYC
text: This hotel is amazing, central location on 42nd Street and Broadway, so easy walking distance to all the sights or subway if you prefer. Hotel standards are high very clean throughout and all the staff were friendly and exceptionally friendly.  The concierge team, especially Dianna, were so very helpful. Giving you tips and advice to make your stay perfect. The roof top bar is so worth the visit too, again great staff there too! Highly recommend this hotel for everything it has to offer. We didn't eat in the restaurant but did have a snack at the rooftop which was lovely. If I had to be picky I would say that the room doors should soft close as when people were coming and going from their rooms at night or early morning it did wake you are the doors banged shut.

title: Great Location... not great hotel
text: Hotel is in a really central location on time square, its a beautiful building and the rooms are nice if a bit dark. The main issue is that apart from the concierge service (particularly Hector) which is amazing everywhere else is really poor, its like you're doing everyone a favour staying there. This was my uncles 70th birthday present trip we did a tour of the US and stayed at 5 hotels from LA to NYC and this was the worst of the lot. On arrival it was 930 pm  at night and the reception staff clearly were not bothered, no welcome to the hotel no smiles or explanations about the services. I asked if we could get dinner anywhere and they said the restaurant was closed but the bar on the top floor was open until 11pm... we get up there and this bar is on the rooftop and its party central which was fine, but the waitress was about as interested in us as a cockroach crawling on the floor, we clearly were not 'on trend' its like a devils wear Prada interview, we said we wanted food (it was 10pm but needed to wait for my uncle) couldn't get coffee or tea just cold drinks, we ordered food at 10.15pm, waitress came back 10 min later to say kitchen closed .....Gave up went out.  Next morning we spoke to reception as we had asked for a kettle and hadn't had any water in our room, which you are supposed to have daily.  We repeated this exercise three days in a row, got water two days and the kettle never turned up  despite assurances they would ( there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms).  One of our rooms was a disabled access, which meant room bars everywhere and no sofa... we asked for it to be changed but again got nowhere.  Sounds like moaning maybe but its an expensive hotel and supposed to be 4/5 star. forget it.  its really the service it just sours it. Dont bother, pay less for a Hilton and get what you pay for.

title: Best rooftop
text: Jhoir best of the best!!! We love this place, food it so delicious, amazing views, I wanna back here again! Music great, dj very very nice.  Time square so close, this rooftop best place for dinner with friends

title: Great trip and helpful staff!
