text: Had a great experience at the Knickerbocker for a work trip. Great staff all around and enjoyed both the restaurants. I have to mention that Jimmy on the bellhop/lobby team is a true gem- so helpful and kind. Made my trip back to the airport so easy. Definitely ask for him if you need anything.

title: Business Trip
text:
Good environment, the area is pleasant for having outside activity: nearby Times Square and the metro.
The American breakfast is a little expensive and could be included into the bedroom price for a better cost for value.

title: Super emplacement
text:
Hôtel au style moderne et épuré avec un super emplacement, à deux pas du métro et de toutes commodités , les chambres sont spacieuses , belles et très propre ! Service de chambre impeccable avec deux passages par jour ! Salle de bain fonctionnelle et assez grande 
Seul bémol pour le petit déjeuner qui n’est pas digne d’un 5 étoiles ! Peu de variété dans le buffet…

title: Great location
text: Not the best service wouldn't recommend dining in hotel location was brilliant but everything else average or below no water on first day the phone didn't work for our entire visit concierge were great but staff were shocking to say the least

title: Smart luxury hotel in busy Midtown
text:
The knickerbocker is one of the oldest hotels in New York and Midtown/ Times Square has massively grown around it! Make no mistake this hotel is in the absolute thick of tourist New York as its right on Times Square and that's why we chose it for our first time. Everything was close by and almost every Subway ran under it. That being said the hotel does offer a relative calm in the madness of 42nd St. We had a corner Junior suite with views down Time Square, W42nd Street and Broadway. We felt in the heart of the city which we were, but if you're looking for a sedate environment try other parts of New York. The room was large and well equipped, designed in a modern style. Lovely bathroom and great shower. Staff were lovely, especially the concierge staff who were a great help to us. We had drinks in the St. Cloud bar on the roof. Albeit it was pouring down, the interior bar was still lovely and the staff were friendly/efficient. 

Overall a great choice if you want a smart luxury hotel in the absolute thick of the crazy, noisy city that is New York.

title: Hôtel parfait pour séjour en famille
text:
Hôtel très bien en tout point.
L’emplacement est idéal, parfait pour rayonner autour. En plein times square et à quelques minutes à pied de l’ESB, de Bryant park, du rockfeller center mais également de Grand Central Station et du Chrysler building. Donc toujours quelque chose à faire et à voir à deux pas, ce qui est toujours agréable notamment après une journée chargée.
L’hôtel est moderne, les chambres bien plus spacieuses que la chambre type new-yorkaise, une salle d’eau parfaite avec vaste douche et WC séparés, avec dressing dans l’entrée. Bouteilles d’eau déposées tous les soirs, ca semble rien mais c’est toujours apprécié.  
Nous étions dans la chambre 1611, sans vue sur la 42nd street mais un silence total. Literie au top. Vraiment la chambre parfaite pour NYC et surtout un super rapport qualité prix.
Le bar avec la terrasse en rooftop sont clairement agréables, avec une carte très sympa, pour boire comme grignoter. 
L’accueil a été chaleureux, avec des conseils avisés. Merci à toute l’équipe. 
La carte du restaurant pourrait être améliorée. Bien que le diner restait correct, je conseille à l’hôtel de travailler sur ce point. 
Je recommande vivement cet hôtel. Je n’hésiterai pas à y retourner
JB

title: Good location, solid rooms and nice staff!
text: We picked the Knockerbocker for a one night stay for a wedding, and the location was excellent for us. Also seemed to be a great location for Broadway, Times Square and many other highlights of NYC. It’s a bustling area, but calm inside. The room was quiet and a very good size for a city hotel IMO. Solid breakfast options. Sadly, didn’t get to visit the rooftop, though we heard rave reviews! I would stay there again and recommend to others visiting.

title: The most amazing stay
text: The Knickerbocker Hotel with Johor And  Yose was super service minded and we love staying here. The hotel was close to everything around time square with a wonderful rooftop. It was a beautiful view.

title: Good hotel but needs a refresh
text:
Good location if you want to be near Times Square. 
For the price there are better options in the area. 
Hotel a little tired and needs refresh. Typical small NYC small rooms.
Doormen we’re great very pleasant and attentive.

title: Perfect location!
text: Could not be better situated in New York for a city break to take in the sights & be in the middle of it all. Easy walking distance to pretty much everything. Rooms functional. You are paying for location. Concierge helpful but lacks a bit of the personal service I’d expect from a 5star.

title: Rooftop
text: Johir was the nicest waiter we‘ve ever met! Top location & quite good drinks!! Highly recommend it. What should we say it was perfect in any way! We will definitely come back in any ways - thanks for the expirence

title: Johir is amazing at the Knickerbocker St Cloud
text: Johir is the best!  Awesome service.  We were treated amazing with warm blankets and friendly service. Highly recommend coming to the Knickerbocker and ask for Johir!   The St Cloud is a destination you must try in NYC

title: Parfait !!
text: Séjour formidable au Knick, chambre superbe, spacieuse, calme, salle de bain très pratique et très belle, emplacement de l’hôtel au top et surtout personnel adorable, une mention particulière à Paola qui a fait de notre séjour une réussite…!! On reviendra…

title: Great city hotel
text:
Be prepared for the daily charges another tax is added to the city tax !!!
No tea or coffee facilities in the room. Coffee shop is only open until 2pm
Crazy. The roof top bar is extremely expensive 
However the hotel is lovely and the staff are exceptionally friendly

title: GREAT STAY AT THE KNICKERBOCKER HOTEL!!!
text:
GREAT HOTELAND EXCELLENT LOCATION ON SOUTHERN TIP OF TIMES SQUARE. THE STAFF IS VERY ACCOMODATING AND ROOMS ARE VERY COMFORTABLE. IT APPEARS AS IF THE HOTEL HAS BEEN REDONE NOT LONG AGO SINCE EVERYTHING IS IN GREAT CONDITION AND SEEMS FAIRLY NEW.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

title: SHORT STAY - BREAK
text: Johir - great star at The Knickerbocker hotel with my Mum for my late 30th Birthday! The food is good, great friendly staff and a lovely rooftop if you want a good drink and nice laugh with those you are closest to.

title: Amazing stay in the heart of nyc
text: The hotel was in an excellent location. The reception staff were super friendly and helpful. Our rooms were spotless and very comfortable. The cocktail lounge was great. Food in the bar was tasty. Thank you for a lovely stay.

title: 40th wedding anniversary
text: If you want the total experience of New York, no need to look further.  Waking distance to the theater district,  Rockefeller Center,  and  many other popular points of interest.    The roof top bar is wonderful way to enjoy the evenings and look out over times square as many in the past have done before.

title: Outstanding stay at the Knickerbocker
text: Outstanding!!  We stayed at the Knick a couple of times before and look forward to staying there again.  The check-in was particularly helpful.  We had a family member arriving the next day to celebrate a birthday.  They put us both in lovely rooms.  Our family member even had a birthday treat in his room.  Our rooms were spacious with one of the nicest baths we have ever had.  The staff, especially the cleaning staff, were great.  Our breakfast buffet was lovely.  We especially liked the fact that breakfast was served until 11.  We are familiar with New York.  The location is very central with the subway just at the corner, although we walked to just about everything we did.  (21,000 steps a day!)  If you love the theater, as we do, you can not ask for a more convenient spot.  Don't miss the Museum of Broadway, just a couple of blocks away.  The hotel is a bit pricey but you get what you pay for.  I highly recommend a visit to the Knickerbocker.

title: Book it!
text: Had an amazing stay at the Knickerbocker. Biggest selling point to me was the proximity to some of the best sights in NYC. I thought being so close to Times Square might mean a lot of outside noise but honestly you couldn’t hear a thing outside. Very quiet and clean. Great bar and restaurant. Would definitely recommend.

title: Frond desk is letting the hotel down
text:
Do not stay on the 3d floor. Blasting music from JD sport below until 22:30 wouldn’t  let  you sleep. The problem was reported immediately  but not resolved. We were late moved the next day and given breakfast vouchers. Breakfast was excellent. Front desk  has no system of hand over, couldn’t locate one of our packages, repeatedly asking for the same information. Turn down service  was not consistent. Beds are very comfortable.

Paola at the front desk was very competent, professional and charming. Thank you, Paola, for sorting out some of our problems.

title: Morgan is the best!
text: Morgan is amazing! She is so friendly and made me feel welcomed. The service was excellent and the drinks were amazing! I highly recommend this place before or after a show! The lemon drop martini is to die for.

title: The most amazing stay!
text: Every single thing was so perfect and such a high standard! The staff are all exceptional and so friendly! Couldnt fault one thing about our stay! Cannot recommend this hotel enough! Thankyou to all of the wonderful staff.

title: Perfect
text:
The Knick is completely renovated, sleek and modern. We were expecting more of a vintage style hotel (I guess we didn't check out the photos) and it is anything but. Our room was surprisingly large. We loved the bathroom with double sinks, and separate toilet and shower space. 

The location is great- right on Times Square but, more importantly, right next to the subway.

The roof top bar is lovely with a great little bar menu. The buffet breakfast was exceptional. 

We loved everything about this hotel. and would stay here again in a NY minute.

title: Great base to visit New York
text: We stayed for 4 nights. We’ve been to New York 4 times previously and this was by far the best hotel. Andre on the door was so helpful with information and sorting us transport. We asked for a coffee machine in our room and they bought us one with coffee and cups within the hour. They could not be more helpful. It’s fab being near Times Square as we were central to explore both ends of Manhattan. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Stay
text: Check in was useless /lifts waiting time was long/key did not work till I had to change it/mini bar was empty ..to me it was nowhere close to a 5 star hotel more like a better 3 star.Lobby could not find one ..Conceirge not bothered

title: NYC city break
text:
Absolutely loved staying at The Knickerbocker Hotel for our 30th wedding anniversary. 
Cannot fault the hotel. Concierge, porters and reception staff all faultless. Loved cocktails on the rooftop bar at the end of a busy day! Location very central. Less than a minute from the subway!

title: Great! Except for Shower Issue
text:
My husband and I had a fantastic time at the Knickerbocker. Every interaction I had with the staff was excellent, everyone was extremely friendly!

Our one problem was that there was a plumbing issue with our shower. The water wasn’t draining properly and you could only take a short shower - otherwise the water would get too high in the shower pan and start spilling out into the floor. We notified the front desk after the first time this happened and they said they would check on it. However, it didn’t seem to be resolved and was an issue for the duration of our stay.

Other than this, everything about our stay was wonderful.

title: Customer service at its best.
text: Johir & forhad represented high class customer service.   We were having a beautiful night at the Rooftop Bar (St. Cloud @ The Knick) and were very attentive. Knowing guests needs and wants before even asking is a skill these two possess.  This Hotel has a 5-star rating for a reason and now I see it.  From check in, entering/exiting the facility, if your hands are full the entire staff recognizes and will open the doors/elevators for you.  Again, knowing the guests needs and wants us a skill and we are so pleased to be a guest here at The Knickerbocker.

title: Funtastic Stay in NYC!
text: My family stayed at The Knickerbocker for the week during our stay in New York. The Service was great and the hotel was nice. It's dark and muted with a modern touch. Our flight landed early morning so during my booking, I requested an early check-in for a fee. Lucky for us, they had our room available so we were able to check right in. Our room had a pullout couch. Instead of paying the $ 75-a-night service fee, we opened the couch ourselves and asked for extra linen and pillows. Housekeeping still made the pullout couch bed for us every day and no fee was charged. Nightly turndown was nice and always left us with fresh water. Seriously from the Bellmen to Housekeeping, we felt the entire staff was friendly and kind. The Concierge team was great and gave us great tips on subways, restaurants, and the happenings of Time Square.  One of the Bellmen booked us a car service back to the airport - we did this the day before our departure and seriously kudos because the car was ready for us at 3:30 on the dot as he said it would. The location is BUSY. A little too busy BUT the staff and service made the experience so fun, especially for our 11-year-old son.

title: Great location for those planning to see Broadway shows -  and lovely amenities
text: We had a lovely time. My daughter visited during my stay and we were upgraded to the Martini suite on the 15th floor- fab views and lots of light. The food on the 4th floor was delicious and both Fri and Sat nights the jazz band was an added bonus. We went to the rooftop bar which was nice, but preferred the vibe of the Puck restaurant on the 4th floor. Very clean. Staff was really attentive as well.

title: Staying at Knick
text: Knickerbocker is a great hotel but often very expensive.  I would suggest checking dates to find deals but definitely very nice and always impressed by check in staff and accommodations.  Great location.

title: Hög service och utmärkt läge
text:
Ett utmärkt läge i New York men allra viktigast var personalen. I receptionen fick vi fantastisk hjälp och stort engagemang från Paola. Hon var faktiskt anledningen till att vi återvände hit igen.
Och då fick vi ett, om möjligt, ännu bättre mottagande med tidig incheckning och sen utcheckning.
Även frukostvördinnan Ganja servade oss väl.
Tack Paola och Ganja, nu vet vi vilket hotell man ska välja i New York.

title: Disappointed
text:
Arrived earlier than expected. The hotel had an available room but demanded a 150 usd fee to allow the entry before 3 pm. 
This is ridiculous. I paid because my day is worth for me more but it is a dissatisfying hospitality

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Great hotel with much more room space than your average New York Hotel , Huge bathroom and a great shower . Helpful friendly staff and a warm welcoming atmosphere. Love the little extras like good quality slippers and dressing gowns . Excellent location right in the heart of it all .

title: 立地抜群＆コスパ良いです。
text:
ホテルの立地とお値段等のバランスが良いと思います。リーダーズクラブメンバーは朝食無料(アメリカンブレックファーストビュッフェ　45ドル)お得な宿泊プランもあるのでメンバー登録をオススメします。(以前は有料でしたが2023年4月現在は無料で登録できます。)
バスタブ希望でしたがベッド2台のお部屋には残念ながら無いそうです。(デラックスルーム)お部屋には中が空の冷蔵庫あり、コーヒーメーカーと湯沸かしポットはお願いすれば持って来て下さいます。(当然ですが要チップ)
日本語は全く通じませんがスタッフの皆さんは感じの良い方ばかりです。
次回のニューヨークもこちらに泊まりたいです。

title: BEWARE OF THE SERVICE CHARGE!
text:
I stayed mid March with a friend for a girls trip to NYC. I have lots of good things to say about this hotel BUT the fact that when we checked out were stuck with an ADDITIONAL SERVICE CHARGE added to our room per night made the entire experience of the hotel less shiny and a bit disappointing. The Service charge was $45 + tax per night! We asked if it was charged at all hotels and a NYC law, but they said it is something that they have just starting charging - so apparently hotels can just stick you with a "service charge" on your stay. And it is TAXED! We made our reservation through LastMinute.Com and it included services and taxes. And isn't part of staying in a 5 star hotel getting great service? If we had known we were actually paying for the great service and slow WiFi we received we wouldn't have given all the staff such good tips!

So THE HOTEL - is nice. All staff were very friendly and the maids for morning service and turn down service we amazing. The entire housekeeping team were great. The rooftop bar is great! Good vibe, good music and friendly staff. Breakfast was good - not amazing and seemed reasonable but after coffees and a side of bacon it came to over $100 - so only did that once -there are great diners around the corner that are amazing including the diner from Seinfeld (Westway Diner - fantastic!)

Location is great if you want to feel the gritty part of NYC and be close to things by the river. Times Square is on the doorstep and you can see the famous NYE's ball from the roof top terrace. Also easy for Subway that goes uptown and lots of Ubers around. It is a very lively area and a postcard of Midtown NYC and Broadway. Lots of things close by or very easy to get to. Plus a Whole Foods on the corner!

The ROOMS are very spacious (we had 2 doubles) but there was not a stocked minibar and no tea or coffee maker - we asked for one at the front desk on check in because we read from other reviews this was a problem (thank you). The decor is nice but a bit dated and isn't as luxurious as they make out on the website. I was excited that they had Diptyque products in the rooms (I judge the quality of the hotel by their products) and I have to say I was disappointed. The whole hotel, while nice, needs a bit of a little makeover and needs to be more generous to its guest. Aesop products (not nailed to the wall) and a little redecorating is needed. 

Overall it was a good stay and I would recommend it but just BEWARE OF THE SERVICE CHARGE.!!!!

title: Fantastic customer service and wonderful welcome!
text: What a spot! My daughter and I went on a girls getaway and were immediately greeted with a smile at the door upon our arrival. During check-in, the front desk hosts were friendly, professional and gave attention to both me and my 7 year old daughter. As we were escorted to the elevator the Hotel Manager, Scott Case, met us with a warm greeting to ensure we had a good check in experience and inquired about our stay in NYC. Cookies and milk were waiting in the room as well as a children's amenity. Later, we made our way to the rooftop, the Hotel Manager, Scott, checked in with us again and asked if there was anything else he could do for us. The hospitality was wonderful. Needless to say, my daughter and I cannot wait to go back. The atmosphere and kindness was beyond. Thank you Knickerbocker for a great stay!

title: Easter holiday with family
text:
Very nice hotel with rich history and heritage. Great location, well maintained, very good staff. Nice bathroom with best shower pressure I’ve experienced in New York! Agree with many previous reviews, I don’t understand the idea of having a glass sliding door you can’t lock!
I’d recommend getting a room higher up, we were in room 312 with a LOT of nice…
Overall, great hotel for family holiday!

title: The Knickerbocker
text:
This is now my 4th time staying at this hotel and gets better every time. I went this time with two teenagers. The room was spacious, very clean, and made up every day and the small amenities added to the overall experience. This is NYC of course but for sure everyone made us feel welcomed and all reasonable requests were taken care of ( room overlooking times square, free drinks coupons and get these, and late check-out.)  Text updates asking what they could do to help were a nice feature and I used this. For sure not the cheapest price/night but if you book well in advance as I did it does save on other costs and the other intangibles ( taxis/access to subways/less walking/safety/security ) . Overall excellent and 9/10 ...always room for improvements  
)

title: Amazing service
text: I came in on a Monday night walking around and I looked up rooftop bars in Times Square, what a treat! The view was amazing and the bartenders John and Ricardo were the best!! Very entertaining, knowledgeable and they made me their favorite drink, the Old King Cole. I loved the attention they put to detail. Highly recommend!

title: Exceptional Staff, Convenient Location
text: The staff were all incredible at their jobs and made us feel at home and welcomed. We miss Jimmy!! He made our stay extra magical for us and our kids by going above and beyond. We hope to see him on our next visit. The serving staff at the rooftop bar and the 4th floor restaurant were also very warm and helpful. The concierge also helped us by providing excellent directions for multiple outings. Great property, excellent location.

title: Excellent hotel. Brilliant location. Outstanding Customer Service
text:
Excellent hotel. Brilliant location. Outstanding Customer Service.

Biggest, most modern, and cleanest rooms / bathrooms we've EVER had in NYC over the many years we've been visiting.

Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Paola on reception is worthy of an extra special mention, thank you, Paola!

Decided to move here for 3 nights after being massively disappointed with and therefore cutting short our stay at the Hilton Doubletree NY Times Square South. For similar cost, the hotels could not be more different!

title: Brilliant location, very comfortable rooms and exceptional service
text: We have stayed in The Knickerbocker for 4 nights. It is as central as it gets. The rooms were very comfortable: great size, nice showers,  super beds and pretty soundproof. The roof terrace bar was perfect for the sundowners. More importantly though, the team looking after the guests were superb. We dealt mainly with Jimmy and Stephanie, who really did make us feel very welcomed, took their time to check what we might want to do whilst in NY and came up with great recommendations. It makes huge difference, thank you! Definitely will stay here again.

title: Osterurlaub
text:
Wir haben einen Familienurlaub in New York gemacht und ein passendes Hotel gesucht. 
Die Zimmer waren sehr geräumig und sauber. Geschmackvoll eingerichtet und mit sehr bequemen Betten ausgestattet. Wir hatten ein Zimmer ohne Aussicht, dafür war es sehr ruhig trotz lauter Location. Für Familien ideal.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: I have been to NY several times but this was my first time at the Knickerbocker. It was perfect. Amazing location. Large clean rooms. The gym was adequate. The breakfast buffet was a quick relaxing way to start the day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Couldn’t ask for any more.

title: Great location and a comfy bed
text: Traveled to NYC see a some shows. This hotel is in a great location near Broadway, MSG and Bryant Park. The bed was comfortable and the room was remarkably quiet. We were disappointed in the lobby (which is very small and basically nothing more than an elevator waiting area). Given the storied history of the hotel, we had expected more ambiance and beauty. It appears that the best parts of the main level have been leased out to retail stores and no longer are part of the hotel. The common areas overall were uninspiring, and the gym was very awkward to get to (it required passing through staff areas). But still a good location, and a good night’s sleep.

title: Amazing trip!
text: Lovely hotel, definitely would recommend. Had a superior room, which was so spacious with comfy beds & fluffy pillows. Door staff were super friendly. Hotel location was perfect for getting around on foot. Only downside missed having a tea/coffee tray in the room.

title: Five star service in five star hotel
text: Hotel exceeded my expectations for both service and quality. Upgraded to a beautiful suite, my family had a wonderful experience. Room was so quiet, location was excellent and the unexpected small touches made it even more special (backpack for kids, cookies/milk for kids, and concierge mailing my daughter’s postcard).

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: Through LHW membership, relatively good value for more than 300ft2 of very tastefully designed, contemporary room. Spacious, generous-feeling, well laid out and quiet despite the frenetic Times Square activity below. Staff helpful and friendly throughout. Don't be put off by the check-in area that feels a bit like a basement. This is a standout hotel in the otherwise mostly cynical NYC hotel scene, where overcharging and underdelivering is an evolved art form...

title: The Knickerbocker a great stay
text: Phenomenal hotel. Located in times square yet the outside noise level never effected our in room stay. The staff members are personable, knowledgeable, and very helpful. Our room was in great condition and the hotel housekeeping staff keep our room clean and organized (they should be the industry standard). The roof top bar St. Cloud was breath taking, the views are mind blowing and the drinks are on point. Ryan our bartender was the best, full of knowledgeable, a pro at his craft, and very entertaining. Ryan was the highlight of our stay. Definitely will be back

title: Would book again!!
text:
Wonderful stay! Luxury hotel- very clean, nice amenities. Check in was a breeze. Front desk staff were so helpful, friendly and always available. 
The lounge was perfect for a pre-dinner drink and appetizers. Staff and servers were friendly and accommodating. 
The room was very clean with a comfy bed and perfect in room amenities.

title: Central location but calm
text:
We had only a 3 days trip but enjoyed the hotel so much because of the services, cleaness and the central location.  Only a few minutes away from Times Square.
Next trip will be in The Knickerbocker again.

title: mother/daughter trip
text: We recently stayed at The Knickerbocker and had a wonderful time! The hotel was beautiful, quiet, had well-appointed rooms, and was located in an excellent location. The staff was very attentive and helpful! I will definitely stay there again!

title: Best Times Square hotel PERIOD
text:
Amazing family trip to NYC thanks to the Knick family of staff! From the moment we walked it we were greeted by friendly smiles of the doormen. Check-in was smooth and easy with the room ready before the 3pm check-in time which was so helpful after the long trip into the city. 

Our most enjoyable experience was with our amazing house keeping attendant Efoua. She came by every evening to check on us with her warm and welcoming demeanor. My kids loved when Efoua would stop by to see about our day and drop off a treat or two :-) along with extra towels or any other amenities we needed. It’s individuals like Efoua that make traveling away from home feel just like home. Overall great experience at the Knick! Great location amazing staff and top notch service. Will be back for sure!

title: Fantastic!
text:
Fantastic hotel, exceptional staff. Roof top bar is fabulous. Highly recommended
Great location too. It was my birthday they gave me a cake and bottle of Champagne! 
Cannot recommend enough.
Bar staff were so welcoming and view from the terrace was outstanding.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Stayed at the Knickerbocker for a three – night mommy/daughter trip. The hotel is perfect in service, location and amenities. We loved our time there and the staff made it easy to enjoy everything. Lovely room, spacious with a gorgeous bathroom. Highly recommend!

title: Don't knock the Knickerbocker its Great!
text: Great location we walked everywhere.  Staff was excellent.  Room service was PERFECT exact time as requested for breakfast arrival 4 days in a row.  Clean and comfortable.  Also, we arrived when it was raining there were umbrellas in the closet for our use while we stayed.

title: Hidden gam in the heart of Time Square
text:
Great hotel with great service. 
Lovely staff, great big room and the only luxury hotel in Time Square.  Roof top was phenomenal place to meet with associates. 
Srdan was amazing same as Elizabeth P who helped us with the bookings.

title: Knickerbocker hotel NYC
text: Beautiful hotel. The staff was great , very friendly and helpful. Room very modern and very clean and it was very quiet. Great rooftop bar.  Great location, Times Square and Broadway. Subway stop right by hotel.

title: A wonderful welcome
text: This is our third time at this wonderful hotel. Absolutely faultless as ever. The staff are courteous and helpful. Our room is spotlessly clean and luxurious. A special mention for Paola. She has gone above and beyond to make us feel welcome  and nothing has been too much bother. Paola has made our stay feel extra special and we will definitely be back.

title: 5 star Concierge Team at the Knickerbocker Hotel
text:
Jay's concierge team are the best. They were all genuinely interested in making sure we had the best stay for our business/anniversary trip to NYC.  Thanks to each of them.
Even on a chilly evening, the rooftop bar is a great place to have a drink and excellent food. The tuna tacos were really good and you will be lucky if Vera is your server.
We look forward to our next visit already.

title: Wonderful stay
text: This hotel is the perfect location.  Just off Times Square and convenient to everything, but you don't feel like you are right on Times square, because you don't even hear noise at all.  There are black out shades so you don't see all the lights.  The security of the hotel is top notch.  The rooms are a great size and the bathrooms are very nice.  Every need was met.   My only complaint (which isn't a huge deal at all) was there wasn't more options for food for the in-room dining/menu at the restaurant for lunch or dinner.  Most people won't even eat here much so probably not even something I should type- but in case someone wanted to know.  We only used it twice on our trip but they just didn't offer much. The breakfast was phenomenal though.  Again, that is a very very small complaint-  and I wouldn't even call it a complaint.  We would 100% stay here again.

title: Fantastic Stay at the Knickerbocker
text: My wife and I came to New York City for a week of theatre.  From its historic roots to its perfect location,  the Knickerbocker met and exceeded all of our expectations.  Our room had a great view and the hotel staff members were perfect hosts.

title: Right in the Heart of NY
text:
The location of the Knickerbocker was the reason that we booked our rooms there.  Easy walk to all things Times Square and the theater district.  Subway stop on the corner that connects with most places that we wanted to go.  Good food and shopping within easy walking.
The reason that I would return is the helpful and pleasant staff, the clean and quiet accommodations, and the amenities provided.  Best place that I have stayed in NYC.

title: Great location ; updated and clean rooms; great service
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Knick . The location to Times Square and theatres was ideal. Rooms were typically small for nyc but updated clean and comfortable . Ver nice walk in shower. Roof top bar was nice and the breakfast buffet was very good. Excellent service throughout. Very good value for nyc

title: Tolles Haus direkt am Times Square
text: Das Knickerbocker ist ein tolles Haus in  einmaliger Lage mit direktem Blick auf den Times Square. Von außen und durch die eigene - nicht mehr genutzte - "Türe" zur U-Bahnstation  ist die Historie noch spürbar - innen empfängt einen moderner Luxus in warmen Farben. Alle Mitarbeiter sind sehr herzlich und zuvorkommend. Unsere Junior-Eck-Suite war fantastisch und hatte einen atemberaubenden Blick auf den Times Square. Das Frühstücksbuffet war natürlich sehr amerikanisch - bot aber auch für europäische Gewohnheiten einige Highlights, wie z.B. täglich frische Beeren, Melonen und Ananas. Nur, dass Kaffeespezialitäten, wie z.B. Cappuccino, extra berechnet wurden, hat uns überrascht, aber der gefilterte Kaffee schmeckte auch gut. Dieser wurde auch immer eifrig nachgeschenkt - beim Frühstück haben wir uns durch die herzliche Betreuung von Gania sehr wohl gefühlt.

title: Beautiful place at Times Square
text:
Excellent location. Easy reach with public transport or cab too. 
Excellent service by hotel staff right from your arrival till ur departure.
Great amenities around the hotel.
Next to subway. Beautiful decor inside. (Depend on ur room) we have stayed in suites at higher floor.
Tourist from UK, must arrange kettle and coffee maker in room before arrival.

title: We had a great time
text: Updated rooms, friendly & helpful staff, and a lovely experience. Very close to Times Square and Bryant Park, and since we were there for Broadway, it was perfect for us.  There was some street noise, but nothing that disturbed our sleep.  We will be back!

title: Knickerbocker NY
text: Extremely satisfied with my experience at the hotel. Rooms were very clean and room service was excellent. Varied menu in the restaurant. Very little street noise in the room at night. Staff were accommodating.

title: Perfect Location
text: The hotel is very well located for exploring NYC.  It is in the heart of Times Square just blocks from Broadway shows, 5 star restaurants, subway and shopping.  The staff was very pleasant and helpful.  The room was a corner room with an outstanding view, great mattress, amazing housekeeping and room service!!

title: The hotel staff makes you feel welcome and to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable.
text: The friendly and helpful nature of the staff. They make you feel at home. Just about every member of the staff—front desk, concierge, porter, security, and the general manager —all demonstrated genuine interest in our well being and making sure we were comfortable and our needs were being met.

title: Friendly staff make the Knickerbocker the perfect place to celebrate an occasion!
text: The Knickerbocker was the perfect place for our family weekend in New York to celebrate my grandson’s birthday.  The hotel is well located so we could easily attend a Broadway show and visit museums and other attractions. The staff were all welcoming and warmly wished my grandson a “Happy Birthday” and even sent him a giant chocolate chip cookie and milk to the room. He was thrilled!

title: An outstanding experience all around in one of the busiest months of the NYC year
text:
We visited the Knickerbocker to celebrate St. Patrick's Day weekend. Already in NYC (and as a local), I know that accommodation can be overpriced and kinda meh on this weekend. The Knickerbocker was a fantastic experience all around, and I wouldn't hesitate at all to return or to suggest the hotel to friends and family members at any point of the year. 

The room was spacious, clean and quiet, even though it was located above arguably the biggest street in NYC (42nd St). Check-in was seamless, and the staff were extremely accommodating. 

However, the best part about the stay was a special experience. I had asked the staff if they could organize a martini experience, since the hotel is known as the "birthplace" of the martini (to learn more, ask about what that means!) Sofia, the Food and Beverage Manager, and Julian, a world-renowned Mixologist, curated the most amazing martini tour for me and my partner. Sofia brought her outstanding expertise on the history and cultural aspects of the hotel, while Julian curated a similar historical trip through the martini's timeline. Highlights were the tour of the older aspects of the hotel and a trip in time through the variety of the tasting. I truly believe that Sofia and Julian have created a most unique experience, and we are very grateful to them. 

Checkout was seamless as well. I would highly recommend the Knickerbocker at any point. As a Manhattan resident since 2002 and as having stayed in many hotels in the city, I would say that this has by far been my favorite due to the combination of kind staff, exceptional service, fair prices, and spacious, comfortable rooms.

title: Perfect location and beautiful hotel.
text: This hotel was on the pricier end of the places that fit within our budget, but it was worth it.  Our room was very nice and extremely clean.  We were shocked at how quiet it was. We expected to hear the constant NY noise of honks and sirens and the room was very quiet.  The staff was extremely nice and super helpful.  You can't get a better location. We went to 3 shows and walked to each of them. Although it's a longer hike, we walked to Central Park, about a mile to the bottom.  The High Line is about a mile walk as well. We took the subway to the Statue of Liberty ferry, a straight shot from the station right by the hotel.  We had a great time.

title: Excellent location at the Time Squre
text: This is our 1st time staying at the Knickerbocker.  Love the location. It is a block from the center of Time Square. The room is a decent size for  NYC and clean. Ambiance of hotel is quite modern.   Staffs are very professional. Overall, we had a great experience. An uneventful bathroom leak occurred after 2nd night of stay, hotel upgraded the room with the Time Square view. They do take care their customers.  We booked this hotel via Signature Visa site and received some perks such as complimentary breakfast and drinks credit.  I highly recommended this hotel.

title: Great stay
text: Excellent location and huge room size plus the brunch-like breakfast included in our rate was marvellous. Diana at concierge and Gaina in the dining room provided superb service. Rooms are a bit worn and could use a refresh of furniture but bathrooms were huge and modern.

title: Second time to say
text: Great location, not too far from favored destinations.  Very friendly and helpful staff. Diana, the concierge is outstanding:  Very professional, knowledgeable, friendly and dedicated to making the visitor have an enjoyable experience. Truly a gem!  Bellman were very friendly and helpful with cab service. Hotel room very nice and clean.  A few small items were not picked up with cleaning, but not a big deal.  I would love to return to the Knickerbocker. Price is reasonable.

title: Great service & Amazing concierge
text: Great service at the hotel and excellent location. But most of all Diana F- concierge was absolutely fabulous. She offer great advice for places to go, eat and even made reservations for us and walk outside to direct us exactly where to go. Kuddos for hiring people like Diana F.

title: Nice room and service, Gania is great!
text:
We stayed there for 3 nights and we had a great time in the hotel. 
The room are spacious and very quiet despite on the prime location of broadway.  We had breakfast included, our waitress Gania was very sweet and professional.  She definately made the breakfast time very comfortable and welcoming.

title: Great hotel at a great location
text: The Knickerbocker is a very comfortable hotel right in the heart of Manhattan. The rooms are luxurieus, with very comfortable beds and a bathroom I would love to have at home. The staff is super nice and very service oriented. I stayed for 5 days and wished I could stay longer.

title: Makes any trip to Broadway to see the theater extra special and convenient!
text: In fact, I LOVED the pillows! We, also, loved the staff who were all so helpful. The location is EXCELLENT and quite quiet given the area surrounding the hotel. We will, for sure, stay here again and suggest all our friends stay here, particularly if they want to be close to Broadway. The subway being right on the corner was a real plus, also. I really liked the small but nice fitness room, and the restaurant and rooftop bar are a real treat. I have NOTHING to say negative about this fine property.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Awesome hotel with amazing staff in a convenient location.
Rooms a bit worn…just need a furniture update.
Diana and Gaina were amazing a concierge and breakfast.
Huge bathrooms with wonderful showers and efficient cleaning staff.
A bit pricey but a wonderful stay

title: Wonderful stay at The Knickerbocker
text:
The hotel room and concierge services exceeded our expectations.
We loved the rooftop bar, has a good selection of drinks and the ambiance is fun but also relaxing.
Great location! Theatres, subway station and multiple stores are within a walking distance.

title: Fantastic hotel in Times Square
text:
The Knickerbocker hotel is an oasis in TS. I was concerned about the location - the minute you step into the lobby all concerns disappear. The Knickerbocker has thought of everything, even cookies + milk and delicious chocolates. The bed was so comfortable, motorized blackout shades were fantastic. 
The shower was terrific and the entire bathroom was perfectly appointed.
I will return and enjoy the rooftop bar I'm sure the views are exquisite

title: Best place to stay in New York
text: The service, the atmosphere, the cleanliness and the experience were all top notch. We couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay in New York. The location and room are unbeatable. It will remain our favorite and only place to stay in New York.

title: Excellent for those looking for larger rooms.
text:
Excellent sized rooms, attentive room services, central location and friendly helpful hotel/door staff.

Room has plenty of USB charging ports, shower pressure perfect.

Chargeable coffee shop is great but would have liked in room hot drinks making given coffee shop shuts at 2pm.

Large bed and plenty of storage including complimentary use of umbrellas, safe etc..

Would recommend for those that require larger rooms.

Tip: we sacrificed city views to be placed at the rear of the hotel, we could not hear a single noise from Times Sq which suited us.

title: Amazing Visit
text: NYC has always been a top choice for us to visit. Our son, who is 18, has never been so we decided to take him to NY for spring break. We couldn't be happier with our stay at The Knickerbocker. It was an amazing visit, partly because of this hotel. Staff is topnotch, restaurants are great, bartenders and servers are awesome. We WILL be back to stay here for sure.

title: Astonishing Hotel!!
text: The Knickerbocker is GORGEOUS; and the staff was sensational!!!  Adored the entire experience.  I was particularly impressed by the design of the rooms and the technology.  And the staff always gave beyond expected service.  And the gym is first-rate.

title: If you're looking for a loud hotel with poor customer service - book the Knickerbocker!
text:
I stayed for 4 nights recently for business.  There were a number of issues with my stay:
 - Upon check-in, offered a street view or quieter interior room.  I took quiet.  The desk clerk failed to mention loud music until 10pm (I called and they clearly knew the stopping time).
- Night two, music softened at 10pm but still audible in my room until 1:30am which made it hard to sleep.
-Couldn't take the music so requested a room change.  
-Not even an apology for the inconvenience or misdirection upon check in.
-TV in new room not working.  Had to call for service.
-Woke up late for an early am flight and ran out of the hotel quickly.  Immediately realized I didn't grab my charger.  Texted the hotel and they said they would look.  
-Never received a response so texted 2 days later.  Said they would follow up, Said it wasn't found.  I disputed as I am 100% positive it was there.  Again, no follow up so had to contact again and it was not found.

SO disappointed with my stay and lack of response from the staff,  Also concerning if you accidentally leave an item in a room it will disappear.  

The location is good for my business travel but not worth the poor service to stay there again.  They had every opportunity to make my stay more pleasant and not once did they do anything.

title: Wunderbares Hotel
text: Wir verbrachten eine Woche im Knickerbocker Hotel und fühlten uns absolut sicher und wohl. Alle Mitarbeiter waren sehr sehr nett und hilfsbereit, vom Check-In bis zum Check-Out war alles wunderbar. Unser Gepäck wurde bei Anreise aufs Zimmer gebracht und bei Abreise hielt ein Mitarbeiter Ausschau nach unserem Fahrer während wir gemütlich im Hotel warten konnten. Unser Zimmer war sehr geräumig und die Betten gemütlich und weich. Ebenso angenehm war die Qualität der Bettwäsche sowie die Badezimmer-Produkte von Diptyque. Das Zimmer und Bad wurde morgens und abends gereinigt und abends auch immer das Bett aufgeschlagen und die Hausschuhe bereitgestellt. So konnten wir uns gut vom Laufen durch New York erholen. Die Lage am Timessquare war für uns perfekt, da wir die meisten Sehenswürdigkeiten zu Fuß erreichen konnten. Einziger Kritikpunkt ist, dass man den TV nicht mit Netflix verbinden konnte - aber wir waren abends meistens eh zu müde um noch viel zu schauen. Ich würde mich jederzeit wieder für dieses Hotel entscheiden.

title: New York Anniversary Trip at The Knickerbocker
text:
Excellent choice, close to everything, walking distance to Bryant Park, Summit One Vanderbilt, and Grand Central. St Cloud Rooftop Bar 🍸has good views,  vibes, and environment. Great size room and hotel is  very quiet, considering you are steps from Times Squares madness. Also, the subway is just around the corner. The bathroom shower is the best!! 

Hotel is very clean 👌,  staff and concierge very attentive.

Only negative note on my stay was that fire alarm was activated at 1230am. It was a false alarm, but scary at first.  

I will return to this hotel without any hesitation.

👍

title: Modern and chic lodging.
text: As soon as we strolled through the front door, the staff were polite and welcoming. The lobby is very modern; the room which we stayed in was the Caruso suite, the best suite in the hotel, was simply the best room we have ever stayed in. The decor was luxurious, the room had electrical blinds, skylight, a full marble bathroom, two minibars, a full set of crystal glasses, double doors when you walk in, a table for 6 people, two televisions, two wardrobes, and a vanity. The service is what you would of expect a five star hotel to be like, definitely an amazing experience for sure.

title: Always attentive
text: Whenever I have a trip to NYC and it’s focused near Times Square, The Knickerbocker is the place to stay. The staff is siesta accommodating, no matter how minute my requests have been, the issues are corrected quickly.  And the accommodations are very comfortable.

title: 3rd Stay and great to be back
text:
Having returned from NYC just over 2 weeks ago, I couldn’t go without writing a review on this wonderful hotel. This was our first time back to this property, since 2019. The hotel was still as lovely as the previous stays and the staff were wonderful. From the moment my son and I checked in, we felt like we had returned home. We were very fortunate to have received an upgrade to a junior suite, which was very much appreciated. The concierge were fabulous! Diana and Stephanie went above and beyond to make dinner reservations for us, and gave us some good advice. My son was extremely delighted that we managed to get a table at Bar Massa! 
The doorman and the other man on concierge ( Jeff) I think we’re also so friendly and helpful. The bedroom was very spacious and clean.

We can’t wait to return and thank you for making our trip so great.

title: Très bel hôtel très bien placé sur Time Square
text: Bel hôtel, propre, agréable et efficace, très beau Rooftop avec magnifique terrasse. Chambre spacieuse et propre. Super petit déjeuner en buffet, salé et sucré. Selon moi c'est quand même un hôtel pour couple ou business. Le top c'est la conciergerie qui nous a été vraiment utile pour les réservations de restaurant ou autre. Bonus et un grand à Marcello qui s'occupe d'accueillir les clients à la sortie du taxi devant l'hôtel et qui à été d'une aide précieuse pendant notre séjour et qui est d'une gentillesse incroyable ! Je recommande donc fortement cet hôtel surtout si vous profiter du Rooftop 🥸😎

title: The Knickerbocker NYC
text: The Knickerbocker has a great vibe! IT’s location At Times Square and Bryant Park is perfect! Concierge was actually wonderful and led me to a new favorite-Zuckers for a catering delivery and a bagel/sandwich shop just a block away! The staff from front desk, even making the reservation arrangements were too-notch service! Loved the interaction with Paula at check in, Brandon at checkout, and everyone in between- Jimmy at bell service upon arrival and KJ and Marcelo especially at departure for bag storage and getting cab service to JFK. Rooms clean and modern, bathrooms spacious, ample closet space and amenities galore!  This is a Highgate run LHW property that has really done a great job with meeting expectations, from the facilities, to the staff and the food and beverage offerings at bountiful breakfast buffet on 4th floor to rooftop bar and lounge for a little nosh, was very pleasant!  The staff is very professional, true hospitality - both passionate and knowledgeable and so friendly - I loved my stay and I will be back!  I completely recommend The Knickerbocker - it is so convenient to all parts of the city - I walked to midtown to visit an account of mine, ordered bagels from Zuckers around the corner (recommended by the wonderful concierge, Stefania who was knowledgeable and walked back even from Bellini on the West End /Waterline Square - easy access to Times Square, Broadway, and Avenue of the Americas-a straight shot to Grand Central Station!  So conveniently located, short cab ride to Cipriani Downtown. It snowed that night but coming back to the warmth of the hotel from the staff made you feel safe at right at home! Walked to Gotham Hall with ease!  The hotel is great and it was a very comfortable, clean, friendly property and a nice place to call home for the four days in The City!  I’d like to stay here on my next visit to NYC!

title: Increíble desayuno y servicio 🙏
text:
Muy buena ubicación 
El desayuno americano espectacular y el servicio increíble 
Tan bien servido 
Y Gania y Houcine dos personas tan serviciales y muy profesionales que merecen ser nombrados especialmente 
Siempre atentos si falta algo o si uno quiere mas café más té mas agua 
Un Servicio espectacular 
Nos  atendieron e hicieron sentir reinas 
Lo mismo con todos los pasajeros y clientes que estaban desayunando 
Fue un placer bajar a desayunar 
Y lo recomendamos sobremanera 
Además el buffet es muy muy bueno

title: Best breakfast service in New York
text: Gania and Houcine made our stay a pleasure!! Amazing attitude and attention.  Every day, a smile received us and made us feel like home. The cold outside was compensated with the kindness of them. This hotel will be my choice for the next visit to New York.

title: Fantastic stay with kind staff!
text: My mom, my sisters and I booked a last-minute getaway to NYC, and we chose the Knickerbocker to host us for the long weekend. We were met with considerate staff, clean amenities, and access to a wonderful hotel. We've since recommended the hotel to other friends who plan on visiting New York and hope they choose the Knickerbocker as their place of residence.

title: Excellent First NYC Experience
text:
The Knickerbocker and its staff exceeded our expectations. The hotel has a perfect location to walk to Broadway shows and everything else in Times Square. 

The room and hotel were very clean and the staff was helpful and nice. With the craziness of Times Square, the Knickerbocker was the perfect quiet spot to take a break from the hustle and relax.

We plan on staying at the Knickerbocker again this summer with our family.

title: Great location, great amenities, Great Breakfast!
text: This is not the first time that we stayed at the Knickerbocker, and it will not be the last. The location is perfect, it is a very high class hotel right next to Broadway. We love the fact that it’s near Bryant park and so many other amenities that are important to us.  The upstairs bar is incredible and the food at the hotel are fantastic. We especially love the breakfast. I would like to particularly recognize Gania and Houcine, who run and work in the breakfast restaurant on the fourth floor. They are as honest, warm, friendly, and accommodating as they could possibly be. They are the main reason that we will be coming back at the end of March!  Again, I cannot Recommend in Knickerbocker highly enough.  See you soon!

title: Best Hotel Value NYC
text: The rooms are near-four-seasons, the bar is very nice and the location could not be more central.  Incredible value for the dollar. Friendly and accommodating staff.  Consistently have a positive experience at this property and it is an LHW member.

title: Wonderful time at The Knickerbocker Hotel
text: We loved staying at The Knickerbocker Hotel. The staff, the room, the bar were all great. I highly recommend this hotel. Extremely close to many subway lines. Within walking distance to pretty much all the theaters. Overall a great place!

title: 6days in NYC
text:
I spent 6 days in NYC, with my daughter, travelling from London UK. 
It was our second time at the hotel visiting previously 3 years ago. 
The hotel staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The hotel is very well situated enabling you to walk to many of the main tourist spots.

title: Oasis for Broadway Trip
text: Annual mother/daughter trip to see Broadway shows. Knickerbocker was quiet, very friendly and had  lovely rooms. The rooftop is great before or after shows. We loved slipping in to elegant surroundings after Time Square crowds.

title: Ms
text: Highly recommend this hotel.  The location was convenient to everything.   The staff was attentive and helpful.  Service was above and beyond expected. The hotel was beautiful.  The rooftop had an amazing view of the city.   We met another couple there and they happily assigned us rooms next door to each other.

title: A great hotel with fantastic service in a great location
text: I stayed at The Knickerbocker two weeks ago and was blown away by their beautiful hotel and world class service. It happened to be 69 degrees during my stay and the rooftop restaurant was open. It offers amazing views of Times Square and the food is delicious. The rooms are spacious and the sheets, towels and amenities are the best I've ever seen. Anyone looking for a premier hotel in Manhattan should look for The Knickerbocker, you won't be disappointed.

title: Ótima estadia em um excelente hotel
text:
Reservei o hotel através do programa de concierge da Visa, tendo direito a café da manhã, checkin antecipado, late checkout, upgrade de quarta e voucher de 25usd. Todos esses benefícios foram honrados pelo hotel o que me deixou extremamente satisfeito.
Sobre o hotel:
Localização excelente, bem na Time Square, próximo ao Bryant Park, estações de metro, ponto de Taxi, Onibus, Uber, ou seja: Muito fácil de chegar e igualmente fácil para se deslocar para todos os cantos.
As instalações são incríveis: Quartos espaçosos e muito limpos. Consegui um upgrade de quarto, sem nenhuma custo a mais.
O café da manhã é farto, com variedades, embora sendo todos os dias os mesmos itens. Mas isso esta longe de ser um problema, apenas uma observação. Não é todo dia que você se hospeda num hotel que oferece salmão defumado no café da manhã. 
O Rooftop é muito agradável.

title: Great stay
text:
Great hotel, clean and the service is fantastic. Close to everything and right near Times Square. Definitely coming back!
They greet you at the door and are always ensuring a comfortable stay. Great turndown service and the rooms were very clean

title: A few days in the Big Apple
text: The last two times that we have gone to NYC, we have stayed at the Knickerbocker.  The entire staff is courteous and helpful.  The concierge arranged reservations according to our times, places and food choices.  The hotel is safe and convenient.  We will continue to stay at the Knickerbocker when in NYC.

title: Not worth the money
text: Staff were excellent and friendly. Value and consistency just wasn’t there.  Room service first day was $40 including $18 tip. Same order next day was $56 including a $7 tip. Only ordered as there is no coffee maker in room.  How ?  Why ?

title: Best Hotel stay in a very long time
text: Though the location and the actual hotel are perfection, what I really want to commend is the level of service at this hotel.  Since the onset of Covid, there has been a rampant pandemic of lack of customer service at hotels and restaurants.  Not here.  Every single person in this hotel was warm, attentive, and helpful.  It was the BEST stay in a long time, and I will return.

title: Simply perfect!
text:
We arrived at the Knickerbocker on 12th February 23 from the UK. 
After reading some mixed reviews about the hotel, we did have some concerns that things may not be quite as expected, but we absolutely need not have worried.
The hotel is immaculate, the rooms are spotless and spacious and the staff can't do enough for you. 
We had the premium city view room, for 2 adults and 2 (teenage) children, and we did not feel crammed in or on top of each other at all. 
The rooms were spotlessly cleaned daily, the beds were SO comfortable and the housekeeping staff so friendly. 
We enjoyed many drinks at the hotel lobby bar and also the amazing rooftop bar, which overlooks the Times Square 'ball'. 
The place is so centrally located, that we were able to drop off shopping etc throughout the day, before resuming our sightseeing. 
We did not experience any noise issues as we've read on some other reviews. Yes it's right on top of Times Square, but other than the odd siren, you can't hear the glorious chaos that's down below! 
We would not hesitate to stay here again, it really felt like home from home for us. Thank you all at 'The Knick'.

title: Rhonda and Dr. Pope review
text: Johir and Jordan wonderful people and they took great care of us. I look forward to seeing them again. We want to have them serve us again. They made our experience wonderful. You hired the best people.

title: Stay here and see NYC!!!
text:
I took my senior mom to visit NYC and I was worried because her mobility is limited. The staff here at the hotel went ABOVE AND BEYOND to make sure our stay was comfortable and tailored to us and our needs. Before I get to the rooms, location etc I just wanted to shout out the staff! 
1 - Sayem Mohammed (doorman) - he went ABOVE and BEYOND to make sure my mother was comfortable and felt so welcomed and special. He checked on us continuously, made sure my mom (who is handicapped) got into cars safely, and always was so patient and welcoming. He made our stay memorable! We looked forward to being greeted by him everyday we stayed. 

2- stephanie and Diana concierge - these two also made our stay feel so personal. We felt like we were guests in their own home. They checked up on us, treated us to a tea for two in the bar and sent up a bday cake slice for my mom!! By the end we were exchanging hugs! Cannot wait to see them again. 

3 - Louise was INCREDIBLE. Such a wonderful conversationalist and also so kind and helpful with my mom. My mom is a senior who is slower in movement but loves to chat and Louise gave her a lot of time and attention. It really brightened her whole day. She felt important and seen! 

4 - jimmy - bellman - such a wonderful, helpful man. He made sure our bags were taken care of and loaded. Got us a great deal on transport to the airport and was the last person we interacted with on the way out. Such a fun man, so nice and helpful to my mom. 

Rooms are nice and BIG and spacious for NYC! and for hotels in general. Beds are comfy, diptyque products are so luxurious and the location is so perfect if you want to be in the mix! Seconds from Bryant park, minutes from time square and perfect to show someone who wants to see the tourist attractions. 

Overall, my recommendation is: STAY HERE! you won’t regret it!

title: One of the best hotels to stay in Times Square
text: Fabulous hotel, amenities, rooms, and staff, with an ideal location in Times Square. The rooftop bar has fantastic views of midtown and the famous NYE ball drop as well as delicious signature cocktails. Coffee at Jake's is a perfect morning stop before hitting the city, and breakfast at CP @ the Knick was great as well. Will definitely stay again.

title: A Times Square Hotel without the Frenzy
text:
Perched the heart of Times Square, The Knickerbocker, dubbed 'The Knick' is an elite NYC luxury hotel. It's a landmark Beaux Arts building and its prestigious Times Square address means easy access to NYC notorious attractions.

I relished my Premier City View room with King Bed and great view over Broadway. Soaring 12 foot ceilings and oversized doors and windows created an outlandish sense of space. Decor consisted of textured fabrics , oak wood finishes and bespoke lighting that all taken together promoted a heavenly ambiance. The bathroom was spacious, sleek and luxurious with marble sinks and a frosted glass walk-in shower with waterfall.

There are 3 distinct dining venues at the Knick. Charlie Palmer at the Knick specializes in American cuisine and offers 3 categories of service namely: breakfast, bar& lounge and in room dining. Breakfast options range from the buffet to a la carte and the all-day lounge menu featured a range of plates and I tried the signature fried chicken.. amazing.
 I found Jakes @The Knick coffee shop an excellent spot for grab-and -go pastry and a cup of Joe. For a view , I headed upstairs to St. Cloud, a rooftop bar purveying inventive cocktails.

So, if you are looking for luxe accommodations in the heart of Manhattan but want to escape the Times Square mayhem..............then try the ............Knickerbocker.......A Times Square Hotel without the Frenzy.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: The Knickerbocker exceeded our expectations. The rooms were large, friendly staff, great rooftop bar and a delicious breakfast. It’s centrally located near Times Square but the rooms were very quiet. Highly recommend for a trip to NYC and Broadway.

title: Great location
text: We stayed for four nights as part of a couples break and had flown in from Chicago. We upgraded the room for a street view for $85 per night. Superior suite was spacious for New York, two TV's and sitting area, large bathroom, good show and toiletries. The room was very quiet at night even though the hotel was in a very central location and the bed was very comfortable. Staff very accommodating, would have liked a coffee machine in the room. We didn't eat in the restaurant which is part of the Charlie Palmer Group, the bar was nice and the grab and go coffee bar in the lobby a must for breakfast. Overall a great stay.

title: Headphones went missing from hotel room
text: I stayed here during the end of November/beginning of December for my first visit to NYC. We loved our stay, however during the last few days had realised my expensive headphones had gone missing from our room and we notified the hotel. This still has not been resolved and now my emails are being ignored by hector in the security department. Be warned about your belongings if you stay here!

title: Excellent stay!
text: I stayed at the Knickerbocker for the first time last weekend.   It was wonderful...the staff were friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and the amenities were great.   There is a beautiful roof top deck that we were able to have cocktails on in January!  The location was terrific, close to all the Broadway shows.   Ended our stay by having a yummy breakfast in the restaurant.   Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: Terrific!
text: Interested in a great hotel to stay in NYC especially if you’re attending a Broadway play, try the Hotel Knickerbocker….location location!!  The hotel has been completely updated…beautiful rooms with lovely amenities…Parisian soaps and lotions!!! The hotel staff is friendly and helpful.  Beautiful rooftop deck where we enjoyed cocktails and a terrific breakfast in the dining room.  Highly recommend this property!

title: Outstanding Service
text: From the moment we checked in until we checked out, we were helped by an incredibly professional staff who continually assured us that all we had to do was ask if we needed anything. Our room and the hotel facilities were extraordinary so we never had to ask for anything. The hotel’s proximity to Broadway and great restaurants made this one of my wife’s best birthday presents.

title: Superb stay!
text: First time at The Knickerbocker and it did not disappoint! The staff was very welcoming and helpful, rooms were spacious and clean with comfortable beds and nice towels and toiletries. Roof Bar was fun( great views!) and breakfast was delicious. Highly recommend!

title: Great hotel for New York stay
text: We went to New York in mid-January and stayed at the Knickerbocker. It was our first time to stay there. We had an early morning flight, and I had contacted the hotel before traveling to see if we could arrange an early check-in. They said to call them on the way from the airport, and they would see what they could do. They were great about it, even had a room with a tub, which I had also requested. The staff was always welcoming and helpful. The room was lovely and quiet. We had a view of another building, which was fine. We ate once at the hotel for breakfast, and it was very good. There was bottled water every day. The room had umbrellas, which came in handy one evening. There were also robes and slippers. We asked for and received extra towels.  I would recommend staying there.

title: A friendly and accommodating staff from check-in to check-out.
text:
Luxury accommodations and convenient location to broadway theaters and restaurants.
Very Comfortable bed and and the room had black out shade option. We enjoyed a nightcap on the St. Cloud rooftop bar, Overlooking time square. Despite a cool January evening we were very comfortable with the outdoor heaters.
A wonderful weekend getaway to NYC!

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
text: We have stayed at the Knickerbocker several times and have never had a bad experience. The staff is friendly and very attentive - always happy to help with any request. We always enjoy a drink at the rooftop bar. The location is perfect - close to fabulous restaurants, theaters, Bryant Park, shops. The bed was very comfortable, the room clean, quiet halls. We won’t stay anywhere else when we visit NYC!

title: Excellent hotel. Exceeded expectations
text: The location was excellent as it was at the heart of Tines Square. The room was clean and very comfortable. The service was excellent. We requested for a kettle in the trim and they were happy to provide one. Would highly recommend this hotel

title: My new favorite NYC hotel
text: The Knickerbocker is amazing.  It is great value, service and location for the money in Times Square.  Everything is modern except the slow elevators, but the staff is great, the rooms comfortable and updated and the Internet wireless free and fast.  Highly recommended and a better value than the chain based hotels.

title: Nothing like the 'glossy brochures'!
text:
We stayed here for two nights in late December 2022. I would not recommend this property.

We stayed in a Deluxe Room with 2 Queen beds. I really wish I took a photo to share on here. It was awful and nothing like the photos online. The room was sparse (I don't even think there was a picture on the wall) and one of the two "windows" was actually curtains across a wall. The other window looked into the office next door. The carpet throughout was very freyed and stained and the bathroom worn. 
There's no mini bar or coffee and tea facilities. We were so stunned as we had such high expectations of this hotel, especially as we'd paid AUD$1800 per night.

The rooftop bar/restaurant has a fabulous terrace, but inside it is very ordinary. It's more like a grubby airline lounge with fed-up staff wandering around trying to fake a smile. The food was average and expensive. We were sat in a rear lounge type area of the restaurant full of families with kids running everywhere.

The admin staff just seem tired and fed up and despite sending us an SMS to check that we were OK, didn't seem to have any genuine interest.

I'm surprised by all the good reveiws on here, I genuinely am.

title: All the Special Touches
text: The Knickerbocker was located perfectly in Time Square to all the theatre action and subways for movement around the city. The rooms were spacious and updated with all thing luxury. The special touches of turning the bed down, leaving slippers, and water, were a surprise. We were celebrating our son's 18th birthday (which we mentioned at check-in) and they were sure to leave him a piece of cake in the room!

title: Lives up to expectations
text: Outstanding hotel from start to finish. Requested adjoining rooms and they accommodated. Rooms are large for NYC size, stylish, blackout electronic shades, comfortable beds, nice showers. Robes in room. Blowdryer left a bit to be expected (just not powerful). Customer service was A+++++. Everyone we interacted with was impressive. Breakfast was very good. Location was the best. We cannot say enough good things about this hotel.

title: Great to Return to The Knickerbocker Hotel Post Covid
text:
Pre-COVID the Knickerbocker hotel was my 'hotel of choice' when in New York for business...

...so it was with some trepidation that I returned in November 2022 for the first time since the 2020 lock-down to see what had changed - and whether it would remain central to my business plans.

The good news was that the excellent front of house team were still as friendly, courteous and helpful as ever. Lucy on the front desk helped organize the type of room I prefer (one with a bath-tub), as well as a tea kettle for the room, and helped with my business breakfast arrangements. 

The room I had was, as ever, comfortable, well appointed and spotless - I also always find the beds very comfortable (especially important if you are suffering from jet-lag anyway!). The house keeping staff were super helpful with finding some additional toiletries and short hangers as well.

In the Charlie Palmer restaurant I was greeted by Gania who was as friendly, helpful and super efficient as ever. It was great to see other familar faces as well. 

The one thing that I hoped might have changed in COVID was the height of the tables and chairs in the restaurant. These have always felt about 1cm-2cm out of synch to me :)...but as with the good things at the Hotel, they were also the same as before!

It was also good to see the team in Jakes cafe. They seemed pleased to see a returning Brit and they still make an excellent cup of tea and express breakfast (the fruit parfait's are a good way to start the day if you have to leave early).

Once again, this was an excellent visit - very efficient wifi (important in a zoom based world) - and super helpful staff with a very comfortable room. Well done to the management for keeping their team (and theefore the 'feel' and culture of the Hotel intact during three tough years. 

I wil be back again - I hope!

title: splendidly suprised
text:
Stay here. The location is perfect. The coffee shop down stairs is cute with delicious coffee. The check-in process was amazing. I checked in very early, they took my bags because my room wasn’t ready and had the concierge continue to communicate with me all day until it was. The rooftop bar was dreamy. There was another bar inside that was quite nice and quiet but amazing service. The staff at the front door made sure to check keys when unsure about guests. I was so pleased with my stay. 
Also, I wrote this review with one thing in mind. The hospitality. I called and asked about their online price matching. I had found a better rate that their AI wasn't catching. I called and they gave me the runaround. The front desk couldn't help me, they transferred me to reservations and they couldn’t help me. I was only able to be helped by a manager. So, after I reached out through email (which is the slowest form of communication after USPS) they got back to me. The room had sold out that I was looking for by the time they responded. They accommodated me and made the grueling process of price-matching bearable. 
Also, they put my room next to the elevators at first, I thought I could handle it but they ended up moving me part way through my stay so I could sleep through the night. It was quiet other than that. 

Thank you, Knickerbocker, for being clean, safe for a single woman to stay in Manhattan and making my time on the East Coast quite pleasant.

title: Amazing location.  Hotel well maintained.
text: Everything was clean and well maintained.  Best sleep I've had in months.  Great views.  Rooftop bar was a must. Balcony at the top was fun and very spacious. The staff made me feel like a celebrity.  Spend a little extra and Stay here.  You won't regret it.

title: The Classic
text:
The architectural monument plaque outside is obscure, but important. To appreciate the exterior, you must look from across the street. The interior has been modernized; our room was not huge, but didn't feel cramped either-comfortable. Staff friendly. THE place to stay if you want to walk to Broadway shows. Or maybe NASDAQ. Member of Leading Hotels of the World and trying to prove it belongs. Twice a day housekeeping is a rarity and I left a tip for the good job they did.

Pro tip: Upon checkout I said it would have been nice to have a coffeemaker in the room. Was told they are available if you ask, but was never informed.

title: Amazing 4 Night Stay
text: My 3rd time in NYC but the 1st time for my partner and 2 teenage children. Location is amazing, stones throw to Times Square and the subway around the corner. On the 10th floor with little outside sound and the electric blackout blind was brilliant. Very clean room and bathroom. No tea or coffee facilities but with so many coffee shops nearby this wasn’t a problem. Bed was comfortable and we all slept well. Concierge were fantastic. I was really apprehensive about using the subway for the first time but had instructions clearly written for me after being clear and helpful instructions. They also assisted with booking transport to jfk. All staff were so friendly and helpful. An excellent base and wouldn’t want to stay anywhere else during future visits. NYC is firmly my favourite city and The Knickerbocker provides the perfect base! Was very sad to leave.

title: On the doorstep of Times Square
text:
My daughter and I have just returned from a stay here at the start of January. We travelled from the UK to celebrate my daughter’s 16th birthday.
The hotel is located just around the corner from Times Square and along the road from
Bryant Park. So top marks for location.
We stayed in room 817 which was clean and modern. We had a city view but no issues with any noise or lights (electric blackout blind).
Bed was really comfortable and evening turn down service was provided.
A friendly lady at check in arranged for us to have a room with a view and a birthday cake delivered to our room which was a lovely touch- thank you.
There’s lots of storage space in the room, nice toiletries and the umbrellas came in handy for the rain.
No tea and coffee making facilities but there’s a Starbucks just around the corner. 
We visited the rooftop terrace bar which was really relaxing and had great views.
Also located around the corner is a lovely little bakery which offers beautiful cakes, pastries and sandwiches which was ideal for breakfast. 
We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

title: Some things to be aware of
text: Very friendly and welcoming at check in. Our room was clean and spacious. The closest parking is a city block away so if you drive in plan according to drop your luggage and park your car. The front desk sent us to a garage that 2 city blocks away. The location is terrific as you are in the start of times square. We got to the rooftop bar 30 minutes before close and our greeting from the bartender was last call. By the way they close at 11 pm ( Wednesday night) so it was only 10:30. Upon leaving we asked if there was discounted parking and the bellman said yes and you pay at the desk here. Neither of which was true. When I did not tip him quickly enough he thanked me for helping to support his family. Full disclosure at that point I did not tip him at all. For $431 for one night stay in a hotel with a parking garage, that has a bar in the city that never sleeps open past 11 and, that has a staff that would never be that rude on their worst day.

title: Rewcommended
text:
Great location, very nice hotel.
Room was large and very comfortable.
We were in a side room, and that was still noisy through the night (they love to sound their horns over there!). However, the bed was very comfortable and once the ear plugs were in, we slept well. Went to the roof top bar and it was very nice.
We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great hotel in an even better location
text:
We loved this hotel. Upon check in we were double upgraded which was really nice after a very long flight! 
The rooms were huge, beds comfortable and really clean. 
I thought the noise would keep us awake but we both slept really well and it’s pretty near to sound proof bar when the police drove by and you heard the sirens.
Really helpful and friendly staff.
When I come back to NY, I won’t be staying anywhere else! Thanks!

title: Don’t spend New Years here!
text:
Bucket list for myself- planned this trip to share with my son. Buffet was gorgeous, hotel is nice. We are enjoying the ball drop, DJ is playing and his girl friend pushes/ elbows her way into our space so she can nestle herself behind the DJ’s set up. My son told the DJ that it wasn’t cool that she elbowed and pushed me out of the way to get to her spot ( I am 56 and have cancer) and “ Danny” starts cussing and pushing my son saying he is going to throw him over the roof as the excitement of the ball was dropping. I had to get between my son and this guy to stop him from putting his hands on my son, threatening to now kick him out of the event we paid 3500$ to attend.
GI the customer service manager was no help- we left the event sad and disappointed. “ what do you want me to do?” He asks?! 
What?!?!
Disappointed & disgusted.
Heart broken in NY

title: Absolutely the best location if you want to be close to Times Square!
text:
The Knickerbocker is a 5 star hotel that is located right smack in the middle of Times Square. If you are looking for a hotel in midtown Manhattan that is within walking distance to F&B outlets, great shopping as well as other amenities, I would strongly recommend the Knickerbocker.

The gym is very equipped with weight machines as well as free weights. There are also ample tread mills available for those who want to have a good cardio workout.

The hotel room itself is relatively small and walking room is limited if you have got big luggages. I would have preferred a firmer bed but the one that I slept on did provide me with decent sleep for 5 nights.
