My shower experience was really good as the overhead showers provided almost instantaneous hot water, which was really important in the midst of an artic cold front, and gave a powerful spray. 
The toiletries provided by Kickerbocker was also top notch and my favourite was the Diptyque body cream which left my skin well moisturised and softened. 

I would highly recommend the Knickerbocker to anyone looking for a 5 star accommodation in mid town New York.

Hotel location 5/5
Wifi 5/5
Check-in experience 4/5
Gym 5/5
Shower Experience 5/5
Hotel room size 4/5

title: Very dirty
text: arrived on the day after Christmas and was greeted very nicely by the staff. The hotel is located in a wonderful area in Times Square. So you ask why the 2 stars?? Our bathroom had a huge ring on the wall where the toilet sit flips up. I’m sure you can guess what that nice yellow ring was. If this is the way they clean bathrooms then how must they clean the food they prep or the beds we sleep in. Our room number was 1424.

title: Honesto e com boa localização
text: A localização do hotel é muito boa, pois está na Times Square, porém numa parte mais tranquila, a cerca de dois quarteirões da “bagunça”. É um bom hotel, porém o isolamento acústico não é bacana. Tinha uma família hospedada em 2 ou 3 quartos na frente do nosso e eles batiam porta, gritavam, conversavam o dia todo e até de madrugada. Em uma das noites precisamos reclamar na recepção para que parassem. Isso atrapalhou a nossa experiência. De resto, achei o hotel honesto.

title: One of the best in NY
text:
Having had a bad experience in 2021 we were looking for a high end hotel within a decent budget to not cost the earth. This is definitely one of the best that meets the spec. 

The rooms are clean, everything has been thought of and the staff were really really helpful with nothing being too much. 

The beds were super comfy and clean with the housekeeping kept to a high standard. 

We loved it and will be back when we can.

title: Christmas @ The Knickbocker
text:
Great location, a fairly good sized room, nice bar lounge and great rooftop bar with amazing views.
There was not  much effort taken to recognise Christmas other than a tree in the lobby. Christmas morning breakfast at the hotel was a rather flat / none celebrated event - a welcome drink or decorations on the table would have been a nice and easy gesture.

Generally the service attention was lacking, in particular at the 4th floor restaurant & bar.  We were often standing around at the entrance waiting to be seated as there was nobody at the front desk. Then came further prolonged waiting for some to acknowledge our table so we could order drinks. Not good service at all for a 5 star establishment.

Overall, our experience of the hotel was good but have stayed at many other 5 star hotels around the world that offer the service and amenities you would expect.  They’ve not quite got it right at The Knickerbocker.

title: Disappointing
text:
This hotel is in a five star location but that is literally all it has going for it.  Rooms are tired and old,
 the team are completely disengaged from their guests and could not care less, bar/restaurant closes super early and service is completely absent.   We had a great adventure in NYC, the only thing we would not do again is this hotel.

title: AC problems
text: This does not feel like a 5 star hotel. Do not stay here if you are expecting 4 or 5 star amenities. Our room was so hot! 79 degrees with hot air coming out and no way of fixing it. Maintenance tried to fix it but the room was SO hot. I heard the front desk talking to someone about a room being hot so we were not the only ones with this problem. We have stayed at high-end resorts and this hotel is not one of them.

title: Can easily do much better for the price.
text:
The nightly rate including all the extra feed was around $600 for the least expensive room. Room was nice enough. Slightly run down around the edges but fine. Started in an exterior room but the buskers outside made so much noise late in to the night that we moved to an interior room. 
Only reason I can see to book this place is if you absolutely LOVE being right at time square. If that's not your goal there are hundreds of other hotels with greater impact and amenities. 
I'm confused by a lot of the reviews as the amenities are basic. Mediocre coffee shot at the basement open til 2pm. No option to get a soda or snack other than to order it through room service, including getting some ice. Had a bunch of employees standing around the entrance but not a single doorman. 
First room service meal was a simple breakfast with lukewarm potatoes and eggs. Second meal was a very well done steak with lukewarm fries. 
Housekeeping did a great job. 
Resort fee is bogus. Includes 2 bottles of water and "tv" which is basic channels and archaic guide. Movies are extra. Includes a gym use, housekeeping. Basically all things that used to be included in your fee but now get charged for. 
I'd make a different choice unless TS is your focal point.

title: Christmas 2022
text: Great location, attentive staff! Cozy rooms, wonderful housekeepers! We had so much for Christmas! Hot Chocolate during the day and evening over looking Times Square! Can’t wait to come back in February ❤️

title: Waste of money.
text: Wow, what can I say… let’s start with the doormen that stand 10m away from the doors and give you a loving scowl as you walk in after you’ve pushed open a door that weighs the same as a small village. The concierge on the entrance doesn’t even make eye contact and proceeds to never look in your direction , even after you’ve said hello. Now I proceed to review the room. The mould in the shower is rather off putting , it’s not what you would expect from Forbes best hotel in my opinion. The open bin in the bathroom makes it rather off putting to discard of female sanitary products and the lack of amenities make it even more vile. The only positive thing is the location, thats the knickerbockers saving grace… all in all I wouldn’t touch it with a barge pole.

title: Worst value for money
text: The only thing going for this hotel is location, sadly its dated and in need of modernisation, lack of storage space wardrobe give the illusion of space but sadly lacks,at the price I have paid I would expect tea and coffee facilities. Sadly I am so disappointed.

title: Poor experience
text: Concierge - promised to send recommendations for dinner via email, never received although I gave him a $20 tip.  Housekeeping, three adults not enough towels, last night diff lotion than provided prior, cheap.  Room service, meet on a charcuterie board tasted rotten, fries cold, coffee in morning cold. Second time I’ve stayed there. It will be my last.

title: Best time...
text: Stayed at the Knickerbocker Hotel in December 22, just before Christmas. The location was fantastic, right in the centrre of things, meaning everything was easy to find and use. The hotel itself was outstanding and the people there magnificent - easily one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. We were so well looked after and nothing was too much trouble...

title: FANTASTIC Hotel
text: My wife and I spent three nights in the city to see a couple of shows and do what tourists do.  The staff was so courteous and helpful.  The room was excellent.  Loved the rooftop bar.  And you are just in the middle of it all!!  Shopping, shows, sights, restaurants are all within easy walking distance of the hotel.

title: Didn’t live up to expectations
text: When you book into a Leading Hotel of the World your expectations are high. Sadly, my room was next to the lift (I suppose somebody has to have that room!). The carpet was badly stained. There were no tea and coffee making facilities and when I enquired I was told that this had to be requested. Finally I received a coffee maker and coffee but no tea bags. On subsequent days I had to repeatedly request cups and coffee as they weren’t replaced. There is no welcome information so you have to figure out things for yourself

title: We loved it here
text: Me, my daughter and my husband stayed for 5 nights last week to celebrate my husband's special birthday.  Check in was smooth and quick and we received an upgraded room which was 1502.   The room was very spacious and extremely comfortable and quiet.   Room and bathroom were spotless and had everything you could possibly need.   The hotel is just off the main part of Times Square but its location is perfect.  There is a Target two minutes walk away and its got everything you could want.  We only used the room so I can not comment on the food or rooftop bar.   Upon check out my daughter got to pick a little gift from under the Christmas tree which was sweet.   We had a return transfer booked with our tour operator and he was running late and we were getting concerned.  Stephanie on the Concierge desk was absolutely brilliant she phoned them and was so thoughtful at putting our mind at rest so please thank her, she was priceless.  If you are coming to stay at The Knickerbocker you will not be disappointed.

title: Overpriced and clearly not 5 * and should not be part of the leading hotels of the world
text:
This hotel plays on its location at Times Square but that it about the only thing going for it.  Serious staffing problem but not at all reflected in the price.  Was there for 5 nights and one of the reasons we chose the hotel was the rooftop bar which was closed off to guests the whole time we were there as it was booked out for private events ???  The other bar was also overtaken with private events and there was standing room only. Restaurant service was atrocious, we waited over 30 mins to get served and even longer to sign the bill (should have walked!).  No tea or coffee making facilites in the room which for this category of hotel is unreal.  No doorman at the hotel and check in and check out were both laborious.  Noise form the corridor was incessant with people coming and going, would have expected better.  

The only good thing I can say about the hotel was the concierge and how friendly she was.  Will NEVER return to this hotel even at half the price, total rip off.

title: Excellent Hotel in Fantastic location
text:
Excellent hotel which felt clean, safe and welcoming. Superb location but still quiet and peaceful with no noise problems. Staff were all friendly and helpful and went out of their way to offer assistance.

Would be nice if they had tea making facilities but there’s lots of options locally for this so it didn’t bother us, just meant we spent more time outside.

Thanks to all the staff for making our stay a very happy one.

title: NOT a 5-star property. .. stay next door at the Hilton.
text:
Honestly just choose another hotel. How this place ever got 5 stars is beyond me. Here are a few of the reasons why:

The doorman was not at the door. For three full days we never saw him anywhere but chatting in the back with coworkers. This matters in NYC a lot…exhausted guests wrangling with bags and heavy doors while staff just enjoys their conversations was pretty annoying. 

Upon check in we had no toilet paper or tissues in the room. Pretty awkward and inexcusable. 

Our first showers in the room included mold falling off the plumbing fixtures ONTO us, and it took three calls and two days to get someone to “clean” it but they didn’t really fix the problem. There was so much mold buildup in there it seemed it hadn’t been cleaned for a very long time. 

No coffee in the room, the furniture is terrible quality and beat up and the drawers barely open or close. There was no bathroom door in our room - just a curtain. Which is sheer. Strange for a room with two queen beds - obviously not a couple using that room. There is a window in the shower with no blind, so morning sun came in the bathroom and shines right in the room with no door or way to stop it - exactly the opposite of what you want in a hotel room. 

At one point, someone spilled a cup of coffee in the elevator so the staff, instead of just wiping it up, propped open the elevator door for what may have been an hour which made the other elevators useless - all in a Monday morning during checkout. I was tempted to get some paper towels and help them out. So stupid. 

I kept wishing we had chosen the Hilton Garden Inn right next door. I bet their bathrooms aren’t moldy and they probably have a coffee maker in the room. 

In addition to the property problems and the lazy staff, there was an issue with my reservation and even though I had an email confirmation IN MY HAND, the hotel did not honor it. I had changed my checkin and checkout dates and instead of doing what was right for the guest, they informed me that I had been charged for a no-show the night before and I had to pay for my third night.

I spent hours and hours trying to rectify the situation during our vacay. No one - not even the GM - was empowered to do the right thing for me and stop making me work on their problem. In the end I locked my credit card so they couldn’t charge me. 

Just choose somewhere else - the five star rating doesn’t translate and there are plenty of places to choose from in Times Square.

title: Fantastic time in NYC
text: Great hotel, centrally located.  Short of staff sometimes, we waited a long time for the bellboy to collect our luggage from the room.  Other than that all good! Staff at reception were great, the bar was awesome

title: Our December Getaway
text:
Nothing beats the Knick.  It's a special combination of class, location and style.  Topping if off are the talented and professional staff.  They get it right all the time and every time. 
Highly recommended!

title: Great Location
text:
The location is perfect to enjoy Manhattan and Times Square. The staff is professional, helpful - overall awesome. The entire hotel is clean including rooms. They let us do a late check out and that was greatly appreciated. They provide nice toiletries in the rooms and slippers and robes. 

The amenities are lacking. Restaurant and roof top bar close too early for a hotel in Times Square. Breakfast is sub par at the cafe. Even though the gym is open 24 hours, you have to go down to the front desk to ask to let you up to the 4th floor after hours. The city view is of another building. To pay extra for that is silly, which we did, and would not do again.

title: Excellent hotel, amazing concierge team
text:
We have had the most amazing honeymoon in New York City. The Knickerbocker hotel was brilliant, the room was spacious and clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Bottled water is also provided for free.

The best part of the Knickerbocker was the concierge service. Diana and Jay went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed, including making reservations for us at restaurants and recommending places to go. They were so friendly and made our stay so special. 

I couldn’t recommend this hotel more. Hopefully we will be back soon!

Thank you to the staff at the Knickerbocker, and a very special thank you to Jay and Diana.

title: Great Upscale Hotel
text: Great near Times Square location. Rooms really are sound proof. Loved the bar staff in the lounge. This was a second stay and we will be back. The only bummer was not finding out until we arrived that the hotel does not offer valet parking or any inside parking. We had to park at a lot down the street but we survived.

title: Excellent location but some things could be improved
text:
On arrival struggled in through heavy doors - no doorman. Receptionist’s first words were ‘ I need your credit card for your room’ Hardly a warm welcome. Took cases to our room ourselves.
The hotel wasn’t very festive- more effort needed.
No nice lobby.
The room was lovely, super comfy bed and gorgeous bathroom with excellent little luxuries provided. Housekeeping excellent. 
No coffee maker in room tho one was provided immediately we asked.
Roof top bar was delightful.
We felt the hotel could reflect its history as it was rather corporate.
Top marks to the employee who advised us on airport journey and offered helpful tips to enhance our holiday.
Excellent location.

title: Great Hotel!
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from thanksgiving. The location is amazing. Staff very helpful. Rooms are huge, comfy beds, everything we wanted and more. Very modern hotel. Clean and great amenities. Will definitely recommend to others.

title: Consigliatissimo
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per la prima volta.La posizione è top perché a 2 passi da Time Square quindi comodissima.IL personale tutto molto gentilee super professionale.Le camere belle e pulitissime con Doccia spaziosa e comoda.Veramente consigliato!

title: Hotel muy céntrico
text:
Ubicación perfecta, hotel situado en el centro de Manhattan, habitaciones muy amplias ( difícil de encontrar en nyc) hotel bastante nuevo, una terraza muy agradable para poder tomar algo, 
Servicio agradable y profesional, seguro q repetiremos

title: City break
text:
We’ve recently returned from a 5 night stay. We felt the staff could have been a little more attentive for the quality/rating and cost of the hotel however no real problems. We found the staff to be quite rude on check out which has promoted this comment, especially when it’s your last encounter. Unfortunately I didn’t get the ladies name but the young lady who works on the front desk was really helpful and attentive. 

Really spacious rooms with the most comfortable beds! Slept a dream. The room was kept clean with a nighttime downturn service also. 

Despite being in such a busy area we heard no noise at all in the hotel and room. 

Both bars offer a good choice of drinks, they are on the more expensive side but this is to be expected. We did not eat at the hotel.  

Pleasant stay overall.

title: Really enjoyed our stay
text: We were here for a conference and would have never found this hotel otherwise.  We really enjoyed the location and the hotel.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Will definitely be back and will recommend this hotel.

title: zero service
text: I stayed at the hotel about 3 weeks and will not go into all the details of how bad my stay was..but I contacted them on IG to state how bad it was and they said they would contact me back...never heard a word. Another words they do not care and their customer lack of service is terribile..if you want service do not stay here, if you want a bathroom where things are not full of mold and not taped to together do not stay here. if you want help with your bags so not stay here. If you want more than one elevator working do not stay here. if you want a clean and not stained hangar do not stay here. if you want any information about the hotel when checking in do not stay here..

title: Thanksgiving week vacation
text: This hotel is great. The price was on the lower side for a 5-star hotel in NYC. Every person we encountered was very kind and help. And the room was phenomenal - modern and the decor is sparse (on purpose), depending more on clean lines and lighting for a beautiful and welcoming experience. Sheets, comforters, pillows, towels were all high quality and the shower was top-notch, which is crucial in a city where you walk a lot. Location is perfect for sightseeing. For sure would stay again.

title: Excellent Stay At The Knickerbocker
text:
We stayed at this lovely hotel at the very beginning of November, for four nights. We arrived in the evening and were greeted warmly by staff, who informed us we’d been given an upgrade and this meant that we had a view over Times Square. 
The room was clean and spacious and though we were overlooking a really busy street, we were able to sleep really well and were not disturbed at all. 
Housekeeping was excellent and really attentive, turning down the beds at night and checking to see if everything was ok. 
We found all staff really polite and helpful throughout our stay. This continued after our departure: our son had left two expensive items in the room and as soon as I alerted the hotel to this, their communication was excellent. They arranged for the items to be shipped internationally and they were back with us within a week. 
This is an excellent hotel. We will definitely stay here again when we return to New York.

title: We want ice and cold water
text:
We’re still here, room 516, and checking out tomorrow morning, 11/26. Overall, the hotel is great, however, our biggest problem is that this is the first hotel ever where we’ve had no ice buckets in the rooms, or ice machines anywhere in the hotel. Even the Venetian in Vegas had ice buckets and ice machines in every floor. I understand the lack of coffee makers and microwaves inside the rooms, because they want you to spend money at the hotel’s restaurants, but for God’s sake, what if you get up at 2 AM with the urge of having a cold glass of water? Do you call room service and spend $6 plus tip on a bottle of water, and stay up for 30 minutes waiting for it to get delivered? 

It just doesn’t make any sense!

On a positive note, Juan and Ricardo at the Charlie Palmer Bar on the 4th floor are the BEST! These two guys are very professional, personable, friendly, and funny! Without these two there, that Bar would never be the same!

title: Convenient Location
text: The location makes it easy to go uptown or downtown. Our check-in was easy.  Our room was stylish and comfortable.  The Knickerbocker pays attention to details that make your stay that much nicer.  I would definitely stay there again.

title: First class service
text: My stay was wonderful.  The personnel were professional and kind.  The rooftop bar was amazing! The location is a short walk to so many places.  We will definitely stay there next time we’re in Manhattan!

title: Great Service
text: Always staff were very accommodating when we needed anything at all. Upgraded our room since it was our wedding anniversary. In room dining were very quickly to respond when we requested ice, coffee, wine etc. Maid service was very thorough.

title: Oasis on Times Square
text:
I loved everything about this modern minimalistic hotel (maybe not the view of the neighbouring building from our room but I half expected this and after all – does it really matter with all the views you will experience during your time in NYC?)
Stayed for 3 nights in their standard room – we were given a lovely spacious room with the comfiest bed I’ve every experienced in a hotel.  The hotel is 5 stars in my opinion – the staff were all lovely, the room spotless and well appointed – large TV, USB charging outlets, large wardrobe with lighting inside - iron, ironing board, robes & slippers, sofa,  work area, in-room dining available, digital safe, umbrella, good hairdryer for a hotel.  Lovely bathroom – separate walk-in shower and separate WC.  Large sink area and lots of towels and lovely toiletries.  We had a cocktail or two in the rooftop St Cloud bar which is worth it.  Do be prepared for the Times Square location – very busy but this hotel really is an oasis.  We used yellow cabs to get from JFK and back – the fixed rate fee takes the stress out of the journey – it cost us around $64 each way all in.

title: Amazing Views!
text: The Knickerbocker is a phenomenal hotel! 10/10 would recommend! The room, location, and view was nice. The rooftop bar lounge was a plus. The entire staff was very friendly and accommodating. I would go again when I am back in New York!

title: Çok Rahat Ettik,Ailece
text: Konum mükemmel, Temizlik mükemmel, Çalışanlar mükemmel. Yataklar inanılmaz rahat. Güvenlik her açıdan iyi kontrol altında ve insana huzur veriyor. Bizi iyi ağırladılar iyi misafirperverliği gösterdiler teşekkür ediyoruz tekrardan görüşmek üzere

title: Spectacular
text: My family and I just concluded our fourth stay at The Knickerbocker. It is a spectacular hotel. The concierges, Stephanie, J and Diana are world class and share their knowledge and expertise of the City. At the front door, Andre, Hector and KJ go out of their way to provide a great family atmosphere and provide whatever help is needed.  The location and amenities are wonderful but it is the people at the Knickerbocker that make it a special place.  I recommend it wholeheartedly.

title: A little past it’s prime
text: Stayed for three nights on a business trip .  Great location right next to times square and walking distance to many things .  The housekeeping service was super responsive and great, the front desk not so much. Several times I called and the phone just rang 10 to 12 times before I hung up.  The room I was in had some severe drainage problems out of the shower, and the tile in the shower was also cracked such that I could see back into the wall. This has obviously been going on for a while given the dry rot I could see.  The location of the room was such that the Wi-Fi connection was not strong enough to support my VPN, and the cell signal was quite weak as well as it was stuck down between two buildings.  But, housekeeping stated that they had many rooms available….

title: Knickerbocker a win
text: Knickerbocker treats you well.  From the comfy chairs to sit in as you check in, to luxurious rooms, it was a win for us. We were upgraded to a suite which was nice to have a little extra room since it was a rainy weekend when we were there.  Very centrally located to Bryant Square, the broadway theatres and Hell’s Kitchen for dinners.  Short walk to Rockefeller Center and right next to subway entrance. Couldn’t ask for more.

title: Location
text: Have stayed here multiple times in the last 12 months. Excellent location cannot be beat. The coffee shop is open now. The hotel is very quiet given its location, but city-view rooms will let in a bit more noise than non-city view rooms. This is mostly evident on Saturday nights and if you hear anything, it will likely be a car engine being revved to show off a loud exhaust or something similar. The hotel has been increasing room prices throughout the year as demand increases, but this is also true of all of the NYC properties I checked out for this trip. They now have turn down service, but it did not happen on Saturday night and no explanation was provided. It did take place every other night so not sure what that's about. Not a huge deal when you come back to the room late at night and tired and just want to sleep but a bit disappointing given the rates you pay. I enjoy that this is a historic property as well.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Room was well appointed, exemplary tech, great shower. No refreshments in suite, but you can order from the rooftop lounge, or restaurant on the 4th floor. Staff was exceptional. Food was fresh. Peloton bikes were available in the fitness studio, so I was able to maintain my streak on the go. Great location for a weekend getaway to NYC. Steps to Times Square and all that the vicinity has to offer. My third stay at the Knick so far, and looking forward to the next trip.

title: Luxury in Times Squatr
text: Perfect location of this luxurious hotel, most must see landmarks a short walk away.  Great hotel team from doormen to reception, staff in bars and coffee bar, nothing too much trouble. Cloud bar worth a visit.  Can’t wait to return!

title: We expected more
text: We had to change rooms because the blind wasn’t working which took far too long. The hotel does not provide water in the rooms nor does the hotel have a small store to buy necessities. The hotel lacks information about where to find coffee, fitness, and other amenities. There is no information in the rooms and the lobby attendants are not well informed to assist you with much of anything. Overall it felt like a disconnected place to stay. They are not helpful in obtaining transportation either. It was cold and average, not worth going back to.

title: A Marriott would be Better at half the Price
text:
I grew up in NY, am a Leader’s Club member, and avoided the Knickerbocker because of the location. But on reading reviews I saw it had been recently renovated and was quiet (my number 1 requirement), and I thought that because it was the old Astor mansion, it would be an interesting and different hotel, as many Leading Hotels of the World properties are. Was I ever wrong. I could have stayed at the Marriott for half the price and it would have been better. I entered the hotel and the Concierge who was busy looking at her phone never looked up and never greeted me. (and again, not once the whole stay). I was escorted past a bank of plain elevators, not the Beaux Arts building I was led to believe, where a disinterested staff member checked me in, and seemed annoyed when I asked if there was an upgrade available. It looked like NY office building from the last century. There was nothing wrong with the room but there was nothing special either. No coffee maker, no mini bar,  bare shelves, none of the nice amenities that one associates with a luxury hotel. The bathroom amenities were scant, half were missing, and the ones that were there looked like Best Western bottles and smelled like my grandmother. 
I arrived after a long trip and looked forward to a relaxing cocktail in the lounge. The 'bartender' (who in all fairness was doing his best), took my order of an Aperol Spritz, arguably the most popular cocktail in the world. He took out a champagne flute? and a shaker?! So I nicely asked him if he knew how to make it. His response revealed he did not and he apologized saying he was just a server. Clearly he had been corraled into this against his will, but was a team player. I explained how to make it and he tried, but it was awful, it was served without a garnish, without ice and no napkin. I got a 'discount' but still, there was no way I should have been charged for that drink.  
The next morning, at a truly sub-par breakfast, 3 of the servers got into quite the shouting match in the middle of the dining room. Nice look. The food and the coffee were dreadful. Denny's would have been better.
That night the Broadway drummer (you know, those guys that bang on plastic tubs in the street) was below my window making the most gawdawful racket til after midnight. Windows were definitely not soundproof. 
I was charged $300 for my 5 lb dog!!! I have had far better experiences at a Marriott. I cannot fathom how LHW could include this in their portfolio of beautiful hotels that pride themselves on treating their guests well. It was just dreadful. Even if they get their staffing problems under control, you can definitely do better in the NYC luxury market.

title: Amazing and Luxurious!
text: This hotel was amazing! The aesthetic was pleasing! And the customer service was nice! I absolutely cannot wait to return! Perfect location to theater, restaurants, and shopping!!! The Knickerbocker is one of the kind.

title: Great location
text: Our first visit to New York. We chose this hotel primarily for its location and we were not disappointed. We had a suite with views of Times Square which was amazing. The service was impeccable and the hotel exceptionally clean and well maintained. Would definitely recommend this hotel and we will return.

title: Knickerbocker Hotel
text: This is a historical hotel right in the centre of New York convenient for attractions and restaurants. Excellent soundproofing of the rooms ensured that no outside noise disturbed us. Our room was comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Great stay
text: My family and I were impressed by the overall cleanliness of the lobby, common areas and particularly the room.  Every staff member we encountered were friendly and helpful.  The location of the hotel was convenient.  Overall, it was an excellent experience.

title: Loved It
text:
Check-In went very smoothly.  I was very impressed by the halls on the way to our room.  Very clean and quiet.  When  we got to our room, the doorman brought our bags and made sure that we had everything that we needed.  The room and bathroom was so clean.  We wanted a good NYC experience in Times Square as well as other parts of NYC.  We got good recommendations on places to eat in Harlem and Queens.  

The staff went above and beyond.  The location is great.  

I would definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC!

title: Excellent hotel!
text: Fantastic hotel very clean at all times. Lovely staff. Beautiful roof terrace &  Excellent location!  We would definitely return nothing was too much trouble. Drinks where a little pricey but you are in the perfect location of New York.

title: Great time at the Knickerbocker Hotel
text: We had a great stay and the staff was very helpful and friendly, the concierge team really took care of us.  They gave some great recommendation for dining and other activities along with assisting in directions. Plus bagels and coffee in the hotel cafe' was good.

title: Nice hotel, great location, lackluster service
text: This hotel has the potential to be great, but the staff lacks the service-minded attention to detail that you would expect at a 5-star hotel. This hotel should just be marketed as a 4-star property so expectations would be better aligned with reality. The hotel is clean, in a great location, with a super cool rooftop lounge. We stayed in a suite that was very big for NYC standards but lacked a minibar and even simple things like coffee and tea. Overall, I would recommend this hotel but there are better options in NYC if service is a priority for you.

title: Underwhelming
text:
Just a bit underwhelming really.

Was really excited about our stay at the Knickerbocker and on the whole it wasn't bad but the little things that make for a really outstanding hotel experience were missing.

The Good
- room was great, family of four in two queen sized beds with effective air conditioning, very comfortable.
- cookies and milk for the kids on a (late) arrival from UK was a nice touch.
- grab and go breakfast bar was fast and convenient
- cocktails were pricey but delicious
- staff all courteous and helpful.

Less than good
- both bars were tatty and in need of some tlc - ripped seating and chipped tables etc.
- concierge service was non existent, seemed to have no taxi relationship, we ended up walking to grand central and queueing there.  Asked them to recommend a good, small family run Italian restaurant locally, response was "just go to the meatpacking district and pick one", we found a good one but it was more luck than judgement.
- after a long day walking headed back to the famed rooftop bar for a drink, popular spot but we were dumped on a rather cramped table with poor view when lots of better, comfier options were available.  Being a resident held no priorities.  Suspect we weren't "cool" enough.

On  the whole, for the money, a forgettable experience, wouldn't go back.

title: Great hotel and excellent service. Very conveniently located
text: Great hotel and excellent service. Very conveniently located. Close to Times Square and broadway. Steps from Nasdaq. The breakfast was given in the form of credit of $25 per day which I utilized at a single time as I stayed for 2 days.

title: Great hotel in convenient location
text: We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, there was plenty of storage and a very well appointed bathroom. The staff were helpful and friendly. It is well located for exploring Manhattan with a subway station on the doorstep.

title: Updated classic hotel on 42nd street and Times Square
text: A phenomenal hotel experience in a classic Hotel on 42nd Street and Times Square.  We stayed in a corner suite on the 9th floor. Great room with over 600 square feet overlooking Times Square and 42nd Street.  The guest room was spectacular, as well as the amazing updated, modern bathroom!!!!   Housekeeping visited 3 times a day to clean and bring amenities to the room.   We never saw them or heard them during a 7 day stay.  Very extraordinary. It is notable that I mention housekeeping first. They are underappreciated and undervalued, but they can make the hotel experience very special. They are there everyday and can make your stay memorable. The concierge desk was amazing with advice, reservations and great tickets for whatever we wanted to do or see.   The doormen were very helpful with good advice on nearby, walkable diners for breakfast, simple lunches, as well as navigating the subway system or helping stop traffic on 42nd Street for us to cross and catch our lyft ride.  A terrific location with modern, technologically up-to-date rooms including high broadband wifi as well as remote controlled black-out shades and remote controlled lighting levels.  All the staff were thoughtful, helpful and, again, special kudos to the housekeeping staff that made returning to our room a joy.  I would highly recommend this hotel for location, service and value (space and ambience) for the price.  As an aside, it’s a half block to the 42nd Street station for subway #7 to Jackson Heights in Queens; free transfer to the bus, Q70, to LaGuardia Airport.   WOW, 45 minutes for $2.75 vs the lyft ride at an 1 hour, 10 minutes for over $100 dollars.   Easy, seamless and inexpensive.  Subways are cheap, safe and great!!!!  Statistically, you are way more likely to be in a fatal car accident on the drive to LaGuardia Airport than having ANY trouble on the subway.  Just sayin’ “.

title: An oasis of calm and luxury
text: We have just returned home from a 6 night stay at the Knickerbocker. Given the location I had warned my children not to expect much space in the room as there would be 4 of us sharing. We were genuinely shocked how much  space we had and I was like I guess I got that wrong. The hotel and amenities were pure luxury. I feel like we were truly spoiled and would struggle to stay anywhere else when we return. We really appreciated the text message from Brandon to check in on us and we did message back with a few queries. The responses were always super fast. Thank you. You remembered that it was our sons 18th birthday and someone came to the room with a cake when we arrived for him which was a lovely touch. Enjoyed a lovely cocktail on the rooftop bar and the views were just amazing. The only improvement I could suggest was our check in experience. It was functional but not warm and welcoming. It took us awhile to work out what we needed to do in the lift with the key to get to the room. We could have done with a bit more guidance. Wouldn’t put us off though. We loved everything about the hotel. Thank you for an amazing stay

title: Beautiful and Clean Modern Hotel
text: I very much enjoyed my stay at the hotel. There was a bit of a bottleneck at check in but the staff was very friendly. The room was stunning and very modern. Housekeeping made sure you had everything you needed and that the room was cleaned when I wanted. The daily bottles of water was a nice touch. The staff at the bar on the fourth floor was a bit stressed out and was sometimes rude to guests. However, the drinks were good. I'll be back.

title: Perfect hotel for Times Square
text: Most Times Square hotels are cramped, loud and not the greatest.  The KB redefines that with great rooms, amenities, quiet and the staff are amazing.  The rooftop restaurant and bar is also a great place to hang out.  Definitely going back.

title: A Great Five days at the Knickerbocker
text:
My wife and I spent 5 days at the Knickerbocker Hotel. From the moment we arrive we were made to feel very welcome by the friendly and helpful staff from the doorman to the duty manager.
Our room was spacious, very clean and best of all quiet which was a real boon as we were were working everyday till quite late at night. 
The only downside was the lack of hotel dining facilities but these were being completed as we were there and there were many alternative eating places within a few hundred yards of the main entrance.
All in all a very pleasant and enjoyable stay

title: Great experience
text: We had a great stay at the Knickerbocker. The location was excellent. Very centralized and right in time square. Room was wxcellent and suites my family perfectly. The staff was immensely helpful. Highly recommend

title: Fabulous Girlfriends Getaway
text: Our group of 12 friends stayed at the Knickerbocker for 3 fantastic nights! The helpful staff, great location and wonderful amenities were outstanding. The breakfast buffet was delicious and we really enjoyed the rooftop bar and patio. It was my first time in New York and I can’t wait to return!

title: Dirty
text:
Take a look at a deluxe king room for almost $700 per night
They would change my room but to a down grade. How much worse can you get.  Black mold all over the air grate. All they could say is they would alert housekeeping. Don’t waste your money

title: Hidden Fees
text: There is a $50.00 residence fee. No idea what this is for other than to jack up the daily rate over what is advertised. Maybe soon there will be a daily rate of $75.00 with a $600.00 residence fee. Otherwise very good service, cleanliness and value.

title: Beyond Fabulous!
text: Divine property. All needs and comforts are considered in our gorgeous room. I mean, it's extraordinarily well-appointed with what is needed and the things I didn't realize I valued. I have never experienced customer service quite like the Knickerbocker. Marcelo greeted us as if we were old friends and took better care of us than I have room to write. He took it upon himself to bring up ice when he learned I broke my toe. Then he sent goodies when he learned it was our anniversary!! What?? Paola at the front desk not only accommodated our needs, but she (the front desk) also texted to see what else they could do or provide to improve our stay. We travel quite a bit, but I have NEVER in all my years felt more welcome and cared for. The location is second to none in NYC, but that seems almost secondary to the facility and staff. Even the concierge, Stephanie, was helpful about the surprising best ways to get around town and what shows to see, things to do, etc. We are dazzled and will stay here going forward.

title: Aus meiner Perspektive sicher keine 5 Sterne
text:
Wir hatten eine Corner Junior Suite, das Zimmer war schön groß und hatte viele Fenster mit Aussicht und zum Glück eine gute Verdunkelung. Für die Lage war es auch relativ ruhig. Apropos Lage, die ist natürlich top direkt am Times Square. So weit so gut. 

Nun zu den Kritikpunkten:
- Die Qualität der Bettwaren entsprach nicht meinen Erwartungen; die einfache Bettdecke war zwischen zwei einfachen Laken eingepackt, das hält über Nacht natürlich nicht und man hat am Ende lauter einzelne Laken und eine Bettdecke ohne Bezug. Bei 5 Sternen erwarte ich Daunendecken und hochwertige Bettwäsche. 
- Oberflächlich war alles sauber, aber das Sofa hatte Flecken / war teilweise speckig, die Dusche roch ein bisschen muffig, die Fugen waren teilweise nicht mehr weiß. Schade. 
- Es gab kein Duschgel / kein Shampoo, ich musste erst danach fragen. 
- Es gab zwar ein Bügelbrett samt Bügeleisen, aber weder Gläser noch die Möglichkeit, sich einen Kaffee oder Tee zuzubereiten. Der Kühlschrank war leer. Zwei kleine Wasserflaschen wurden nur auf Nachfrage aufgefüllt. Bei der happigen Resort Fee wäre es schön, eine spürbare Gegenleistung zu bekommen. Wir sind von anderen Hotels in NYC einen ganz anderen Standard gewohnt (morgendlicher Kaffee, nachmittags wine hour, Minibar inklusive, …).
- Wir waren für 5 Nächte hier und es gab weder einen Welcome Letter noch irgendeine Aufmerksamkeit. 5 Sterne? Nein. 
- Die Rezeption ist sehr versteckt und schon dadurch fehlt ein “Willkommen-Gefühl”, was dadurch verstärkt wird, dass selten mal ein Mitarbeiter an der Tür anzutreffen ist; niemand begrüßt einen, niemand hält die Tür auf, niemand ruft einem ein Taxi - man ist hier auf sich allein gestellt. 5-Sterne-Service? Habe ich hier nicht erlebt. 
- Alles wirkt ein bisschen in die Jahre gekommen. 

Das mögen kleine Punkte sein, aber es sind doch einige und bei 5 Sternen erwarte ich einfach mehr. Es war ein Versuch, aber wir werden nicht wieder herkommen.

title: Perfection!
text: Everything about The Knickerbocker was perfect! The staff was amazing and went above and beyond with anything we asked. Our room was spectacular, quiet, comfortable, and very clean. We can’t wait to visit again! Perfect spot for NYE Celebration!

title: Best Stay Ever
text: My daughters and I went to New York for our annual girl's trip! We choose the Knickerbocker and we are thrilled we did as they treated us like royalty. It was beautiful, luxurious, and quiet in our room. The staff was friendly and helpful throughout our entire stay. We will definitely stay again in the future.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: The Knickerbocker was a lovely hotel. I was in town for a business trip. The location was fantastic. The room was quiet and cozy. It did not feel like there was a busy street outside. It felt like an escape to a relaxing vacation even though I was working. Thank you for the cozy feel during a busy time.

title: A lovely stay
text: After a hiccup upon check in, our stay was great. Every staff member that we interacted with was fantastic. Everyone was kind, professional and knowledgeable. And, the room and bathroom were immaculate. A wonderful birthday trip.

title: Fantastic stay in New York
text: Lovely hotel, great location, great rooms and nice staff. Our two rooms were really lovely. Great air conditioning. Quiet for New York. Location amazing, walk across the road to Times Square. Subway station close by. Door men were really helpful. Big thank you to Jimmy who was really helpful. Concierge was really helpful getting us great tickets to shows.  Breakfast was ok. Charlie Parker Steak across the road had excellent steak.

title: Grand lady
text: This is another return visit for us and we still love this hotel.  Super clean and chock full of amenities.  Close to everything, but quiet and tranquil inside.  Love it and highly recommend.  Walk to the theaters and enjoy the nightlife

title: Exceeding expectations
text: First family trip to NYC - we were please with everything about our stay. Out of all the things we appreciated at The Knickerbocker, the hands down favorite was the shower! Giant streams of high pressure water, micro adjustable temperature perfection. Glorious. Super clean room and public areas. Plenty of fast elevators. Desk and Bell staff are courteous, professional and attentive. Easy walking & subway access to city landmarks and dining. I thought that it would be much noisier in Times Square but the outside noise is negligible. Worth the $.

title: Amazing find! Best room in NYC!
text: I lived in NYC for 5 years and have spent hundreds of nights in Manhattan hotel rooms over the years. This was the first time I’ve ever stayed at the Knickerbocker as I typically avoid the tourist crowds associated with the theatre district. The rooms at the Knickerbocker make the location well worth it. It’s actually so close to 6th Ave that the location is not an issue—the hotel is very close to Bryant Park and is across from the new Bank of America HQ. The room was huge and the bathroom was definitely 5-stars. This was the largest, best appointed room I’ve seen in Midtown. The check-in was a breeze and the staff were terrific. I even ran into a very friendly and super famous Food Network hostess in the elevator! The Knickerbocker is truly an oasis in Times Square!

title: Best place to stay!
text: Everyone was so nice. We mentioned it was my husband’s birthday and they upgraded us to early check in. KJ brought us to our room and showed us the amenities and how to operate the blackout shades (this was super nice to have in Time’s Square) and talked with us a bit. Made us feel right at home. They surprised my husband with a piece of cake on his birthday which was so thoughtful. They arranged a car for our early ride to the airport. They really know how to take care of people. I can’t wait to come back. I’ll never stay anywhere else! You guys are really the best!

title: A very well run and accommodating hotel.
text: My two sons and I shared a queen double. It was well designed and comfortable. There was no view, but that was not a problem tho would have preferred one. Staff was excellent and warm. Had never stayed there before, but would again. Only concern is location which is smack in center of times sq area.  It served our purposes but right out the door is pretty hectic. But again a very good establishment with employees who are looking to make sure you enjoy your stay. We def have it thumbs up.

title: Wonderful Experience!
text: First, the location is awesome! I and my wife spent 6 nights. Overall the hotel is incredible, with good staff, a nice room with good space, a perfect bed and shower, and excellent cleaning and care, the amenities really have good quality, so, the experience was perfect!

title: Los precios de las habitaciones han subido considerablemene, los servicios ofrecidos ya no son los mismos
text:
El Hotel esta muy bien ubicado, las habitaciones, 721, muy bien insonorizadas, el desayuno carísimo y monótono. Después de siete pernoctaciones te cansas de desayunar las mismas cosas. 
La profesionalidad del personal es pobre y se detecta nerviosismo de no abarcar las peticiones de los clientes. Somos huéspedes que repetimos experiencias y notamos que hay diferencias sustanciales con años anteriores. La cafetería cerrada, el coktail por las tardes en el Hall del Hotel suspendido. 
Si quieren mantener y fidelizar clientes deben volver a los estándares de servicio de calidad.

title: Passable Room with awful front of house service
text: My friends were visiting from London and had never been to the US. So, I decided to take them to NYC to show them the best of the Country. I chose the Knickerbocker for its reviews and also, the location had seemed useful, and it had come recommended by my boyfriend. We arrived to the hotel via the Acela at about 4:45pm and had rented a junior suite as there were three of us and I wanted it to be as luxe as possible. Our room wasn't ready. We had just fought our way through the hottest, loudest, overwhelming Times Square crowds, with a lot of luggage and were sweaty and very casually dressed. Not to speak of my friends' jet lag.  The check-in agent offered ZERO apology. Just a "Yeah, room's not ready yet. We'll give you these drinks coupons for the roof deck while you wait. Giving us two coupons each. Keep in mind that we all needed showers and to freshen up before being public facing and this rooftop bar was filled with smartly dressed millennial Euro types. We were entirely underdressed and self conscious. We walked out onto the roof deck and a man blew a full exhale of cigar smoke right into my face. The smoking section is placed immediately at the entrance to the bar. We lumbered around awkwardly to the non-smoking section which was basked in hot sun, and found seats. We tried to order the champagne that we would have ordered if paying for our drinks and were immediately told that we could only buy drinks priced to $20. So, basically, drinks we didn't want were comped to us by the non-fussed front desk agent. We got in another argument with the waitress who was completely unapologetic and finally went and got approval for us to get what we wanted. (Even when I had offered to pay the difference in price, we weren't allowed to do that! So, the "comped drinks" did nothing to assuage our anger, but only made us more angry.) We finally got into our room at about 6pm. This is a day we paid about $1k for, and we were only allowed access at 6pm.   The room had a view of a warehouse 10' from our windows and garbage dumpsters at ground zero. It was equipped with 2 coffee cups. 2 of each size towels and one set of soaps and shampoos. In a Suite. Our whole stay was a disaster. They later comped us breakfast for both mornings, which was the only saving grace. However, even that wasn't entirely useful, as it precluded me from showing my friends a diner I had planned to take them to. I slept on the pull out sofa and it was straight out of 1972. Painful.

title: Ordentlich aber nicht besonders sauber
text: Bad und Dusche sind nicht besonders gepflegt. Schwarze und braune Stellen in den Ritzen der Dusche und am Waschbecken. Bademäntel waren ausgefranst. Sonst völlig normale, einfache Ausstattung. Nicht 5 Sterne Luxus.

title: Wonderful
text: Me and my friends were very welcome by Paola from the reception. Everyday, she was ready to help us in ALL situations. Wonderful experience Thanks her and her kindness with us brazilians. I strongly recomend The hotel because of first The staff, and Then because of The rooftop and The localization .

title: Outstanding Service from a High Quality Property
text: The staff provided exceptional service. They went out of their way to help me throughout my stay. Paola, Ariellee, and Brandon were attentive, knowledgeable, and professional. They went 'above and beyond' to make sure my stay was comfortable. The hotel is beautiful and the location is excellent.

title: Excelente Hotel
text: No checking, fomos atendidos pela Paola!!!!! Quanta gentileza, prontidão para ajudar em todas as nosssas dúvidas, competente e com ótimas indicações de restaurantes; também como chegar aos lugares ( museus, shows, etc ). O hotel é perfeito! Vale cada estrela! Tem um rooftop sensacional, chamado St Cloude! Vista linda! Super recomendo a hospedagem!

title: מצויין!
text:
מלון מעולה, חדרים גדולים ומרווחים מה שלא אופייני בניו יורק כלל. 
החדרים נקיים, הצוות אדיב והמיקום של המלון מושלם, 4 דק הליכה מהטיים סקוור, ועדיין ממוקם נמוך יחסית ומאפשר גישה נוחה לרחוב 34 ונמוך יותר. 
על גג המלון קיים רופ טופ עם נוף משוגע!
ללא ספק אחזור שוב!!

title: Surprisingly ordinary
text:
So not sure what I was expecting but 5 stars doesn’t really cut it at The Knickerbocker.
The building from the outside looks amazing but inside there was little that could be considered charming or of value.
There was definitely a lack of staff but truly it was the management of staff as well as the set up that were of fault here.
The 2 points I gave was in consideration for us being out of Covid as otherwise the score and the number of days I would have stayed would have been less.
Specifically simple things like having straws for drinks in the bar, being able to accommodate a requirement for cups / glasses for the room without asking 4 times and then being told that guest services were extremely busy. We initially asked for the cups at 2pm and then again at 5pm etc.. finally arriving after 9pm.
Loved NYC as always and it’s reinvention every time we come. But won’t be staying at this hotel again. There are better hotels and easier ways to enjoy your break.
So, so long The Knickerbocker but see you soon NYC.

title: Trip to the US Open
text:
The Rooms was too small, the limited counter space made it difficult to House the Coffee Machine and Microwave. The Staff was wonderful and responsive to all request.  The Shower leaked water on the outside causing a pool of water (I used towels to dry). The location was the selling point, close to shopping, dining, and public transportation.
Will Stay again, but in a larger room with a view.

title: Genial!
text: Tiene muy rico desayuno, con lo Justo y necesario con  buenos productos. Habitación espaciosa y realmente linda. Y la gente de la recepción muy amable, paola una Genia, muy predispuesta. Gran ubicación si queres estar cerca de Times Square, donde los locales cierran más tarde que en otros lados . Además de estar Cerca de Bryant Park que es hermoso .

title: Gran estadía
text:
Estuve alojada en The Knickerbocker New York por primera vez y fue una excelente experiencia 
El hotel está en muy buenas condiciones, la atención de Paola Stoja en la recepción desde el momento que llegue fue tan cordial que hicieron que la estadía sea más linda aún. 
El desayuno es super completo y delicioso 
Recibieron sin cargo alguno las compras que hice previamente a llegar al alojamiento 
La ubicación del hotel es perfecta, subtle en la esquina y cerca de todos lados
Gracias por el buen servicio del hotel, volveré!

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in a great location for those wanting to be near all the action without the noise and chaos of being in the middle of Times Square. The rooms are nice but we were a bit underwhelmed by the lack of amenities to what we were expecting for the price. We also only had 1 towel so had to call to request another. The staff are polite but the relationship between reception and the bellmen is a bit disconnected - with only one person helping with bags it took us a while to pick ours up because the reception staff couldn't help while he was busy. Overall I'd still stay here again because it's clean, convenient and comfy. There is a bit of noise but definitely nothing as bad as if you were right in the heart of Times Square. I also missed out on the rooftop bar this time which was a shame and can't wait to see next time.

title: Best place seen ever
text:
Came for roof top fun for our 60th birthdays in New York!!
Johir is the best server ever!!!  We saw the ball and enjoyed drinks on the roof top. Food was delicious we will come back next time for sure!!

title: Best choice in Midtown NY
text: Spacious and modern rooms, noise-proof windows, good service, very gentle, friendly and effective staff, excellent front desk service, 24 hours fitness room. Not comparable with any other choices in Times Square area.

title: Elegant location in mid-town
text: Beautiful hotel remarkably quiet for being next to Times square. Good size rooms, modern style, up to date and clean. Friendly and service-minded staff. The roofbar is well worth a visit. All of that does come at a cost but I would return here in case of a next trip

title: Enttäuschend!!!
text:
Unverständlich, wieso dieses Hotel Mitglied der „Leading Hotels of the World“ (wie das „Sacher“ in Wien oder das „Hermitage“ in Monte Carlo) sein kann: Laut, unpersönlich, abgewohnt! Es wird, bei check-in erst um 15h, kein Early-Check-in angeboten (Rezeption ist freundlich desinteressiert), der Turn-down findet erst nach Aufforderung statt, das total schiefe Zustellbett wird vom Zimmerservice untertags nicht wieder aufgeräumt. Die finsteren Lift-Etagen sind kaum ablesbar (alles nur schwarz-in-schwarz), die Mini-Bar leer, das Gratis-Wasser wird nicht ergänzt. Die Bad- und Schrank-Türen knacksen, die Fenster bieten wenig Schallschutz… Der Frühstücksraum hat die Temperatur eines Gefrierfachs, der Preis ist überhöht. Einzig und allein der Concierge ist bemüht, muss allerdings lange Zeit versuchen, auf dem Times Square ein freies Taxi heranzuwinken, da das Hotel weder Taxiruf noch App hat.
Einzig erfreulich ist der nahe Bryant Park!

title: Family of 4- The Perfect Hotel!
text:
So many reasons why this hotel is just perfect! The rooms are soundproof. The beds are so comfortable and the bedding is very soft. We were surprised and delighted to see chocolate chip cookies and 2 glasses of milk for the kids in the evening. 
The rooftop is a must see!! The view is stunning and having a DJ gives it a really fun vibe. 
Love love this hotel!!!

title: Very well located
text: Very nice rooms which is the plus of this property. Service is not at his best and sometimes they treat you like nobody. Concierge with not enough coverage and breakfast could be better. Gym is good..

title: Great location, spacious rooms and fabulous staff
text: A great location for a visit to Manhattan. Easy walking distance to many attractions plus subway lines very close by. Our room was very spacious and comfortable and the staff are really friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again

title: Excellent
text: Great location!  Close to Bryant park for a quieter escape at the end of a busy day, but also so close to the action at Times Square, Madison Square Gardens and subway.  Very spacious rooms with high ceilings. Clean and service was polite and efficient.  Parking was self park around the corner and was well managed and easy.

title: Great stay!
text: Hotel was perfectly located, convenient to everything, super friendly staff and very clean.  We’ve been in many NYC hotels and this was by far the best.  Stayed five nights and enjoyed them all, will absolutely come back!

title: Great Place!
text: Johir is amazing! We love his service! The food was so delicious. You need to come here! We are visiting from Austin and this is my favorite place so far. Time Square is only steps away and the NY ball is so close!

title: Defining Elegance and Hospitality
text: Recently, my husband and I spent a long weekend in NYC.  We had the VERY good fortune to stay at the Knickerbocker.  It is now the only place I want to stay in Manhattan.  The hotel is elegant and understated.  The staff clearly understands how to make clients feel that they are the most important part of their business.  A  special mention to Lucy, who remembered talking with me prior to our arrival and to Joseph who was so friendly and attentive.  Just two members of the staff that made me feel more than special.

title: Pleasant stay
text: the best hotel in Time Sq area / Spacious room space we stayed in Corner suite / the shower cube is amazing/ located just few steps from the Time Sq/ the area is so busy so expect some noise in the room otherwise it’s a perfect / few hotels in the same area have a room with such spacious space / if I will be back to NYC I will choose the same

title: The Knickerbocker - why look anywhere else
text: Booked a suite for my wife, two teenagers and myself for 4 nights. Didn’t know what to expect, two weeks earlier I was at a suite at the Grand Hyatt, so I was hoping it would at a minimum match that. Suite was very well appointed, clean and overall a very modern feel (much more than the Hyatt). Only problem was it could only accommodate 3!! We spent the first night there- explained the situation to the night manager. He said they would accommodate our needs the next day - just leave everything packed and they would move it. When we returned from a day of walking Manhattan- wow! They hotel provided two suites and a private entrance to the two suites. The kids were over the moon, adults were relieved and completely reinstilled my trust in the hotel. The staff went above and beyond for everything (or the hotel has a customer training process that should be the gold standard). Security/doormen yo front desk staff yo hotel cleaners and rooftop staff were all just amazing!!! Found my go to hotel for NYC! Read up the history on the hotel, quite interesting!

title: Well appointed room!
text: Only bad comment is whoever designed the bathrooms had serious issues. The toilet paper was mounted 12 inches off the floor, and there was a 2 foot pillar in between the toilet and the shower, making it awkward to get in or out. And the toilet door could not be open while somebody was using the sink. There was not enough lighting in the room, and with every single thing on it was still too dark.bathroom was well-lit however. Mattress was fabulous!

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel in a prime location of Times Square and Bryant Park. Here for our son’s belated 30th birthday celebration. Was a fantastic holiday of seven nights in an extremely nice hotel with great atmosphere and staff. Would come back to the knickerbocker for sure if in New York.

title: Perfect hotel, perfect location.
text: I loved everything about the hotel. Great location right near Times Square. Great shopping right near by. The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was big for NYC and everything seemed newly renovated. BIG fan of the St. Cloud rooftop bar! I will definitely be recommending this to others.

title: Hôtel à éviter
text:
Un hôtel, ce n'est pas uniquement une bonne localisation.
 Au kniwkerbocker : 
- Le service client est déplorable. 
- Les chambres plus petites qu'annoncées.
- Les fenêtres sont toutes petites. C'est étouffant.
- L'équipe de management est totalement incompétente. 

Attention aux faux upgrades à votre arrivée : ils vous annoncent un upgrade mais vous donnent une chambre plus petite.

Seule compensation : la terrasse roof top de l'hôtel très sympa.

Mon conseil : logez vous ailleurs, et allez prendre un verre sur le roof top.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Stayed at the hotel for a family trip. Location and staff could not be better. Rooftop restaurant was ideal for when we wanted to have a late night drink/snack without the crowed streets. Great central location for theater, food, and much more.

title: Perfect hotel
text: This hotel is really perfect, the staff was very helpful for all our needs (specialy for Shabbath needs, going up with us on the elevator and opening the toom for us each time) cleanliness, warm welcome and best location. I will definitely come back again to this hotel.

title: 4 star, not 5, still a good hotel
text: I’ve been lucky enough to stay at 5 star hotels around the world, this isn’t one of them, the rooms are small with no really luxury feel, it’s still a good hotel room, but not 5 star. The “acoustics” of the bathroom are loud, it’s so modern that it echos. Not good for bathroom privacy. Staff was amazing, friendly and helpful, location can’t be beat, hotel is nice, beautiful and historic on the outside, modern and chic on the inside, rooftop bar is lovely. The gym is good with 2 peloton bikes!  I would stay again, just know what you are getting.

title: Birthday Getaway
text: One great night in the city! Room was very nice. Beautiful, modern bathroom and decor. We enjoyed our complimentary drinks at the gorgeous rooftop bar. The location was perfect-right at time square and a short walk to the theater, restaurants, and Bryant park.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
We stayed for few days in NY and we really enjoyed our stay: everyone is nice, the hotel is of high level standard and ideally located!
The roof top is also a ;ust if you want to have a drink and a snack at an amazing spot!
We'll come back as soon as possible

title: Its not a five star hotel
text:
Usually i go to a 4 star. This trip i paid more for a 5 star hotel , and wasnt a good stay. 
Firstable the room was smaller than other hotels, with a column/ pilar in the middle of the room. ( we order to change the room) , then the blackout not working we have to call to fix jt . Then the room has not glasses , and there isnt ice machine in the building. So we have to call every night to service room to bring it. Then the alarm started to sound 8 am . The elevator didnt work.we had to go down 7 floors then if you forget to push the bottoms the service dont clean your room . So many things to be a 5 star

title: Surprising stay
text: After having stayed over different hotels in NYC in the past 10 year, visiting the city on business, I´ve stayed at Knicker recently and the experience couldn´t be better, not to say surprising. An intimate place, with a very personal touch, and with such a distinguished infrastructure. Special thanks to the Director of Front Office, Srdan Jovanovich who made our stay a delighed one.

title: Johir
text:
Amazing vibe, great tuna tartare and the cocktails are awesome! 

The outdoor space is perfect for a girls night out or a work event.  Make sure to get a seats outside! View is great!

Also,  Johir he is a great photographer! 

Highly recommend!

title: Excellent accommodations/ can’t beat location / customer service lacking
text:
First the location is unbeatable If you want to be in Times Square with easy access to trains and broadway shows .  The inside of the hotel is tranquil and the room
Is almost spa-like. No noise came into our room and the room was very very clean.  Beds are comfortable.  You forget you are in Times Square . Disappointed that the hotel didn’t offer coffee in the room or at least in the lobby .  Never had the breakfast at the hotel but it seems very pricey .  Grabbed my coffee at Krispy Kreme or Starbucks .  At this point coffee should be made available at least  in the lobby .  Did I mentions how huge the shower was ?  Customer service was average at best .  I had stayed here in 2019 and was blown away by the customer service.  Greeted with a smile every time we came in through the doors and excellent check in process.  Even a follow up call to the to the room to check if everything was to our liking .  This time was quite different . Also, the day of our check in, our flight had been delayed and we arrived incredibly close to the time of our broadway show.  I had called ahead of time to see if there was a way to just check our bags in so we could literally run to our show.  I was told we would be taken care of but a kick would have it, I had to repeat my story multiple times until someone check my bag in
And it was done with a very “ how is this my problem” kind of attitude.  Again at this price point , I would expect a little more
Of “how can we help” .  Location can’t beat and hotel itself is fantastic.  Customer service and lack of coffee keep me from giving it 5 stars

title: Top Adresse
text: Dieses Hotel hat einen perfekten Standort, am südlichen Ende des Times Square. Sehr gute Dachterassenbar. U-Bahnstation direkt neben Hotel. Viele Sehenswürdigkeiten und Shoppingmöglichkeiten in wenigen Minuten zu Fuss erreichbar. Ebenso für den Besuch von vielen Musicals. Sehr freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal.

title: Great location , staff , cleanliness
text:
Great city central location , staff  support  and engagement timely and freidly, Room cleanliness excellent 
Cant wait to return , The knickerbocker  this is a treasure and time less , the roof top bar is a must do activity

title: Awesome is an understatement!
text: Stayed her in August of 2022 with co-workers.  Had a fabulous time and enjoyed the hotel and proximity to everything.  The rooftop bar is a must for everyone.  Rooms were great and breakfast buffet was delicious!  Thanks to all the staff there.  Will be back.

title: Knickerbocker review
text:
Enjoyed it for a second time!!
First time was 2016. Perfect location, especially for going to Broadway shows. 
I highly recommend it!!
Great breakfast buffet!!
Very quiet!!
Love the rooftop bar overlooking Times Square!!

title: Good location, room LOUD at night, limited restaurant service
text:
It's a great location in the theatre district and generally a decent hotel. However, in a 3rd floor room, the noise from the outside was very disruptive and woke my family every night at 2-3 am we stayed there. The restaurant is okay but limited in hours and the overall menu, and very expensive for what you get. 
Note: Charlie Palmer at the Nick is a very mediocre experience vs. Charlie Palmer Steak House.

title: Super Comfortable, Perfect Location!
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Knickerbocker to celebrate her college graduation enjoying Broadway shows, lots of shopping for a wardrobe to begin her new career and do some sightseeing.  The Knickerbocker is a perfect location for all of those!  It's a few minutes walk to shows, 2 different subway stations, and all types of shopping.  Each evening we would come back to an immaculately cleaned super comfortable room.  The bathroom, especially, made us feel pampered with its massive shower and spa like amenities. Though it's on Times Square, it's as quiet as can be in the room affording the best nights sleep I've ever had in the city on a pillowy thick bed covered in such soft comforters. The Knickerbocker will be our choice again on our next visit.

title: Good location, nice rooms and friendly staff
text:
Enjoyed our stay at the Knick.  Pros: location, staff, room size and service.  Cons: no view, limited amenities (no in room coffee maker), no lobby to grab quick items (water, snacks, coffee etc)

Overall we enjoyed our stay and the rooms were very quiet and comfortable.  Shower drain was clogged upon arrival which they fixed right away.  Did not eat on location as there were better options close by (Paris baguette was our go to breakfast for quick and inexpensive food).  Lounge/Bar was nice but expensive.  Rooftop bar was very nice though got extremely busy at happy hour during the week with office/work groups.

Overall a good stay near everything in midtown.

title: Great people - great hotel !
text:
At every single corner of customer service, this hotel delivers !
At check in, Janelle was lovely explaining all aspects of our stay.
We found our room large, comfortable & clean.
We went to the rooftop bar & Elizabeth was an amazing server that helped us enjoy our meal & drinks after long days of college visits.
I am a Diamond level at Hilton but I am likely always going to stay at the knickerbocker in NYC. 
People make this hotel one of a kind in a very busy city.
We will be back!

title: Gutes LHW Hotel direkt am Times Square mit Perlen (Concierge Stephanie und Bell Boy Andrew)
text: Der Empfang freundlich, jedoch nicht herzlich. Concierge Stephanie ein Profi und sehr herzlich. Die Zimmer sehr schön, modern gehalten, sehr sauber, TOP Pflegeprodukte, das Bett herrlich und die Klimaanlage leise sehr gut eingestellt. Das Gym klein, sauber und mit guten Geräten. Das 2. Gym hat super Hanteln und bietet super Privatsphäre. Das Frühstücksbüffet auf europäischem LHW Niveau. Empfangsdame beim Frühstücksbüffet eine Schlaftablette auf zwei Beinen (langsam, spricht viel zu leise, kann sich nichts merken). Die Bedienung beim Frühstück waren unfreundlich. Keine Freude an der Arbeit spürbar. Kaffee musste mehrmals verlangt werden bis es dann endlich kam. Hier klar kein LHW Niveau. Bell Boy Andrew wie auch Concierge Stephanie sind Leichttürme der Freundlichkeit und ragen klar aus dem gesamten Knick-Team heraus. Fazit: Wer ein Hotel an TOP-Lage beim Times Square sucht, dass auf dem Niveau der LHW spielt, der ist im Knickerbocker gut aufgehoben. Sollten die Mitarbeitenden in Punkto Freundlichkeit noch ein paar Gänge zulegen, dann ist das Hotel in der Champion-League. Wir kommen in jeden Fall wieder!

title: Great Stay
text: I stayed 3 nights and had 2 rooms.  They are spacious rooms and nice bathrooms.  Service is exceptional.  The location is good-right near Times Square/Broadway but not stuck in the middle of the chaos but also only a few blocks to 5th Ave shopping.  When you step inside the hotel away from the crowded NY streets, you find peace and quiet!

title: Great NYC stay for this NY’er!
text:
Loved this oasis in the middle of Times Square! Could hardly believe the bustle of the city wa s outside! 
Great security; felt very safe.
Seamless check-in.
Definitely recomend for families and out of towners. Multi lingual staff are very helpful.

title: Fabulous location
text: This property was very well located and extremely comfortable. The staff were lovely, and the rooftop terrace was pleasant for pre-dinner drinks. Our room was city view and it was nice that we could see Times Square.

title: Good service; good location if you want to be close to time square
text: Good service. Very responsive.  We had one concern where the staff said a manager would call but the manager never called.  Took me three attempts before a manager actually called.   Wasn’t very receptive when they did call to do anything even though it was clearly something they could easily have done to make things right.

title: Excellent
text:
prime location close to time square , very quiet !!!, although its central location , the room was exceptionally quiet !!!  , the bed was comfortable and the room is spacious . the service was excellent 
many thanks to Lucy in front desk to be so kind and helpful

title: Posizione meravigliosa
text: Sono stata in questo hotel per 4 notti nell’aprile 2022. Le camere sono carine , un po’anomime , ma il bagno e’ grande e molto ben disposto. La colazione e’ buona , ma il servizio minimal . E’ New York times Square : il prezzo tanto alto e’ giustificato da quello , ovvio che a parita’ di prezzo l’ hotelerie asiatica offre MOLTO di piu’!

title: Amazing stay at the Knickerbocker hotel.
text: After extensive research we decided to book a stay at the Knickerbocker hotel.  We booked a corner suite.  After an awful day of traveling we arrived at the hotel frustrated and ready to check in and relax.  Imagine how upset we were when we were told that they had had a “glitch” in their system and our reserved corner suite was not available.  We were very disappointed.  They did try to make it right by offering us free breakfast and some vouchers.  When I complained and told them that this was supposed to be special weekend which is why we wanted a suite they asked for a minute to see what they could do.  We were pleasantly surprised and pleased when they came back and said they were going to upgrade us to the Martini Suite on the 15th floor.  The room was incredible with amazing views of Time Square.   The Knickerbocker and their excellent customer service made all the difference after the unfortunate “glitch” in their system.  Because of their willingness to make it right for us we will definitely come back and stay here and I’ve already recommended the hotel to several friends.  Do not hesitate to stay here - you won’t regret it.

title: Great location Great service Overall good experience
text: The iconic hotel is situated a few minutes walk to the greatest Broadway shows in New York next to TimeSquare.  Overall a great experience and the most bang for your buck(considering the cost of transportation).  Great restaurants around and close to Bryant park!   I had a great time taking my family of 4 on the amazing trip that will last us a lifetime.  Don’t expect too much from the hotel eateries but close restaurants and delivery made up for it!

title: 1/2 business, 1/2 pleasure
text: First time in NY, here for work; but evenings/weekends are free to explore, eat, drink, be merry! The Knickerbocker is AMAZING so far; stellar service (Joyce! 😉) perfect location, friendly staff, A+++!

title: Largest quality rooms in NYC
text: Big rooms, the most comfortable bed, cold air, clean clean clean. What’s not to love? Oh ya, the price. 😬 at least for the price you are safe from noise, lights and humans smack dab in time square. Oh and a gym that slaps. 🙌🏽

title: Magnifique hôtel, emplacement parfait, personnel arrangeant !
text:
Emplacement exceptionnel ! En plein coeur de Times Square, pourtant sans le bruit extérieur, métro au pied de l'hôtel,
Personnel très sympathique et arrangeant,
Lits hyper confortables,
Chambre très propre et bouteilles d'eau chaque jour,
Juste niveau caution Carte Bancaire, bon à savoir, ils vous bloquent le montant total de la chambre dès l'arrivée, donc sur place prévoir une autre solution de paiement ou autre CB,
Sinon vraiment parfait hôtel !

title: Near Times Square
text: Good hotel, seems recently renovated, walking distance from the Times Square. Large and quiet room. Large and clear bathroom. Wi-Fi was fast. I did not get a particular view from my room, however, it was quiet consisting proximity to the Times Square. Rooftop bar from 4pm to 11pm. Service was good.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We visited the hotel in July. Reception was great and no line. Process was smooth. Bellman was ready to pick up and deliver my luggage quickly. The room was very clean and renovated. Color was relaxing even bath room was clean and renovated. Thank you

title: Perfect location, amazing hotel.
text:
Views of the ball at Times Square from the rooftop lounge.

Rooms are impeccable. You walk right out into the middle of it all, broadway & 6th ave.
