Blackout electric blinds to give you privacy. Room service is so quick, we had lattes within 10 minutes of calling.

Will definitely be back.

title: A Perfect New York City Getaway
text: This was our first special trip since our two years of self isolation due to covid concerns. We spent a couple of nights in the city, attended a ball game and a museum exhibit, ate in two really good restaurants. The Knickerbocker was the perfect place to stay; excellent service and amenities, beautiful , spacious room, cool and quiet, tucked away in a very convenient location. Great choice!

title: Lo mejor es la ubicación
text: La ubicación del hotel es increíble comunicado por todos lados, si quieren llegar desde y a todos lados este, es el lugar ideal!! La habitación está bien, la limpieza regular cuando llegamos había un papel en el retrete, te cobran la ya regular tarifa de hotel que te incluye gym, wifi para tus dispositivos, y un par de botellas de agua que algunos días no las dejan y hay que pedirlas, también tenía dos bebidas de bienvenida que jamás me ofrecieron al momento de registro.

title: Exceptional Service
text: Great location with excellent service.  Stayed one night in a king room on the 14th floor prior to a cruise from the Manhattan terminal. From the time we pulled up to the curb in our cab, everyone (bellman, desk clerk, wait staff) provided exceptional service.  The room was very well appointed and comfortable. We were really surprised that we could not hear any outside noise from the streets which was a good thing.  Our room was across from a stairwell so we could hear that but it did not impact our sleep or stay. We visited the roof top bar but only to look around. The host let us check it out even though we didn't request a table. We had breakfast on site which was very good.  The price for the buffet was pretty high but the $25 credit we received when booking lessoned the blow a little. The check out process went very smooth and it took us about 5-10 minutes to get to the cruise terminal from the hotel via a Lyft.  The total cost at check out was right at $600 which included our breakfast tab. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again in the future.

title: Incredible experience
text: Where do I start me and my sister visited New York on the 1st July for 10 days we stayed in the knickerbocker it was a wonderful experience. All the staff are amazing but Jimmy went above and beyond nothing was to much trouble. Our room was exceptional big ,spacious, and always clean, big comfy beds ,lovely shower and housekeeping was brilliant throughout our stay. Central to all the attractions I have nothing bad to say about the hotel or staff it was PERFECT and I wouldnt  stay anywhere else now  the staff deserve  MASSIVE PRAISE 👏

title: Stay at Knickerbocker
text: Right in the middle of Times Square.  Seems like a newly renovated Hotel. Very clean and the room sizes were fantastic . The rooms had all the necessities you would need. The staff was very courteous all the time. Overall a good experience.

title: Incredible staff!!
text:
This was our second stay at the Knickerbocker. Paola (front desk) is the kindest, attentive and most caring person. The entire staff was exceptional and during these post-Covid times, it’s refreshing to see staff who love what they do…..and is shows. 
Location is great, easy access to transit, and the rooms are a respite from the city. We look forward to staying again.

title: Great stay in the heart of Manhattan
text: Perched on the edge of Times Square you couldn’t ask for a better spot to access all that NYC has to offer. Close to both subway and bus stations with Broadway on your doorstep. Staff were friendly and helpful and the welcome cookies were a definite highlight and were a great surprise. We had an accessible room and it was fabulous for my daughter who uses a wheelchair.  The rooftop bar St Cloud is a must visit. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

title: Disappointing stay
text: We had problems with the room, which took far too long to resolve, ultimately involving moving rooms at midnight. The new room we were given we were told was a "quiet room" but this could not have been further from the truth as we could hear constantly loud music.  The rooms and corridors are extremely dark.  The breakfast based on the cost was poor.  The best part of the hotel was Erik on the Concierge desk, who was extremely knowledgeable and helpful.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Amazing! if your in New York you have to stay here. You have to go to the roof top patio and if you are under aged the mock tails are AMAZING *chef’s kiss*. The staff is so so so helpful. Another amazing part about this is how it is conveniently placed right next to time square. ☺️

title: Loved our stay!
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights.  A beautifully located hotel between Bryant Park and Times Square, well appointed rooms, very helpful staff.  Bed was comfortable and room was spacious.   Very convenient for going to shows. 
 Highly recommend!

title: Best location for a 5 star hotel in New York City
text: At the corner of Times Square and 42nd Street. Prime Location to access the most interesting parts of New York City, and especially the Broadway element. As busy and as noisy as that area can get, the Knick is an Oasis in the middle of chaos.   Not the cheapest hotel, but certainly if you want to feel the pressure cooker called Manhattan.. this is the location.

title: Great place!
text: This hotel is just classy.  It is beautiful and full of soft classic tones throughout.  Staff is great and extremely attentive and communicates often.  Highly recommend!  Location is perfect.  Close to action but an oasis from the crazy.

title: 1st Class Service
text:
Wow, from the moment we were greeted at the entrance, to the caring,professional front desk and concierge  the service and dedication to detail has been the best.I have stayed in six different hotels in NY, this is by far the tops.I can not rate this hotel and its staff highly enough, genuinely dedicated to their craft.Definitely found my 
favourite Hotel in NY.

title: Beautiful rooms & incredibly helpful staff
text: The rooms are elegant, spacious and beautiful. The hotel’s atmosphere is quiet and calm - in contrast to the busy area it is located on. The staff are incredibly helpful and take initiative to make your stay better. The lobby is small, but there is a great room top lounger and bar as well as a lounge and a restaurant  on the fourth floor.

title: Impressive hotel in an impressive location
text: Very impressive hotel in an impressive location. A word or warning to start however about the hotels reservation service, I spent over half an hour while the agent ensured that we were booking interconnecting rooms but on arrival the hotel know nothing about this. To be fair, they went above and beyond to try and accommodate our requirements and upgraded us for two of the three nights. This was really excellent service but obviously our original request should have been noted and honored. The rooms were exceptionally spacious, modern and very comfortable. Housekeeping was excellent. Location can not be faulted because it is literally central to everything. Because of its relatively small size we felt that there was a very personal service with all the staff being welcoming and very willing to help. We would certainly stay here again on any future visit to New York.

title: Worst experience ever!
text:
Worst worst worst experience. Unfriendly and rude staff. They don’t know the meaning of ‘hospitality’. Not coordinated and haphazard. Not a child friendly hotel at all. My 6 years old was hungry for breakfast. And the Resturant wasn’t ready to give a seat. Made us go to the room and back to the restaurant twice. And then she’s yelling at us. Like excuse me? Hospitality??? And it’s not over yet. House keeping staff opens the door in the morning when we are sleeping in the room. This has never happened with me in my 33 years and I was shocked. We had to literally fight for 2 bottles of water on the room.

This is how this hotel made my family vacation at NYC. Thank you Knick bicker for such a great experience!

title: Weekend stay
text: Stay was good, the tv and WiFi service went out throughout the weekend. Tried to watch the Yankees game while relaxing, but couldn’t due to cable going out. I ended up going to a nearby bar. Overall great value for your money, but could have been better.

title: 30th Birthday Perfection
text:
This was the nicest hotel I’ve ever stayed in (Thanks to a connection through my work) that I was able to get a reasonable discount on. I believe online these rooms are ~$450/night which is insane to me, but after this experience I’m convinced that you get what you pay for. 
The room was spotless, nice and cold on a 90• June weekend, toiletries by Diptyque were divine, shower/water pressure unmatched, and ample space for two people to get ready in a NY hotel room. 
I was celebrating my 30th birthday and the staff went above and beyond, upgraded my room to a room with a view, and even brought me a piece of birthday cake delivered to the room (which was so thoughtful)! 
The day of check out the staff were nice enough to store our bags in the lobby (watched over of course) free of charge so that we could run out to grab bagels and coffee for the ride home without having to lug our bags around the city. 
10/10 would recommend if you can afford it/are looking to splurge for a special occasion!

title: Unforgettable weekend
text:
Excellent service and such a wonderful get away! Thank you Mohammed Jimmy for your quality care and your kindness. It was unforgettable and made the stay even more memorable! Thank you! 

All the best,
Jimmy and Adrienne

title: Stop thinking about it...book it.
text: This place is top notch.  The staff is amazing, rooms are amazing, breakfast is amazing!  We stayed in a premium room with two queens family of four and the kids were through the roof about the place.  Auto blackout blinds, spacious rooms, milk and cookies upon arrival, just all around so happy with our stay.

title: Great location, nice hotel.
text:
Stayed here for our honeymoon. On arrival we were met with polite and helpful staff.
Room was clean and tidy, we were at the back of the hotel so it was very quiet on an evening.
Bed was very comfortable, bathroom nice and powerful shower. 
Fresh bottles of water everyday, since it was our honeymoon we also got strawberries covered in chocolate and 2 free drinks vouchers. 
 
Only had breakfast once in the hotel and this again was very nice, and plenty of choice. 

Never made it to the rooftop bar - would recommend checking opening times. 

Few problems with the room. The battery went on the door so our key card would not work; informed reception and was sorted in less than 30minutes. Then the following daddy the battery ran out on the safety deposit box, again had to wait for the maintenance man to fix. Again this was sorted in under 30minutes.

Good location - about 20/25 minutes to Grand Central Station.
Literally next to Times Square. 
Bug Bus Tour there is a bus stop outside. 

Probably wouldn’t stay again as plenty of other hotels to choose from.

title: In the heart
text: Excellent location and great rooftop to get a drink and light food when arriving from Europe. Easy walking distance to everything. Bryant park next door is nice as well as Grocery shops around the corner

title: NYC experience
text:
Was not expecting to get such a great room. 
Not only was the room clean but very updated, comfortable and spacious. The team members have been extremely helpful, above and beyond excellence in service.

title: Casa 916
text:
916 é stata la nostra camera per 4 notti,in questo delizioso Hotel!
Probabilmente ne hanno anche migliori,ma se dovessi tornare chiederei la stessa camera!
Letto grande e comodo,luci soffuse,bagno spazioso con doccia grande e pioggia di acqua abbondante.
Asciugamani di ogni tipo di qualità e pulizie eccellenti.
Personale gentile e disponibile,grazie a Katie?? della reception!
L'Hotel dispone di ristorante "a la carte" e di Rooftop Bar affacciato su Times Square.
La cura dei dettagli,é la loro carta vincente.

title: The Knickerbocker the best
text: Abbiamo trovato questo hotel dopo aver soggiornato al Riu Plaza di Times Square all’impatto sembrava un vecchio palazzo di New York non altissimo ma una volta entrati all’interno si è aperto un mondo tutto curato nei minimi dettagli stanze pulitissime e servizio in camera impeccabile check in velocissimo e tutti gli operatori gentilissimi un po’ caro rispetto agli altri hotel in zona comunque un cinque stelle impeccabile consiglio il rooftop con una vista mozzafiato sulla città

title: Wonderful experience, except for the rooftop restaurant
text: We had a great overnight at The Knickerbocker.  Hotel staff were very accommodating.  We went up to the rooftop bar for a drink and were directed to sit at the bar.  The bartender served three young ladies who came in right in front of us.  We sat for 20 minutes before my daughter approached the maitre’d to complain about the lack of service. He was rude and told us we shouldn’t have sat at the bar.  No apology from him and attitude from the bartender when we finally ordered.  We were eventually seated outside but there was no effort to address the poor service.  Front desk staff were very gracious.

title: Good front desk curstomer service but bad billing experience
text: The front desk staff and staff in the restaurant have been very helpful. However, it has been more than a few weeks since I emailed and talked with accounting department to correct a billing error.  No change has been made beyond  a misleading statement that the issue will be fixed. Very frustrating.

title: sejour en demi teinte
text:
malheureusement l'hôtel n'est pas à la hauteur du tout 
impersonnel, chambre pas très propre, et surtout impossible d'accéder au roof top qui est tout le temps privatisé pour des events !!!!!!!!!
Le seul point positif se trouve dans l'emplacement car très central et également le professionalisme et l'efficacité  +++++++++ de Chester !!!!!!!!
Je ne renouvellera pas mon expérience dans cet hôtel

title: Great for families!
text: We had a beautiful room, everyone slept like a rock on the comfortable beds.  The kids had cookies and milk upon arrival waiting in the room. The service was amazing, they arranged a private car to transport us to and from the airport which saved a lot of grief!  Great central location near the subway and Times Square.  Did we mention the service was great? Even had an issue where my son spilled his water bottle in the car that picked us up from the airport and the hotel managed it.  We will stay there again for sure!

title: Nice Hotel
text: The hotel generally was very good. Comfortable room and well cleaned daily. Location was great close to many theatres and restaurants. However a couple of downsides. The cafe on the ground floor was shut and has been since the pandemic so nowhere really convenient to get a coffee and no rest rooms on the ground floor so had to go to 4th floor. Also the cloud rooftop bar was not available on a couple of evenings because of private functions which defeated the object of staying at the hotel. However overall a nice hotel with good staff particularly Chester.

title: Modern, large and comfortable
text:
Really large comfortable modern rooms, which are both understated and luxurious. Triple glazed so you are shielded from the street noise. 

Really pleasant rooftop bar.

Great area between Bryant Park and Times Square and a great NYC go-to hotel for reliable comfort.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
This hotel was ideal. Perfect, central location, within easy walking distance from most places, and plenty of subway stations around for reaching the further away places. Room was perfectly clean, and room service were wonderful and very accommodating. Comfiest hotel beds I have ever slept on. Staff were always pleasant and willing to help. Beautiful, modern decor. I loved the fact that there were two full length mirrors, too!

One downside for me personally was that the gym was pretty limited in terms of equipment - it had enough, but for someone who takes training seriously, it simply was not optimal. Ended up paying to use an external gym instead, but that was no problem really.

I would highly recommend the Knickerbocker, and when I return to new York, I will absolutely be looking to stay here again. Great experience.

title: Review
text:
Nice hotel.  I would definitely stay there.  Staff very helpful and friendly 
The concierge and the manager of the bar were particularly helpful in accommodating me and my 90 year old clients.   The location of the hotel is terrific for any business trip in midtown

title: Outstanding stay for our wedding
text: From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were absolutely thrilled with our experience. We were staying as a party of 3 (my husband, daughter and I) for our wedding, staying fir 4nights. A welcome gift of a bottle of Prosecco for us and cookies and milk for our daughter were very thoughtful! The room itself was magnificent, room 1421, with a separate seating area and huge bathroom! We had breakfast in the hotel on the morning of our wedding which was really good. Every single member of staff we met were friendly, polite and exceptionally professional! Our room was left spotless each day by our cleaners, always replenished the amazing toiletry’s (no need to bring your own shampoo/shower gel etc, this is quality stuff) Unfortunately the rooftop bar was closed on the evening of our wedding for a private event, but the staff at the bar on the 4th floor were wonderful and we were treated like royalty! I genuinely can not recommend this hotel highly enough, amazing location too right on the corner of Times Square (but our room was so quiet!!) Thank you so much for making our wedding trip so very special, from Lesley and Chris

title: Week in New York
text: Stayed at the Knickerbocker for 4 nights with my wife. Got a complimentary upgrade on arrival which was a perfect start. The hotel was excellent and the room as spacious and clean. Only criticism was that the bar and restaurant seemed to be mainly used by non residents and got too busy to get a table for drinks before heading out for the evening. Other that that great location with 42nd street station just a couple of doors down and right on Times Square.

title: Just Perfect
text:
As soon as we arrived at the Hotel, we were greeted with nothing but smiles and a warm welcome. Janelle was so welcoming and friendly offering lots of help. 
The Hotel is very impressive and so clean with a perfect temperature.
When we arrived to our room.. all I can say is WOW. The room was amazing, spacious with an awesome bathroom area. 
The air conditioning was just perfect and plenty of clothing storage space and a fridge. 
The Housekeeping guys did an amazing job of looking after us too.
Checking in and out was very smooth.
I just was to say a massive Thank You to everybody for making our first New York visit Just Perfect.

title: Modern and clean hotel in prime location
text: We stayed here for 5 nights whilst visiting NYC. For a prime location, clean and modern room, this is your place. We didn’t have breakfast so can’t comment. They have a bar which is open most nights but is on a lower floor. It was very stereotypical hotel bar. They have a rooftop bar which is only open a few nights a week. They did good cocktails. Given the hotel is lower than the other buildings around it, their neighbours tower around it so not best views but very nice to have. You are right in the heart of midtown, spitting distance to the subway. Very reasonable price for location. Can’t go wrong.

title: Great hotel in Times Square
text: I spent five days in NYC for work with an extra day added on for pleasure. This hotel is perfectly located near the sites and if you are willing to walk a bit you can see much more. The rooftop bar offers great views and the restaurant has wonderful food in a very relaed atmosphere.

title: Stay could not have been better!
text: I honestly cannot say enough positive things about our stay at the Knickerbocker!  The staff were so lovely and could not have been more helpful.  The room was larger than I was expecting for a NYC hotel, with a comfortable bed, large bathroom and lots of closet space.  The rooftop bar is beautiful with exquisite views of the city that would rival Rockefeller Center.   It was our anniversary during our stay and we came back to our room to find some fresh chocolate brownies and a bottle of red wine, so very thoughtful!!  We stay in a fair number of AirBNBs when we travel, but I will be staying in at the Knickerbocker for all my future NYC trips!

title: David & Louise in NYC
text: Ideal location. Staff efficient and friendly. Rooftop bar was a bonus but shame it was not open Sunday or Monday evenings. Overall a very enjoyable experience and will stay again when next in ‘The Big Apple’.

title: Our fabulous stay at the Knickerbocker!
text: My family and I had top-of-the-line service and accommodations at the Knickerbocker in New York May 19-23, 2022. A special shout-out to the best concierge ever, Jay Walters! I accidentally left my necklace in the room  after checkout - and he personally put it in the mail to me himself! The Junior Suite was awesome; whatever we did not immediately have was brought up to us promptly with a quick phone call to the front desk. (ie: coffee maker, tea set-up; roll-out bed, extra coffee mugs). I would highly recommend this hotel!

title: Nice hotel
text: Nice hotel around Times Square. Rather expensive. Many people from outside visit the bar, therefore expect queuing up for the elevator to get up to your room. Take away breakfast & coffee corner in lobby still closed

title: Our stay at the Knickerbocker
text: We came to the Knickerbocker on the rebound, after extracting ourselves from another (terrible!) apartment hotel at great financial penalty. Found you on the web. We stayed four nights here, and the experience was totally positive. The room was excellent, the service was good, the location great. Enjoyed  reading about the hotel’s history; impressive. The faucet in the bathroom has a tad aggressive flow. That’s my only suggestion.

title: Lovely bar - great staff!
text: Absolutely amazing night here. Thank you Forhad for being the loveliest man in New York so far! Beautiful views, can’t recommend it enough! Can’t wait to come back again hopefully soon. It really is a must visit!!!! Great place for friends, family, or after works drinks.

title: Amazing view, and amazing staff!
text: Forhad was so friendly and made our night out! Super friendly and lots of tips and took some 👌🏻 photos! Amazing rooftop views, especially as the sun went down! Definitely worth a visit, you see New York with good vibes!

title: Forhad Amazing.
text:
Amazing spot. Great foods and drinks and amazing views. Forbad the back server gave us a great experience and ensured we had an amazing time.  could not recommend enough.
Five stars! Cannot wait to come back here the next time we are in New York.

title: Fabulous Location
text: Loved staying at The Knickerbocker on our first visit to NY. Staff were very friendly, knowledgable, and helpful.  Slightly disappointed that The Cloud bar on 19th floor was closed for private parties on our first 3 nights. Room - clear comfortable - lived up to expectations.

title: Très bon séjour
text: Nous avons passé 5 nuits au knickerbocker hôtel. Hôtel très bien situé à 2 pas de Times Square. Idéal pour les visites puisque toutes les lignes de métro y passent. La contrepartie est le bruit de la rue,peut être un peu élevé pour des européens mais à New York le bruit est partout ( les plus sensibles prendront des bouchons d’oreilles ) .Nous après nos 20000 pas quotidiens nous avons dormi sur nos deux oreilles. Nous avons apprécié la grandeur de la chambre. Le lit très confortable et moelleux et la salle de bain au top Un gros plus à New York Bouteille d’eau offerte tous les jours très sympa quand il fait très chaud. Petit déjeuner buffet est bien ( surtout si vous trouvez une offre ou il est inclus) sinon peut être un peu cher mais a NY tout est assez cher.

title: BEST PLACE EVER
text: Johir is the best staff ever! He was so welcoming and he made my friend and i feel like home ❤️ The restaurant is near Times Square, in the perfect location! The food was great, the drinks were great!

title: CEO
text: Johir and  Gio are fabulous!  Thanks for a great evening w/ friends at St Cloud Rooftop Lounge in Times Square, Manhattan, NY.  Can’t wait to come back.  The men were fine, cocktails flowing, and the view impeccable.

title: 5 star property, 3 star experience
text: Nice place but I had some issues with customer service and some other short-comings. It just wasn’t worth the amount I paid - I expected so much more from such a high-end hotel, but I was disappointed in a few ways.

title: Exceptional Customer Service
text: From the time we arrived through our check out, I was VERY pleased with the level of customer service exhibited at The Knickerbocker. I have over 10+ years in hospitality so I have a high expectation. The Knickerbocker is one of the few that measures up to meet my expectations and exceed. Thank you for a memorable experience!

title: Did not satisfy expectation
text:
The suite does not have enough room for our clothes, which are many as we are staying in the hotel for 13 nights. It only has one closet with only 3 small drawers. We had to leave clothes in suitcases we brought from our country.
Housekeeping only cleans rooms up to 3PM and one day I had  to work in the room  until 4 PM, we could not have our room cleaned with fresh towels until the following day.
The bulb of the reading light beside the bed burned out and the hotel could not replace it as they said they have not bulbs for replacement.

title: Great Location
text: The Knickerbocker Hotel is in a prime location just off of Times Square. I cannot fault the service and friendliness of the team. The room was very clean and housekeeping do a great job. My only criticism is the there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but more than this the bar availability is very limited. It closes at about 10:30 in spite of the website stating 1am and it’s closed on Sundays and Mondays. I was very disappointed that I couldn’t come in from a night out and relax in the hotel bar.

title: Times Square location 👌
text:
Can’t beat the location- Times Square. Very nostalgic coming here the first time, if you’re fan of movies etc. Staff were very friendly, however room service for food not great. But the location is ideal for eating and drinking, literally endless options.

One thing about Brits won’t be used to- tips/service charges! Literally everywhere you go they expect it, and even suggest what you should give (up to 25% of the bill!) even hotel taxations aren’t included in the initial bill, you get whacked when you check out. Refusing to give tips, waiters take great offence, just a warning.

title: FIRST CLASS
text:
Just returned from Knickerbocker hotel, it was absolutely fantastic, spotlessly clean, fresh dressing gown every day & Towels, slippers are a lovely touch, the turn down service was great. Very friendly staff, nothing to much bother. We asked for coffee making facilities it arrived later that night. 
This hotel is definitely 5 star. Loved it, I have recommended this hotel to friends. 
Thank you all so much for making our first trip to New York very memorable.

title: Excelente opción, buena ubicación y servicio
text:
Elegimos el hotel para pasar una semana en pareja, la habitación muy cómoda, linda y limpia. El servicio es excelente, siempre se están preocupando para que tengas una buena estadía y todas las personas a las que acudimos por diferentes razones siempre nos atendieron con buena predisposición. Sacamos la habitación mas básica asique la vista daba a una pared pero debe tener muy lindas vistas... El rooftop es hermoso y el clima es muy agradable, los precios un poco elevados pero vale la pena pasar una noche allí. Me encanta sentir que estamos en un hotel y que no están viendo de que manera cobrarte todo lo que necesitas, nos repusieron café en la habitación cada vez que pedimos, nos dieron un microondas para cocinar nuestra avena por la mañana y nos permitieron recibir paquetes, todo esto sin cargo adicional... Generalmente siempre se cobra todo aparte.
La ubicación del hotel es lo que mas nos gustó, en pleno Times square, a una cuadra del mercado orgánico wholefoods donde hacíamos todas las compras de comida y desayuno y a una cuadra del Bryant Parck. El subte también ahí nomás. Valió mucha la pena el hospedaje y SIN DUDAS LO VOLVERÍAMOS A ELEGIR!!! Espero que la próxima podamos acceder a una linda vista desde la habitación sin pagar diferencias tan elevadas. GRACIAS POR TODO!!

UN DETALLE IMPORTANTE y no menor: Nuestra habitación era de las más cercanas al ascensor y el problema fue que cada vez que llegaba a nuestro piso sonaba un timbre para avisar que el ascensor estaba ahi... La verdad un detalle innecesario que podrían desconectar porque subía y bajaba gente hasta las 23/24 hs y arrancaba el timbre desde las 6 de la mañana... Este sonido se escuchaba desde adentro de la habitación y era bastante frecuente en esos horarios... SI NO FUERA POR ESTO DARIA UN 10 A ESTE ALOJAMIENTO... Pero como todo lo demas fue EXCELENTE me parece que no vale la pena bajar la calificación.
Otro detalle importante: Solo tuve que reclamar una cosa (no vale la pena mencionarlo), lo importante de esto no es que haya tenido que reclamar algo sino la manera en que lo resolvieron, muy bien predispuestos, compensándonos con un crédito de regalo y además asegurándose de que no vuelva a pasar... Estas son las razones por las que uno vuelve a elegir el hotel, por la buena predisposición y GANAS de hacerte sentir que le importa que estés cómodo. Ojalá volvamos pronto y SIN DUDAS VOLVERÍAMOS A ELEGIR KNICKERBOCKER! GRACIAS A TODO EL STAFF!

title: Amazing service and hotel
text:
Everyone at this hotel was amazing , very grateful to have a great vacation as a family, kid friendly and great for adults , definitely I’ll stay again.
We love the services , the room and the facilities

title: Excellent location and customer service
text:
The staff was very friendly and the rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable.
Location is a premium right on Time’s square.  My only “complaint” is the lack of complementary coffee in the rooms, especially that a cup of coffee in the restaurant costs $8!!

title: Excellent Experience
text: Since arriving the courtesy of all at The Knick was remarkable. All needs and requests were met and we felt special. Luz at reception and Andre and Pedro at front entrance were particularly unforgettable to us for their warmth and dedicated attention to us. Roof Top great! Location of the Hotel is the best. I am looking forward to returning soon. Thanks!

title: This is it.
text:
If you’re looking for a great  location and top shelf service, look no further. I knew we were in for a treat while checking in with Paola. She was extremely knowledgeable and equally as hospitable. She even went as far as to send bday balloons and chocolates up for my wife’s special day unsolicited The great service continued with Andre at the door who is a true gentleman and always had great recommendations on where to go and what to do. I’d be remiss if I didn’t mention Paul and Hector working late nights who went above and beyond to  fulfill our extraordinary late night snack request.  
Five star experience. 
We’ll be back.

title: Unterkunft für gecancelten Flug
text:
Mein Bruder und ich hatten die einmalige Möglichkeit aufgrund eines gecancelten Fluges am 30.04.2022 im The Knickerbocker untergebracht zu werden.
Unser Review beruht darauf, dass uns für die Buchung eines neues Fluges, wofür die Singapore Airlines nicht fähig war, einen Flug anstelle des 03.05. bereits am 01.05. umzubuchen. Unseren absoluten Dank für diese Organisation  gebührt ARIEL - Guest Services - Front Desk. Ariel war das Beste was uns passieren konnte. Mit Ihrem Einsatz hat sie es ermöglicht uns wieder schnellstmöglich nach Deutschland kommen zu lassen und nicht unnötig zwei weitere Tage in New York sitzen zu lassen. ARIEL you did a very great Job. Thank You so much. Das komplette Personal ist sehr aufmerksam und hilfsbereit.

title: Knickerbocker hotel did not disappoint
text: The knickerbocker hotel is centrally  located in the theater district and was convenient for our broadway show. Room is luxurious and comfortable, rooftop bar had a gorgeous view of the city and staff were attentive.

title: Excellent emplacement
text:
Hôtel idéalement placé sur Time square 
Chambre spacieuse, calme et confortable
Dommage qu il soit difficile d avoir une table au roof top. En fait le bar est indépendant de l hôtel et on ne peut pas réserver. 
Buffet petit déjeuner: bien mais compte tenu du prix, nous nous attendions à plus de choix et de service ( pas de chocolat chaud, de beurre doux)

title: Excellent hotel!
text: Great hotel overall. Paola is the best! Service was excellent, the fitness center is great and room service was always quick to deliver and delicious. Everything was comfortable and in a great location!

title: Family, Broadway Vacation
text: We waited almost 3 years after Covid postponed our trip.  The Knickerbocker was fantastic!  We will return and stay there.  Family members totaling 6 all with connecting rooms.  The concierge was amazing and made everything easy.  The location is ideal for Broadway shows.  Wish they had more food options and better hours of operation.  All in all, we highly recommend The Knickerbocker!

title: Adult week
text: We stayed here along with our friends from Ireland and England. The hotel was so clean, and stylish. The roof top bar is awesome and super popular with the locals so make sure you make reservations if you want a table. The front desk staff was amazing, even brought a coffee machine in my room at zero cost.  Totally recommend this hotel. Great location to everything. Walking distance to everywhere.

title: Fantastic Stay
text:
We sprung for the corner room overlooking Times Square.  
A real treat. Beautifully decorated in a contemporary style. Everything was first class.
Electric shades.  Well soundproofed windows (but remember this is in the heart of Times Square)
Breakfast was really nice. The staff was super friendly.  White table cloths and all.

title: April Vacation
text: We enjoyed our trip very much.  The employees were friendly and knowledgeable and helped us get the most out of the city.  The room was good sized, clean, and had a nice shower.  Great location, would recommend to friends.

title: Excellent location
text: The location, the size of the rooms (for NYC) and the facilities are very good. The service can be better; sometimes you have to call many times to get something. One day they didn't clean my room because nevertheless I pushed the "service" button, outside of the room the light indicated "privacy".

title: Perfect for a Broadway show
text: My wife and three daughters and I came to NYC to see Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. This crew of mine is difficult to impress and they LOVED the Knickerbocker. Spacious rooms, great service, and perfect location. I will definitely stay here next time I bring my girls to a Broadway show. I can’t imagine any place better.

title: Excellent Experience
text: I recently stayed at the Knickerbocker Hotel - and hosted a dinner event for close to 50 people there. During my four days, the staff was responsive and professional and friendly - from the people at the front door to the front desk to the Food & Beverage people - everyone! Despite the fire alarms going off at 2 am (smelled smoke, fire trucks showed up, so not a drill but over quickly and no harm done). The location of the hotel is fantastic! Easy walking to everything! Clean, well maintained, lovely accomodations! I can't wait to return!

title: Still COVID as reason to cut amenities that are costly for the hotel ?
text: This is not a 5 star hotel. Not even on a good day. When a 5 star hotel lacks amenities to be awarded five stars the hotel fully depends on the quality of the rooms and the service .Both lacked which made you wonder why this hotel is charging $700 per night. The only thing does very well is blaming covid-19. Where even a Hampton Inn can make sure all lights are working, not at this hotel. ‘Covid has limited room inspections and maintenance ‘ . Room 1515 (tiny) had no luggage racks, no body soap, no stocked mini bar , no coffee makers and the bare minimum of towels —- when you ask? Covid Covid Covid! It is the first text message you receive after check-in . Because of COVID amenities are limited but they will bring you what you need.  When you arrive the bell captain will tell you that because of COVID they don’t valet cars but they have no issue to bring your luggage to the room and spend some time in your room without a mask . The only thing this hotel has figured out during Covid is how to cut every amenity away and see how far you can push it. The hotel is a embarrassment for all visitors staying and hospitality in general.  For the money there are so many better options in NYC. Even a Renaissance inn offers more amenities and luxury for half the price . I would not return, I actually didn’t extend my stay and run to the Peninsula. Strangely enough COVID had not resulted in removing amenities only a few blocks away. Perhaps as long as this hotel (mis) uses COVID as reason to cut most of their amenities, COVID should be the reason to not stay at this hotel . With rooms not being clean, staff not wearing masks and elevators packed with guests , the hotels concern regarding COVID apparently only are a concern when it is costing the hotel money .

title: Fed, lækkert og super oplevelse
text:
Super lokation og en super service fra personalet 
Det værelse vi boede på var super lækkert og badeværelset var rigtigt stort og flot
Der er en super fint lille Gym, hvor vi kunne få trænet det vi skulle 
Der er en super fed bar på toppen med en rigtig fed udsigt 
Lige foran hotellet kan man hoppe på Big Bus Tour ved ekstra betaling, det er super smart og gjorde det lettere at komme rundt og se ting

title: Honeymoon
text: Finally after Covid we get away!! A very warm welcome by the front office, room wasn’t ready but took my number and called as soon as it was available. Also kind enough to give us a complimentary upgrade.

title: Spring Break Trip
text: This is the place to stay! We visited with our family of five for Spring Break. The hotel staff is wonderful! The rooms are very spacious for NYC. The beds are comfortable and everything was quite clean. The hotel location is close to so many restaurants, sites and a subway entrance is right at the corner. Bryant Park is a gorgeous place to grab a quick breakfast and soak in the sights. There was no street noise and we will definitely return!

title: Top location and very nice room
text:
The location on time square is perfect to visit NYC. We was there with to kids for my birthday.
The  room was very quiet and very comfortable.
The service was very friendly and from high quality.
We will come back.

title: Disappointing - family trip. Average at best
text:
1. check in. At check in, we had to wait 30mins and it was already 4pm. After a long journey this was disappointing. We were offered a drink and a breakfast voucher but pretty poor show. For the rate we paying, this isnt good enough.

2. Room - when we eventually did get our room, we entered to find a manager sat on our sofa. it was unnerving for the kids and she noted we were missing a tv remote, while putting her phone away. Over the course of the day the door flew open unannounced 3 times, surely a knock is in order? Upon complaint we got a bottle of wine, which i suppose was a decent touch but when you look at the rate, it hardly makes up for it.
The junior suite we got was nice, but has zero view and is a cell in effect as no point opening the blinds.

3. Housekeeping - our toiletries were not replenished in 3 days, dirty glasses were left in our room. pretty average effort.

4. roof top bar - was closed on monday, we werent aware of that at check in and was a shame as we had planned to go.

5. breakfast - was disorganised. no plates one day, lots of food run out another day. A waiting time of 10mis on the other day. 

In short, it was adequate - but over priced. Expected better for the rate and didnt help our trip go as we had hoped

title: NYC Break Knickerbocker Hotel
text:
While researching hotels to stay near Times Square for a five night break in NYC, found reviews showing hotel rooms were small.  Came across the Kinickerbocker reviews and majority were positive so phoned TUI up and booked it for a package break.  When we arrived, there were cookies and milk left on the table for us. Really pleased with the hotel in general;

Easy to identify from the street
Courteous, friendly and helpful staff
Room was bigger than I expected.  We had two beds of good size plus a sofa in the room.
Two bottles of water delivered to the room each day
Fridge in the room
Ironing board 
Umbrellas hung in the wardrobe if we needed them
Large TV which includes hotel guest channels for check out time etc
Table and chair for working at, eating or using a laptop.
Shower had fantastic pressure and loads of room
Bathroom had two sinks
USB and plug sockets next to each bed
Remote controlled blind
Touch button press to operate lighting in the room.
A safe was located within the wardrobe.
Housekeeping did a fantastic job, room was spotless each day we returned from our activities.
Hotel also has a rooftop lounge.

We couldn't have asked for a better location, plenty of shops, restaurants and activities within walking distance such as Rockefeller, Empire State, Madam Tussauds, Broadway, Macys and loads more.

Our check out time was 12 noon but flight was not until 10pm that night but the hotel allow you to keep cases and bags at the hotel so you can continue to explore then return to the hotel before you leave for the airport.

We only had one issue and that was the fore alarm going off during the night then a message came through the intercom that we were to disregard it.  When I spoke to reception, they stated that it was a system fault.  Suggestio  would be to have a pre recorded message to disregard the alarm and it actually wasn't initially clear.  However, the alarm is not a criticism as that could happen to any hotel and outwith their control.  

We do plan to return to New York again and will be booking the Knickerbocker again, I think we will struggle to find a hotel with all the same positives.

title: Always Surprises Me
text: I assume that the Knickerbocker offers such a great value for the money because others see the location (essentially the corner of 42nd and Broadway) and say "no way".  I can understand that, but one feels completely shut off from the Times Square noise once one enters the hotel.  The rooms are quiet and very nice.  The service is excellent.  The beds are very comfortable.  I've now stayed here three times over the years and will return.

title: Had a fantastic stay!
text: Stayed 4 days. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Food in Charlie Palmer is good but a bit pricey. Lounge was nice. Rooftop view is amazing! Great spot for a photo with the NYE ball. Location was perfect.

title: Truly Amazing.
text: From start to end this hotel was fabulous, helpful staff who are happy to go above and beyond to make your stay fantastic, gorgeous room (we upgraded to city view) the bathroom was gorgeous, the bed huge! And super comfortable, with minimal outside noise, the best I’ve slept in years! A huge thanks to all the staff here. 10000000% recommend a stay at The Knick!

title: New York Trip
text: Really great hotel in good location. Staff friendly and helpful. Room was really nice on the 9th floor and the shower was so nice it was hard to get out. It is hard to fault this hotel but small issues such as only one water in room on one day and one pair of slippers on another would be all I could focus on. Having said this if you call down they bring water straight away. Would stay again.

title: Spacious!
text: Perfect location!  Subway & Times Square steps away.  Spacious Jr. Suite- 2 Queens, sitting area with fold out bed, 2 TVs. Lg bathroom double sinks,  & rain shower. Starbucks close. No coffeemaker. Yes refrigerator.  Rooftop bar is amazing.  Hats off to the Knickerbocker's personable, resourceful, and caring staff. Your hotel added an extra special touch to my 83 year old mother's "Bucket List" trip to New York.  A special thank you to Marcelo & Robert.  We all felt welcomed.

title: Location is Key
text: The Knickerbocker Hotel is located in an ideal location to wonderful restaurants, the subway system, shopping and theater venues.  The 12th floor rooms offer a quiet oasis from the hustle and bustle of the outdoors, yet if you want to experience a vibrant bar scene, hang out at the rooftop lounge (indoors or outdoors) or the 4th floor lounge.

title: Great location, underwhelmed by ‘suite’
text:
Overall, a good stay. 

Positives:
Great location, perfect for exploring Times Square. Subway station very close by.
Very comfortable bed.
Great shower with lovely Dyptique toiletries.

Negatives:
Booked a junior suite and found this slightly underwhelming - would probably go for a regular room with benefits of hindsight. Views from room were good (facing Times Square) but obscured by filthy windows. 

No hairdryer in room, upon asking for same, staff were adamant there was one in room but did finally provide one.

Should have received daily bottled water but this only happened once during stay.

title: Bad customer service front desk
text:
We stayed from 3/31/22 to 4/2/2020. We took the superior room two queen beds-  PARKING PACKAGE which includes room + parking which was for 4/1/22 $540.00(refundable $60 parking) +120.2(taxes and fees) total for 4/1/22 was $660.20
and 4/2/22 $580 (refundable $60 parking) + 126.17(taxes and fees) total for 4/2/22 was 706.67 (total for stay whole stay was $1366.87.)
We were told that we will be refunded the $120 parking as we have the parking package and would be charged a total of $1246.87. They took the parking ticket from us and 
Instead of refunding from our total , we were charged an additional $120 and charged us $1486.87. When we asked they said they will refund and gave us back $120 and charged us $1,366.87. And when we asked the front desk that we should be charged only $1246.87 they very rudely dismissed us and said we did not charge for parking so no refund will be given back to us. We told them that we booked the PARKING PACKAGE but they did not honor it. This kind of billing mistakes were not expected from a 5 star hotel. We sincerely hope knickerbocker hotel will honor and  refund our parking $120 which was charged. Very disappointed with the front desk and their attitude.

title: New York Holiday
text: Really nice hotel in great location. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was spotless and good size too. Shower was hard to get out of as sooo nice, I think I would have been happy to spend the day in it. If we ever go back to NY then we would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Amazing stay!
text: Couldn’t fault this hotel, great location, staff very helpful and friendly. Our room was lovely and spacious. Location right on times square in the heart of it all. Would definitely stay here again…..

title: Fabulous stay with the Knickerbocker
text:
A fantastic welcome with reference to the reason for our stay which shows that they take an interest in their visitors. 
Always a smile from staff and happy to help with any questions. 
When we requested coffee making facilities they were on it right away. 
When we return to NYC we will most definitely be staying at The Knickerbocker.

title: 5 Star Hotel at a Reasonable Price
text: The Knickerbocker hotel is centrally located in T-Sq. but tucked into a quieter corner on 42nd & Broadway.  This iconic 1906 hotel has been elegantly reappointed and refurbished with modern elegant appointments.  The staff is very helpful & friendly. My room was large (400+ Sq. Ft.) compared to most other Manhattan hotels.  The room was clean & well serviced throughout my stay. This was great bang for the buck. The breakfast option was well excellent and worth it.

title: Not Pleased
text:
I had reservations for one week.  Because of an airplane delay, I arrived at 3:00 am.  I was escorted to my room by a hotel employee, but the key cards I had been given didn't work.  The escort let me into my room and said he would back in 10 minutes.  After 30 minutes, I tried to call the front desk, but my telephone did not work. I went back downstairs and asked about the cards.  The front desk man snapped at me that I would get them.  I asked when, and he said in a very nasty voice that I would have them in the morning.  So, I had someone escort me back to my room and open the door.  I was exhausted and went to bed immediately,  
The next morning when I got up, I noticed five blood spots on the floor between the bath and the entry. When I took a shower, there was quite a bit of mold in the shower.
The next day, I asked for a coffee machine with just decaf coffee and tea bags.  The coffee machine that was delivered was broken, and there were five regular coffee pods and no decaf or tea.
Two friends had arrived the day before me, ate at the bar and came down with food poisoning.
Needless to say, I will not be staying at The Knickerbocker again.

title: A Great Stay At A Great Hotel
text: Just returned home from a stay at The Knickerbocker.  What a great hotel!  The rooms were spacious and well appointed.  But, more importantly, the service was over the top.  The staff was gracious and kind and so accommodating.  Cynthia (at check in) was so nice and so helpful.  And, Andre (the doorman) was so great and very helpful!  I can't say enough about The Knickerbocker.  I will stay here again and would recommend it to anyone travelling to NYC!

title: Best Times Square Hotel
text: This hotel was convenient to all the theaters and restaurants in the Times Square area. It is steps away from a number of subway lines. We could easily get anywhere we needed to go. The staff is friendly and professional. Concierges Erik and Stephanie were very helpful with restaurant and transportation recommendations and reservations as well as general sightseeing suggestions. Hotel is clean and comfortable. We loved it!

title: Excellent location and great service
text: We had a legendary stay at the Knickerbocker and were treated like VIPs by the staff. Paola who checked us in was SO KIND and accommodating after a long travel mess of a canceled flight and a canceled night. She made sure we got in a room and near our friends who were also staying. The location can't be beat if you want to be near the action of Times Square and take in a show. The fun thing about this hotel is how historic it is- there is a book in the room with pictures and stories which I DEFINITELY recommend checking out. I read it cover to cover! I loved the diptyque amenities in the room and we loved the robes. KJ in the lobby also made our stay completely memorable. We had a first class experience here. Thank you!

title: Short but amazing stay!
text: We only stayed at the Knickerbocker for one night, but it was such a memorable experience. It was our first trip with the kids since 2019 and the staff made everything amazing!! We definitely made new core memories!

title: Great location and customer service!
text: Love the hotel location, but really loved the customer service!  We had a flight delay and I called Guest Services and spoke to Paola.  She was able to get me a late checkout for 3, but then we had another delay and she was able to move my check-0ut to 4:00....it was greatly appreciated!

title: Honeymoon stay
text: High class service from the moment we checked in. Absolutely blown away by the location. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. We were given a free upgrade because of our honeymoon and the room was gorgeous. If we came back to new york, i would stay here again

title: Great weekend
text: The Knickerbocker was great. From the staff, to the location and amenities, you could not ask for more. Food and drinks were fantastic. Room was very clean and large. Rooftop views were amazing. A NYC staple!

title: Great stay at The Knick!
text: We had a wonderful stay during our recent visit to NYC.  We had an issue with the bed linens upon arrival and received excellent service in resolving that.  Paola, in Guest Services, when above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied with the resolution of the problem - and we were.  We could not have asked for better customer service!!

title: Once more at The Knickerbocker
text:
Sleek and modern, with a very attentive staff, on our fourth stay the Knickerboker has become our home away from home when we’re in New York City. Perfectly located with a 5-8 minute walk to all the Broadway shows and excellent dining choices, as well as 5th Ave. shopping and Rockefeller Center. The roof top bar and lounge is fantastic.
Thank you for always taking great care of us.

title: Perfect for Theaters and Time Square
text: Excellent location. Junior corner suite had views of huge bright billboards, but windows were too dirty. Rooms are meticulously clean, but lack character. Was hoping for some kind of historical feel. Bed was very comfortable. Shower was wonderful, but was expecting a bathtub. Rooftop view extraordinary!

title: Fantastic from start to finish
text: We stayed at The Knickerbocker for 4 nights as a family of 5 and we have nothing but positive comments. Our welcome from Paola at check-in was exceptional and our room was fantastic. Very spacious and easily accommodated 2 adults and 3 children. As others have said, location is fantastic and staff all very friendly and helpful. Hotel was great value and we hope to return some day!

title: Good hotel
text: It’s a good hotel. I mean you have to accept being in Times Square, but it’s very convenient to the subway and offices around there. The staff is nice and responsive. Free water in the rooms. Reasonable prices for five star in a prime location.

title: Excelente atención
text:
Es la tercera vez que me hospedo en este hotel. Todas fueron muy buenas experiencias. Desde la amabilidad en la recepción, el personal encargado del equipaje, los del desayuno y especialmente la manager Ingris quien ante un inconveniente que tuvimos se encargó de solucionar, asistir ocupándose que nos sintamos escuchados y atendidos. Lo mismo el chéster a la hora de solucionar temas de traslados, siempre atento y con mucho humor.
Valoro la intervención de Ingris que fue por ella que decidimos volver la próxima vez a este hotel. Marco una gran diferencia. Excelente, gracias!

title: Johir
text: Great location with great service! Johir was especially accommodating. Taking great pictures of us and giving us advice for our trip to New York. Would recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice pre dinner drink.

title: Amazing stay
text: Such a great hotel. Great location and service. Especially from Johir at the rooftop bar. The hotel room is beautiful and the restaurants and bars are great….. Will definitely be back next time we are in NY :)

title: Johir
text: Best drinks and views in the city!! The service is incredible Jahir was the best!! Will for sure be back for more drinks, the service was unbelievable! Best first time in NYC, appreciate Jahir always willing to take our photos!

title: All in one: quiet, central, clean, nicely designed!
text: We were on the last floor. It eas unbelievably quiet knowing that the hotel is in Times Square! Very clean, spacious and well designed rooms. We had a perfect stay and will certainly come back soon! Thank you!

title: Loved our stay! Accessibility for wheelchair too!
text:
We arrived at the knickerbocker and actually had to downgrade our room to have a tub, but the staff were very helpful.
We had an accessible room as I am in a wheelchair…. Only problem with shower being there is no shower chair or stool, so I had to sit on the floor to wash when I didn’t have a bath. Although we had an accessible tub…….. it was not an easy transfer - it was a standard tub that was quite difficult to use as a disabled person…… however it was heaven once i was in to help with my pain after days rolling Around NYC!!!! 

Room was tidied and beautiful every day. 

The staff on reception were lovely, and we were always greeted so well on arrival back to the hotel.

Lovely breakfast, but most days were not offered coffee…… however it was only a small detail.

 I almost did not rate  5 stars, as during breakfast one of the waiters spoke to another asking “did they leave us anything as a tip? How much?” When another family left. I felt that was so inappropriate to say that guests could hear. I was happy to leave tips each day…… but rarely had much service and felt awkward after some of what I heard as staff chatting between themselves. However, not all staff! Most were amazing. 

The girls on breakfast service were incredible & always so friendly - really just wonderful! Good selection at breakfast was phenomenal! The yoghurts were insanely beautiful! There was a Continental option, cooked hot breakfast, cereals, fresh juices and fresh fruit! 
One of the days I struggled to reach the fruit, and the chef had come out and said “please let me help” and honestly - that was so kind and so much appreciated.

I will definitely go back, but likely opt for an accessible with view or suite rather than downgrading for a tub. I just wish there were tubs in the premium rooms…… and a shower chair

Concierge text us during our stay and that was lovely. However, I did message back with some questions and requests and although one of the staff were amazing…… we had no reply to our questions at all in the end of the trip.

Chester booked us a lovely SUV to take us back to the airport. 
The guys who are around reception, concierge & bell boys - so friendly! 
Before our visit we had constant email communication and the staff were the most friendly and helpful

I was even given a list of recommendations and places for accessibility / wheelchair friendly ways to travel NYC! 
If you are in a wheelchair and wondering about the knickerbocker…… I totally recommend it !!!

title: Birthday  Trip made extra special at The Knickerbocker!!!!!
text:
Fabulous Birthday Trip! The staff made this one of my fondest travel memories! Warm and friendly staff. Chester gave us a HUGE New York welcome!!! Rolando & Lisette were the first to mark my Birthday with a  surprise!Tim was Wonderful with his city suggestions that were very much appreciated.
The hotel had such charm.  We loved the St Cloud rooftop! Don and Emmy were so kind and  great with their cocktail recommendations! Still singing “purple rain!”
The room was comfortable. Housekeeping did a GREAT job keeping up with our room. Would have loved a coffee pot in the room and this was my only negative. However the coffee at breakfast was wonderful! Lisette started each morning with a cheerful attitude!
Upon check out Fausi took great care to store our luggage while we went to brunch before our flight. Robert helped to make sure we were all loaded into our Uber and were safely away from the hotel.
Many MANY thanks to all that And those not mentioned- you were no less exceptional than those mentioned!  
We will be back!

title: Lovely hotel and staff
text:
Place was amazing 
Only down side was the cost for a few pieces of laundry 
Also got charges 86dollars for a 11 dollar bottle of wine to the room 
Other than that the room amd hotel roof top bar was lovely

title: Great location with a spectacular rooftop bar
text: Have never spent a couple of days to wander Mid-Town Manhattan with now real agenda. The Knickerbocker was a perfect location literally at the heart of it all. They lost a star because the rooms felt too minimalist/modern for the grand old hotel. We expected more character. And the open bathroom concept with EVERY sound and utterance echoing around the room and down the hall was just uncomfortable. The shower was amazing, though. The cool feature of this hotel is that you can be in constant contact with the concierge staff via your phone and texting. They took care of minimal matters as well as our Charlie Palmer’s reservation. And their rooftop bar gave us two amazing nights (the bartender made perfect New York Sours). The vibe is very cool up there and the folks were beyond friendly. The amenities make this place stand out, even if the room left me a little cold. Also, housekeeping routinely tried to break in n two of our three mornings. The first one may have been a mechanical malfunction. The second be was clearly on them.

title: Stunning hotel and excellent location
text: We were very happy, the only let down was lack of items in the mini bar and no coffee facilities in the room.  Room service didn’t start until 7 am and with our sleep pattern out we were awake early with no access to food and drinks.  Not a huge problem but would have been great.

title: Our New Favorite NYC Hotel!
text: Paola made check in smooth and was extremely kind. The room was extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable. The rooms were well sound-proofed. The location absolutely couldn't be better for every place we went over the weekend.

title: Exceptional Hotel
text: If you are looking for a central hotel with luxury look no further the knickerbocker is the best! We originally booked into a 4 star hotel in Times Square and it was horrendous so had to move so glad we found the knickerbocker. Staff location rooms all 5 star!

title: 💎 in the heart of Manhattan
text:
Such a wonderful hotel. Located at the junction of 42nd Street and Broadway/Times Square. Subway and bus routes adjacent.

We had 1607 (The Cohan Suite) and 1612 (Junior Suite) both lovely rooms. 1607 (A 'Tribute Suite') has wonderful views of Times Square and is on the hotels highest residential floor (the Cloud St John Bar is one above.)

Both rooms were large, nicely furnished with electronic black out blinds. You are in Time Square so expect some noise but if you don't like noise, probably Manhattan isn't for you!

We didn't try the breakfast as the area I'd awash with restaurants but did try the food top bar which was very nice.

All staff we experienced were very smiley and friendly.

As a family we will be back. Thanks Knickerbocker, we had a blast!

title: modern luxurious rooms
text:
I had a long stay at the hotel that was unexpectedly amazing.
The reception at the hotel was extremely small, that's the only down part though.
Check in was smooth, the bellman was of great help.

Room was spacious, and furniture was amazing, very modern, with wonderful bright tones. Bathroom was excellent with amazing toiletries. My view was not that bad, I managed to maintain my privacy though.

I had a problem with my room cleaning which I addressed in the form of an advise and not a complain, but to my surprise the head of the housekeeping came to check and investigate herself, and made sure on the next day that I was satisfied 100%. IT was truly refreshing.
The housekeeping men who took care of the cleaning and did a good job were Mr. Nam Gyal, Mr. Pema Tsering, and the one who cleaned my room in my final days at the hotel was Mr. Anil Roka who was so sweet to even confirm with me if all was great and if anything I needed to be done extra.

The concierge gentleman was very helpful as well and always available for aid.

Overall my stay was truly amazing, the location was unbeatable in the heart of time square, the service at the hotel was very nice and whenever I needed something they were easily accessible and able to resolve any matter. my room was in excellent shape as well.

Would definitely stay again in my coming visits to the big apple.

title: Warm and welcoming, friendly staff and a spacious modern and clean room
text: We spent ages researching and deciding where to stay which was difficult as neither of us had been to New York and it was to be a one off trip so we were desperate for it to be perfect. We chose the knickerbocker for location and its modern decor and we were not disappointed. The location ls perfect as it is just off times square and within walking distance to most sights and attractions. The room was clean and spacious with electric blinds and lighting. Thr bathroom was modern with the toilet and shower in separate frosted glass enclosures. The shower was hot and powerful and toiletries and robes were provided. There was a fridge and 2 bottles of water are left daily (we left empties outside if we didn't require housekeeping and they were exchanged ) it was a quiet hotel and we slept well. There are 2 bars, one a rooftop serving lite bites, but be aware that both are closed in a Sunday and Monday.  We were given a complimentary drink voucher on check in and we used it before a show so ordered some sliders and Mozzarella bread which were fresh and tasty. The only downside other than the bar closures which we were unaware of, was that there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We asked at reception and were provided with a kettle and 2 cups which should be charged at $24 for the duration of the stay but this was wavered. We feel as a 5 star hotel this should be included. Also the breakfast is very  expensive at $44 (if I remember rightly) per person...we ate at a nearby diner for half the price. Despite these niggles i would definitely reccomend this hotel as there was nothing that wasn't sorted and as a base for seeing the city it was perfect.

title: A stunning landmark hotel located  on Times Square, modern facilities fantastic roof top bar.
text:
A lovely stay at once of NYC iconic hotels fantastically located on Times Square and steeped in so much glorious history.

The moment we arrived, the front of house desk team were caring, enthusiastic and made a welcome greeting that started our first experience of Knickerbocker well. The Check-in process was smooth and slick. We booked through BA Holidays and everything that was requested was delivered and the smashing team gave us a spacious room that had all the usual hotel amenities with a lovely view overlooking Times Square.

The rooms are modern decorated and immaculately clean. The bedding and pillows are divine and the service impressive.

You’ll get complimentary water during your stay and also a fantastic complimentary shoe shine service.

The hotel has a breathtaking roof-top bar terrace that has amazing views overlooking the square and serves amazing cocktails and a variety of other beverages. Gio is a skilled mixologist.

Eric on the concierge desk is very helpful as are the general concierge and porters.

Definitely once of NYC finest and a place we would happily return.

title: Great hotel experience!
text:
Such a pleasant stay at The Knickerbocker! Upon arrival, I was greeted by friendly staff and conceirge. As I approached the front desk, Ms. Paola was so nice and super helpful. When I checked in she immediately welcomed me. I shared with her that I was in town to see my sister’s Broadway debut.  When my sister met me in the lobby, Ms. Paola congratulated her and hoped to see her show!  The room was very comfortable and I greatly appreciated having a room with interior windows (verses facing 42nd). I really liked the blackout drapes too! 

If you’re in town to experience Time Square and Broadway, you can not beat the location. The history of this hotel is unbelievable and I can’t wait to stay here again.

title: Outstanding staff and perfect location
text: We had such an amazing time and the staff were so good the front desk team and the guys on the door honestly couldn’t have been more amazing. Chester on the bell team went above and beyond for us he’s an absolute credit to the team and Paola, Cynthia and Brandon on the front desk couldn’t have been more helpful out stay wouldn’t have been the same if it weren’t for these amazing team members. The general manager also super kind he brought us up to the rooftop to take a couple of pictures for our wedding day absolute gentleman. The location and the facilities of the hotel are top tier the rooms are larger than your average NYC hotel and so clean and comfortable but with so many hotels in NYC it really is the staff that really make a hotel and make your experience. We honestly couldn’t have had a better 6 nights in NYC and that is down to the super helpful and kind staff in the Knickerbocker. I couldn’t recommend the hotel enough. And we can’t wait to return next year! You pay for what you get the location is close to absolutely everything and anything you need at all the staff on the front desk and the bell team will go above and beyond for you. No hidden charges/taxes which can be common with nyc hotels but not at the Knickerbocker! Can’t wait to go back!

title: Check your bill!
text:
Stayed for 5 nights. Great location, comfortable room.  Had an excellent breakfast one day. 

Would have been 5 stars but

On leaving, we were in a bit of a rush so asked for the bill to be  emailed not printed. It never arrived but some weeks later got hit by a bill for over USD300.  For 2 breakfasts?! 

I've emailed 3 times to ask for details but received no reply.  Be careful!

title: A Times Square Classic, Right in the Middle of Things
text:
The hotel is easy to find, literally right at the corner of 42d St and Broadway.  At street level the hotel’s portico makes it easy to find.  The entrance is on 42d St.  The hotel staff does not hail cabs for guests but we did okay for ourselves out front.  Just down the street is Broadway, and the traffic there guarantees a cab hail in no time flat, with a nice safe place to pull over, too.

Check-in was a bit slow, as it seemed they were a bit short on staff.  I overheard another party having difficulties with reserved suites, having to settle for donwgrades.  We did not have a problem with our reservation, in and up to the room in good time.  Our baggage arrived in no time.  I asked for a portable luggage rack, which showed up in very good time.

The elevators are activated by your room key, which is a nice security feature given the traffic in the Times Square area.  It’s mighty dark in the elevators, which makes it somewhat difficult to quickly read and punch your floor.  There are cameras in the elevators.

The room was clean on arrival, but showed some signs of wear, specifically the wooden veneer on the bedframe, clearly showing some intense wear.  Given that this hotel is literally right on Time Square, that’s not too bad.  The room was in order, with everything working except for the bedside reading lamp on one side.

We got some instruction on the working of the automatic blinds, which worked just fine.  Both of the huge windows do in fact open, to only about 6”, so you can get some "fresh" air if you want it.  But you’ll also get all of the sounds and delightful scents of the street, which is why we kept the windows closed.

The TV was good size, could have been bigger.  The channel selection was modest, not that impressive, and the remote control was a bit sluggish.  The room desk had an HDMI plug for your own video.  The desk also had a USB port and two electric plugs for devices; there were no USB ports at the bedsides.

There was a mini fridge, which was a godsend, in the closet, with some small space above it.  There was no coffee maker or coffee service in the room.  The closet was good size, with a number of amenities.  No sofa, but a single swiveling but non-reclining easy chair.

The bed was big and pretty comfy.  There were lots of pillows, surprisingly fluffy and resilient; they did not smash down flat after just a couple of minutes.  One side of the bed had a huge shelf next to it, lots of space, while the other side had a tiny little shelf, no space at all for a bottle of water, phone, etc.  There were electrical plugs close by on both side of the bed, but no USB plugs.

Room servicing each day was very well done.  My partner and I both sleep with our own woobies, and whaddaya know, the staff had actually incorporated the woobies into the bed on each side when they made the bed each day.  That’s some wonderful and attentive service, for which I left a nice tip.

We called down to room service twice, first for some plates and flatware and a second time for coffee cups and flatware.  Service was quick and helpful.

Room lighting was good, but the controls were screwy and hard to figure out, all set with push buttons on the walls.  It was hard to suss out how to work individual lights, with the entire room going dark or lighting up.  The bathroom light control was cleverly hidden by a countertop magnifying mirror.

The room thermostat was good, intuitive and immediately responsive.  It got mighty cold in NYC while we visited, and the thermostat did its job perfectly.

There were two phones in the room, both of which worked just fine…but not so much for Guest Services.  I called the number, noted right on the phone a couple of times and no one answered.  Not ever.  Eventually it went to the hotel central service and I was asked to leave a message.  Midway through the visit I got a hotel survey via text, which I filled out with something like “yeah, answering the phone would be a good thing when guests call.”  I got an email from management and a couple of notices asking me how things were going, but nothing else…not a personal visit or, ahem, a phone call, as it were.

The bathroom was spacious, with a separate toilet room and a walk-in shower for at least two.  Depending on how friendly you are, you could easily get four folks into the shower.  Good space, good heat and water pressure, with modest shelf space inside, but no seat, no bench, no hook or rung for a washcloth, and no step at all inside the shower.

Lots of awesome counter space inside the bathroom, which was very good.  None at all in the powder room, which is not so good.  For some reason the toilet is very low-slung, with the toilet roll holder all of 11” from the floor…why so low?  In distinct opposition to the ample counter space there was only one peg in the entire bathroom, on which two hotel robes were already hung.  So where to towels go?  Can’t throw them over the bar as the powder room and shower have floor-to-ceiling glass doors.  There were smallish handles on the powder room and shower doors, but not very big.  Put up some more pegs or rungs for things, folks.

Note that the breakfast buffet is not included with the room.  It’s a modest buffet, with the standard stuff like eggs, bacon, fruit, cereals, etc., all of it pre-made and nothing done with a chef.  Enough choices but nothing really spectacular.  I figured, yeah, you know, a Times Square hotel, so maybe something like $35.  Nope, it was $42.  Sorry, but the food and the service was not even close to a $42/person experience.

Bottom Line: this hotel is about as close as you can get to the heart of Times Square…and you’ll pay for that proximity.  The site is a good one, clean and in proper working order, not perfect, but right in the middle of things.

title: Very nice stay
text: We stayed for one week. It is very conveniently located on 42nd street (Time Square). Despite the noise outside, we never heard anything from the room. Very nicely equipped. Pity the restaurant was closed but lots of nice places to go in the area. Subway entrance right next to the hotel.

title: Great location and clean hotel
text: I really enjoyed our stay at the Knickerbocker. The location was convenient to many subway lines and in the heart of time square. Joes pizza which is amazing is literally a 2 minute walk. The rooms were spacious for a NY hotel and very clean. Check in staff was friendly and concierge  was nice and helpful. The one complain I would say is there were lots of noises that we could hear from our bedroom. We can hear people from the hallway talking really clearly and the doors closing. It felt as if the door was open and we could hear everything inside the hotel. I don’t mind the noise from the street because, hey, it’s NYC and you’re going to hear noise from the street. Overall, still enjoyed the stay.

title: Great location
text: The Knickerbocker was the perfect place to stay for attending Broadway plays. We are within blocks of all three plays we say within a week, and within walking distance. The staff was so helpful to answer our every question or to help solve our transportation needs. Even the room maid was very friendly and smiling. A man brought us bottled water everyday and they greeted us with cookies and milk, and fruit in our room the very first day. The room had a gorgeous view of Times Square with lots of activity to watch, yet the noise was sufficiently muffled not to disturb sleep. The room was well appointed and pleasant to spend time in. All in all, we were extremely pleased with our accommodations and will definitely stay again our next trip to NYC.

title: Great Location and Great Service
text:
This is my new favorite hotel in NYC.  We go several times a year and this hotel by far has the best service.  Everyone was super friendly and helpful especially Stephanie at the Concierge desk.  My daughter needed hair and makeup done for a photo shoot and she found the most amazing person before we even got there.   She also managed to snag a spa reservation last minute for my daughter and her friend. 

 The location of this hotel is amazing as well.  It is not in the busiest part of Times Square and is very central to everything.  We were able to walk to all our Broadway Shows and loved walking to Bryant Park every morning.  Also, there are a bunch of subway lines close which is very convenient for getting anywhere in the city.   

The rooms were a good size and the bathrooms were definitely bigger than most NYC hotels.   I will definitely be staying here again!

title: Quality Hotel Near Very Near Times Square
text: This hotel provides all of the quality and service you would expect of a "Leading Hotels of the World" property.  It is exceptionally close to Times Square and provides a top quality alternative for accommodation in an otherwise touristy area for the masses.  Parking is not on site but the hotel certainly provides and option nearby.  Curiously there was an absence of front door staff, perhaps due to pandemic constraints.

title: Very insensitive staff
text: My worse experience in a New York hotel. Bad odor On the rooms and total lack of Covid protocol. I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to my friends or family. The manager were so rude . I feel frustrated to waste my Christmas breaks an my money in that hotel .

title: Excelente hotel
text: Excelente hotel, logran resolverte todo lo que necesites, destacó a Paola y su profesionalismo, volvería sin dudarlo, ubicación fantástica, un bar en el último piso con una vista preciosa y sobre todo personal gentil y bien preparado

title: Our Honeymoon
text: We stayed here either end of our honeymoon in December 2021 and early January 2022.
