I got Covid and my wife and I had to self-isolate in the hotel in Jan 2022 for 5 extra days (so far, we are still here). The staff could not do enough to help us and have been absolutely fabulous. The Ops Manager, Tenzin Namdol, Richard who helped with supplies to our room and the reception team all deserve a special mention - Thanks to all of you. We wouldn't hesitate to come back here again

title: NOT a 5 star hotel at all This is a 4 star hotel with poor service
text: This was my second visit and my last visit. No one to help with luggage, everyone standing at reception, no one really cares about you....robots. Concierge is not normal. I booked because it was a Leading Hotel. This hotel charges a sneaky $35 per day resort fee but there is no minibar, not a glass in the room, no restaurant in the hotel, no real room service...

title: Amazing!
text: We stayed here as a family of four mid dec from the UK. The room was a great size for a family, large bathroom and little sofa area and a small fridge. 2 large comfy beds. Excellent location, clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, doormen always pleasant and welcoming. We requested a quiet room. We had room 1519 on the 15th floor and it was perfect. We didn’t have any particular view from the room as it was an internal view room but it was extremely quiet which is rare for a hotel room in NYC. We weren’t in the room ally’s lol during the day. The blind didn’t work properly when we arrived - maintenance came within 10 mins and fixed. Rooms were cleaned daily/beds made and new towels when you press the service button by the door. The only negative is you have to pay $25 for a coffee machine in the room which we weren’t impressed with. No tea making facilities. We had to ask for coffee pods to be replenished. For a hotel like this tea and coffee should be a standard basic. All other hotels we have stayed in nyc have this provided for free! Would definitely recommend this hotel for its location, lovely rooms, friendly staff. We would stay here again.

title: Christmas in New York
text: Great 5 night stay at the Knickerbocker over Christmas. We've stayed here before and this has become our "go to" hotel in new York (we've tried 3 others) -  even in these strange and difficult times, the hotel didn't disappoint - from check in to check out, we were exceptionally well looked after (as always). The Hotel is always spotlessly clean. Special mention to Ganyia, who served us so well the last time, and did so again. Would definitely recommend this hotel to all.

title: A wonderful experience in this beautifl hotel
text: We booked four nights in this lovely hotel over Christmas and to celebrate my partner's 50th birthday. The staff were wonderful, especially the concierge Erik and the front of house staff member, Paola who couldn't do enough for us and helped me with making arrangements for balloons and a cake for my partner, they well and truly spoiled her and us in general. lovely room as well.

title: Week-end in New York
text:
I appreciated my stay at your hotel.
Your employees are super friendly.
The hotel is very well located. 
The beds in the rooms are very comfortable.
The only thing I don’t like is that your breakfast are very expensive.

title: Fun Christmas Getaway!
text: The location of this hotel is ideal - walking distance to most everything. Easy to get to restaurants, stroll through the lights at night… The staff was friendly and energetic - especially the middle of the night crew! They even helped us locate a pizza at 11:30 when the restaurants were too full to get a seat. Great find. Thanks guys!

title: Great Weekend Getaway in Time Square
text: Came to the city to catch a show or 2, shop and enjoy Christmas in NY. Perfect location!! Service was good. Roof top restaurant view was special!! Room was descent size. I was surprised how quit it was 12th so very little street noise.

title: Outstanding option in the heart of the city
text: The Knickerbocker experience is truly wonderful. Extraordinary service and attention to detail. Situated in the perfect location for all times square activities and a level of luxury that is missing from many of the other hotels in the area. Everything that you need for a perfect NY experience.

title: Lovely Rooftop
text:
I went to the Knickerbocker Hotel and they have a very nice rooftop. This place is located  at the middle of Times Square with a very nice view and good drinks.
They have a short menu with appetizers and nice cocktails for $24. The staff was very attentive, our waitres Carolina gave us an amazing experiencie.
We will come back.

title: Amazing view and cocktails
text:
We were looking for a nice rooftop close to Times Square with my girlfriend and we  found ST Cloud.
We loved it, our waitres Carolina was amazing and very helpfull explaining us the menu in Spanish. 
The place has an amazing view and cocktails.      We will deffinitly come back.

title: Amazing place yo chill and relax
text: First Time I visited this rooftop and it is honestly the best rooftop lounge un nyc, the ambiance is so relaxing, the Dios is amazing and the service is perfecy, Carolina made the experience so perfect with her recommendations and she truly elevated our experience.

title: Amazing experience
text: Such an amazing experience, carolina was such an amazing person that made our night as fabulous as possible. Honestly the best rooftop I’ve ever been in, from the service to the drinks and the ambiance everything is top notch.  Thank you so much for the wonderful experience.

title: 7 nights of disturbed sleep
text:
First of all, the hotel is very clean, bath amenities are great; staff members are very helpful and friendly. 
Now the comments have nothing to do with the staff members, most of the room have wobbly door, the door and frame are not properly sealed. 
First night of our stay, all night long and all we hear is bang bang bang bang(not sure why someone having room service and have to slam the door that hard）
In the morning, we then realised whenever someone leave the door shut itself, it will just slam shut! 
We made a few comments to the front desk and they were very helpful and get an in house technician to come and have a look. The technician acknowledged the hotel is due refurb!
So, we get moved to another room, a bit smaller but pretty much the same and thinking we will be fine.
Guess what, exactly the same thing happened; door slamming whenever someone get in and out of their room, we can hear the heave bang/slam noise from our room. 
We walk to the front desk again the next morning, they get us to fill out a survey form.
But, the noise issue persists on our entire stay. We ended up putting a couple of towels think that might reduces the noise. 
A part from the noise, I think the hotel should also have a few towel rails or hooks that enough for at least 2 towels!
If the management wants a video footage of the noise, I am more than happy to send it to them. I have a few copies of them capturing inside our room when our neighbours slamming their door

title: Nice room, comfortable bed. Extremely Loud.
text: We had a nice stay. The service at this hotel was very poor. They have levied unexplained charges. They have not bothered to return calls to clarify. Extremely loud location. Overall very dissatisfied, feel like the price of this hotel was definitely not worth it.

title: The Perfect Weekend
text: We had a great time in NYC! When we arrived our room wasn’t ready because it was early, so they called and texted us when it was ready. Everyone was super nice from the front desk people, the doorman and the cleaning people. The room itself was extremely comfortable for two people. The bathroom was large; each part of the bathroom was private. We went to the rooftop before going to the theatre and had a great time there. And you can’t beat its location! In the middle of everything. Best weekend getaway!

title: Great Hotel - NO ONSITE PARKING!
text: The hotel was absolutely AMAZING! Very large room and very clean! It would be a 5 out of 5, however, the hotel did not advertise that there is no longer on-site parking. You have to "self-park" a few blocks away. We all know what just "a few blocks" away is like in the City. When I went to pick up my car the garage only had one person show up that day. I waited over an hour only to find out they essentially lost my car. They mixed the numbers up and I had to walk around the different floors with the attendant to find my truck. Once we finally found it (it took a WHILE) it was an absolute nightmare to get back to the hotel to pick up my kids and all of our bags. There were no employees outside to watch the truck so I could run up to our room, so I had to leave my kids in my truck on the street in front of the hotel. As much as I loved the hotel, I would not stay here again after this ordeal.

title: Forhad
text: Staying at Knickerbocker Hotel. Lovely hotel and the roof top is amazing! Forhad who works at St Cloud Roof top bar was brilliant and so helpful with his recommendations where we should visit, not to mention fantastic service!

title: Forhad
text: Our photograph captured  a once in a lifetime memory. This will be something we will hang on the wall in our home. Forhad did an amazing job and we thank him for capturing this moment. Our trip to New York City was amazing!

title: Forhad and johir
text: Best time ever. Best staff. So much fun. I love the time I spent there. Best drinks ever. So happy to be here. Forhad is the best employee ever. He is awesome thank you.  Love it here so much. Def coming back.

title: Great location, beautiful room
text: Centrally located in the heart of NYC - the knickerbocker provide a large room that was clean and comfortable. We felt safe and comfortable in and around the hotel. We saw the beautiful roof top bar which was amazing but unfortunately didn’t have time to sit and enjoy a beverage this trip. Short walk to theaters and many great shops/restaurants.

title: Johir
text: Amazing service. We had a blast at my friends 21st birthday view of Times Square and the ball!! So much fun would 10/10 recommend. Margaritas were to die for and the espresso martinis!!!! Johir the server was the best gave us a charger for our phones and made sure we were happy thank you!

title: Forhaf
text: Service was excellent! The views are breathtaking! Farhaf was amazing, he was really attentive and caring. This guy went above and beyond to make sure our needs were met. I will definitely return back with our family!

title: Great time!
text: Johir was awesome! He took great pictures! He  was so friendly and personable. The drinks were also great and the view is like no other in the city! We will definitely come back next time we’re in town.

title: Forhad
text: Forhad gave us excellency service at Knickerbocker. He was very attentive and recommend Forhad to all my friends who visit New York!!! You won’t be disappointed! The best service in New York and I will definitely come back!

title: Forhad
text:
Forhad si very nice he take caer Of alse he Govea a
Eles water blancat .very nice Services.forhad is the best.se enjoy here .we higly recomand here drink is good .view is so nice.i Love eare New York enjoy

title: Rooftop Christmas visit
text: Johir was awesome - took our picture and took great care of us.  He really went above and beyond to help us enjoy the evening.  The food was good and drinks were delicious too!  Atmosphere was fun; highly recommend pre-Broadway outing.

title: Johir and Victoria
text: The view and drinks were great! Johir and Victoria were were great servers on the rooftop, very friendly and professional! You can even see the New York New Years Eve Ball! Personal heaters at the tables and great friends made!

title: The Knick’s a Classic
text: Sitting in the heart of the theater district and Times Square, the Knickerbocker is quintessential NYC. Look out at the bright lights, feel the city’s energy. What really sets the Knick apart are the people that bring it to life. Their service and style are second to none. Highly recommended. First on our list.

title: Great food at an incredible location!
text: Great food and service at a marvelous location at Times Square. Johir helped us very well, and told us everything there is  to know about New York. I would recommend visiting this place whenever you are in NYC.  The drinks maybe a little on the expensive side but the view absolutely makes up for that.

title: Forhad
text:
Forhad is so accommodating! He made us feel welcome and gave us the perfect photo op as a family :) 

Upon arrival, our drinks arrived timely and we were taken care of throughout the evening, huge shout out to Forhad!

title: forhad
text: Great service, heated rooftop in the winter, very good place for drinks and small bites! Went here to celebrate a birthday and were seated immediately. We did go on a weekday on a chilly day in December but we were very comfortable!

title: Johir
text:
Me and my partner arrived in New York looking for a lovely rooftop view and boy did we find one!

All of the staff were Friendly, attentive, and so so kind!! 

What a perfect spot and an amazingly honeymoon treat!

title: Great location
text: This is a wonderful hotel if you are in town for a theatre weekend - so centrally located & beautiful to boot. Rooms are beautifully designed,. The staff is so friendly & helpful. Only wish (& I know this will probably come back after Covid) Would have loved easy access to coffee or water in the morning :)

title: Not a 5 star hotel AT ALL!!
text:
Definitely not a 5-star hotel at all.
Bad Customer service, no concierge, no 24 hour room service, food and beverage menu VERY VERY limited, internet/Wi-Fi DOES NOT WORK AT ALL.
We stayed in a suite and supposedly was the best one, and even though we were on the 15th floor, we had No VIEW of anything at all. Our only window was blocked by other buildings.
Elevators smelled like Gas.
Will not stay here again and will not recommended as a 5 star hotel.
However, it is in a GREAT location and it is completely remodeled.
This is more like a 3 star hotel with a good location.

title: Forhad
text: Forhad was so great! We had a party here recently and the whole event was totally lovely! Service was wonderful. The food also was excellent. Wish we could’ve stayed longer.  Will definitely come back.

title: PHENOMENAL
text: lemme tell you… johir and don: AMAZING. i was here for an opening night event and the staff were ridiculously attentive and kind. the professionalism they showed, even on a cold rooftop, was immaculate. if you need a place to go for wonderful drinks, delicious food, and wonderful service: CHOOSE THE KNICKERBOCKER!!

title: Johir,and Don
text: Beautiful staff! Wonderful and quick service. And amazing experience overall! Playful. Even in the cold, everyone  is willing g to assist the customers. I don't know where else you'd want to go! I CANT EXPRESS MY GRATITUDE

title: Scandalous Hidden Charges...!!
text:
Hotel, Location PERFECT..
BUT!!! On checking out we were NOT TOLD about some Hidden costs that apparently ALL NYC Hotels Charge?? We stayed for 4 nights and had No Extras But we got charged $183. 00 for what??? Apparently for the Privileges we had in the Room! (Which we didn't use btw) Bottled water, Robes Etc and even so these things you would have thought were included in the cost of staying in the hotel surely... So NOT A HAPPY FAMILY... 🤬🤬🤬

title: A must in NYC
text:
Awesome bar with great views of Times Square, heated terrace and comfy sofa area with private booths 

Super friendly staff, Forhad our server was amazing thank you so much :-)

Keep up the good work guys!!!!!

title: Great place to stay
text: I had never stayed in a hotel in Times Square.  I had no idea what to expect.  I knew I wanted to be right in the middle of Time Square action, and that is exactly what I got by staying at this location.  We had a corner suite so it was very roomy.  The staff was great and very attentive.  There are two bars/lounges in the hotel, so you don't have to go far if you don't want to.  A subway stop was on the corner.  All in all, I would definitely recommend the hotel due to location and the atmosphere.

title: St. Cloud: Rooftop Bar
text: Our bartender Enayet had great recommendation for drinks and was able to make some additional drinks off the menu. Drinks are great and the service was amazing!. Highly recommend visiting if your are in NYC Or Time Square

title: Best Busser Ever!!!
text: Forhad  was the best fun busser ❤️❤️❤️ I will come back every time I come to NYC!  He takes the best photos ever!!! I really enjoyed how personable he was and made us feel welcomed!!! He knows all the best spots! He is expecting his first child soon!!!

title: Forhad
text: Forhad was our “rooftop, selfie angel” You. Must. Come. AND let’s not forget Gio, the bartender extraordinaire! Knickerbockers is a lot of fun! Early, Late, maybe even for breakfast! Thank you! They say I need 200 characters!

title: Great roof top bar
text: Great place to grab a drink in midtown. Amazing views of Times Square and good drinks. Forhad is the best, he really went the extra mile for us!! Great views and experience, would highly recommend!!!!

title: Un hotel nuevo!!
text: El hotel estaba prácticamente recién abierto. Las habitaciones y zonas comunes son fantásticas. Muy recomendable si quieres estar en la zona de Times Square. Yo prefiero sin duda otras zonas de NY mucho mas tranquilas y agradables y menos ruidosas, aunque dentro del hotel no se oye nada.

title: Johir and Isabel
text: Johir and Isabel were fantastic! We were guests of Knickerbocker and stopped at the rooftop bar for a pre-event drink and snack! They made sure we were warm, entertained and all around taken care of. 10-10 recommend a visit to this rooftop and this team!

title: Rude Valet that made us happy to leave the city; hotel was fine
text:
I’ve been staying at this hotel once a year ever since they reopened in 2015 (aside from 2020), but this has got to be my worst stay by far. I think there’s more wear and tear on the elevators and the cards wouldn’t read all the time so it was difficult to push the button to our floor without the elevator moving elsewhere because the floor didn’t stay selected. Aside from that, I would say the worst part was actually the staff. Reception was wonderful, but the valet was not. I believe his name was Chester? He was very rude and not helpful. We got ticketed twice while in the loading zone of the hotel to check in/out. The first ticket had colorful language that the officer had written down. I didn’t realize that he was the one that said “f— you” and I had tipped him for handling the car even after the first ticket! When we were were leaving, we noticed that there was another ticket and Chester had knocked on the window to give us back our valet key, and had very rudely said “the car’s been here over an hour” as if we were stupid and caused it. 

Not only was that a gross exaggeration, but we were just following rules of what the other staff when checking in had said about calling to get the car from the garage: on Sunday, call an hour ahead of time you need to leave to get the car because it gets very busy. That’s what we did. We also never heard from the hotel that the car was out front, so we got out there shortly after check out time (around 12:05 pm). 

I usually recommend this hotel for first timers going to New York because of the location, friendly staff, and spacious rooms, however, I won’t be coming back due to the poor experience we had. I was super embarrassed about overselling this hotel and not have it live up to the expectations I had given my partner. With that being the start to our last day, he had said “I can’t wait to leave the city” and I think it’s such a shame that there was this rudeness from a stranger working in the hospitality industry. It’s been a hard couple of years for everyone, and while we try to be compassionate to those who are working hard with long hours, this was inexcusable.  Do better.

title: Great location to Times Square
text:
Pretty good room but felt disappointed by no bed side cabinet and staff were inconsistent.
I have stayed in many American hotels between 100-120 and always had a bed side cabinet. I had to use a chair for my phone and alarm clock. Went to the roof top bar, waitress was miserable. The man from Bangladesh was friendly thou. Great view from there too.overall quite pleased.

title: Hits all the right notes!!!
text: Great hotel, great location, great service, great food and great price!!! what is there to fault here. Modern - with an amazing roof top bar. Super central. Would not consider staying anywhere else - business or holiday!!

title: A nice stay at the heart of NY
text: Great location, spacious rooms, excellent bed quality, effective and nice staff at the reception made the 7 nights stay very comfortable. The only negative issues where the noise coming from the corridor (there is no noise isolation at all, for which the strong noise of the rooms's doors closing, as well as a gap of around 4 centimeters between the bottom of the door and the floor probably contribute). The service was not always perfect - the bins weren't drained out everyday, the empty bottles of water were not always removed and I got one complimentary bottle of water which was only half full and had already been opened ... Will get back anyway.

title: The knickerbocker Hotel
text: Absolutely amazing hotel with wonderful service. It made our stay in New York extra special. Gania and all the breakfast staff were so friendly, and the doormen were too!! Will definitely be using this hotel if we ever return to New York

title: Excellent Stay!
text:
From the moment we arrived till we drove away to come home, the customer service was excellent! We were greeted by Brandon at reception who went above and beyond to ensure our first moments upon arrival went smoothly. His friendly, professional personality was very welcome after a long drive. He took the time to find out our needs and was able to meet all of them. Our suite was so clean, quiet and spacious, just what we needed for a 5 night stay. We had breakfast every morning and Lisette also went above and beyond to get to know and serve us. We had drinks at the roof top bar and again the service was excellent! Every single employee we encountered was extremely friendly, well done Knickerbocker! 
After our second night we booked a return trip to this hotel for the spring:) 
Thank you for helping make our stay wonderful!

title: Stay anywhere else in NYC other than here
text:
Worst hotel experience I’ve had in a long time. 

I have no idea how this place is classed as a 5* Hotel… list of bad’s, before good’s, as there really aren’t many goods.. 

- Overall entrance hall is very underwhelming; there was no concierge on.. and it was unclear where the reception desks actually were
- check-in was rude and abrupt 
- apparently we got “upgraded” to a suite with a city view. They shouldn’t have bothered, I woke up at 7am by the traffic every day as the walls are as thin as paper. We were also close to the lift, and every time someone got off on our floor, we could hear the doors open and shut…. Not ideal every morning
- room had apparently been covid “sanitised”. Not overly fussed about the covid situation… but the room clearly hadnt been “sanitised” as there were still glass ring marks on the bed side tables. We asked for someone to come and clean it up, they sent someone up.. not sure what they did as the marks still remained after.. we just left it as we cba after that 
- Room layout and decor was poor, more like an English Premier Inn
- lifts were shocking, and none of the screens worked so had no idea what floor you were on… everyone in the hotel had problems with the lifts
- check out was disastrous… we got told we had to pay an additional $150 of city tax and “resort fee”… not that there is a resort… such a basic hotel. We said we’d contact Expedia to sort out what had happened, when we got back I was just handed my invoice and they told me they’d taken it off of my credit card already (without me saying so), we wanted to pay cash….. 

Disgrace of a hotel and would strongly recommend staying anywhere else. 

This hotel isn’t 5*. Maybe 3* at best. Location is obviously decent… but that doesn’t make the hotel quality / staff any better or politer. 

Stay in Chelsea/Greenich/Brooklyn where the hotel might actually care about the service they’re providing customers.

title: Average
text: Great location. Very clean. Staff polite and professional. Disappointed in service ie took an age for morning coffee to be delivered to the room/the concierge did not reply to my email regarding booking tickets. We booked a superior deluxe double room but got a normal one. After a lot of 'polite haggling' the hotel wavered the 'tax payment' but tried to avoid it. Breakfast very nice but also very, very expensive

title: Johir and Elizabeth
text: Wonderful experience at the rooftop with Johir! He shares his life and story with you, should you like to know. Attentive to water refills and helping you unwind after a long day in the city. Such an easy place to get into and have a great drink! They are also great at helping you grab great photos from the rooftop of iconic locations close by. Thanks all who work here!

title: Sue NYC theater trip
text: Great hotel!  The service couldn't have been better.  The Roof Top Bar is awesome too.  This was a theater trip so the location was perfect.  We felt safe yet close to all the action.  I will definitely be back!

title: Classy, Jazzy in the location one would least expect
text: Thanks to the 'Leading Hotels of the World', I now found this great hotel and probably  my next permanent one. Although I am less one to enjoy the hustle of Times square, the magnificent views I had from my room and the amazing roof top bar, were worth the location. Room was specious (yes I was upgraded), room is clean and modern styled, perfect amenities and  impeccable service ( thank you @Paola from the front desk that gave us the most professional, helpful and friendly service I have received in along time). This hotel is a winner.

title: Forhad
text: We had a great time at St Cloud while in NYC, had the best food and the best waiter Forhad!  He was so sweet and helpful ! We celebrated my daughter’s Birthday!  Love love love this place! Daughter speaking’s—-I love it here most amazing drinks and food to get in nyc DEFINITELY RECOMMEND-ask for farhad!

title: The Knick
text:
Great hotel and location. Have stayed here multiple times and we are happy enough that we keep coming back.
The only negative is the activity fee. We were charged $35 plus taxes for 2 bottles of water. We did not use the gym, spa or internet. Perhaps they should charge the people who prefer to use those services.

title: Johir,Guy,Gunja, Dogan
text:
Johir was AMAZING. This was our first time here and it was a little chilly but he brought us blankets, took amazing pics, and was super helpful. Told all my friends about this place and will definitely come back! Highly recommend. 

Also, the drinks were delicious.

title: If you're in for a poor hotel experience, go here!
text:
Net, net: The Knickerbocker management must realize that running a 5-star hotel means lots of qualified staff; frankly, to take care of the basics and every whim of its high-paying guests. Sadly, the hotel doesn't live up to the 5-star promise; it struggles with the basics like cleanliness and attentive staff. I appreciate that it's hard to find and keep the right team. It's the management's job, though.

My stay at The Knickerbocker Hotel must have been my worst hotel experience for the last 30 years. Here's the list :

- First night, electric window blinds were not to be closed for whatever reason. Great, if you want to give others an unobstructed view of you. Maintenance showed up to fix it and couldn't, but at least got it lowered for the night using brute force. Set the next day.

- One of the bedside lamps not working. It was never fixed due to 'LED bulbs not available.'

- Inner closet light was operating permanently, providing a 'nice' ray of light during the night. Fixed the next day.

- Glass walls in bathroom dirty – some yucky-colored and dried-up water runners - totally disgusting. Housekeeping never managed to clean it. After two days, I got tired of it and cleaned it myself.

- Restrooms on 4th floor next to gym/breakfast area on Sunday, 11-14-21, 4 pm unbelievably filthy (apparently not looked after for the whole weekend), our son: "Saying, 'like in a 4th world country', would be a great injustice – to those countries!"

- When getting ready to checkout, our son discovered the dirty coffee (let's hope!) stains on the duvet under which he had slept the last few nights (see photo). Here we are, amid the COVID pandemic, and this hotel doesn't even get basic cleaning done.

- Upon scrutinizing my bill at checkout, I found out that the breakfast staff hadn't accepted my tip as written down. Instead, they had left their suggested tip of 18% on the check (which I had crossed out - 18% tip for self-service breakfast, I don't think so). In any event, I call this thievery!

The last incident called for the involvement of the hotel management. Tenzin, the assistant manager on duty, got hugely embarrassed when I showed her photos of the duvet and the breakfast check. To her credit, she managed to calm me down and promised to get the breakfast check right. In addition, she offered to drop the daily $30 for wifi, gym access, and water bottles on the room. Meanwhile, both have happened.

title: Thanksgiving visit
text: We selected our stay here based on rating, location and the fact you were one of the view hotels with two queen beds; many hotels only offer one king.  Very clean and friendly environment, we have thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

title: Johir
text: He was absolutely fabulous and courteous! Professional and charming. He made our visit magical. You should absolutely visit and look for him on the rooftop deck/bar. Have a hot toddy and enjoy the beautiful view!

title: not 5 star - very dirty
text:
no doorman was helping us getting of the taxi
no uniforms of the employees
no restaurant (except for breakfast. Even the bar was closed - and the roof top bar was closed on Sundays and most of the day!
empty minibar and of course no room service!!!
my request sent prior to arrival were not answered - for example provide Coca Cola in Minibar or make a reservation in a restaurant the day I arrived
there was no adapter in the room for European iPhone but I RECEIVED IT AT THE FRONT DESK WHEN  I ASKED FOR.
In the bath there was one small bottle of shower gel and one shampoo - this was improved after intervention from my side
no brush in the toilette and two Kleenex left in the box...
very dusty groud floor and old and very used furniture which would not be acceptable for a 3 star hotel
If this room was supposed to be a Executive Suite I do not want to know how the other rooms looked like.
The lobby - the only place where we could wait for our transportation had 8 seating placed - all occupied  and many bags lying around - obviously since the Bar and the restaurant and the roof top bar were closed at 14.30 h !!!
as a reaction on my complaint they reduced my bill by 85 USD or 2% on a 5 nights stay! Thank you!!! Never again!!!

title: Great time
text: We had a drink at the rooftop bar after walking around the tourist sites of Times Square. Had  a great time on the roof top bar.Johir who helped us was great. Good drinks, great views and worth being outside even in the cold. Definitely worth the visit

title: Wonderful time at the Knick
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights, and had a lovely time. The atmosphere was welcoming, comfortable, and elegant. The staff was outstanding . Very kind, helpful, cheerful, seemingly glad we were there. Very special commendations to Paola & Perla! They were simply wonderful; so sweet, helpful- made us feel like family. Answered every question, and made an effort to help in any way needed. Paola upgraded our room on checkin, which was a welcome event. 
They also provided us with vouchers for free drinks at the St Cloud rooftop restaurant/bar; awesome!!
Also, concierge Erik Sherr. He worked very hard, and went out of his way to get us the very best tickets to The Lion King, which I was very much looking forward to. He worked for 2 days to make this work, and checked back with us to make it all work. 
The rooms and entire atmosphere were "comfort modern". Cozy/modern, yet welcoming. We have stayed at larger hotels in NYC, but this was not as hectic or as crowded feeling. Overall, a great experience, and we would look forward to staying there again. 
The doorman and his associates were friendly and accessible, but also made us feel safe. The particular doorman on our departure (Sunday, 11/21) was extremely helpful getting us a taxi to the airport. Our car service failed us (Carmel) failed us, and if it weren"t for him, I don't know how or when we would have ever gotten a taxi to the airport. The holiday crowd was starting in as we were departing, and taxis were at a premium. 
They even provided a coffee maker and Kuerig cubes for in room coffee, very important for my husband. 
Overall, great, considering understaffing everywhere due to Covid reality. We never felt ignored or "neglected"'
Additionally, the location is great!

title: Fantastic Time!
text: I was in NYC to see family and friends in October, and l am glad I stayed at this hotel. Service was great given how short-staffed hotels are today, the location was prime and overall, everyone was just really friendly. My room was clean and tidy upon check-in and they did a great job of letting me know about things to do in the area.

title: I was overcharged on my credit card & can't get it resolved.
text: The location is great, the on site staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. However, I was charged twice for the "resort fee" or whatever they call it, and after 4 phone calls and 3 weeks, I can't get them to give me a credit. It's a small amount of money, but I'm not impressed with their response to the situation.

title: johir & Forhad
text: amazing service and photos. I love the view. can you the hotel is really cool and I really like it. sooooo prettyyyyy love the photos they are super nice and i will definitely be telling everyone about this!

title: Beware of the noise and disappointing for a Leading Hotel of the World
text:
We came with such high expectation for our first return trip to NY for 600 days following the lifting of foreign entry into the USA.
Our first impression was not great when we were “greeted” by the reception staff who were very officious but had no charm or elegance about them. It doesn’t help that the reception area is small and dark, but for a 5 star hotel, they could have made the most of their welcome.
The main criticism however relates to the noise. The first night we were located by the elevator - a BIG mistake in that every time anyone arrived on our floor, we could hear the “bing”. Imagine being woken up at 3 o’clock in the morning by this!
The reception staff accommodated us the next morning by swapping rooms, but again in a very formal and unwelcoming manner.
This room was on a lower floor, and with the location directly in Time Square, the noise was again an issue.
Unfortunately we had to move a second time, and again the reception staff were helpful, but not gracious.
Finally had a room on 15th floor which was nice.
In short, I think the service was certainly not up to the standard of a Leading Hotel of the World (main reason we chose it), and only stay if you are not bothered by noise or stay on the top floors.

title: Johir
text: Amazing views!  St Cloud rooftop at the Knickerbocker has Great service, friendly staff, and delicious food, wine, great bourbon selection! A must go!  We will Definitely be coming back!  Johir and Gania (hope we spelled right!) are awesome!

title: Nice hotel bad service
text: Good location and nice rooms , no service at all. Hotel could be very nice due to location and building but who pays 300+ expects the service to be responsive . Is not the case in hotel where whatever you ask by phone , you get the answer that will happens immediately but in reality never happens …. Even basic things  like towels for shower can take more than 12 h . Quality of hotel is m assured by level of service and its very niceties send SMS to clients asking if everything ok , but would be much nicer that thinngs really were at minimum level

title: Knickerbocker Hotel
text: Wonderful hotel.  Fully remodeled.  Staff is wonderful!  They changed my room when I asked.  Rooftop bar is amazing! Know your traveling companion well as the bathroom doors are textured translucent glass!

title: Great first-time NYC experience!
text: This was the first visit to NYC for my husband and I.  We really enjoyed our stay at the Knickerbocker.  Corner suite was worth the upgrade for the extra space/views.  Great service/staff and clean, comfortable accommodations.  While there isn’t much that can be done about the city noise (to be expected in the heart of Times Square), the automatic blackout shades created a good sleep environment.  A little disappointed that one of the hotel’s restaurants was closed, but the great drinks, apps and atmosphere at the hotel’s rooftop bar, the St. Cloud made up for it.  Breakfast buffet was fresh, with a nice variety of fruit, pastries and savory options.  Prime location, within walking distance to many restaurants, shops and theaters.  Subway nearby to easily get to other areas of the city, and only about a 10-15 minute walk to Central Park!  Highly recommend this hotel, especially for first-timers like us :)

title: Great staff!
text: Given restrictions due to Covid it was a very plesant stay. The hotel is running on low of course, but the staff is doing their utmost to make it all work -  especially Chef Concierge Eric Sherr, who is a true five-star asset!

title: Very nice and pleasant stay
text: This hotel offers very nice modern amenities with comfortable beds and spacious rooms for a quite reasonable price in NYC central. It is as central as in can be - right on the Time Square, but noise-proof windows offer quite sleep at night. The bathrooms are very nice, fresh and clean - all looks new after the latest refit of the hotel. The rooftop bar is great addition and staff at the reception is very friendly. Highly recommend this hotel for short or long stays.

title: Excellent, responsive staff but the rooms are lacking and the rooftop restaurant is disappointing
text:
We found the hotel staff wonderful and the few times an issue arose (ex. TV wasn’t working, towels were missing) they were quick to help.  

The hotel was modern and lovely, however the rooms did not meet our expectations for a hotel presenting itself as a 4-star location. The TV failed repeatedly throughout our week-long stay, there was no coffee/tea service in the room (just water stains on the desk from where it obviously used to live) and several lights had burned out bulbs or were non functional.

I’m not sure if the rooftop bar is owned/operated by the hotel or a third party, but since they promote it with signage I’ll mention it here on their review - it was terrible. Servers were too few, to ridiculous wait times - it took more than 15 minutes to order drinks which then took over half an hour to arrive, at which point we left due to the wait and from hearing our neighbors on both sides complain after their food arrived that it was cold. We were very excited for a rooftop bar overlooking Times Square, and it ended up nothing but a disappointment.  So, if you’re staying at the Knickerbocker I’d suggest dining or grabbing drinks elsewhere.

title: Luz & Paola are the BEST
text:
My husband and I had a quick getaway for our anniversary. From the moment we checked in Luz and Paola were so informative and friendly. They made us feel right at home immediately. We will definitely be back please thank them for me! My room was perfect cleanliness was great, I enjoyed my quick stay. We will back with the twins :) 

- Rodriguez Family Room 509

title: Understaffed and overpriced
text:
We had a room with no view.  In fact you had to keep the curtains closed because there were offices a few feet away and they could see straight into the room.  So you paid a premium for being central but you could have been anywhere.
There was a massive staff shortage so it took hours to fulfill the simplest request.  We asked for bars of soap for the room and it took a total of 24 hours, including dozens of unanswered calls to the front desk, 3 calls and 2 visits to reception.
Breakfast buffet was very limited and they didn't have enough staff to refresh the food so it became stale and we had to wait for them to bring food out (25 minutes for bacon).
If this was a 3 star hotel, I would have been OK.  But you are paying 5 star prices ($400 per room) and getting 2 star service.

title: Beautiful and convenient
text: We were two blocks from our theatre, one block from our restaurant and in the middle of Times Sq. Perfect! Room was cozy and clean. Small but has everything we needed. Concierge snd staff all helpful and pleasant.

title: No View for a Premier City View room
text:
We were really disappointed that our Premier City View room had no view whatsoever.  It looked directly into another building.  I've attached a photo.  View is important to us and I do understand this hotel Is only about 16 stories tall and wouldn't have fabulous views but to look directly into another buildings windows as the view was disappointing. 

 I did call prior to booking and was assured the city view room was not looking into another building.:   I called the day prior asking for a nice view.  At check in I asked  again for the nicest view they had with my City view rate.  I was assured at check in that I had a great view.  I was in room 909 and this was not a city view.  Finally I called and requested something different once arriving in the room and was told they had nothing available and to go to the rooftop bar if I wanted a view.  WHAT A SNARKY COMMENT!!!  To make matters worse the rooftop was closed two of the three days we were there...  Never again here.

title: St. Cloud.
text: Isabel sandigo is a gem. And a very good asset to your company. Thanks for the great service.I would definitely recommend. Always ask for Isabel when visiting. When I return to New York I will definitely visit again.

title: Excellent service and food!
text: Excellent service and food!  Our servers Jahir and Elizabeth were so helpful. We had heaters and blankets on their rooftop which helped stave off the cold. Incredible views.  We had a business gathering and it could not have been more perfect. Highly recommended!  Music was great too!

title: Best luxury hotel on Times Square
text:
The Knickerbocker is hands down one of the best luxury hotel literally on Times Square.
The rooftop bar is absolutely beautiful with stunning views.
The front desk team at the Kickerbocker is very helpful and extremely flexible on all front.
I had multiple interactions with Paola, Perla & Tony and they were all very prompt & helpful.
Diptyque products are in the rooms which makes the stay perfect. 
Definitely coming back the view from 1505 was really special!

title: Enayet is the best
text:
Fantastic cocktails by Enayet
Brilliant service and good atmosphere
Cocktails were great quality 
Location of the hotel great 
Enayet was charming and showed great skill 
Definitely recommend visiting this establishment it’s really good value

title: נעים, איכותי, מיקום נהדר
text: התארחנו במלון לעשרה לילות בחודש אוקטובר והחוויה היתה נהדרת. החדר בו שהינו (פרמייר) היה מרווח ונוח בצורה בלתי רגילה. לא נזקקנו מידי לשירות אבל בפעמים הספורות בהם הדבר קרה - זכינו למענה מהיר ויעיל ולשביעות רצוננו הגדולה. המיקום של המלון יוצא מהכלל - וודאי למי שמבקר בעיר בפעם הראשונה. בסך הכל היתה לנו חוויה נהדרת.

title: Amazing time at St.Cloud
text:
If you looking for a rooftop bar that serves special  cocktails, I recommend St.Cloud.  This bar is located on the top of the Knickerbocker Hotel, and has a super nice atmosphere and friendly staffs.
My husband and I liked every cocktails the bartender served us! We spend very comfortable time. Thank you Enayet, we really enjoyed your  Paper Plane and Bahama Mama:) !!

title: johir& mohmmed
text: Staff was very accomadating. Rooftop bar is so nice!  Would be a great place to celebrate NewYears Eve. The New Years Eve ball drops in a building right next to the Knickerbocker St Cloud rooftop bar.  Very nice menu also!!

title: Johir&Ganja St Cloud’s Rooftop
text: So much fun!!!! Excellent service by both Johir & Ganja. Times Square roof top bar at its best. We had the most delicious cocktails and snacky snacks while taking in the sites. Personalized care- blankets and heaters!!

title: Johir&Ganja
text: Amazing service and truly great staff! Would recommend St. Cloud to anyone for business meetings or social gatherings. 5/5 stars! Constantly checked on us, 0 complaints whatsoever. We will be back!!!!!

title: Amazing event at Roof Top , St Clouds
text:
It was a great evening at St Clouds Rooftop at Saturday. First of all it’s a very well known place heart of Manhattan Times Square. Our Server Jahir was very nice with his services and has a touch of great humor. I am really pleased and satisfied of his hospitality and I would like to thanks to other stuffs as well. Highly recommended for who what to have a taste of great food , drink and enjoy the diversity of Times Square. :) 

I Hope I will visit soon .

title: Great location to walk Manhattan.
text: Beautiful and clean hotel! Staff was friendly. Convenient location in the heart of the city, but with that came terrible street noise, an anti vax rally outside of my window, honking and yelling from the street all night, a couple physically fighting and tearing apart their adjoining room at 1am. For the price payed we didn’t expect these issues. Rooftop bar was very cool, pricey ($28 for 2 Corona’s)  but you’re paying for the view. Very convenient to walk to all major attractions. If you want a great location and a clean hotel this is for you. If you want rest, or any sleep, this may not be the best one for you.

title: Good drinks and hospitable staff
text: Had a great time at on the roof top far. Service was great, Johir was unbelievably accommodating and helpful. Made sure we stayed warm and had everything we needed. The chicken sliders are a must have and the views are unbeatable.

title: Gio at The Rooftop Bar is everything a bartender should be.
text: I wasn’t a guest at the hotel, but landed at The Rooftop Bar after theater nearby.  Gio, the bartender, made our visit (and pricey cocktails) worth every cent.  A talented mixologist who’s quick with the bottles as well as his wit, was a delightful person to banter with, and he guided us to delicious drinks and a wonderful evening.

title: Justin
text: Staying at this hotel has been amazing but the roof top and bartender Gio just truly great when I return i will make sure this is the place I stay! This really made my birthday experience great not one complaint here!!!!

title: Business event - fantastic experience
text: We had an amazing business event at St Clouds rooftop. Johir, Isabel and Tyra were our servers for the evening. From the moment we arrived, they had smiles on their faces and helped with everything we needed - they made our event so much better. They were quick to bring out our food and drinks and were always around asking if we needed anything else. It was an excellent event. We ended up extending our event for an extra hour because everyone was having so much fun. The space is gorgeous, location is very well appointed and the view is fantastic. We will definitely be back for many other events in the future.

title: ..great place for happy hour light dinner
text: Great ambiance, great music, great food…..great location, beautiful view, great service. Lots of private parties, also intimate quiet spaces. Get a glass of wine and an app and just read or meet a friend for a drink, full bar inside and outside

title: A Delightful Experience
text:
My husband and I recently booked a stay at the Knickerbocker Hotel to celebrate my mother’s 70th birthday. I was drawn to the hotel because of its location just off Times Square and a short walk to the theater. We were not disappointed.
Upon our arrival we were greeted by the doorman and concierge who offered to help with any needs we may have from theater tickets to dinner reservations. From there we made our way to the guest services desk where we were greeted by Paola, the most professional, responsive and attentive customer service attendant I’ve ever met.
Paola greeted us with a smile, shared in our joy to be celebrating a milestone birthday and ensured that the Knickerbocker was honored to be chosen for our stay. She truly exemplified what I envisioned service would be at this historic hotel. Paola you are amazing!
Our room was lovely and much larger than most rooms in NYC. The large window gave us a great view of Times Square. It was quiet and included an electric black out shade so sleeping in our comfortable beds was easy. 
We indulged in the amenities offered by the hotel including the Charlie Palmer Steakhouse where my husband had the best spicy lobster spaghetti of his life, and the rooftop bar where we had Martinis and Manhattans under the glow of the New Year’s ball. As a special treat we were given a beautiful table and complimentary drinks from Paola for my mother’s birthday. It was truly a night to remember.
It is my hope that this review reaches many people who are planning a special trip to the big city. This trip was the experience of a lifetime made even more special by the team at the Knickerbocker.
I would give 10 stars if I could.

title: Forhad and Victoria
text: Great service! I appreciate it. Great drinks and food! Look forward to coming back. Great atmosphere! Great for big parties.Forhad and Victoria are great! Great lighting. However the bathrooms are horrible!

title: Work Happy Hour at St. Cloud
text: We had a work happy hour at the rooftop at St. Cloud. The service was great as well as the drinks & snacks. Johir was fantastic & super friendly! The views are stellar, weather was perfect. Will definitely come back!

title: Great Rooftop Bar with Great Service
text: I have been here to the rooftop on a date and then again recently to work an event. At the bar, Juber really took care of me! He was so attentive and genuine. Would recommend this place and service by him! :)
